title: A Year Full of Missteps Is Finally Over
description: Dan McGrath writes a column for The Chicago News Cooperative.

title: Serviceman Held for Carrying Explosives Into Texas Airport
description: HOUSTON  A man preparing to board a flight at the airport in Midland, Tex., on Saturday morning was detained by the authorities after explosives in military-grade wrapping were discovered in his luggage, leading to an evacuation of the terminal building, law enforcement and city officials said.

title: Picturing How Ryan Brothers Could Settle  Family Business
description: Yes, the Jets are a long shot to qualify for the playoffs Sunday. They need to beat Miami and hope for other outcomes to occur. Since we have exhausted every possible playoff scenario this week, and with the drama still to be played, I thought it might be fun to explore  Hollywood style  what could happen AFTER all N.F.L. games are concluded. Here is one possibility, with apologies to Francis Ford Coppola, that borrows heavily from a scene in The Godfather, when Michael Corleone, played by Al Pacino, settled all family business.

title: Experts Weigh In on Outside Groups Pro-Gingrich Spots
description: DES MOINES  Can they do that?

title: An Unlikely Group Rebels Against Preservation Districts
description: Susan Beckstead stepped out of her sky-blue, three-story classical revival Victorian on Pierce Street  the one with bay windows, dentil and egg-and-dart molding, a modillion cornice and balustrade-lined flat roof  to show a visitor around her 120-year-old neighborhood bordering Duboce Park in central San Francisco.

title: Money Refused Could Become Money Owed
description: Juvenile offenders are often reminded that bad decisions have consequences. The juvenile justice systems in California counties are about to learn the same hard lesson.

title: Simms Taback, Author of Wry Childrens Books, Dies at 79
description: Simms Taback, a childrens book illustrator and author who won the Caldecott Medal in 2000 for his adaptation of the nonsensical Yiddish folktale Joseph Had a Little Overcoat, died last Sunday at his home in Ventura, Calif. He was 79.

title: Fancy Footwork for the Raiders and 49ers
description: This season, the Raiders and the 49ers have had standout performances by players who rarely get their hands on the ball. Meet the place-kickers and punters whose feet, though gnarled and sometime missing toenails, have helped carry their teams in the 2011 regular season.

title: This Time, Wisconsin Is Ready
description: LOS ANGELES  Delayed by the filming of a car commercial on Figueroa Street, Wisconsin Coach Bret Bielema was about 10 minutes late for his scheduled Rose Bowl news conference Saturday morning. Upon his arrival, a grin and one of his standard wisecracks expressed the mantra the Badgers have been pushing since the moment they arrived in Southern California earlier this week.

title: For a Second Night, Vehicles Are Set Ablaze in the Los Angeles Area
description: After a night when nearly 20 cars were set ablaze in Hollywood, in parking areas under apartment buildings or beside homes while people slept, area fire stations called in extra staff and increased patrols on Friday evening, awaiting a second strike, fire officials said.

title: Girl in a Fishbowl
description: In a large fishbowl behind the bar at Bimbos 365 Club, it looks as if a small naked woman is swimming with the goldfish. This girl in the fishbowl has been part of the nightclub since it opened in 1931 at 365 Market Street. In 1951, Bimbos relocated to North Beach. Dolphina, as she is known, still lures patrons to the bar.

title: If 2011 Was Any Indication, Hold On to Your Hats in 2012
description: Texans will close out 2011 with more questions than answers: How will Gov. Rick Perrys presidential bid play out? How will lawmakers multibillion-dollar budget cuts affect education, Medicaid and health care? Will the courts ever decide on new State House, Senate and Congressional districts so Texas can hold elections?

title: Norah Jones and the Music She Loves
description: It took Norah Jones precisely one year to become a household name. Her debut album, Come Away With Me, was released in February 2002, and by the following February it had sold four million copies and she had won five Grammys.

title: Romney and Paul Ahead in New Iowa Poll
description: DES MOINES  The Des Moines Register poll  the final one before the Iowa caucuses on Tuesday  has Mitt Romney and Ron Paul virtually tied in the lead going into the final 72 hours before voting.

title: Chief Justice Defends Peers Hearing Case on Health Law
description: In the face of a growing controversy over whether two Supreme Court justices should disqualify themselves from the challenge to the 2010 health care overhaul law, Chief Justice John G. Roberts Jr. on Saturday defended the courts ethical standards.

title: Winter Classic Alumni Game
description: The game welcomed back legendary players from the Rangers and Flyers, including Mark Messier, Bernie Parent, Eric Lindros, Brian Leetch, Bob Clarke and Adam Graves.

title: Losing Her Job, Electricity and Prescriptions
description: It came down to living by candlelight.

title: Intervening After Robbery, an Off-Duty A.T.F. Agent Is Killed
description: An off-duty special agent for the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives was fatally shot on Saturday afternoon when he, along with at least one other law enforcement officer and a retired officer, tried to stop a robber who had just held up a pharmacy on Long Island, the authorities said.

title: Romney Says He Would Veto the Dream Act
description: LE MARS, Iowa  In Le Mars, Iowa, the self-proclaimed ice cream capital of the world, Mitt Romney ordered a scoop of rocky road before heading to his first campaign stop of the day, a crowded restaurant filled with more than 200 voters.

title: Playing Five Minutes, Old Goalie Steals Show
description: PHILADELPHIA  Given the long, truculent history of the Flyers-Rangers rivalry, a lot of people expected at least a mock fight to break out Saturday at the Flyers-Rangers alumni game at Citizens Bank Park. Instead, the capacity crowd of 45,808 saw a display of good-natured class and surprising skill from players ranging in age from 28 to 68.

title: Age 52, and Still Working the Streets
description: Barbara Terry, 52, raised four children and bought a house from the proceeds she earned working the streets of Hunts Point, in the Bronx.

title: Amid Lead for Romney in Iowa Poll, Momentum for Santorum
description: The much-respected Des Moines Register poll was published on Saturday night and shows Mitt Romney in the lead in the Iowa caucuses, with 24 percent of the vote to 22 percent for Representative Ron Paul of Texas and 15 percent for Rick Santorum.

title: Corrections: January 1
description: INTERNATIONAL

title: The Caucus Click: The Week in Pictures
description: The Republican presidential candidates campaigned in the final days before the Iowa caucuses, and in New Hampshire.

title: The Caucus Click: The Week in Pictures
description: The Republican presidential candidates campaigned in the final days before the Iowa caucuses, and in New Hampshire.  Go to the slide show.

title: For Romney on New Years Eve, Quirky Questions in Sioux City
description: SIOUX CITY, Iowa  Mitt Romney has attacked President Obama over the economy, the military, and their differing visions for the future of the country. But there are some areas where Mr. Romney just wont go.

title: Surging Back Into Zuccotti Park, Protesters Are Cleared by Police
description: 2:10 a.m. | Updated  More than 500 people associated with theOccupy Wall Streetmovement gathered in Zuccotti Park on Saturday and, in a return to scenes from earlier in the year, the evening began with the sound of drumming and calls of the now familiar slogan, We are the 99 percent  and it ended with torn-down barricadesand a scuffle with police officers.

title: N.F.L. Notables Who Died in 2011
description: A look back at how the Fifth Down remembered some of the pro football greats who died in 2011, via Andy Baralls reports:

title: Photo Replay: Dec.31
description: A look back in the day in sports, from a footrace in Sao Paulo, Brazil, to a cross-country ski race in Oberstdorf, Germany.

title: Devils Rookie Henrique Settling In Between Two Stars
description: NEWARK  Adam Henrique, a 21-year-old center playing in only his 35th N.H.L. game, hopped over the boards with two other Devils forwards 45 seconds into Saturdays game, and the three quickly pushed the puck into the Pittsburgh Penguins zone.

title: MSG Leaves Time Warner Systems
description: The MSG and MSG Plus networks wereremoved from Time Warner Cables New York metropolitan-area and Buffalo systems at midnight Eastern on Saturday, cutting off subscribers from Knicks, Rangers, Islanders, Devils and Buffalo Sabres games. In total, the dispute affects 1.7 million cable homes.

title: Ringing In 2012, Around the World
description: People gathered from Beijing to Kabul to New York to celebrate the new year.

title: Stoudemire Sits, but a Rookie and a Veteran Stand Tall
description: SACRAMENTO  The Knicks were in midair somewhere over Californias central valley when physics and physiology conspired against them.

title: What Was Your Favorite Soccer Moment From 2011?
description: As part of The Timess look back at 2011, members of the sports staff have been writing about memorable moments from the year in sports, a sort of mental scrapbook.

title: For Occupy the Caucus Protesters, a Successful Day of Arrests
description: DES MOINES  How many people had fun today? said David Goodner, a 30-year-old community organizer, to a bus full of Occupy the Caucus protesters on their way from Newt Gingrichs local campaign headquarters to President Obamas. The question was met with cheers, as the group considered the 18 arrests, including those of two local teenagers, that made today a sign of success.

title: Lottery Numbers
Sarah Pusey, Kevin Husson
description: Sarah Michele Pusey, the daughter of Belinda S. Beeker of Warren, Mich., and Terry J. Pusey of St. Charles, Mo., was married Saturday to Kevin James Husson, a son of Mary Ann Husson and Mike J. Husson of Troy, Mich. Msgr. Michael LeFevre performed the ceremony at the Cathedral of the Most Blessed Sacrament in Detroit.

title: Michelle Girolami, Spencer Cohen
description: Michelle Marie Girolami and Spencer Steven Cohen were married Friday at the Church of Fabbrica di Peccioli in Peccioli, Italy. The Rev. Brian Lowery, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony.

title: Susan Galereave and Kiki Zeldes
description: Susan Galereave and Kiki Zeldes were married Friday in Northampton, Mass. J. Mary Sorrell, a justice of the peace for the Commonwealth of Massachusetts, officiated at the common house in the Rocky Hill Cohousing community, where the couple live.

title: Bonnie Foley and Jay Mangold Jr.
description: Bonnie Marie Foley, a daughter of Dr. Lisa A. Dado and Dr. Michael R. Foley of Paradise Valley, Ariz., and Jay Reid Mangold Jr., the son of Carol W. Mangold and Mr. Mangold Sr. of Fox Chapel, Pa., were married Saturday at the Montelucia Resort in Scottsdale, Ariz. The Rev. C. Raymond Rau, an affiliate of the White Robed Monks of St. Benedict, performed the ceremony with the assistance of L. Sandy Maisel, a friend of the couple and a professor of government at Colby College.

title: Gregory Brown, Linton Stables
description: Gregory Neal Brown and Linton Dunn Stables III, were married Saturday at First Presbyterian Church of Brooklyn, where the couple are members of the choir. The Rev. Dr. Flora Wilson Bridges, the churchs senior pastor, performed the ceremony.

title: Marianna Mancusi-Ungaro, Nicholas Chapleau
description: Marianna Caruso Mancusi-Ungaro, the daughter of Carol Mancusi-Ungaro of New York and Dr. Harold R. Mancusi-Ungaro Jr. of Santa Rosa, Calif., was married Saturday evening in Galveston, Tex., to Nicholas Justin Chapleau, the son of Sally Chapleau Meckstroth of Clearwater Beach, Fla., and Edward A. Chapleau of Granger, Ind. Robert G. Stevens, a Roman Catholic deacon, performed the ceremony at Sacred Heart Catholic Church.

title: Margaret Macdonell, Joseph Higgins
description: Margaret Julia Macdonell, the daughter of Geraldine L. Macdonell and James Macdonell of Hillsborough, N.J., was married Friday evening to Joseph Patrick Higgins, a son of Dorothy Higgins and Andrew Higgins of Warren, N.J. The Rev. Sean W. Kenney performed the ceremony at Our Lady of the Mount Roman Catholic Church in Warren.

title: Alison Silber, Eric Lesser
description: Alison Faye Silber, a daughter of Bohne G. Silber and Dr. Glenn M. Silber of Clarksville, Md., was married Saturday evening to Eric Philip Lesser, the son of Joan G. Lesser and Dr. Martin Lesser of Longmeadow, Mass. Rabbi Mark Dov Shapiro officiated at the Garrett-Jacobs Mansion, an event space in Baltimore.

title: Liliahn Johnson and Ibrahim Majeed
description: Liliahn Marguerite Johnson and Ibrahim Abdul Majeed were married Saturday evening at the Mandarin Oriental Hotel in Washington. The Rev. Graylan S. Hagler, a minister with the United Church of Christ, officiated.

title: John Graves, Dennis Lonergan
description: John Allen Graves and Dennis Bernard Lonergan were married Saturday at the Lake Placid Lodge in Lake Placid, N.Y. Margaret E. Doran, a village justice there, officiated.

title: Leigh Quarles, Eric Farmer
description: Leigh Walker Quarles and Eric Keith Farmer were married Saturday evening at the University Club in Memphis. Kathleen H. Averett, a Universal Life minister, officiated, with Briton M. Green, also a Universal Life minister, participating.

title: Nina Heebink and Jamie Schmidt
description: Nina Marie Heebink and Jamie Mark Schmidt were married Friday at the Lake Windsor Golf Club in Madison, Wis. Karlos Moser, a Universal Life minister, officiated.

title: Margo Lederhandler, Douglas Zolkind
description: Margo Helen Lederhandler, a daughter of Dr. Judith W. Lederhandler and Dr. Marc R. Lederhandler of Pinecrest, Fla., was married Saturday evening to Douglas Samuel Zolkind, a son of Beth F. Zolkind and Dr. Neil A. Zolkind of Sleepy Hollow, N.Y. Rabbi Terry A. Bookman officiated at the Ritz-Carlton Coconut Grove in Miami. Cantor Rachelle Nelson assisted.

title: Katherine Beirne and Brian Fallon
description: Katherine Noel Beirne and Brian Edward Fallon Jr. were married Saturday by the Rev. Robert T. Begin, a Roman Catholic priest, at St. Colman Catholic Church in Cleveland.

title: Does the F.A.s Report Change Your Opinion on Surez?
description: Englands Football Association on Saturday released the 115-page report compiled by an independent commission that suspended Liverpool striker Luis Surez for eight games. The document lays out in painstaking detail the evidence that Surez directed a racist insult at a black opponent during a Premier League game in October, as well as the methods it used to go about determining his punishment.

title: Marnie Hanel, James Bordley V
description: Marnie Elizabeth Hanel and James Bordley V were married Saturday evening at Trinity Parish Church in Seattle. The Rev. Paul Collins, an Episcopal priest, performed the ceremony.

title: The World This Week, Part 2
description: A look back at the big news stories of the year.

title: The World This Week, Part 1
description: A look back at the big news stories of the year.

title: South Korea Predicts Changes in Peninsula
description: SEOUL, South Korea  President Lee Myung-bak of South Korea vowed on Monday to deal strongly with any provocations from the North, predicting a big change on the divided Korean Peninsula following the death of the North Korean leader, Kim Jong-il, and his young, untested sons rise to power.

title: Newswallah: Long Reads Edition
description: Joe Sacco, the well-known American cartoonist and journalist, uses his comic journalism lens on a rural district of Uttar Pradesh, Indias largest and one of its poorest states. Caravan magazine publishes a long piece by him in its latest issue, which also includes a long profile of Imran Khan, the Pakistani cricketer turned politician. Mr. Sacco and an Indian journalist who assisted him, Piyush Srivastava, travel to the district Kushinagar near the border between Uttar Pradesh and Bihar to meet with poor and lower caste families.

title: Madrid to Celebrate Three Kings, and the Gift of Innocence
description: One of Spains most popular holiday events, the colorful Procession of the Three Kings, will proceed down the Paseo de la Castellana from Nuevos Ministerios to Plaza de Cibeles on Friday between 6:30 p.m. and 9 p.m. It features the elaborately dressed kings, their pages and helpers, who ride on floats distributing sweets to the children lining the route. There are at least 30 carriages, theatrical re-enactments, dancers, musicians, jugglers, street performers, royal pages, giant puppets and many other entertaining characters.According to the Bible, at this time of year, three wise and powerful kings brought gifts of gold, frankincense and myrrh to the infant Jesus. To celebrate the occasion, on Jan. 5, children in Spain go to bed early, awaiting the morning, when they hope to find the presents that they requested of the three kings in letters written on Boxing Day, Dec. 26. They leave shoes on windowsills or balconies or under the Christmas tree to be filled with toys.

title: The Year in Football Language
description: Its a running joke in our office. One of our editors starts imitating a coach  To be a good football team, you have to protect the football, and then make some football plays  and others sometimes join in.

title: Unboxed Extra: I.B.M. and Americas Job Challenge
description: I.B.M.s success in recent years is clear from the numbers  an upward ascent in profits, profit margins, stock-market value and even research and development spending.

title: Wheels, Old and New
description: Dear Diary:

title: Americas Enemies On The Rise
description: According to the latest Iowa polling.

title: Charlie Trotters Closing in Chicago
description: 10:43 p.m. | Updated For a complete version of this article, see Chicago Losing a Chef Who Refined Its Stockyards Palate, by Monica Davey of The New York Times.Charlie Trotter plans to close his famous Chicago restaurant in August, 25 years after it opened in a Lincoln Park townhouse and quickly became a national destination, The Chicago Sun-Times reported on Sunday.

title: Coughlin a Keeper, Win or Lose?
description: Giants Coach Tom Coughlin is poised for a triumphant night.

title: New Years Resolutions From the Travel Industry
description: Now that the gluttony of the holiday season is over, we can all be on our best behavior. That includes travel companies, several of which are turning over a new leaf for the New Year. Among their resolutions for the coming year:

title: Boom Year for Illicit Elephant Ivory
description: If you think you had a bad year, spare a thought for Africas elephants. They are being killed in ever greater numbers for their ivory, which is smuggled these days mostly to Asia. Rising wealth has led to a boom in demand there in recent years.

title: Q. and A. With Ed Snider: Philadelphia Hockeys Heart and Soul
description: Ed Snider co-founded the Philadelphia Flyers in 1967 and has owned or run the team ever since. Today, as chairman of Comcast Spectacor, the company that owns the Philadelphia Flyers,he is perhaps the most powerful man in the game, as outlined in this Dec. 31 New York Times article.

title: New Years Revelry Hurts Hundreds in Philippines
description: MANILA  Officials in the Philippines mounted one of the most extensive campaigns in the countrys history to stem the annual tide of injuries caused by New Years Eve celebrations.

title: Little Syria (Now Tiny Syria) Finds New Advocates
description: In 1891, Yusuf Sadallah arrived in Lower Manhattan from the town of Baskinta, in the part of the Ottoman Empire that is now Lebanon. Going by the name of Joseph Sadallah, he set up a trading shop on Washington Street, where other immigrants from the Levant  Syrians, Lebanese and Palestinians  had created a vibrant Arab quarter known as Little Syria.

title: In Iowa, Rick Perry Is Stuck in the Second Tier
description: Every candidate has a lot on the line in the Iowa caucus on Tuesday, but perhaps none more than Gov. Rick Perry of Texas.

title: Not Too Close to the Critters, Little Lady
description: There was a time when it was considered high entertainment  in novels, on the stage and at the movies  for a pretty young woman to be tied to a railroad track and left in imminent danger of decapitation by an oncoming train.

title: After Victory at Hopman, New Confidence for Li Na
description: PERTH  As Li Na would tell it, making history can be pretty exhausting.

title: From the Cage to the Screen, With Fists Flying
description: BEVERLY HILLS, Calif.

title: Missing Chinese Lawyer Said to Be in Remote Prison
description: BEIJING  The brother of a prominent dissident rights lawyer who had been missing for 20 months said Sunday that the lawyer, Gao Zhisheng, was being held in a prison in the remote western region of Xinjiang.

title: Romney Fights for First-Place Showing in Iowa Caucuses
description: DES MOINES  Mitt Romney sought to convert his tentative standing atop the polls into a first-place finish in the caucuses here, telling Iowans on Sunday that he had the capability to go the full distance against President Obama, as his rivals beseeched voters not to settle on a candidate lacking full commitment to their conservative values.

title: Disruptions: Resolved in 2012: To Enjoy the View Without Help From an iPhone
description: Last week, I drove to Pacifica, a beach community just south of San Francisco, where I climbed a large rocky hill as the sun descended on the horizon. It painted a typically astounding California sunset across the Pacific Ocean. What did I do next?

title: New Years Rockin Eve Draws Strong Ratings
description: ABC extended Dick Clarks New Years Rockin Eve on Saturday night, and it appeared to pay off, giving the network its best end-of-the-year prime-time ratings since 2000. The two new hours of New Years Eve merriment, from 8 to 10 p.m., drew about 8.3 million viewers, an unusually high number for a Saturday night. Repeats on the other networks drew between 1.5 million and 3 million viewers.

title: Falling Forward (Without Falling Down)
description: Heres a Twittter post for a new year in a century in which the things we dont know are easily as important as those we do. In such an environment, what qualities can help individuals and communities avoid big missteps? Id start with literacy, connectedness, empathy, engagement, enterprise and anthropophilia.

title: Palestinians and Israelis Will Talk This Week
description: JERUSALEM  Palestinian and Israeli negotiators plan to meet for the first time in more than a year in Jordan on Tuesday, in an effort to revive moribund peace talks, although none of the sides involved suggested any reason to view the meeting as a sign of significant progress.

title: Sad Things (Wonkish and Trivial)
description: I see that some people out there dont like me. A couple of odds and ends:

title: Bachmann Makes Final Pitch to Iowa Faithful
description: OSKALOOSA, Iowa  Representative Michele Bachmann took the pulpit at the Jubilee Family Church here during the morning worship service on Sunday and preached from Scripture, weaving her personal story with biblical parables about redemption  a message that seemed tailored to reassure undecided voters about the viability of her embattled campaign.

title: A Nebraska Fan Faces the New Reality
description: I was walking through the office when a colleague stopped me. Did I hear you say something about Nebraska football? he asked, innocently, cheerfully, not realizing the twisted synapses that were about to fire in my brain. I frowned and shook my head over the idea of writing about the team. My comments would be too blue, I assured him glibly.

title: As U.S. Agent Is Mourned, Officials Try to Figure Out Who Shot Him
description: On Sunday morning, James J. Capano stopped in front of the pharmacy where his son, an off-duty federal agent, had lost his life less than 24 hours earlier.

title: Gilbert Puts His Stamp on a Lively Celebration
description: Alan Gilbert had an elegantly straightforward idea for the New York Philharmonics New Years Eve concert at Avery Fisher Hall (and on televisions everywhere, thanks to PBS). He set aside the orchestras long tradition of following the Central European model of offering either bubbly programs of Viennese waltzes or grandly serious works like Beethovens Ninth Symphony as well as recent alternatives, like presenting a pops concert featuring a Broadway singer or light classics that would not otherwise be heard in a Philharmonic program.

title: Fiction Writer Plays Tourist in Real World
description: The American-Canadian science-fiction writer William Gibson is best known, at least for those who havent read his brooding and oracular novels, for two things.

title: Text Messaging Is in Decline in Some Countries
description: Perhaps to the chagrin of cellphone carriers, all signs point to text messagings continuing its decline in several parts of the world.

title: At Worship, Iowans Consider the Candidates
description: Times reporters visited several Iowa churches Sunday to take the pulse of worshipers as they prepare to caucus on Tuesday.

title: Plumbing the Depths, With a Little Help
description: Welcome back to the cabaret.

title: What Are Jets Biggest Off-Season Needs?
description: The Jets would have missed the playoffs anyway  Tennessee defeated Houston  but the way they went out on Sunday had to be demoralizing for Jets fans.

title: On a Big Football Weekend, Gingrich Makes His Plea to N.F.L. Fans
description: AMES, Iowa  Where do you find voters on the last Sunday of the regular season of the National Football League?

title: Amid Impeccable Slams, a Revealing Bid Gives Away a King
description: The Goldman Pairs started in 1929. It was traditionally held during the Eastern States Regional over Memorial Day weekend. However, that event did not take place last May. So the event was moved to the Edgar Kaplan Winter Regional, which ended on Friday in Manhattan.

title: You Read It Here First: Plays Plans Still in Flux
description: The new play Detroit was a hit at Steppenwolf Theater Company in Chicago in 2010, so much so that the New York producer Jeffrey Richards announced last January that he would move the show to Broadway in the fall of 2011. But as summer passed, there was no word on a cast, a theater, an opening night. Asked for an update, Mr. Richards said his fall producing schedule was hectic  he had Chinglish, Bonnie & Clyde and The Gershwins Porgy and Bess all coming to Broadway  so he was waiting until winter for Detroit.

title: Tom Cruise Is Again a Box-Office Draw
description: LOS ANGELES  Tom Cruise appears to have left behind his weird period, at least at the North American box office.

title: From City Park to Stadium: A Giants Unlikely Return
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  About five weeks ago, Chase Blackburn was living in a suburb of Columbus, Ohio. He lifted weights close to his home, at Dublin Community Recreation Center, and practiced punt coverage alone on a field at a nearby park.

title: With 24/7, HBO Refines a Winning Formula
description: HBOs 24/7 series has nearly perfected the documentary as a promotional vehicle.

title: Occupy Protesters Aim Anger at Both G.O.P. and Democrats in Iowa
description: With the whole state of Iowa fixated on Republican presidential contenders just days before they go head to head in the caucuses, anger from Occupy protesters over what they see as the overwhelming influence of corporate greed in politics is spilling over to both sides of the political divide.

title: Jets Chances End Early as Offense Fights Itself
description: MIAMI GARDENS, Fla.  The Jets filed out of their locker room and into the off-season. Some players wore headphones. Others fiddled with smartphones. Their faces showed disappointment and frustration, but also resignation, as if their tumble from playoff contention was expected. And in a way, it was.

title: On Modern Time
description: We live in time. On days like this one, when we find ourselves carried without any effort or intent from the end of one calendar year to the next, this observation is perhaps especially clear.

title: Reviving a Long-Lost Tale From Kurt Weills Archive
description: LONDON  A small girl and boy play with their toys before falling asleep, and when they have done so, the toys come to life. Adventures ensue as Evil is battled, with Good duly prevailing and the toys returning to their former inert state. This is not, as you might think, Toy Story 17, but a new childrens show at the Royal Opera Houses Linbury Studio Theater that boasts an almost-forgotten score by none other than Kurt Weill.

title: Google Bases a Campaign on Emotions, Not Terms
description: Google, one of the biggest advertising companies in the world, has finally embraced advertising for itself.

title: Gingrich to Take Aim at Romney in New Hampshire
description: MANCHESTER, N.H.  Newt Gingrich said on Sunday that he intended to campaign in New Hampshire, where polls show him running third, rather than move directly to South Carolina, where he is leading.

title: Game of Thrones Treat
description: The author George R. R. Martin has given his fans a late Christmas gift in the form of a sample chapter from his forthcoming Winds of Winter, the sixth book in A Song of Ice and Fire, his popular fantasy series. Mr. Martin, who is also the executive producer of the HBO series Game of Thrones, which is adapted from his novels, posted a preview of his latest work on his Web site, georgerrmartin.com, last week. No publication date has been announced. The seriess fifth book, A Dance With Dragons, was published in July after a six-year wait; it sold more than 170,000 print copies on its first day. Mr. Martin also announced that the books paperback edition, to be released in July, would contain a different sample chapter from Winds.

title: Schedule Announced for Scotland Week
description: 59E59 Theaters has announced that it will present the United States premiere of A Slow Air, a new play written and directed by David Harrower, beginning April 4 as part of Scotland Week, the annual celebration of all things Scottish. A Slow Air explores the impact of the 2007 terrorist attack on the Glasgow Airport from the perspective of a family in a nearby village. It had its premiere at the Traverse Theater during the 2011 Edinburgh Festival Fringe. Blackbird, a previous play from Mr. Harrower, had a well-received run at Manhattan Theater Club in 2007 and won the 2007 Olivier Award in London for best new play. 59E59 is also set to present the United States premiere of Federer Versus Murray, a dark comedy written and directed by Gerda Stevenson, on April 4.

title: Footnotes
description: After 14 months of marriage, the comedian Russell Brand has filed for divorce from the pop star Katy Perry, citing irreconcilable differences, The Associated Press reported. The couple, above, met in 2009 at the MTV Video Music Awards, of which Mr. Brand was the host. They were married in October 2010. ... After being hospitalized on Dec. 21 for shortness of breath, the R&B singer Etta James  who has terminal leukemia  is now breathing on her own and has been taken off a respirator, The Associated Press reported on Saturday.

title: Santorum Pushes Supporters to Keep His Surge Alive
description: SIOUX CITY, Iowa  Emboldened by a late and unexpected rise in the polls, Rick Santorum came to this conservative corner of rural Iowa on Sunday and urged his supporters to redouble their efforts to help ensure a win in the states caucuses on Tuesday night.

title: Shiny Bibelot From Shakespeare, Handel & Co.
description: Forget Auld Lang Syne. The best music to ring in a new year is Now a bright new day is dawning, the joyous chorus that ends The Enchanted Island, the inventive concoction that had its premiere on Saturday night at the Metropolitan Opera. The music for this finale is lifted from the Hallelujah chorus that concludes Handels oratorio Judas Maccabaeus. The new words are by the librettist Jeremy Sams, who devised the story and assembled this fanciful, clever and touching pastiche by selecting arias, ensembles, choruses and dances from works by Handel, Vivaldi, Rameau and lesser-known Baroque composers.

title: In Flop of H.P. TouchPad, an Object Lesson for the Tech Sector
description: The TouchPad tablet from Hewlett-Packard was one of the most closely watched new gadgets of 2011  and quickly turned out to be the years biggest flop. The TouchPad, which was supposed to be a rival to Apples iPad, lasted just seven weeks on the market before H.P. killed it, citing weak sales.

title: Metropolitan Pastiche
description: The Enchanted Island at Metropolitan Opera borrows from the Baroque era when taking music from one opera and fitting it with new words was commonplace.

title: Monday: Unconventional and Then Some
description: MONDAYS PUZZLE  You cant tell from my head shot, but I wear glasses. Even so, it was a strain to make out exactly what Paula Gamache was trying to get across to us, because no matter how hard I peered OVER, AROUND, BEYOND and UNDER, her message went SIGHT UNSEEN.

title: PBS Takes On the Premium Channels

title: Romney Talks About  Santorum, a Bit Mischievously

title: In Speaking for TLC, the Least Said Is Best
description: Every public relations executive has to manage a crisis from time to time. But in the last few years, Laurie Goldberg has had a careers worth.

title: A Fairy Tale Stoked by Childhood Dreams
description: We live in a golden age of childrens fiction, and in the most memorable moments of his staging of The Nutcracker, Alexei Ratmansky takes his place among the most imaginative childrens authors. The snow scene that ends Act I, with aspects of seduction, terror and vengefulness unlike in any other Nutcracker, has a dramatic urgency that recalls some of the classic works of Hans Christian Andersen. The time-traveling scenes whereby a pas de deux in each act shows us a Princess and Prince who are the adult alter egos of Clara and the Nutcracker Boy recall some of the finest parts of the Harry Potter and His Dark Materials series.

title: Colts Gain From One Last Loss, Earning Top Pick
description: The Indianapolis Colts season ended several days before it began in September, when quarterback Peyton Manning had neck surgery that sent him to the bench, imperiled his career and put the Colts into a tailspin. But on the final Sunday of their miserable year, the Colts won big  by losing one last time.

description: Lets start with the clothes: an electric cobalt-blue blazer over a soft plaid shirt; a peach-colored bowtie; an all-leopard-print ensemble; a slim pink suit (with shorts instead of pants), paired with knee-high red socks; a black sequined blazer with sparkling shoes to match.

description: Last year will be remembered as the moment when dance music slithered across the Atlantic and insinuated itself into American genres that have hitherto been immune to it. In mainstream pop, R&B, even hip-hop, tempos and ecstatic feeling were on the rise across the board.

description: DES MOINES  Virginias attorney general on Sunday backed off of a proposal to loosen the states ballot access rules to allow more Republican presidential candidates to qualify.

title: Barbara Lea, Cabaret Singer, Dies at 82
description: Barbara Lea, a jazz-influenced cabaret singer known for an intense fealty to words and music that resulted in interpretations of masterly subtlety, died last Monday in Raleigh, N.C. She was 82.

title: Overdosing on Extremism
description: ACCORDING to a recent study by the Centers for Disease Control, drug overdoses have increased almost six-fold in the last 30 years. They now represent the leading cause of accidental death in the United States, having overtaken motor vehicle accidents for the first time on record.

title: Live Coverage of Winter Classic on Monday
description: Slap Shot will provide live analysis of the Winter Classic game between the Rangers and the Flyers, beginning at 3 p.m. Monday. On Sunday, the N.H.L. moved the games start time from 1 to 3 p.m. in the hope of improving ice conditions. NBCs coverage will still start at 1 p.m., the same time the gates open at Citizens Bank Park.

title: Bring on a Playoff, but Save the Bowl System
description: By the time we arrived in Queens at the Comus Clubs 89th annual Christmas Ball, Id already begun to reconsider my position that the minor bowl games that dot the college football landscape were irrelevant.

title: The Danger of an Attack on Piracy Online
description: By invoking the acronym SOPA right at the get-go, I may be daring many of you to check the next column over for something a little less chewy. After all, SOPA, which stands for Stop Online Piracy Act, sounds like a piece of arcane Internet government regulation  legislation that entertainment companies desperately care about and that leaves Web nation and free-speech crusaders frothing at the mouth. The rest of us? What were we talking about again?

title: Rangers and Flyers Bring Bare-Knuckle History to a Showcase
description: PHILADELPHIA  When the N.H.L. and NBC originally plotted the Winter Classic, the idea was to present two traditional rivals. It does not hurt that this years matchup  the Rangers and the Flyers  play in the first- and fourth-largest television markets in the country, but these clubs also have a venomous history that is hard to equal.

title: Bulks Not Just in Bulkhead, So Coast Guard Steps In
description: SEATTLE  In this season of expanding waistlines, even the Coast Guard has been forced to monitor midsections: specifically, the drafts of passenger vessels burdened with transporting an increasingly heavy population.

title: An Ad Blocker Opens the Gate, Ever So Slightly
description: ADBLOCK PLUS became the most popular piece of add-on software for the Firefox Web browser, in part, because it had a simple mission: see online ad, block online ad. The name said it all  and each day 10 million people or so surf the Internet with Adblock Plus installed, presumably never missing the advertising they were meant to see.

title: Flyers Make Goalie Switch for Classic
description: PHILADELPHIA  The Flyers No. 1 goalie, Ilya Bryzgalov, has been a star of HBOs 24/7 series, quirkily philosophizing about Russian literature, the cosmos and other subjects. But Bryzgalov is unlikely to be a marquee name when the Flyers take on the Rangers in the annual Winter Classic on Monday at Citizens Bank Park.

description: DALLAS  Besieged by scandal and uncertainty, the Penn State Nittany Lions discovered a refuge of sorts in the TicketCity Bowl.

title: Howard Halpern, Therapist and Self-Help Author, Dies at 82

description: COUNCIL BLUFFS, Iowa  Mitt Romney may not be able to keep up with the Kardashians, but he did manage to bring them into a speech here on Sunday night.

title: Top Social Topics in 11: Bin Laden and Mubarak
description: Almost two-thirds of adults who used the Internet in 2011 also belonged to social networks, like Facebook and Twitter, according to the Pew Internet and American Life Project.

title: Homeward Goes the Dust Bowl Balladeer
description: The news that Oklahoma is now ready to accept and celebrate Woody Guthrie, the seminal American folk singer who died in 1967, as a native son with an exhibition and a study center for his archives is welcome if long overdue. The state resisted honoring him for decades, because of his leftist politics. I aint a Communist necessarily, Guthrie said, but I been in the red all my life.

title: Holmes Ends His Season on Sideline
description: MIAMI GARDENS, Fla.  A simmering season of discontent for wide receiver Santonio Holmes boiled to the surface Sunday, sending the Jets into the off-season as a splintered squad.

description: The Treasurys schedule of financing this week includes a regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills on Tuesday and an auction of four-week bills on Wednesday.

title: Send in Questions for Melinda Gates
description: Melinda Gates will be traveling shortly to Bangladesh to look at maternal health, child health and womens issues (including family planning and reproductive health)  and she has agreed to answer your questions about these topics while shes there. So please post your questions for Melinda and me about these issues in the comments below, and well choose some and give you our best answers.

title: The Distorted View from Capitol Hill
description: Last week, both The Washington Post and The Times published illuminating stories on the growing affluence of members of Congress. Both stories  Peter Whoriskeys in the Post and Eric Lichtblaus in the Times  demonstrate how the economic fortunes of those elected to Congress have diverged radically from those of the men and women they represent.

title: Looking Ahead to Economic Reports This Week
description: ECONOMIC REPORTS Data will include I.S.M. manufacturing index for December and construction spending for November (Tuesday); Factory orders for November (Wednesday); ADP employment for December, weekly jobless claims and I.S.M. service index for December (Thursday) and unemployment for December (Friday).

title: Where the Real Jobs Are
description: The Republicans believe they have President Obama in a box: either he approves a controversial Canadian oil pipeline or they accuse him of depriving the nation of jobs. Mr. Obama can and should push back hard.

description: Baghdad

title: Nobody Understands Debt
description: In 2011, as in 2010, America was in a technical recovery but continued to suffer from disastrously high unemployment. And through most of 2011, as in 2010, almost all the conversation in Washington was about something else: the allegedly urgent issue of reducing the budget deficit.

title: Obscuring a Muslim Name, and an Americans Sacrifice
description: He was buried after the Sept. 11 attacks with full honors from the New York Police Department, and proclaimed a hero by the citys police commissioner. He is cited by name in the Patriot Act as an example of Muslim-American valor.

title: Essential Benefits and Health Reform
description: The Obama administration surprised supporters and critics when it decided to let states define the essential health benefits that must be provided to their citizens under health care reform. The move could lessen opposition in Republican-led states and increase the chances that they will move ahead on building new health insurance exchanges to comply with the reform law.

title: Democrats Descend on Iowa to Hit Romney
description: DES MOINES  Mitt Romney is fighting to be the top choice of Republicans here in Iowa, but hes already the top target for Democrats.

title: A Dilemma for Russian Leaders: To Suppress Protests or Not
description: MOSCOW  Three weeks ago, when this city was bracing for the first in a series of large antigovernment protests, some commentators seemed to dip into the well of Russian history, when czars and crowds collided in a blur of sabers, poleaxes, cavalry charges and masses of commoners holding icons over their heads.

title: In Times Sq., Gross Reminders of Overindulgence
description: It lurked in the celebrations darkened crevices, safely off camera, pooling atop the Times Square sidewalks where the eyes of the world had been fixed hours before.

title: Wearing Special Shoes on an Arduous Journey
description: Dmitriy Frenkel has only one pair of shoes. He wears them in August heat and through December snow. The shoes are brown and have thick soles; the right one is shaped differently from the left. They are not particularly stylish, but were specially molded to suit Mr. Frenkels disfigured right foot, affected by the polio that he contracted as a child.

description: ISTANBUL  Which is scarier: a government that hunts down and kills dozens in cold blood, or a government that hunts down and kills dozens by accident?

Cars Set on Fire, and Los Angeles Set on Edge

There are palm trees, year-round gardens and splendid weather  it was 81 degrees and sunny on Sunday  but there are also mudslides, gang shootings, wildfires and earthquakes.

title: Political Bickering and Government Inaction Marked the Year in India

Ron Paul, Rick Perry, Ron Paul, Mitt Romney, Rick Santorum. RomneyRomneyGingrichSantorumSantorum.

title: Disposal Halted at Well After New Quake in Ohio

description: After his third deployment, Sgt. Matthew Pennington, 28, returned to his home in Dexter, Me., where he is recovering from both physical and psychological traumas.

title: In Afghanistan, Poppy Growing Proves Resilient
description: NAKILABAD KALAY, Afghanistan  This stretch of the Helmand River Valley, the heart of the nations poppy-growing area, stands as a showcase for one of NATOs most ambitious offensives against the Taliban and the drug trade. But now, the area is also becoming an object lesson in the resilience of militants and opium producers alike.

description: CAIRO  Egypts military-led government on Sunday justified its recent crackdown on human rights and democracy-building organizations as a defense against foreign interference in its politics, defying international pressure and contradicting reports from senior officials in Washington that Egypts military rulers had pledged to soften their stance.

title: Embattled but Confident, Bachmann Says She Is the Complete Package
description: OSKALOOSA, Iowa  Representative Michele Bachmann of Minnesota took the pulpit at Jubilee Family Church here on Sunday and gave a charismatic sermon, weaving her own personal story with Biblical parables about rebirth and redemption. The message seemed tailored to convince skeptical and undecided voters of the viability of her embattled campaign.

title: Giants Rout the Cowboys and Win the N.F.C. East

The Giants season had been reduced to the simplest of situations: If they beat the Dallas Cowboys, they would win the N.F.C. East and advance to the playoffs. If they lost, though, and collapsed for a third consecutive year, the ending  for underperforming players and besieged coordinators and maybe even the veteran coach  would topple upon their heads.

description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  The Giants defensive coordinator, Perry Fewell, has lamented not having a full complement of players at his disposal this season because of injuries in nearly every area: on the line, among the linebackers and in the secondary.

description: VARANASI, India  I needed to do a double and then a triple take to believe my own eyes.

title: In Defense of Brian Schottenheimer
description: Theres talk of the Jets reshuffling their offensive coaching staff. Theyd be fools to let Brian Schottenheimer, one of the best young offensive coordinators in the game, get away. The Jets problems pertain to player personnel. Theyre constructed to run the ball and win with defense. Thats why they felt comfortable building around a quarterback that has limitations like Mark Sanchez.

description: Whats affecting me, my clients and other small-business owners this week.

title: Iowa Race Tightens in Final 48 Hours
description: A new Public Policy Polling survey in Iowa, conducted Saturday and Sunday, shows a virtual three-way tie in advance of the Iowa caucuses. Ron Paul has a nominal lead with 20 percent of the vote in the poll, followed by Mitt Romney at 19 percent and Rick Santorum at 18 percent.

title: Image of the Day: January 2

description: Youre invited to read between the lines of Rex Ryans final postgame news conference of the 2011 season on Sunday. You can read the real lines, too.

title: What Tomlinson Said About Santonio Holmes
description: Wide receiver Santonio Holmes is coming under criticismfrom Jets teammates, some of them speaking anonymously,for quitting on the team. (Holmes was benched for the final minutes of the Jets season-ending loss at Miami after arguing with teammates in the huddle).

title: Los Angeles Police Arrest Suspect in Car Arsons
description: LOS ANGELES  A four-day storm of arsons that caused more than $3 million in damage to cars and apartment buildings across Los Angeles led to an arrest early Monday morning after a reserve sheriffs deputy, on patrol in the midst of another chaotic night of serial fires, recognized a man from a video surveillance tape released this week.

title: Braised Rabbit, a Warming Winter Meal
description: For a cold weather meal, a braised rabbit is a fine choice. The recipe in this weeks City Kitchen is for an oven-baked version of the classic hunter-style rabbit alla cacciatore. A touch of tomato, some crimini mushrooms and some dried porcini, garlic and rosemary are all you need, plus a splash of wine and chicken stock. The proportions are forgiving, so measurements need not be exact.

title: Statistical Lows for Romo and Tebow
description: Anyone could see that Tim Tebow was having a bad day Sunday, and the numbers backed that up. He was 6 for 22 for 60 passing yards in a loss against Kansas City, and his rushing wasnt anything special (six carries for 16 yards).

title: Monday Reading: A Week at a Fat Camp for Grown-Ups
description: A variety of consumer-focused articles appears daily in The New York Times and online in our blogs. Each weekday morning, we gather them together here so you can quickly scan the news that could hit you in your wallet.

title: The Unconstitutional Constitution
description: The latest on Hungary from my Princeton colleague Kim Lane Scheppele, below the fold.

title: Hermetic Economic Cults (Wonkish)
description: Brad DeLong points to repeated quotes from Chicago economists asserting that any economist proposing fiscal stimulus  Christy, Larry, me  must be corrupt. And then they get all huffy about the way I insult them!

title: Bachmann Returns to Iowa Airwaves
description: DES MOINES  Representative Michele Bachmann hasnt been on the air in Iowa with a television commercial since August when she surprised the country by placing first in the states straw poll. But she reappeared on Monday with a 30-second spot that comes just in time for the caucuses on Tuesday.

title: Gym-Pact Fines You for Not Exercising
description: With the start of a new year, many people resolve to shed their holiday paunch by hitting the gym more frequently. Its easy to stay motivated for a few weeks, but then other things seem to take precedence  late nights at work, happy hour or the couch.

title: Eric Lander
description: An interview with the mathematician and geneticist behind the Human Genome Project and the Broad Institute.

title: Power in Numbers
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass.  His Ph.D. is in pure mathematics, in a subfield so esoteric and specialized that even if someone gets a great result, it can be appreciated by only a few dozen people in the entire world. But he left that world behind and, with no formal training, entered another: the world of molecular biology, medicine and genomics.

title: New Years Resolutions to Parent By
description: Either youre the kind of person who makes New Years resolutions or youre not. I most emphatically am and a few of my resolutions are very specific to me as a parent. Ive made the whole idea of the parent we want to be versus the parent we actually are something of a meme for Motherlode in part because for me, theres often such a huge gap between the two.

title: Paul Turns Ad Focus to New Hampshire
description: As Ron Paul tries to pull off a first-place finish in the Iowa caucuses on Tuesday, his campaign has turned its eyes to his next primary battle, releasing a new television ad in New Hampshire.

title: Coursekit Raises $5 Million to Reinvent the Classroom
description: LinkedIn helps professionals connect around job opportunities; Facebook helps people unite around social experiences, like the birth of a baby or an approaching holiday party. But what about online hubs where students can gather to meet their fellow classmates, dish on assignments and trade study tips?

title: On Our Radar: Oil Washes Ashore in Nigeria
description: Nigerian villagers and environmental groups say that oil washing up on the coast must be from the recent Royal Dutch Shell loading accident, which caused the biggest offshore spill in the countrys waters in 13 years. Shell denies that the oil is from the spill, saying its dispersal efforts prevented any of that crude from washing ashore. [Reuters]

title: Genome Study Points to Adaptation in Early African-Americans
description: Researchers scanning the genomes of African-Americans say they see evidence of natural selection as their ancestors adapted to the harsh conditions of their new environment in America.

title: Gingrich on the Culinary Trail in Iowa
description: INDEPENDENCE, Iowa  Is it a coincidence that Newt Gingrichs long and winding bus tour has stopped at many food businesses?

title: Russian Art Group Claims Attack on Police Van
description: MOSCOW  A spokesman for the radical art collective Voina on Monday announced that its members had broken into a St. Petersburg police station on New Years Eve and used gasoline bombs to incinerate a police vehicle used to transport prisoners as a gift to all political prisoners of Russia. Amateur video posted online showed a figure tossing lighted objects under a large vehicle, which was then engulfed in flames and spewed smoke into the night sky.

title: Twisting Race Hits First Turn as Iowa Votes
description: DES MOINES  Mitt Romney has grown so confident of his Iowa prospects that on Monday night he dropped all humble pretense and proclaimed, Were going to win this thing. At the same time, Rick Santorum insisted that his momentum carried its own whiff of victory.

title: Turnips: Versatile and Nutritious in Any Season
description: Turnips are one vegetable you can count on during the winter months; like carrots, they store well. The root vegetables are members of the cruciferae family, the same family that brings you nutrient-rich vegetables like cabbage, kale and broccoli (genus Brassica). Turnips are rich in sulfuric compounds, particularly glucosinolates, that are believed to have antioxidant properties. Theyre also a very good source of potassium. When you can get them with the greens attached, theyre a two-in-one crop, like beets, as their greens bring you a whole new set of nutrients  lots of calcium, vitamin K, vitamin A and beta carotene  and culinary possibilities. Turnip greens are similar in flavor to kale, perhaps a little more bitter, and with a more delicate texture.

title: For Gajdosova, a Slow Australian Embrace
description: PERTH, Australia  Just like on the Australian flag, Australian tennis still has one star who considerably dwarfs the rest.

title: Really? The Claim: Listening to Music Can Relieve Pain
description: THE FACTS

title: Back in Iowa, With the Usual Fuss
description: DES MOINES  There is always something a little peculiar about coming to Iowa for its quadrennial day of fame, but this time it was particularly disconcerting for me to land in an otherwise unremarkable Midwestern city for its first-in-the-season presidential nominating contest.

title: The Call of the Wild
description: Q. How do deer communicate? Do they have any ability to vocalize?

title: A Medical Tell-All Can Be Found in Urine
description: I happen to love asparagus and eat it often. But an acquaintance once told me she carefully avoids this wholesome vegetable simply because it makes her urine smell bad.

title: India on $1,000 a Day
description: City hopping by private jet, mingling with maharajas in their palaces, hanging out with world famous artists in their ateliers or being serenaded by a group of classical musicians in the middle of the desert  for a tiny, elite group, travel in India is far removed from the backpacker trail.

title: Lunchtime Polling Update
The Caucus | Undecided in Iowa
description: The decision-making process so far for three Iowans who are still choosing among the presidential candidates ahead of Tuesdays caucus.

title: Push for Votes as Iowa Campaign Wraps Up
description: The six contenders in Iowa fanned out across the state looking for anyone to caucus for them Tuesday night.

title: Iowa, the Early Decider, Still Hasnt
description: DES MOINES  In an election in which waves of support have come and gone for candidates, one thing has remained near constant: the percentage of voters who have been undecided, or who have indicated that they could easily change their minds on Tuesday at the Iowa caucuses. According to recent polls, 41 percent of likely Republican caucusgoers considered themselves undecided just days before votes are to be counted.

title: Two Point Guards Are Better Than One in Denver
description: When the Denver Nuggets traded Carmelo Anthony and Chauncey Billups to the Knicks last season, an opportunity arose for George Karl and his incredibly deep and highly unorthodox roster. There would be no more stifling isolations, no more breaks with the slow-footed Billups leading the way, no more indifferent defense from Anthony, nor any dropoff when the Nuggets stars went to the bench.

title: Veteran Lobbyist to Advise Romney Campaign
description: 2:39 p.m. | Updated DES MOINES  Mitt Romney has added a veteran Washington lobbyist  Charlie Black, a top political aide to Senator John McCains 2008 presidential campaign  to the circle of informal advisers who are trying to help to guide him to the White House.

title: Animal Studies Cross Campus to Lecture Hall
description: Once, animals at the university were the province of science. Rats ran through mazes in the psychology lab, cows mooed in the veterinary barns, the monkeys of neuroscience chattered in their cages. And on the dissecting tables of undergraduates, preserved frogs kept a deathly silence.

title: Glee Star Gets His Broadway Turn
description: In a rehearsal studio off Times Square last week, Darren Criss  a breakout star of the Fox high school musical series Glee  was performing a bit too perfectly.

title: One on One: Scott Harrison, Charity Water
description: Scott Harrison used to be a New York City club promoter, making a living from selling people $16 drinks and $300 bottles of vodka. Now he is the founder and chief executive of Charity Water, a nonprofit that focuses on the need for clean drinking water around the world.

title: Johnny Wilson, N.H.L. Star, Dies at 82; Held Consecutive-Game Record
description: Johnny Wilson, an All-Star forward who set a National Hockey League record by appearing in 580 consecutive games, and who played on four Stanley Cup championship teams with the Detroit Red Wings in the 1950s, died on Dec. 27 in Livonia, Mich. He was 82.

title: The Caucus | Obamas Shadow Operation
description: Jeff Zeleny reports on President Obamas robust campaign in Iowa. In spite of all the attention on the Republicans, Mr. Obama the most organized candidate in the state.

title: Staal Returns With Light Day and Some Rust
description: PHILADELPHIA  At last years Winter Classic, the Penguins Sidney Crosby received the first of two hits to the head that would sideline him with a concussion for almost 11 months.

title: Caucus Video: Obamas Shadow Operation
description: Jeff Zeleny reports on President Obamas robust campaign in Iowa. In spite of all the attention on the Republicans, Mr. Obama is the most organized candidate in the state.

title: A Gathering Storm Over Right to Work in Indiana
description: INDIANAPOLIS  Nearly a year after legislatures in Wisconsin and several other Republican-dominated states curbed the power of public sector unions, lawmakers are now turning their sights toward private sector unions, setting up what is sure to be another political storm.

title: Science, Faith and Progress (With and Without a Capital P)
description: Thomas M. Lessl, a scholar at the University of Georgia who has long studied the rhetoric and societal relationships of both science and religion, is well positioned to add to the recent discussion here over whether confidence in science as a source of progress is based on faith or fact.

title: Reaching Back 2,000 Years to Unravel a Curse
description: A vegetable seller named Babylas was the target of an alarming curse nearly 2,000 years ago. Written on a lead tablet found in Antioch, one of the largest cities in the Roman Empire, the curse calls on the gods to tie up the hapless greengrocer, then drown and chill his soul.

title: NBCs M.L.S. Promo
description: Pretty interesting NBC Sports Network promo of Major League Soccer. The new network was the Versus channel until 4 p.m. Eastern, Monday. M.L.S. will make its debut on NBC with the game between the Red Bulls and Dallas from Frisco, Tex., on Sunday, March 11 at 3 p.m. Eastern.

title: Opposition Protests Constitution in Hungary
description: BUDAPEST  As the governing party celebrated its achievements inside, tens of thousands of Hungarians rallied outside the nations 19th-century opera house on Monday in a rare opposition protest of what critics see as a campaign by Prime Minister Viktor Orban to undermine democracy and consolidate his power.

title: Reports Differ of Attack on an Iraqi Minister
description: BAGHDAD  As reports of violence in Iraq go, this one seemed straightforward, almost routine: A convoy carrying a leading Sunni politician was said to be hit by a roadside bomb north of Baghdad on Sunday night, wounding two bodyguards but leaving the official unscathed.

title: New Reality on Fox: Hurry Up and Dance
description: The reality show So You Think You Can Dance is getting shorter. Weeks or maybe months before Fox would have announced the change, the programs executive producer, Nigel Lythgoe, disclosed in a Twitter message on Sunday that the network had canceled the results show for the season scheduled to start in May. I will have to change the format, he added. Fox previously split the show into two nights, revealing the weekly results a day after the competitions. The eighth season, last year, lost ground to another summer competition, Americas Got Talent on NBC, but it remains an important piece of Foxs schedule. A Fox scheduling executive said on Twitter on Monday that the reasons for the shortening would be explained in due time.

title: Live Analysis: Rangers Win Winter Classic
description: Brad Richards, the Rangers prized off-season acquisition, scored early in the third period to lift the Rangers to a 3-2 victory against the Flyers in the Winter Classic at Citizens Bank Park on Monday.

title: Were Baa-ack, and the Academy Is, Too
description: The Bagger may have taken last week off, but the celebrity-industrial complex never rests. Meryl Streep earned kudos from the Kennedy Center and will receive an honorary Golden Bear from the Berlin Film Festival next month. The Palm Springs International Film Festival also announced yet more honorees  Charlize Theron, Jessica Chastain and Howard Shore join most of the seasons other lauded performers. And the Academy signaled once again that it is not trying to shake things up this year.

title: Mistakes and How To Deal With Them
description: So Alex Tabarrok thinks he has a great gotcha in my warnings about deficits and interest rates from 2003. Except, Ive already acknowledged that mistake:

title: Lang Lang to Play at Sonoma State Opening
description: When the financier Sanford I. Weill wanted a sense of what the music hall being built at Sonoma State University would sound like, he asked a friend, the pianist Lang Lang, to stop by to play. Mr. Weill liked what he heard, so he and his wife, Joan, went on to donate $12 million toward the projects $130 million cost.

title: A Collaboration That Began With a Disastrous Lunch
description: In the annals of academic rivalries, perhaps none is fiercer than the crosstown one between Harvard and the Massachusetts Institute of Technology.

title: Gingrich Says He Is Unlikely to Win Iowa Caucus
description: WALFORD, Iowa  Newt Gingrich has dusted off an old theme song: Eye of the Tiger, whose lyric just a man and his will to survive pumped from speakers as his campaign bus rolled dramatically into the warehouse of an excavating company here.

title: In Euro Zones Crisis, Technocrat in Paris Works Behind the Scenes
description: PARIS  With France widely expected to lose its vaunted AAA credit rating any day now, the government here is bracing for the fallout. But as President Nicolas Sarkozy heads into a tough re-election fight, for financial damage control he is increasingly reliant on a civil servant of whom few people outside France have ever heard: Ramon Fernandez.

title: A Celebrity Chef Will Take to the Chicago Stage
description: The celebrity chef Rick Bayless will take to the Chicago stage this March. Collaborating with the Lookingglass Theater Company, Mr. Bayless will serve the audience a Mexican-influenced dinner with wine pairings as he tries to cook his way into the heart of an unhappy woman in Cascabel. Mr. Bayless created the show with Tony Hernandez and Heidi Stillman, who are directing it together. Promoted as a theatrical feast, the show will run from March 21 through April 22 at the Water Tower Pumping Station. Tickets  for $200 to $225  include dinner.

title: Two Choices for Best Bedside Read in the Hospital
description: What is the best reading material for a stay in the hospital: the book that will lift you far away from that miserable place, or the one that will plunge you deeper in, a kind of guidebook to clarify local customs and keep you out of trouble?

title: An Innocent in America
description: Steven Spielbergs new film The Adventures of Tintin took in roughly $12 million during the past holiday weekend. This is not tremendous box office (Mission: Impossible  Ghost Protocol, by contrast, exceeded $30 million), but its more than some skeptics had predicted for a movie about a cartoon character who, though beloved in most parts of the world, is practically unknown in the United States. Charles de Gaulle once declared that in terms of international fame, Tintin was his only rival. We, on the other hand, dont even know how to say his name right. In the original cartoons Tintin, the creation of the Belgian artist Herg, spoke French, and thus his name should be pronounced Tanh-tanh, and not, as the movie has it, to rhyme with win win.

title: Watching Them Grow Up (1 Letter)
description: To the Editor:

title: Rape and Its Aftermath (2 Letters)
description: To the Editor:

title: Oscar Ballot Doesnt Add Up for Some Voters
description: The Oscar nomination ballots were mailed out last week  they are due back on Jan. 13  and the new voting rules are already causing problems. Its not quite a debacle on the order of hanging chads, but as Scott Feinberg writes at The Hollywood Reporter, some voters are perplexed about why the ballot only has five spaces for best picture, when there can be up to 10 nominees.

title: Risks: Resting Heart Rate as Simple Biomarker
description: A large study has found that a rise in resting heart rate over a decade may indicate an increased risk of death from coronary artery disease.

title: Patterns: Trace Elements and Pancreatic Cancer Risk
description: A new study has found that high bodily levels of the trace elements nickel and selenium may be associated with reduced risk for pancreatic cancer, and that high levels of arsenic, cadmium and lead may increase the risk.

title: To Asia and Back, Sleep Not an Option
description: IM a music guy who loves technology. My company develops things like text messaging platforms and mobile payment processing solutions. I used to work for Virgin Records, where there was a dedicated travel department that helped with everything. Now, Im on my own.

title: Nutrition: 4 Vitamins That Strengthen Older Brains
description: Higher blood levels of omega-3 fatty acids, vitamin B, vitamin C, vitamin D and vitamin E are associated with better mental functioning in the elderly, a new study has found.

title: Giants and Cowboys Lift NBC in Ratings
description: The combination of an N.F.L. division rivalry game between the Dallas Cowboys and the New York Giants with playoff implications for both teams and a lack of competition from other broadcast networks worked strongly in NBCs favor on Sunday. Preliminary overnight Nielsen estimates suggest that the game  won by the Giants, 31-14  was not only the highest-rated Sunday Night Football game since the program moved to NBC in 2006, but that it also had the best overnight rating of any Sunday prime-time N.F.L. broadcast in 13 years. It barely beat the ratings for this seasons Week 1 game between the Cowboys and the New York Jets.

title: To Promote Brisk Tea, Pepsi Enlists Yoda
description: PEPSICO is piggybacking on the release next month of Lucasfilms Star Wars: Episode I  The Phantom Menace 3D to promote its Brisk iced tea and juice drinks.

title: A Tasmanian Maginot Line for Two Millipede Species
description: On the Australian island of Tasmania, two species of millipedes maintain a mysterious standoff, according to a new study  separated by a 140-mile boundary they rarely cross.

title: British Columbia: Aggressive Strategy Lowers the Number of New H.I.V. Cases and AIDS Deaths
description: New H.I.V. cases and AIDS deaths are both going steadily down in British Columbia, according to data released last week.

title: Ron Paul Sounds Good at First, but Then Gets Pretty Scary
description: DES MOINES  They say that one of the great things about the current primary system in our country, which puts most of the power of picking in the hands of the least populated, least representative states, is that it promotes retail politicking. That means the candidates shake your hand, look you in the eye and lie to you directly.

title: Cantor Defends House G.O.P. Stance on Tax Increases
description: During an interview with 60 Minutes, Representative Eric Cantor, Republican of Virginia and the House majority leader, strongly defended his partys dug-in opposition to tax increases last year, saying it reflected the partys core values, but he seemed to stumble when recounting former President Ronald Reagans record on taxes.

title: Tending to the Loyalists
description: With airplanes flying so full these days, its not easy to find a seat using frequent flier miles. But hotel loyalty programs are a different story.

title: Gaza Premier in Turkey, in First Official Trip Abroad
description: ISTANBUL  Ismail Haniya, the Hamas prime minister of Gaza, who is making his first official trip abroad since his Islamist movement took over the Palestinian strip in 2007, sought Monday to strengthen ties with the Arab and Muslim world in the wake of regional uprisings that have produced a rise in Islamist political strength.

title: Protocol to Treat Anorexia Is Faulted
description: When a malnourished teenager with anorexia nervosa is admitted to the hospital, weight gain is a top priority  and food is medicine. But doctors mete out meals with caution, providing fewer calories than needed at first because the patients may be so frail that major swings in diet can be life-threatening.

title: Romney Sounds Increasingly Confident in Iowa
description: DUBUQUE, Iowa  Ann Romney fell on her bottom in Dubuque four years ago, and her husband cant stop talking about it.

title: How Conservatives Spin the Nations Predicament
description: Pity the Billionaire, by Thomas Frank, is a showcase example of the problems that can be created by the long lead time (six to nine months or more if a project has not been fast-tracked) involved in publishing a topical book in an age when news is instantaneous, and there is 24/7, wall-to-wall coverage of hot-button issues.

title: Out of the Kitchen and Into a Bit of Trouble
description: Blame it on the chicken.

title: A Public Policy Expert Looks at the Bird Flu Threat
description: Responding to experiments in the Netherlands and the United States in which scientists created a highly transmissible form of the potentially deadly H5N1 bird flu virus, the National Science Advisory Board for Biosecurity urged scientific journals not to publish details of the work out of fear that the information could be used by terrorists. Laurie Garrett, senior fellow for global health at the Council on Foreign Relations and a recipient of a 1996 Pulitzer Prize for her coverage of an Ebola epidemic, responds to questions about the public policy implications of bird flu and bioterrorism. Her latest book, I Heard the Sirens Scream, offers a detailed account of the 2001 anthrax attacks and the bioterrorism policy actions that resulted.

title: How Hard Would It Be for Avian Flu to Spread?
description: Recent reports that two teams of scientists had genetically altered a deadly flu virus to make it more contagious have provoked fear, even outrage, in some quarters.

title: Photo Replay: Jan. 2
description: Oklahoma State beat Stanford, Oregon beat Wisconsin, and Houston beat Penn State as the college football bowl season continued.

title: A Recipe for Simplifying Life: Ditch All the Recipes
description: Whats the first step toward cooking and eating better this year? Perhaps you should start by learning how to boil water.

title: Sometimes You Have to Settle for Just Being There
In Classic vs. Modern Violins, Beauty Is in Ear of the Beholder
description: What gives a violin made by Stradivari or Guarneri del Ges its remarkable sound? Researchers have examined the wood preservatives, varnish, even the effects of the Little Ice Age on the density of wood, for anything that might explain the instruments almost magical properties.

title: Ancient Capital Wilted When Water Ran Low
description: Angkor, the ancient city in Cambodia that was the seat of the Khmer empire, flourished from the 9th to the 15th century. Today, tourists still appreciate the remnants of its architecture and sophisticated hydro-engineering systems, composed of canals, moats and large reservoirs known as barays.

title: Triumph for Houston Comes at Penn States Expense
description: DALLAS  Quarterback Case Keenum joyously climbed into the stands and began directing the Houston band. He hugged everybody in his path. As the clock wound down in the Cougars 30-14 victory over Penn State, he made sure to give his coach, Tony Levine, a Gatorade bath.

title: Herding Quail Like Sheep
description: Jennifer Gee, a biologist at the Claremont University Consortium and the University of California, Riverside, writes from the tropical dry forest near lamos, Mexico, where she and Jennifer Calkins are studying Callipepla quail.

title: Patti Smith Ends Bowery Residency
description: As 2011 recedes in the rear-view mirror and the weekends confetti is swept away, we note as well the passing of another tradition. On New Years Eve, Patti Smith announced from the stage at the Bowery Ballroom that the concert was her last  at the Bowery Ballroom.

title: Jason Taylor on Being Carried Off the Field
description: No matter your rooting interest, it was nice to see teams that were already eliminated compete so fiercely in Week 17. The Dolphins, the Chargers and the Chiefs fought the good fight, and won. The league is smart to schedule divisional games on the final weekend.

title: For Congo Children, Food Today Means None Tomorrow
description: KINSHASA, Democratic Republic of Congo  Today, the big children will eat, Cynthia, 15, and Guellor, 13. Tomorrow, it will be the turn of the little ones, Bndicte, Josiane and Manass, 3, 6, and 9.

title: The Caucus Click: Aboard Romneys Campaign Bus
Michigans Turnaround Forged by a Friendship
description: Minutes after Western Michigan named Jack Harbaugh its head football coach in 1982, a stranger knocked on his office door.

title: Schottenheimer, Coughlin and Jaguars
description: The Jets offensive coordinator, Brian Schottenheimer, will interview for the head coaching job in Jacksonville.

title: American Groups Rebut Egyptian Accusations
description: CAIRO  Two American democracy-building organizations accused Egypts military-led government of a campaign of false statements about their activities and history, ratcheting up a confrontation between Washington and Cairo over police raids that shut down the groups offices.

title: 3 In-Laws of Afghan Girl, 15, Are Held in Her Torture
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  The Afghan girls nails had been pulled out, her skin on her ear and nose had been twisted with pliers, and she had been kept in a dark, filthy basement bathroom without proper food or water for five months by her husbands family for refusing to go into prostitution, Afghan government officials said.

title: Pakistani Panel Begins Inquiry Into Memo
description: ISLAMABAD  A three-member Supreme Court panel opened an inquiry on Monday into a controversial memo suggestive of a civilian-military power struggle, seeking statements from the Pakistani spy chief and Pakistans recently resigned ambassador to United States, as well as a former American national security adviser, before adjourning to Jan. 9.

title: Gingrich Sends an E-mail in Spanish, Asking for Support in Iowa
description: WALFORD, Iowa  Newt Gingrich promises to make English the official language of government, but on Monday he sent an e-mail appeal in Spanish asking for support at the Iowa caucuses.

title: Owners Argue Merits of Firearms on Airplanes
description: TUCSON

title: London Succumbs to the Spell of The Nutcracker
description: LONDON  That four productions of The Nutcracker have been running here over the holiday period may be little cause for surprise in the United States, where Nutcracker ubiquity is entirely accepted. But even as recently as last year, Britain, like the rest of Europe, didnt seem to have succumbed to the dictate that The Nutcracker must dominate all dance stages from December to January.

title: Pension Benefits for Military Retirees
description: To the Editor:

description: To the Editor:

title: For 2012, Signs Point to Tepid Consumer Spending
description: American consumers are running out of tricks.

description: To the Editor:
