description: To the Editor:

title: After Setbacks, Perry Takes the Long View
description: CARROLL, IowaOn his first campaign stop of the day on Monday, Gov. Rick Perry of Texas was introduced by a supporter as the next governor of the United States.

title: World Markets Turn Higher
description: European stocks rallied on Monday, after manufacturing in Germany and China beat forecasts. French bonds fell before debt sales this week and the euro weakened.

title: Heres to Filenes Basement
description: To the Editor:

title: On Wall Street, Renewed Optimism for Deal-Making
description: Before Europes debt crisis flared anew last summer, rattling markets and choking off a revival in mergers and acquisitions, huge corporate cash piles and cheap debt had fostered hopes that deal-making would recover strongly last year.

title: New Albums by Kevin Hufnagel, Jimmy Owens and Guided by Voices
description: GUIDED BY VOICES

title: The Need for Vaccinations
description: To the Editor:

title: Democrats Become Target of Occupy Protests
description: In what Occupy the Caucus members called a symbolic die-in, 12 protesters lay motionless on the lobby floor of the Renaissance Des Moines Savory Hotel Monday afternoon before getting arrested.

title: A High School Naf Doubles as a Competent Career Gal
description: In the 1980s the most dangerous place for a teenage American girl to be was in a horror movie. The wider the eyes and the rosier the cheeks, the more certain it was that she would meet a grisly fate.

title: Europeans Planning for Less Unanimity
description: BRUSSELS  For decades, any European Union nation could block proposed laws in the most delicate policy areas, like taxation, consigning them to the scrap heap if they encroached too much on its power.

title: Rick Santorum at the Pizza Ranch: Dont Vote for That Other Guy
description: BOONE, Iowa  At a hot, crowded Pizza Ranch this afternoon, where journalists and locals jostled for sight lines and breathing space, Rick Santorum explained why Iowans shouldnt just accept what seems like the inevitable, and settle for Mitt Romney.

title: Love Story, the Musical Heading to Philadelphia
description: The Walnut Street Theater in Philadelphia will present the American premiere of Love Story, The Musical in September. Based on Erich Segals novel and movie, the musical has a book and lyrics by Stephen Clark and music and additional lyrics by Howard Goodall. After a sold-out season at the Chichester Festival Theater in England, the show transferred in December 2010 to Londons West End, where it was nominated for three Olivier Awards.

title: Ibsen Fragments Under Scrutiny
description: In a case that has gripped Scandinavia, lost fragments of work by Henrik Ibsen, above, are suspected to have been forged. An economic crimes unit in Norway is looking for possessions and letters that supposedly relate to Ibsen, and to Knut Hamsun, a Nobel-winning novelist and Nazi sympathizer, The Observer of London has reported. Geir Ove Kvalheim, a Norwegian scriptwriter and actor, has been charged with forging more than a dozen documents and is scheduled for trial in April. The case began when Mr. Kvalheim said he had found fragments of a previously unknown Ibsen play, The Sun God, a discovery that would have changed literary history. News reports say that Mr. Kvalheim, who could face up to six years in prison if convicted of the offense, has refused to comment on the charges.

title: Arts Education Center Names New Executive
description: Eric G. Pryor has been named the new executive director of the Center for Arts Education, the organizations board announced on Monday. The center provides programs, professional development and advocacy for New York Citys public schools. Mr. Pryor previously served as executive director of the New Jersey State Museum and as president of the Visual Arts Center of New Jersey. He succeeds Richard Kessler, who became the dean of Mannes College the New School for Music in August.

title: A Packed Schedule For Spoleto Festival
description: American premieres of the Philip Glass opera Kepler and of John Cages 1991 orchestral trilogy, Twenty-six, Twenty-eight and Twenty-nine, will be featured at the Spoleto Festival USA, which runs from May 25 through June 10 in Charleston, S.C. The festivals schedule will also include Mike Daiseys solo shows The Agony and the Ecstasy of Steve Jobs and Teching in India; Les 7 Doigts de la Mains Traces; a production of Nol Cowards Hay Fever by the Gate Theater of Dublin; and Making Up the Truth by Jack Hitt. In addition to Mr. Glasss opera, directed by Sam Helfrich, Spoleto will offer the American premiere of Feng Yi Ting, a contemporary Chinese opera by the composer Guo Wenjing and directed by Atom Egoyan. Additional concerts will be given by K. D. Lang and Mavis Staples, and dance performances will include works from Alvin Ailey American Dance Theater.

title: Storehouses for Solar Energy Can Step In When the Sun Goes Down
description: If solar energy is eventually going to matter  that is, generate a significant portion of the nations electricity  the industry must overcome a major stumbling block, experts say: finding a way to store it for use when the sun isnt shining.

title: Romney Confident of Winning  Something
description: MARION, Iowa  Mitt Romney told a Cedar Rapids crowd Monday that President Obama is great  at some things. I watch a president whos become the great divider, the great complainer, the great excuse-giver, the great blamer, Mr. Romney said.

title: Davenport Becomes a Magnet for Candidates
description: DAVENPORT, Iowa  It took Carolyn Barry nearly until the caucuses to make up her mind. But her flirtations with a series of other candidates seemed a thing of the past as she enthusiastically shook Mitt Romneys hand while wearing a campaign button that spoke to suddenly solid support.

title: In Nigeria, Boko Haram Is Not the Problem
description: GOVERNMENTS and newspapers around the world attributed the horrific Christmas Day bombings of churches in Nigeria to Boko Haram  a shadowy group that is routinely described as an extremist Islamist organization based in the northeast corner of Nigeria. Indeed, since the May inauguration of President Goodluck Jonathan, a Christian from the Niger Delta in the countrys south, Boko Haram has been blamed for virtually every outbreak of violence in Nigeria.

title: Caterpillar Locks Out Workers in Canada
description: OTTAWA  A lockout late Sunday of about 465 workers at a Canadian locomotive factory owned by a Caterpillar unit has renewed debate in Canada about the labor impact of foreign ownership.

title: Teva Names a New Chief Executive
description: Teva Pharmaceutical Industries of Israel named Jeremy Levin of Bristol-Myers Squibb as its next chief executive, replacing Shlomo Yanai. Mr. Levin, 58, a doctor educated at the University of Cambridge, worked at Bristol-Myers as senior vice president for strategy, alliances and transactions. He will take over as president and chief in May, Teva said in a statement, after Mr. Yanai, 59, retires. Tevas shares plunged last year amid mounting competition for its No. 1 drug, a branded multiple sclerosis medicine called Copaxone. Mr. Yanai, a former Israeli army general with no previous pharmaceutical experience, spent $6.5 billion last year to buy the American biotechnology company Cephalon, then told investors in December that Teva might not able to meet its long-term target of $31 billion in sales by 2015.

title: Chiles President Defends His Response to Wildfires
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  Wildfires swept through unseasonably hot, dry parts of southern Chile on Monday, as firefighters struggled to extinguish the blazes and as the government of Sebastin Piera, Chiles beleaguered billionaire president, defended its response.

title: Queens Libraries Speak the Mother Tongue
description: The best-selling biography of Steve Jobs is flying off the shelves at libraries in Queens, which is not surprising. But in many of the boroughs 62 branches, the copies being borrowed are in Korean, Chinese or Spanish.

title: The Slush Funds of Iowa
description: Turning on the television in Iowa recently has meant getting hit by an unrelenting arctic blast of campaign ads stunning in volume and ferocity. Residents here say they have never seen anything like the constant negativity in decades of witnessing the quadrennial combat of the state presidential caucuses. The ads have transformed the Republican race for a simple reason: a new landscape of unlimited contributions to independent groups that was created by the Supreme Court.

title: In Greeces Sour Economy, Some Shops Are Thriving
description: ATHENS  With all the contraction in the Greek economy, with employees laid off en masse and one in four small businesses forced to close, it might seem odd that new shops are springing up like mushrooms in Athens and other cities.

title: Manhattans Master Plan
description: A new exhibition at the Museum of the City of New York celebrates the 200th anniversary of the Manhattans distinctive grid.

title: Mitt, the Paisley Tiger
description: Des Moines

title: Coughlin Is Set in His Ways, Because They Work
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  The notion that coaches in the N.F.L. have job security has always been something of a misconception. Positions are few. Expectations are high. Careers are short. And, generally, one can expect the current prevailing sentiment about a coachs performance  whatever that sentiment might be  to have all the staying power of rent money.

title: German Presidents Call to Paper Reignites Scandal Over Loan
description: A smoldering political scandal that could harm Chancellor Angela Merkel flared anew on Monday when Germanys biggest newspaper confirmed that the president, Christian Wulff, had made a menacing telephone call to its editor in an unsuccessful effort to snuff out a damaging news story.

title: BP Tries to Shift Costs From Spill
description: BP said in a court filing on Monday that all of its costs and damages from the 2010 Gulf of Mexico oil spill should be paid by Halliburton, its cement contractor for the Macondo well project.

title: New York Marathon Raises Entry Fee, Citing Police Costs
description: Running the New York City Marathon is a great way to lose weight. It is also going to leave your wallet a little lighter this year. Largely because the New York Police Department has begun charging event organizers to recoup its costs, entry fees for the November race jumped about $60, or 24 to 39 percent, depending on the entrant.

title: My Name Is ____. Vote for ____.

If the standoff had lasted longer than a few days, and if blood had actually been spilled, we might now know it as the Parsley War. But on July 18, they were overwhelmed and forcibly ejected by Equipo 31, a crack team of Spanish special forces soldiers. No shots were fired.

title: Ohio: Sites of Two Earthquakes Nearly Identical
description: The 4.0 magnitude earthquake that struck Youngstown on Saturday occurred at an almost identical location to one a week before, a seismologist who studied the quakes said Monday. Both earthquakes occurred close to the bottom of a 9,200-foot-deep disposal well where for months, brine and other liquid waste from natural-gas wells had been injected under pressure. They were the 10th and 11th earthquakes to occur near the well since March, but the first to be precisely located. The finding provides further evidence to support what some scientists had suspected: that the waste, from the drilling process called hydraulic fracturing that is used to unlock natural gas from shale rock, might have migrated from the disposal well into deeper rock formations, allowing an ancient fault to slip. Similar links between hydraulic-fracturing disposal wells and earthquakes have been suspected in recent years in Texas and Arkansas. John Armbruster, a seismologist with Lamont-Doherty Earth Observatory, part of Columbia University, said that the epicenter of the quake Saturday was about 100 meters, or 110 yards, from that a 2.7-magnitude quake on Dec. 24. There were a few reports of minor damage from the earthquake on Saturday, but none from any of the earlier quakes. The Ohio Department of Natural Resources reached an agreement last week with the owner of the disposal well, D&L Energy, to halt operations indefinitely and issued a moratorium on further development of disposal wells in the area until the analysis of the 4.0 quake was completed.

description: BURLINGTON, Iowa  With his candidacy battered by negative campaign ads and a disappointing showing in the Iowa caucuses, Newt Gingrich is adjusting his strategy to rescue his ailing campaign, aggressively swatting back at Mitt Romney, whose supporters have painted him into the box of a Washington influence-peddler.

title: The Strengths of Rick Santorum
description: The conventional wisdom holds that Rick Santorums last-minute bid to consolidate the not-Mitt Romney vote in Iowa is, like so many other developments in this election season, nothing but good news for Romney  because Santorums rise is preventing Rick Perry or Newt Gingrich from gaining ground instead, and in a drawn-out campaign Romney would ultimately be more threatened by Gingrich or Perry (as HotAirs Ed Morrissey puts it) than by the former Pennsylvania senator. On record, on economic conservative credibility, on ties to big donors, Dave Weigel writes, Santorums not the opponent Romney feared most. If Perry or Gingrich are in the top three, we have a real race headed into South Carolina, Erick Erickson suggests. But if Santorum wins Iowa, we might as well sit back and declare Mitt Romney the nominee. (Judging by these quotes, the Romney camp seems to agree.)

title: Jeremy Jordan On Verge of Joining Broadway Move of Disneys Newsies
description: One of the major casting questions pending on Broadway is whether Newsies, this springs new Disney musical, will star Jeremy Jordan, whose performance as the newsboy Jack Kelly drew critical acclaim in the shows premiere in New Jersey last year and helped persuade Disney Theatrical Productions to transfer it to New York. Now that Mr. Jordan is free from the Broadway musical Bonnie & Clyde, which closed on Friday, its a good bet that hell be hawking papes as Jack on Broadway.

title: Iowa Caucuses Q. & A.
description: Updated | 4:12 p.m. As Iowans and voters around the country awaited the beginning of the 2012 Republican nomination contests on Tuesday night, Michael Shear, a Times political reporter and chief correspondent for The Caucus blog, hosted a live  and lively  discussion about the caucuses on The Timess Facebook page. Below, a transcript of highlights from the chat.

title: Should Lego Be Gender-Free  or Just Less Complicated?
description: I just saw my first commercial for those Lego Friends for girls I wrote about here before the holiday, and after my first glimpse of Heartlake City, the new Lego world, I wondered if Id spoken too soon about my willingness to place my order now. As the new Ladyfig characters in their brightly colored cafe morphed, on screen, into animated creations that looked far more Polly Pocket than Lego Hermione Granger, I cringed a little. Then I took a closer look at the building, with its ice-cream cups, flowers and railings. And it occurred to me that maybe the real problem with Lego, for girls and boys, isnt the gender specificity of the various building sets. Its that there are so many sets for building so many specific things.

title: Ideas Do Have Consequences: the Ron Paul Appeal
description: NEWTON, Iowa  A Ron Paul stump speech offers something for almost everyone. And that may help explain why Mr. Paul, a 76-year-old Texas congressman, is polling so well here.

title: Jobless Rate in Germany Edges Lower, Hitting 6.8%
description: FRANKFURT  The German economy remained mostly immune to the malaise afflicting the rest of the euro zone in December, with data released Tuesday showing that unemployment fell slightly during the month and that the average number of jobless people for the full year was the lowest in two decades.

title: Romneys Stump Speech Evolved Over Time
description: BEDFORD, N.H. Last month in New Hampshire, Mitt Romney delivered what his aides billed his closing argument,a final pitch to voters before the before the nominating contests begin.

title: The Old Professor Brings Them to Their Feet
description: COLUMBIA, S.C.  For Newt Gingrich, there are no shades of gray. He speaks declaratively and authoritatively. Everything he opposes is fundamentally, profoundly, even grotesquely wrong and is often cast in apocalyptic terms.

title: Rice Noodles With Stir-Fried Chicken, Turnips and Carrots
description: Turnips are a perfect winter vegetable for a hearty stir-fry.

title: Top Hip-Hop Agent Joins C.A.A.
description: 1:31 p.m. | Updated Cara Lewis, a top booking agent for hip-hop who last month left her longtime job at WME, the agency formerly known as William Morris Endeavor, has joined that companys archrival, the Creative Artists Agency.

title: From Pippen to Holmes: Is There a Penalty for Quitting on a Team?
description: When Santonio Holmes of the Jets appeared to quit on the team in a loss to the Dolphins Sunday, a number of teammates went public with their criticism. But it wasnt the first time in recent sports history that a player was in the spotlight for not being a team-first guy. Jorge Posada of the Yankees took himself out of the lineup in May when Manager Joe Girardi tried to bat him ninth in the lineup against the Red Sox. And in 1994 Scottie Pippen of the Bulls refused to play when Coach Phil Jackson designed a scoring play for his teammate Toni Kukoc.

title: Two Hours Later, the Audience Is Won Over
description: CEDAR RAPIDS, Iowa  Rick Santorums surge in the polls took many political watchers by surprise. But it shouldnt have shocked anyone who has watched him preside over one of his nearly 400 town hall meetings in Iowa over the last year.

title: Producers Guild Announces Its Nominations
description: The Producers Guild just released its nominations, and the top film contenders are:

title: Shooting at Checkpoint Raises Tensions in a Disputed Region Claimed by Moldova
description: MOSCOW  Tension rose between Russia and Moldova, a former Soviet republic that recently celebrated 20 years of independence, after a Russian peacekeeper fatally shot a young Moldovan man as he sped through a checkpoint early on New Years Day.

title: Van Halen, Stalwart Arena-Rock Band, to Play Intimate Set at Small Club
description: Van Halen has invited music writers and critics to an intimate concert at Cafe Wha? in Greenwich Village on Thursday night as a prelude to a tour with the bands classic lineup later this year. Nothing official has been released, but journalists have been told the group will play a short set. The one-night performance in that 250-seat club on MacDougal Street in Manhattan marks the latest enigmatic hint that the band has sent about its plans for the year.

title: Man Being Questioned in Firebombings
description: Updated 1:33 p.m. | The police are questioning a man who investigators believe may be responsible for four firebomb attacks in Queens over the weekend, the citys police commissioner said on Tuesday.

title: Training Program for Math Teachers Will Shift Its Focus
Bulls-Eye | Jason Wu for Target
description: I can finally afford Jason Wu! squealed a fan upon hearing about the forthcoming Jason Wu for Target collection, in stores Feb. 5. The capsule, Wus first in collaboration with a mass retailer, possesses a lot of the labels familiar, feminine spirit but takes more direct inspiration from French New Wave films and the actress Jean Seberg. Pleated frocks with sailor-striped hemlines, dainty silk blouses with neck ties and collars, and sportier knits and tennis skirts stand out as some of the lines most wearable pieces. My goal was not to duplicate anything from my main collection, Wu says. Instead I designed completely new clothes and accessories that reflect my taste and have a voice of their own. Friendly reminders of Wus work (like the touch of lace on a trench coat or T-shirt) are matched with a delightful dose of animal humor. (Meet Milu, a mischievous kitty and the collections mascot, who makes appearances as a print on a scarf and tee.) Here, a Riviera cotton striped A-line dress and canvas satchel explain why Wu calls the whole gamut gamine chic. It seems, as they say, les jeux sont faits.

title: Beckham Appears Likely to Stay With Galaxy
description: David Beckhams days in Major League Soccer are apparently not over after all.

title: The Iowa Caucuses
description: The vote count remained too close to call into early Wednesday morning, when Mitt Romney was finally declared the winner by just eight votes.

title: Dutch Firms Finance Officer Quits After Reorganization
description: A business executive who became the first woman to be appointed chief financial officer of a large Dutch company resigned on Tuesday, citing a dispute over a management reorganization at her employer, the phone operator KPN.

title: Great for Hopping About
description: MARIJANA CONDIC and Lisa Leipziger, friends in Frankfurt, had a modest mission: to make espadrilles that were sturdier than the Spanish styles they love to wear. I came back from holiday in Spain and told Marijana we have to do something special with espadrilles so they dont fall apart after a month, Ms. Leipziger said. Their label, Lika Mimika, is the happy result. The unisex styles, in soft lamb, goat and calfskin, are hand-stitched in Spain and come in a range of neutrals and Pop colors. Two new styles, lined with rabbit fur or curly lamb shearling, are a clever travel shoe: cozy for the flight and vacation-ready upon landing.

title: Why Were Trying Another Infomercial
description: We are about to take another shot at something that ended in failure five years ago. Yes, we are making another infomercial, but this time I think I know what Im doing.Actually, that may be an exaggeration. This time, I at least have the experience of having gone through the process once before.

title: Bridesmaids, Ides of March Get a Little Help From Producers Guild
description: Order another corsage for Bridesmaids because its going to the party. The Producers Guild chose the comedy as one of its 10 best films of the year, possibly advancing its standing with the Academy on the road to Oscar. The Ides of March, George Clooneys political thriller, also got a nod, another boost following several Golden Globe nominations. The Girl With the Dragon Tattoo, which so far has been a longer shot according to most Academy Awards watchers, made the list, too. The other films the Producers Guild chose are the expected bunch: The Artist, The Descendants, The Help, Moneyball, Midnight in Paris, Hugo and War Horse.

title: When Romneys Reach Exceeds His Grasp
description: DES MOINES  It is jarring, in an age of irony and nuance, to hear Mitt Romney conclude his stump speeches with a riff on the hymn, America the Beautiful. At an early-morning rally today, a few hours before the Iowa caucuses begin, he discussed his love for the patriotic song  probably the most beloved in the canon  and recited several of the songs verses, strongly suggesting that its vision of the country differed from President Obamas.

title: Anatomy of a Stump Speech
description: A strong stump speech is one of the most important components of a presidential campaign. Times reporters following the candidates have deconstructed and annotated four candidates stump speeches, providing context and checking facts.

title: Robert L. Carter, an Architect of School Desegregation, Dies at 94
description: Robert L. Carter, a former federal judge in New York who, as a lawyer, was a leading strategist and a persuasive voice in the legal assault on racial segregation in 20th-century America, died on Tuesday morning in Manhattan. He was 94.

title: First Contest of the Year: Following the Iowa Caucuses
description: Overview | What are the Iowa caucuses? What role do they play in shaping American presidential elections? In this lesson, students create sketches and analyze visualizations of the Iowa caucuses, then conduct a scavenger hunt through The Times to find information about the 2012 Iowa caucuses and what they mean for the Republican presidential nomination.

title: Karting at Daytona: Fun, but Not Play Time
description: DAYTONA BEACH, Fla.  Late on the afternoon of Dec. 30, the bags were packed and trailers loaded. Daytona Kartweek was over, and by Saturday morning the historic speedway where it took place would be emptied of cars, 18-wheelers and tents.

title: TimesCast | January 3, 2012
description: Republican candidates make their final pitches before the Iowa caucuses | Its the season of the political tourist.

title: Interactive Feature: Anatomy of a Stump Speech
description: A strong stump speech is one of the most important components of a presidential campaign. In an effective speech, a candidate can weave promises and attacks, lay out ambitious plans, and connect with voters on a personal level.

title: Campaigning Across Iowa
description: A glimpse at the Republican candidates campaigning before the Iowa caucuses.

title: Red Bulls to Acquire Swedish Defender
description: According to reports out of Sweden, the Red Bulls have signed defender Markus Holgersson, 26, on a free transfer from Helsingborg, his hometown club.

title: Dates Set for School Closing Hearings
Asian Fusion, the Latest Chapter
description: IF you want to have some fun, bring friends to Simpson Wongs new restaurant on Cornelia Street and watch them taste the duck-fat ice cream in a dessert called duck a la plum.

title: Wong Restaurant
description: Simpson Wong has a freewheeling palate and nuanced instincts for building contrasts.

title: Obama, Romney, Jobs
description: Greg Sargent is rightly outraged by Romneys claim that Obama is a job destroyer:

title: Gingrich Calls Romney a Liar
description: DES MOINES  Weeks of staying cheerily  and ineffectively  positive amid an onslaught of negativity appears to have finally gotten to Newt Gingrich.

title: War Horse Sound Tricks: Ice Skates for Bullets and Other Trade Secrets
description: 1:09 p.m. | Updated  Box office-wise, the surprise winner of the holiday season was War Horse, Steven Spielbergs military epic. With an absence of recognizable stars - save perhaps, for the horse - the films appeal is in the very filmmaking: Mr. Spielbergs own style, of course, and that of frequent collaborators like the Oscar-winning cinematographer Janusz Kaminski and the sound designer Gary Rydstrom, who has won Oscars for Saving Private Ryan, Titanic, Jurassic Park and more.

title: Its Organic, but Is It Natural?
description: My article over the weekend on Mexicos booming market in organic tomatoes bound for the United States raises an important question: Do Americans really need to eat organic tomatoes in the winter, when they are hard to grow naturally here?

title: Landmark on Twisting Path Toward Talks
description: The Taliban re-emerged three years after the American-led 2001 invasion, mounting a violent insurgency against Western forces and the Afghan government, during which repeated efforts to bring them to the negotiating table have faltered.

title: Fed to Publish a Forecast of Rate Moves, Guiding Investors
description: WASHINGTON  The Federal Reserve will begin later this month to publish the predictions of its senior officials about their own decisions, hoping to increase its influence over economic activity by guiding investor expectations.

title: $87 Million Later, Music Start-Up Closes Before Going to Market
description: Beyond Oblivion, a digital music start-up company that raised $87 million from blue-chip investors like News Corporation, closed its doors last week without ever introducing what was supposed to be its signature product, Boinc.

title: Even Without James, Oregon Looks Strong for Next Season
description: PASADENA, Calif.  There was a moment, in the waning moments of the third quarter of what may have been his last game as an Oregon Duck, that perfectly encapsulated the spirit of LaMichael James.

title: Caucusing at Home, and Ready for Crowds
description: Tonight will be the third time Sharon McNutt and her husband, Gary, will welcome caucus voters into their home in Silver City, Iowa, one of a handful of private locations that will bear witness to the first votes of the 2012 presidential election.

title: The Outer Limits of Insider Trading
description: Most insider trading cases start out with suspicions about well-timed transactions that prove to be lucrative once information becomes public about a company. Bringing a successful enforcement action requires more than just suspicious trading, however, because the government must have evidence that a trader acted on material nonpublic information and not just that the person made a particularly prescient investment.

title: Canadian Pacific Railway Clashes With Ackman
description: 8:13 p.m. | Updated

title: Lobbyist Is Expected to Plead Guilty in Corruption Case
description: Richard J. Lipsky, a prominent New York lobbyist who was charged in the bribery conspiracy case that also ensnared State Senator Carl Kruger, is expected to plead guilty on Wednesday in Federal District Court in Manhattan, a person briefed on the matter said Tuesday.

title: From the Mail Bag: On Taking a Gap Year
description: Over the holidays, readers flooded The Choices mailbox with thoughtful comments and observations, including on the initial student postings to our first-person Envelope, Please series.

title: Murdoch Tweet Hints at Chill Between Fox News and Glenn Beck
description: A Twitter message from Rupert Murdoch about the Fox News talk show The Five drew notice on Monday.

title: Liverpool Wont Appeal Suspension of Surez
description: Liverpool has decided not to appeal the eight-game suspension given to striker Luis Surez, who was found to have used racial insults against Manchester United defender Patrice Evra in December. But the club took a few parting shots at the findings of the commission that handed down the ban before announcing its decision not to appeal it.

title: Bachmann Looks to an Election Night Miracle
description: WEST DES MOINES, Iowa  Representative Michele Bachmann made her longstanding pledge to repeal President Obamas health care law the central focus of her last campaign stop in the Des Moines area before tonights caucuses.

title: Quick Action in Kashmir After Death of Protester
description: NEW DELHI  A day after security forces shot and killed a teenager during protests over electricity shortages in Indian-administered Kashmir, regional authorities moved swiftly on Tuesday to keep the killing from setting off new rounds of demonstrations during what has been an unusually peaceful period in the region.

title: Pass the Large Grain of Salt
description: HERES a good example of what were talking about, Simon Doonan said. My Cuban sandwich had just arrived, pressed flat and bulging with cheese. He was giving it a withering once-over.

title: Simon Doonan Is Taking Reader Questions
description: Simon Doonan, the creative ambassador at large for Barneys New York and the author of the new book Gay Men Dont Get Fat, will be responding to reader questions about porking out, slimming down, the perils of guacamole and chips, and whether or not certain foods can truly be categorized as straight or gay. Submit your question as a comment below or tweet us at @nytimesdining using the hashtag #asksimon, and hell answer on Diners Journal.

title: Flavors of Peru, Recast
description: LETS go out for Peruvian! doesnt quite have the ring of a dinner invitation for Chinese or Italian. But as is increasingly clear, Peruvian cuisine  whose indigenous potatoes, chili peppers and seafood have been supplemented by ingredients and transformed by culinary techniques from many countries, China and Italy included  has much to offer beyond rotisserie chicken.

title: Charters Don't Have to Pay Rent, for Now
European Central Bank Picks Belgian as Top Economist
description: FRANKFURT  The European Central Bank unexpectedly named Peter Praet, a Belgian, its de facto chief economist on Tuesday, breaking a tradition in which German hard-liners occupied that crucial policy-making post.

title: Police Demographics Unit Casts Shadows From Past
description: Ethnic and racial profiling by the authorities. Concerns about the true loyalties of Americans whose roots are elsewhere. Tracking where New Yorkers of potentially suspect racial, ethnic or religious backgrounds live.

title: Where the Producers Guild and the Academy Part Ways
description: LOS ANGELES  On close inspection the nominations for annual movie awards from the Producers Guild of America do less to clarify a confusing Oscars race than it might appear.

title: Dancing Diplomacy: American Troupes to Tour Again for State Department
description: American dance companies are once again heading overseas to practice a kind of choreographed diplomacy as part of the second season of DanceMotion USA. The Bureau of Educational and Cultural Affairs of the State Department and the Brooklyn Academy of Music are to announce on Wednesday plans for the international tours of the four American dance companies taking part.

title: College Stars Look to N.F.L. Draft
description: Its not too early to be looking ahead to the N.F.L. draft, especially if youre a promising underclassman wanting to turn pro. Baylors junior quarterback, Robert Griffin III, the recent Heisman Trophy winner, and Stanford quarterback Andrew Luck, who has a year of eligibility remaining, lead the crop of players who have declared for the draft. Also jumping early are the Oklahoma State junior receiver Justin Blackmon and the Rutgers junior receiver Mohamed Sanu.

title: Trying Always to Please, Rarely to Challenge
description: Alvin Ailey American Dance Theaters annual five-week winter season at City Center is always a phenomenal draw. As with few or no other dance companies, all parts of that theater are thronged. The audience arrives in happy anticipation; then it greets everything with joy. Each section of Aileys Revelations, the hit of all hits, is not only followed but also actually preceded by applause.

title: Photo Replay: Jan. 3
description: The day in sports included several skiing competitions and the first round of the Brisbane International tennis tournament in Australia.

title: Alvin Ailey Dance at City Center
description: The Alvin Ailey American Dance Theater recently wrapped up its first season under its new artistic director, Robert Battle.

title: Fewer Viewers Check Out The Bachelor on ABC
description: Could the television broadcast audience be growing less susceptible to the charms of The Bachelor on ABC? The season premiere of the series averaged 7.7 million total viewers over a two-hour period on Monday night, according to Nielsen data, down from the 9 million viewers who watched the 15th-season premiere last January. There was also a 17 percent drop in the 18-to-49-year-old demographic when compared with last year. This placed ABC a distant second in the overall ratings among the broadcast networks, behind the CBS Monday comedy block. CBS finished No. 1 in all ratings categories in every prime-time half-hour.

title: Resolution: Convert Paper Bonds to Electronic Versions
description: As a New Years financial resolution, Ive decided to take care of a financial skeleton in my closet. Well, its actually a shoebox, not a skeleton  but it is literally sitting in a closet.

title: Vain Glorious | Brushes With Greatness
description: Professional-grade cosmetic brushes are a central focus for spring, with options that range from Sephoras comprehensive offering to the targeted, product-specific collections of Tom Ford and Chanel. To help identify the worthy investments from the rest, weve enlisted the expertise of five of the industrys leading makeup artists. Here, they reveal the one tool theyre rarely without.

title: Two Teams With Different Fates
description: The Sports of The Times columnist William C. Rhoden discusses how fans of both the Jets and the Giants should be scratching their heads over how their teams finished up the regular season.

title: Video: Two Teams With Different Fates
description: The Sports of The Times columnist William C. Rhoden discusses how fans of both the Jets and the Giants should be scratching their heads over how their teams finished up the regular season.

title: Afghanistan Widens Effort to Recoup Banks Assets
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  The Afghan Central Bank said Tuesday that the government was stepping up efforts to recoup public money lost more than a year ago in the collapse of Kabul Bank, the nations largest private financial institution.

title: Hedge Funds End 2011 on a Very Bad Note
description: When the history books are written, 2011 may go down as the dark ages for hedge funds.

title: Behind the Cover Story: Tara Parker-Pope on Weight Loss
description: Tara Parker-Pope is the creator and writer of Well, a daily health blog and weekly column for The New York Times. She wrote this weeks cover article, The Fat Trap.

title: Street Style: Holiday Party Outfits
description: The best of readers street style from the holiday season.

title: Quirky Running Back Keeps Hokies Amused and Defenses on Edge
description: NEW ORLEANS  It seems that everyone affiliated with the Virginia Tech football team has a favorite story about David Wilson.

title: Five Dishes at Wong
description: This week, I do my first pirouette as restaurant critic with a review of Wong, which opened on Cornelia Street in September. I dont know why the restaurant didnt make it on to more of those years best lists that everybody was publishing last month (Breaking: Gael Greene just placed it on hers), because the place offers some of the most original Asian cooking that New York has seen recently. Along with RedFarm, Kin Shop and Rouge et Blanc, Wong makes a compelling case that Asian fusion and pan-Asian cuisine are alive and kicking, even though those terms feel extremely last century at the moment.

title: Words of Wisdom From the Candidates: End This, Repeal That
description: DES MOINES  When I was in high school, assemblies rarely deviated from the following pattern: No matter the speaker, the students would start out restless, and leave bored. But we never had Ron Paul as a closer.

title: Multitasking Doctor Imperils Patient, Case Study Says
description: A 56-year-old man with dementia was admitted to a medical center. His feeding tube needed to be removed from his stomach. Its a common enough procedure that went fine. But then things went terribly wrong.

title: The Science of Contagion; Contagious Science; and Mistreating an Eating Disorder
description: The Science of Contagion; Contagious Science; and Mistreating an Eating Disorder

title: On TimesCast, a Preview of Tonights Caucus
description: Republican candidates make their final pitches before the Iowa caucuses and its the season of the political tourist.

title: Lazaruss New Colossus
description: Not like the brazen giant of Greek fame,

title: Broadway Box Office Soars, With Spider-Man Flying Highest Ever
description: Broadway producers and theater owners charged higher-than-usual prices for many seats last week to take advantage of tourists over the temperate New Years weekend, and the resulting profits were enormous. Eighteen of Broadways 34 shows earned more than $1 million, with Spider-Man: Turn Off the Dark setting a record for the highest gross ever on Broadway  $2,941,794 for nine performances  according to data released by producers on Tuesday afternoon.

title: A Portuguese University Town, Both Familiar and Foreign
description: Visiting a college town can sure bring back memories: dorm living, late night studying, partying to excess, roaming the campus dressed like vampires.

title: Georgias Tough Campaign Against Childhood Obesity
description: The blogosphere hates Georgias tough new Strong4Life campaign against childhood obesity. Short ads or billboards, each featuring an obese child (the youngest looks to be about 9, the oldest a teenager), tell Georgia to stop sugarcoating the problem. Fat kids become fat adults, reads the slogan under what looks to be the youngest child, a little girl who can be seen in a brief video saying she hates to go to school, where kids make fun of her. Another ad, under a young boy, reads: Big bones didnt make me this way. Big meals did.

title: The Next War
description: As the new year begins, At War is taking a look at a series by our Washington correspondents dubbed The Next War. The articles examine the American military and the decisions confronting it in a new age of austerity, from the cuts to come, to the costs of technology and the vision of a newer, leaner fighting force.

title: President's Loan Scandal Adds Pressure on Merkel
description: BERLIN  Just as Germany finds itself cast with the leading role in shepherding Europe out of economic crisis, the countrys top leadership appears to be faltering.

title: She Wrote a Nations Welcome
description: Even if Emma Lazaruss poem The New Colossus had not transformed the gargantuan Statue of Liberty in New York Harbor from an aggressive monument  Liberty Enlightening the World  into a welcoming Mother of Exiles; even if she had not provided that crowned goddess with a humane voice that still resonates (Give me your tired, your poor); even if she had not asserted a powerful connection between liberty and opportunity, the exhibition Emma Lazarus: Poet of Exiles  at the Museum of Jewish Heritage demonstrates that there would still be reasons to value her life and work.

title: Off the Menu
description: Opening

title: On Yacht, Murdoch Catches the Twitter Wave
description: Some people sunbathe and drink daiquiris on their Caribbean vacations. Rupert Murdoch, the chairman and chief executive of the News Corporation, joined Twitter.

title: Big Bus Operator Files for Bankruptcy
description: Coach America, one of the countrys biggest bus operators, filed on Tuesday for bankruptcy protection to cut its debt load.

title: How to Avoid Potholes on the Road to Politeness
description: Is it a breach of good manners to mislead folks just a little if you are going to show them a good time?

title: Analysts See Performance Issues Behind RIMs Delays
description: OTTAWA  When Research in Motion said in December that a new line of BlackBerry phones would not appear until the end of 2012, the announcement provoked equal parts of shock and disbelief from analysts.

title: Peter Frampton Reunited With Best Guitar After 31 Years
description: Peter Frampton has been reunited with the Gibson electric guitar he played on Frampton Comes Alive, three decades after it was presumed destroyed in a plane crash.

title: Pictures of the Day: Iraq and Elsewhere
description: Pictures from Iraq, Pakistan, Cambodia and Egypt.

title: Calendar
description: Cassoulet Contest

title: Pictures of the Day: Iraq and Elsewhere
description: Photographs from Iraq, Pakistan, Cambodia and Egypt.

title: Software Helps Identify Anonymous Writers or Helps Them Stay That Way
description: Your writing style is a little like your fingerprint. Your word choice, spelling, punctuation, sentence structure and syntax are all dead giveaways.

title: Eric Asimov: How the View from the Critics Perch Has Changed
description: FOR the last three months, Ive had the pleasure of returning to analytical eating as the interim restaurant critic. While my wife will say that I generally eat a little too critically all the time, its been my first sustained period reviewing restaurants since I began writing about wine full time in 2004.

title: Anger and Hate Devour a Man and His Country
description: The clammy chill that pervades The Hunter, the fourth feature film by the Iranian director Rafi Pitts, seeps under your skin as you wait for its grim, taciturn protagonist to detonate.

title: Steak N Bacon Cheddar Meatballs
description: Adapted from The Meatball Shop Cookbook by Daniel Holzman and Michael Chernow with Lauren Deen (Random House, 2011)

title: Nobody Likes to Talk About It, but Its There
description: DES MOINES  Talking about race in American politics is uncomfortable and awkward. But it has to be said: There has been a racist undertone to many of the Republican attacks leveled against President Obama for the last three years, and in this dawning presidential campaign.

title: Unable to Raise Capital, Brokerage Firm Calls It Quits
description: WJB Capital, a tiny broker dealer that was pushing to expand in the shadows of large Wall Street banks, has decided to close up shop after being unable to raise money from investors in recent weeks.

title: Puddin by Clio Opening in the Village
description: Clio Goodman grew up in a family of serious cooks, so it was only natural that she would try her hand at a culinary career. After graduating from the Culinary Institute of America, she worked at Danny Meyers restaurant group and for Daniel Boulud. Now she is pursuing her dream: desserts built around pudding. Let others have their macarons; Ms. Goodman has fine-tuned a classic stovetop pudding and makes it in eight flavors. On Friday, when she plans to open her little shop, Puddin by Clio, with its open kitchen and white oak trim, she will have parfaits layered with pudding, and cakes, like banana upside-down, with a pudding filling. She also makes pudding pies, including chocolate and Key lime; trifles layered with cake; and, to adorn plain pudding, about 18 sauces, crumbles, nuts and fruit.

title: Todays Scuttlebot: Emoting Robots and the Stalin of Facebook
description: Heres what the tech reporters and editors found on the Web. For more items, go to the full list in the right-hand column.

title: Hamachi Now Available to Home Cooks
description: Hamachi, or yellowtail, a fish in the jack family, is so very familiar and yet so rare: well known in its raw state, as sushi, sashimi and tartare in restaurants, yet seldom sold in retail markets for the home cook.

title: Lysistrata Jones to Close
description: Lysistrata Jones, the new Broadway musical about a college basketball team that brought dribbling, passing, and hoop shots to the Walter Kerr Theater, will close after the Jan. 8 matinee performance, the producers announced on Tuesday, following two months of weak ticket sales. The show opened on Dec. 14 to a mix of positive and negative reviews from critics, and it failed to develop a following despite the relative lack of new original musicals on Broadway last fall, with some ticket sales agents saying that the title  a modern-day twist on the classic Greek play  was off-putting to some potential theatergoers and tourist groups. (The only other original musical to open on Broadway during the fall season, Bonnie & Clyde, received worse reviews and closed on Friday.)

title: Why Id Bet on Santorum (and Against My Model)
description: The official version of FiveThirtyEights polling-based forecasts project Rick Santorum to receive about 19 percent of the vote in the Iowa caucuses on Tuesday night. It translates this to an 18 percent chance of Mr. Santorums overcoming his slight deficit with Mitt Romney and Ron Paul and winning the caucuses outright.

title: Lucky to Be a Leftover
description: HOLIDAY cooking is finally over, but many refrigerators are still in hangover mode: stuffed with the remains of Christmas beef, the country ham from New Years Day, the rest of that disappointing crown roast of pork or spectacular leg of lamb. The holidays generate a special genre of leftovers: too boring to eat, too expensive to toss.

title: Oprahs Next Chapter Draws 1.1 Million Viewers
description: Oprah Winfrey is back on television with a new talk show. But some of her fans dont seem to know.

title: A Token of Peace as a Soothing Brew
description: Unlike the oil, fruit and wood of the olive tree, which have enriched the kitchen since ancient times, the leaves have been more symbolic, as tokens of peace. But the greenery also has a less familiar culinary application. Dried olive-leaf tea is a gently mellow herbal brew with a scintilla of bitterness that evokes a green olive. Some lemon or honey enhances the flavor; its excellent iced, and can be added to a marinade, especially for fish, or  released from its bag  used in a spice rub or to season a salad dressing. Few tea stores sell it, but Garden of Eden now carries Mysia brand olive-leaf tea bags from Turkey. The individual packets are labeled Zeytin Yapragi Cayi, which simply means olive leaf tea. The tea is also available online.

title: Adblock and Wikipedia Look to Raise Money for Free Software
description: On Monday, I wrote about how the lead developer of an open-source project  Adblock Plus  had created a start-up to manage the project. As part of a new business plan, the software, which has long been known for blocking ads, would no longer block what it calls acceptable ads. (These ads will not be flashy or slow down the browsing experience.)

title: City Tells Struggling Schools to Carry On While Funds Are in Flux
Live Blogging the Iowa Caucuses
description: Welcome to FiveThirtyEights live blog of the Iowa caucuses.

title: The Caucus
description: Megan Liberman and Nate Silver talk about what we might expect to see and what unexpected outcomes to look for in the Iowa Caucus tonight.

title: The Mendacity of Dopes
description: So Alex Tabarrok thinks I treat everyone who disagrees with me as mendacious idiots, and Tyler Cowen says that I always demonize my opponents.

title: Bach Cantatas Adapted for One Babys Early Days
description: The presentations could hardly have been more disparate in scale, spirit and spectacle, or lack of it. Still, fresh memories of The Enchanted Island, the remarkable Baroque confection unveiled by the Metropolitan Opera on New Years Eve, crowded in on the experience of two Bach cantatas performed by the Trinity Choir and Trinity Baroque Orchestra on Monday afternoon as part of the Bach at One series at the intimate St. Pauls Chapel in Lower Manhattan.

title: Obama Looks for a Share of the Iowa Spotlight
description: The Republican caucus is clearly the big story Tuesday night, but that hasnt stopped President Obama from trying to grab some of the spotlight in Iowa. The president is hosting a live video conference for Democrats attending precinct caucuses across Iowa, where he will try to get himself in shape to repeat his 2008 win in the state, while at the same time landing a punch or two against the Republicans.

title: On This Rock n Roll Tour of the Heartland, a Sobering Survey of Old America
description: The decay of America is original and massive in its scale, reflects Kurt Markus, the esteemed photographer, who, with his son, Ian, filmed the small, pungent rock n roll tour documentary, John Mellencamp: Its About You.

title: Duct Tape Goes From Fix-It to Dress-Up
description: THERE was a time when Lady Gagas improvised pasties made out of duct tape might have been viewed as a creative, if painful, use of the handymans favorite fix-it. But a couple of strips of strategically placed tape is nothing compared to the elaborate ensembles do-it-yourselfers are making out of it these days.

title: Leonardo Paintings Restoration Bitterly Divides Art Experts
description: PARIS  Leonardo da Vincis Virgin and Child With Saint Anne does not enjoy the same star status as his Mona Lisa. But for the Louvre, it is an equally treasured masterpiece.

title: Why January Is the Coolest Month Onstage
description: Heres an exclamation you will probably never hear: Great news  I just got tickets to see experimental theater!

title: These Actors Think You Can Probably Do It Better Than They Can
description: New Yorkers, are you ready for your close-ups?

title: Legal Fight for Mother of Suspect in Arsons
description: LOS ANGELES  The mother of Harry Burkhart, the suspect arrested in connection with more than 50 fires that were set in the Los Angeles area, appeared in federal court Tuesday, fighting extradition to her native Germany, demanding to know where her son was and calling him mentally ill.

title: Easing Gently Into a Noisy New Year
description: To the Editor:

title: The Casino the State Saved
description: ATLANTIC CITY  The view from the 39th floor of the Revel resort and casino here is nearly as stunning as the fact that the $2.4 billion project is actually nearing completion after five years, including a stretch when construction halted for almost a year after financing evaporated.

title: Harboring Jews in Tunisia: The View From Yad Vashem
description: To the Editor:

title: Fannie Mae, Freddie Mac and the Financial Crisis
description: To the Editor:

title: One Search for a Body, Another for Meaning
description: A metaphysical road movie about life, death and the limits of knowledge, Once Upon a Time in Anatolia has arrived just in time to cure the adult filmgoer blues. It was directed by the Turkish filmmaker Nuri Bilge Ceylan, whose earlier movies include Distant and Three Monkeys and who in recent years has emerged as one of the consistently most exciting directors on the international scene. His latest, which shared the grand prize at the 2011 Cannes Film Festival, takes the unassuming form of a police investigation that, as miles and words mount, evolves into a plangent, visually stunning meditation on what it is to be human.

title: With Ownership of Corporate Parent Reportedly in Flux, Lotus Cars Awaits a Resolution
description: The ambitions of Lotus Cars, which showed six concepts just over a year ago at the Paris auto show, are again the subject of rumors and speculation. The Malaysian government may follow the advice once given by Colin Chapman, the founder of Lotus, to simplify and add lightness by divesting itself of Proton Holdings, the corporate parent of the boutique British sports-car manufacturer.

title: Santorum Delivers Harsh Critique of Obama and His Values
description: URBANDALE, Iowa  The students at Des Moines Christian Assembly found out Tuesday morning that class was being dismissed early so they could get a special civics lesson from a visiting former United States senator, Rick Santorum.

title: Invitation to a Dialogue: Are We Less Violent?
description: To the Editor:

title: On Hezbollah TV, Syrians Who Support Assad Claim to Be the Victims
description: While supporters of the Syrian uprising have done a remarkable job of documenting the Arab League observer mission  filling YouTube channels with video of outraged citizens describing the violent crackdown on dissent by the Syrian government  viewers of one television station in neighboring Lebanon are getting a very different picture of events in Syria.

title: Decoding the Iowa Caucus Coverage
description: The 2012 Iowa caucuses on Tuesday night offer a first judgement on the Republican presidential candidates. But with its changing cast of frontrunners, Web-paced reports of scandal and intrigue, and saturation TV coverage of rural campaign stops, the Iowa campaigning has provided enough spectacle to exhaust entire teams of reporters.

title: Explaining Tonights Polls
description: Within an hour or so, well be getting results about Iowa voters preferences from interviews that are known as entrance polls  similar to the exit polls conducted for primaries in other states. Edison Research of Somerville, N.J. stations interviewers at a random number of caucus sites, and they ask voters before they head inside to fill out questionnaires about their choices for a presidential candidate, and their positions on other issues.

title: Iowa Tackle Will Enter Draft
description: The Iowa offensive tackle Riley Reiff told coach Kirk Ferentz today that he will skipping his senior year to declare for the N.F.L. Draft. Reiff is considered one of the top tackle prospects in the N.F.L. Draft; ESPN projects him as a Top 10 pick. Reiff is planning on leaving this weekend to train.

title: Knicks Hope to Get Boost From Return of Rookie
description: GREENBURGH, N.Y.  The most compelling action on the Knicks practice court Tuesday came 30 minutes after practice ended. There, in a spirited game of 3-on-3, Amare Stoudemire and Iman Shumpert traded passes and slick drives.

title: Women of Steel
description: It had to happen. For female politicians, invoking the name of Margaret Thatcher at a crucial time in your campaign is one of the canniest, most clichd and most predictable of tactics.

title: Steelers Sickle Cell Trait and Denver Do Not Mix
description: PITTSBURGH  Ryan Clark peeked in the window a few moments before Coach Mike Tomlins news conference began Tuesday, a smile creasing his face as he was about to become the most unusual entrant on the playoff injury report.

title: For Wall Street Overseer, Progress Comes at a Crawl
description: Leading a new federal agency intended to help prevent another financial crisis may seem like a dream job for most economic gurus, but the government made a nomination only last month after a painfully slow search process.

title: Clemson Fans Hold Fast to a Tradition Worth More Than the Paper Its Printed On
description: ATLANTA  As far as ridiculous college football traditions go, stamping a $2 bill with an orange Clemson tiger paw is pretty benign.

title: After 40-Year Battle, Train May Roll for Oahu
description: KAPOLEI, Hawaii  From the farmlands here on the western side of Oahu, the hotels of Honolulu and the bluffs of Diamond Head can be seen rising 20 miles in the distance. This is rural Hawaii: waves and coastline on one side, lush mountains on the other and barely a building or vehicle in sight.

title: The Best Android Gaming Apps of 2011
description: Just as the 10 best Android apps can hold their own against the 10 best iPhone apps of 2011, so can the better Android games hold their own against their iPhone counterparts. Here are my picks for the best new Android games of the year.

title: In Ligurias Coastal Hills, a Storms Fury Brings a Struggle for Restoration
description: VERNAZZA, Italy  When Unesco added the Cinque Terre, five medieval coastal towns perched along the Ligurian Coast, to its World Heritage List in 1997, it cited the harmonious interaction between people and nature to produce a landscape of exceptional scenic quality.

title: In Westchester County, the Platinum Mile Is Reinvented, Again
description: In its glory days from the late 1960s to the mid-1980s, the Platinum Mile, as a section of Interstate 287 in Westchester County, N.Y., is called, was what its name suggested: a prosperous stretch of gleaming office parks, home to Fortune 500 companies like I.B.M., Texaco and General Foods.

title: New Hampshire Now Optional for Some
description: MANCHESTER, N.H.  Former Gov. John H. Sununu had come to join the phone banks at Mitt Romneys campaign headquarters here on Monday night when a reporter asked him what effect Tuesdays Republican caucuses in Iowa would have on New Hampshire.

title: Let Noncitizens Contribute to U.S. Elections
description: Arlington, Va.

title: Time, or Tolls? Doing the New Math for New Jersey Commuters
description: It sounds like a problem from a physics exam: Two drivers left a parking lot in East Brunswick, N.J., at the same moment on Tuesday morning. One swallowed hard and took the New Jersey Turnpike, paying tolls that had jumped 53 percent on New Years Day. The other took Routes 1 and 1/9, toll free.

title: The Forgotten Wages of War
description: Cambridge, Mass.

title: A Cuomo Microscope on Capitol Renovation
description: ALBANY  No one would accuse Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo of lacking attention to detail. But in recent months, his passion for the restoration of the Capitol has amazed even his closest aides, as the states chief executive has seemed at times more like its chief historian  or, at other moments, its chief architect, interior decorator and custodian.

title: There Is an I in Quit
description: Of all the various sins committed by athletes on and off the field, the worst  or at least the one that brings the quickest, most fiery denunciations  is quitting. The boxer Roberto Duran will be forever remembered for the no ms ending to his fight in 1980 against Sugar Ray Leonard. And all his N.B.A. rings will not erase Scottie Pippens petulant refusal to enter a 1994 playoff game because the final shot was drawn up for his Chicago Bulls teammate Toni Kukoc.

title: Massachusetts: Police Say Lieutenant Governor Was Sleeping and Speeding Before Car Crash
description: Lt. Gov. Timothy Murray was driving at more than 100 miles per hour and showed behavior consistent with falling asleep at the wheel when his car flipped over early on Nov. 2, the Massachusetts State Police found in an investigation released on Tuesday. In a statement to the news media, Mr. Murray said he believed his falling asleep to be the cause of the accident, although he initially said the crash was caused by black ice. The car, a state-owned vehicle, was totaled in the accident, but Mr. Murray was uninjured. Mr. Murray will pay a $555 ticket; he is not expected to face additional charges.

title: Numberplay: 2011  The Year in Puzzles
description: Happy New Year to all Numberplay readers. The New Year is traditionally a time to look back nostalgically at the past year, and look forward with hope toward the coming year. Today, I want to do mostly the former, because puzzles are infinite and open-ended and not even the authors of Numberplay know what the future will bring! But looking back over 2011 there are plenty of treasures that we can revisit, savor and perhaps extend.

title: Early Numbers From the Exit Polls
description: DES MOINES  Heres some early numbers from the entrance polls, crunched by the crack New York Times polling unit:

title: Gordon Hirabayashi, World War II Internment Opponent, Dies at 93
description: Gordon Hirabayashi, who was imprisoned for defying the federal governments internment of Japanese-Americans during World War II but was vindicated four decades later when his conviction was overturned, died on Monday in Edmonton, Alberta. He was 93.

title: Overtures to Egypts Islamists Reverse Longtime U.S. Policy
description: CAIRO  With the Muslim Brotherhood pulling within reach of an outright majority in Egypts new Parliament, the Obama administration has begun to reverse decades of mistrust and hostility as it seeks to forge closer ties with an organization once viewed as irreconcilably opposed to United States interests.

title: Bring Back Boring Banks
description: Medford, Mass.

title: Dempsey Raises the Bar for U.S. Stars in Europe
description: LONDON  American soccers biggest name has arrived in England, hoping to live up to the reputation he made for himself on his first visit. Landon Donovan is fresh from Los Angeles, so it was understandable when he noted that sequels sometimes do not live up to the original.

title: So Much Fun. So Irrelevant.
description: Two things have struck me about the Republican presidential candidate debates leading up to the Iowa caucuses. One is how entertaining they were. The other is how disconnected they were from the biggest trends shaping the job market of the 21st century. What if the 2012 campaign were actually about the world in which were living and how we adapt to it? What would the candidates be talking about?

title: Teachers Resist High-Tech Push in Idaho Schools
description: POST FALLS, Idaho  Ann Rosenbaum, a former military police officer in the Marines, does not shrink from a fight, having even survived a close encounter with a car bomb in Iraq. Her latest conflict is quite different: she is now a high school teacher, and she and many of her peers in Idaho are resisting a statewide plan that dictates how computers should be used in classrooms.

title: Beyond Elections: People Power
description: The presidential election may be grabbing headlines, but the true rallying cry for 2012 is to struggle and organize around those issues that a president might take seriously, to stake out positions that would benefit what used to be called the working class (and now goes by the 99 percent) and to garner enough political will and power to pressure the president and Congress to move resolutely on the issues that matter.

title: Louisiana: BP Cleanup Payments on Hold
description: The $20 billion fund created by BP to pay damages from the 2010 spill in the Gulf of Mexico has stopped making payments until the judge overseeing the sprawling federal court litigation clarifies a recent order. Judge Carl J. Barbier in New Orleans ruled on Dec. 29 that settlements reached since Nov. 7 must provide 6 percent of the gross settlement amount to an escrow account for certain litigation expenses of plaintiffs lawyers. In a letter to Judge Barbier, David Pitofsky, the lead counsel for the fund, asked the judge whether, among other questions, his ruling means that people who have already received money should be forced to give some of it back. We feel compelled by the courts order to freeze payments to eligible claimants until we get clarification from the court, said Kenneth R. Feinberg, administrator of the fund.

title: Yankees Are Saving Now for a Potential Splash Next Winter
description: The most telling moment of the Yankees off-season was when they simply said no to C. J. Wilson. Here was the No. 1 starter for the Texas Rangers, the two-time defending American League champions. He wanted to come to New York for a visit, and the Yankees would not even extend an invitation.

title: Turning Tax Time Into Party Time
description: AS the holiday season ends, the tax season begins, giving some revelers little reason to celebrate. A new ad campaign for Jackson Hewitt Tax Service wants to change that by getting customers to focus more on refund checks than on the actual filing of their taxes.

title: Fred Milano, an Original Member of Dion and the Belmonts, Dies at 72
description: Fred Milano, one of the original members of Dion and the Belmonts, who wove his backup tenor tones into the musically seamless harmonies of 1950s and 60s hits like A Teenager in Love and Where or When, died on Sunday at a hospital on Long Island. He was 72 and lived in Massapequa, N.Y.

title: Sanchezs Chore: Cleaning Up the Mess
description: Whenever Mark Sanchez finishes distancing himself from the Jets underachieving season, he intends to jot down his emotions so hopefully were not feeling this way next year. In the meantime, we can only imagine what must be swirling inside his head.

title: Romney Wins Iowa Caucus by 8 Votes
description: DES MOINES  Mitt Romneys quest to swiftly lock down the Republican presidential nomination with a commanding finish in the Iowa caucuses was undercut on Tuesday night by the surging candidacy of Rick Santorum, who fought him to a draw on a shoestring budget by winning over conservatives who remain skeptical of Mr. Romney.

title: Entrance Polls Show High Evangelical Turnout
description: DES MOINES  It looks like a similar proportion of evangelical voters is turning out for the caucuses this year, as compared to the four years ago.

title: Firebomber Picked Targets to Settle Personal Scores, Police Say
description: Over the last few years, the list of grudges grew, each emanating from a perceived slight. There was the time he was not allowed to use a bathroom. And the time he was apparently dissatisfied after buying crack cocaine.

title: The Frontier of Classroom Technology
Iowa Caucuses
description: The Iowa caucuses, in which a nation awaits the verdict of a handful of some of its least representative citizens, are not going to settle the race for the Republican nomination for president. But they did put on display the choice the Republicans present to voters: right, far right or the far, far right.

title: Small and Light, Starbucks Bottles as Canisters for Bombs
description: Mason jelly jars, whiskey quarts, wine and beer bottles  all have been among historys vessels of choice for a homemade gasoline bomb.

title: Rangers See Conspiracies in Winter Classic Calls
description: Coaches can be paranoid. They have been known, as well, to pop off about the quality of refereeing after any particular game  usually, of course, after defeats.

title: Reckless Disregard for Safety
description: The House showed its utter disregard for public safety in November when it approved the National Right-to-Carry Reciprocity Act, which would take away the authority of states to decide who is allowed to carry a concealed and loaded handgun within their borders.

title: Fred J. Schmidt
description: Mr. Schmidt, 56, is president and chief operating officer of Coldwell Banker Commercial of Parsippany, N.J., which has about 200 affiliated brokerage companies nationwide and is a subsidiary of Realogy.

title: A Very Likely Miscarriage of Justice
description: The power to pardon is an essential means of justice, allowing a governor to right what the law got wrong. Gov. Jerry Brown of California has been asked to commute to time served the sentence of Shirley Ree Smith, who was convicted in 1997 of killing her grandson and has already served 10 years of a 15-years-to-life sentence. We urge the governor to commute her sentence so she does not now have to return to prison as a result of a misguided Supreme Court ruling.

title: Raising Standards for Head Start
description: The Head Start program, which prepares disadvantaged 3- and 4-year-olds for school, has served nearly 30 million children since it was created in 1965. While there is little doubt that the federal program is critically important for these children and their parents, quality varies widely among programs.

title: No. 22 Harvard Visits Fordham and Leaves With a Loss
description: Chris Gaston, a 6-foot-7 junior forward who endured two seasons in which Fordham won a grand total of nine games, stalked into the locker room at halftime Tuesday, fed up. It was time for a change, he said to himself.

title: Entrance Polls: Examining Romneys Strength
description: Mitt Romney is getting the most support among Iowa caucus goers who say that defeating Mr. Obama was the most important quality in a candidate. Nearly half of voters who said defeating the president was the most important thing in a candidate said they were casting their support for Mr. Romney.

title: Booking a Flight to Space, With Travel Insurance
description: To go to outer space, Catherine Culver went to a travel agent.

title: History at the State Capitol
description: A collection of artifacts will be displayed around the Capitol complex in Albany in connection with renovations scheduled to be completed this year.

title: Accusations of Bullying After Death of Teenager
description: Amanda Cummings was not shy about her interests: animals and poetry, shopping and Katy Perry music, summer afternoons by the swimming pool and excursions to Manhattan, where she hoped to live some day.

title: The Month Ahead
description: A look at the schedule of primaries and caucuses through Feb. 4.

title: Online Sales Buoy U.P.S. And FedEx
description: With sales rising to a record $35.3 billion in November and December  a 15 percent increase from a year ago, according to the research service comScore  online retailers are celebrating.

title: Adrift in Coachs Absence, St. Johns Founders Again
description: St. Johns was a force last season when it played at Madison Square Garden, where it upset elite teams like Duke, Connecticut and Pittsburgh. The building earned the nickname Lavinwood, in homage to Coach Steve Lavin and his California ties, from the rowdy crowd of St. Johns students.

title: Oedipus Rex Complex
description: DES MOINES

title: Obama Speaks to Caucusing Democrats in Iowa
description: President Obama, back in the capital after his holiday break, was making his own speech to Iowa voters on Tuesday night, telling caucusing Democrats that he has kept the promises he made to them four years ago when his win in the Democratic caucus there electrified the country and galvanized his run for the White House.

title: Lottery Numbers
Wednesday: You Are Here
description: WEDNESDAYS PUZZLE  Brendan BEHAN was a lot of things: most chiefly among them, he was a poet and a novelist, a volunteer with the Irish Republican Army and, by his own admission, a drunk. The first two made him famous, the last killed him. What came in between sent him to prison, but it richly informed his writing. Its difficult to encapsulate a writer like Mr. Behan in one small paragraph, but Id like to move on to Brendan Emmett Quigleys puzzle.

title: Sacrificing to Nurture Her Sons Academic Aspirations
description: Listening to Kevin Del Villar rattle off ideas for how to improve Sunset Park, near his Brooklyn home, one might think he has been an urban planner or architect for years.

title: School Loses Bid to Halt Mans Protest
description: Citing the First Amendment, a judge on Tuesday denied a request by a New York City private school to prohibit the son of a former headmaster from picketing in front of the school as students arrive for class each morning.

title: Ronald Searle, Slyly Caustic Cartoonist, Dies at 91
description: Ronald Searle, the British cartoonist and caricaturist whose outlandishly witty illustrations for books, magazine covers, newspaper editorial pages and advertisements helped define postwar graphic humor, died on Friday in Draguignan, in southeastern France, where he lived. He was 91.

title: Grants in Limbo, the City Tells Principals to Hold On
description: In the face of the states suspension last week of federal grants to help improve 33 of New York Citys most troubled schools, the citys Education Department sent a reassuring message to its principals: stay the course.

title: New Wrinkle for a Fixture of Gay Life
description: The last weekend of 2011 brought mild weather to the city, so on their way home from the movies on Friday night, Randy Bourscheidt and his partner decided to go for a nightcap at Julius, a bar on West 10th Street in Greenwich Village.

title: Town Breathes Easier as Frozen Dead Guy and His Festival Stay Put
description: DENVER  It was probably not, in the end, an idea with huge franchise potential or a killer smartphone app in its future. After all, a gleefully macabre weekend celebration built around a frozen corpse  complete with coffin races, tours of the shed where the body is kept on ice and, of course, lots of beer  just might not be as fun beyond the skewed sensibility of Colorados hippie-tinged mountain belt.

title: Out of Santorums Lean Operation, a Muscular Result
description: DES MOINES  Former Senator Rick Santorums campaign in Iowa conducted no polls or focus groups, employed no speechwriter and had no security presence until a few days ago. We dont have a bunch of guys with earpieces running around doing nothing, he would boast.

title: Electability and Principles Split Iowa Votes, Poll Finds
description: DES MOINES  Republicans appeared sharply divided between those whose top priority is defeating President Obama and those seeking someone representing traditional conservative principles and religious values, according to a poll of voters entering the Iowa Republican caucuses on Tuesday.

title: As Israelis and Palestinians Talk, the Rise of a Political Islam Alters the Equation
description: JERUSALEM  Israeli and Palestinian officials met in Amman, Jordan, on Tuesday, their first encounter in more than a year, and while little emerged, the meeting said a great deal about the crossroads facing the Palestinians  and the entire Middle East  as political Islam emerges as a potentially transformative force in the region.

title: Backers Hope Pauls Iowa Strategy Will Move His Message
description: ANKENY, Iowa  Before the voting began in Iowa, Ron Paul was asked by an ABC correspondent, When you lay your head on your pillow at night, do you see yourself in the Oval Office?

title: Dispatch From Des Moines Precinct 73
description: DES MOINESAfter reciting the Pledge of Allegiance, the Iowans of Precinct 73 and about a dozen reporters listened to short speeches about all the candidates except Michele Bachmann. No one present was willing to represent her.

title: Iraqs Factional Chaos Threatens to Disrupt a Kurdish Haven
description: ERBIL, Iraq  For the Kurds here in this ancient city, the rewards of war are numerous and obvious. Construction cranes rise from the cityscape. Highway medians are green with shrubbery. A glittering shopping mall with an indoor ice skating rink stands as a totem of American-style consumerism. The only blast walls in sight are those that protect the regional parliament, decorated by sunflowers painted in muted shades of yellow.

title: Syria Killings Continue; Group to Add Observers
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  Syrian activists reported that at least two people were killed on Tuesday in the restive city of Hama in central Syria, despite the presence of Arab League observers there.

title: Singer Responds to Patriotic Duty to Enter Senegals Presidential Race
description: Putting his lucrative recording and touring career on hold in response to what he called a supreme patriotic duty, the Senegalese singer-songwriter Youssou NDour announced late Monday that he was running for president of his country.

title: Paul Concedes Top 2 Spots
description: DES MOINES  Representative Ron Paul claimed one of the three tickets out of Iowa after results showed him trailing the two leaders in the race, Mitt Romney and Rick Santorum.

title: Corrections: January 4
description: BUSINESS DAY

title: Governor Expected to Set Up Panel on Education Reform
description: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo is expected to announce Wednesday in his State of the State address that he will convene a statewide commission to address a wide range of education issues, including improving student performance and school accountability, according to people familiar with the plan.

title: Iowas Decision Night Arrives With the Air Full of the Unknown
description: PELLA, Iowa  Under the glare of a giant backlighted cross, four volunteers for Ron Paul formed a human obstacle course in front of voters walking into Pella Christian High School here, about an hours drive east of Des Moines.

title: Lovin It at the Santorum Ballroom
description: JOHNSTON, Iowa  Im lovin it! shouted Lynn Rodgers as she stood in front of a television tuned to Fox News.

title: Gingrich Promises Great Debate in N.H.
description: DES MOINES  Newt Gingrich promised that a great debate in the Republican party will begin tomorrow in New Hampshire as he lashed out at Mitt Romney as a Massachusetts moderate who would not fundamentally fix the countrys problems.

title: Iowa Caucus Live Blog
description: Caucusgoers all over Iowa are gathering in their communities Tuesday night to pick a Republican nominee for president. The Timess political unit is on the ground in the Hawkeye State  with the candidates and at the caucus sites  to provide live updates and analysis of the 2012 nominating contests. Follow along on the live dashboard and on Twitter (@thecaucus), get real-time results and dig deeper into the numbers with FiveThirtyEight.

title: A Long Wait for Equality in Parliament
description: The Indian Parliament will remain a male bastion for the near future, Nilanjana S. Roy writes in the International Herald Tribune.
