The lower house, almost 90 percent male in its composition, had ensured that a bill intended to increase the number of female members would not be passed for at least another year, she writes.

title: Bachmann Stays in the Race
description: DES MOINES  Michele Bachmann declined to drop out of the Republican presidential contest despite having come in last in the Iowa caucus, receiving only about 5 percent of the vote.

title: News Quiz | Jan. 4, 2012
description: See what you know about the news below. To prepare, you might scan the articles or summaries on todays paper.

title: 3 Arrested as Occupy Protesters March in Midtown
description: About 150 people associated with the Occupy Wall Street movement demonstrated on Tuesday at several Midtown locations, including Grand Central Terminal, where three people were arrested, the authorities said.

title: Why Ice May Be Bad for Sore Muscles
description: Already, the benches in gym locker rooms and beside basketball courts are filling with 2012s early casualties, those of us who, goaded by New Years resolutions, are exercising a bit too enthusiastically and developing sore muscles. Many of us will then drape ice packs over our aching muscles. But a new review article published this month in the journal Sports Medicine suggests that for sore muscles, ice is not always the panacea that most of us believe it to be and that, in some instances, it can be counterproductive.

title: Real Estate Prices Are Steady in Manhattan, but Sales Fall
description: The Manhattan real estate market closed out 2011 with prices relatively flat, but sales volume for the fourth quarter was down by more than 12 percent from the previous year largely because of shrinking condominium inventory as fewer new developments came to market, according to reports that will be released by the citys major brokerage firms on Wednesday.

title: Word of the Day | regal
description: regal \re-gl\ adjective

title: Perry to Return to Texas to Assess Campaign
description: DES MOINES  Rick Perry said Tuesday night that he would return to Texas to assess whether there was a path for him to continue in the presidential campaign.

title: Newt Gingrich | Iowa Caucus
description: The candidate responds to his fourth place result in the Iowa caucuses. (Courtesy of NBC)

title: Ron Paul | Iowa Caucus
description: The Republican candidate says the constitution is popular with voters in Iowa. (Courtesy of MSNBC).

title: Michele Bachmann | Iowa Caucus
description: The candidate responds to her sixth place result in the Iowa caucuses. (Courtesy of NBC)

title: Rick Perry | Iowa Caucus
description: The candidate decided to return to Texas to reassess his campaign. (Courtesy of MSNBC)

title: A Conversation With: Air Pollution Expert Dr. Gunasekar
description: Dr. Arunachalam Gunasekar is a 30-year veteran of the Indian armed forces, where he was a public health professional and director of medical research. He joined the World Health Organization in 2008, where he currently specializes in environmental health issues including air pollution and associated health problems.

title: Michigan Prevails in an Exciting Conclusion to an Uninspiring Game
description: NEW ORLEANS  Since the Bowl Championship Series went to its double-hosting format in 2006, the contest held before the national title game in the host city has been more relevant as a springboard to the next season.

title: First Vote Reinforces G.O.P.s Ideological Divide
description: DES MOINES  All year long the story of the Republican race for president was Mitt Romney and a rotating cast playing the role of Someone Else. On Tuesday night, Someone Else was played by two candidates: Rick Santorum, the longtime champion of social conservative issues that were supposedly taking a backseat in this jobs-centric presidential race, and Ron Paul, the noninterventionist Texan who represents an almost 180-degree turn from the Republican Partys direction.

title: NYT Front Page for 01/04/2012
description: NYT Front Page for 01/04/2012

title: Rick Santorum | Iowa Caucus
description: The candidate speaks from the top of a race still too close to call. (Courtesy of MSNBC)

title: In Praise of Iowa
description: Its easy to complain about the Iowa caucuses  easy and completely justifiable. Iowas caucus-goers have given us the presidency of Jimmy Carter, lent credibility to Pat Robertsons political ambitions and created a permanent constituency for ethanol subsidies among Democrats and Republicans alike. As friendly and civic-minded as Iowans may be, theres no reason why a low-turnout contest in a small, rural state should play such an outsize role in every presidential nominating process.

title: Donovan Returns for Everton
description: 3:35 p.m. | Updated Landon Donovan provided some wonderful highlights during his two-month, 13-game loan to Everton in 2010. Though credited with only two goals during his brief time with the Toffees, Donovan played extremely well: he injected speed on the wing, served up assists, took corner kicks and helped the squad earn victories over the likes of Manchester City, Manchester United and Chelsea. Named the clubs player of the month for January, he made a lasting impression with fans, teammates and Everton Manager David Moyes.

title: Mitt Romney | Iowa Caucus
description: Romney speaks as he hangs on near the top of a close race.

title: Tight Race Catches TV Anchors by Surprise
description: From their respective television studios in Midtown Manhattan on Tuesday, the liberal MSNBC anchor Rachel Maddow and the conservative Fox News commentator Karl Rove looked to Iowa and saw the same thing: a Republican race that was tight as a tick.

title: McCain Expected to Endorse Romney in New Hampshire
description: DES MOINES  Senator John McCain of Arizona is expected to endorse Mitt Romney on Wednesday in New Hampshire, giving the former Massachusetts governor a boost at a critical moment in the campaign.

title: Jan. 4, 1965 | Lyndon Johnson Outlines Great Society Plans
description: On Jan. 4, 1965, in his State of the Union address, President Lyndon B. Johnson outlined the goals of the Great Society, a set of domestic programs designed to advance civil rights and aid those in poverty.

title: Today We Eat. Tomorrow We Dont.
description: WHO is president of the Democratic Republic of Congo?

title: Test Yourself | Math, Jan. 4, 2012
description: Test your math skills with this question created by Scott Matthews at Math for America from the article Reframing the Debate Over Using Phones Behind the Wheel.

title: The Caucus | On to New Hampshire
description: Michael D. Shear reports from Des Moines on the virtual tie in Iowa between Mitt Romney and Rick Santorum as the 2012 campaign moves to New Hampshire and South Carolina.

title: Iconic Scenes, Revisited and Reimagined
description: An empty road during the Vietnam War. A hilltop landscape in Spain. A nondescript motel balcony in Memphis.

title: The Other Reason Europe Is Going Broke
description: One great way to start a bar fight during an American Economic Association conference is to claim that the U.S. economy is preferable to Europes. Someone will undoubtedly start quarreling about how G.D.P. per capita doesnt measure a persons happiness. Someone else may point out that if you look at income inequality and entitlements, the average European is doing much better.

title: Electoral Politics and Reality TV
description: Every election season, it starts earlier: a chorus of complaints about the election season having started earlier. The twist in the current version of the quadrennial exercise is the persistent meme that the Republican nomination process is mimicking the tropes of reality television. A notable guest on The Tonight Show alluded to this not long ago when asked about the primary drama: Im going to wait until everybody is voted off the island, President Barack Obama demurred. Once they narrow it down to one or two, Ill start paying attention.

title: A Day With Stephen Colbert
description: Staff of 80, cast of one.

title: How Many Stephen Colberts Are There?
description: There used to be just two Stephen Colberts, and they were hard enough to distinguish. The main difference was that one thought the other was an idiot. The idiot Colbert was the one who made a nice paycheck by appearing four times a week on The Colbert Report (pronounced in the French fashion, with both ts silent), the extremely popular fake news show on Comedy Central. The other Colbert, the non-idiot, was the 47-year-old South Carolinian, a practicing Catholic, who lives with his wife and three children in suburban Montclair, N.J., where, according to one of his neighbors, he is extremely normal. One of the pleasures of attending a live taping of The Colbert Report is watching this Colbert transform himself into a Republican superhero.

title: Do You Have a Signature Clothing Item?
description: While campaigning in Iowa, Republican presidential candidate Rick Santorum started making a fashion statement by wearing V-neck sweater vests. Do you have a favorite fashion item or accessory that you wear or carry often? What do you think it says about you?

title: Statistics That Drive Success in the Colonial
description: Field-goal percentage defense, assist-to-turnover ratio and rebounding margin: a recent analysis on The Quad found that success in those three statistical categories to be most correlated with mens college basketball teams reaching the Final Four. But are they also the best predictors for other levels of basketball success?

title: With Unemployment Insurance, Is 99 Weeks the Magic Number?
description: Casey B. Mulligan is an economics professor at the University of Chicago.

title: Ennio Morricones Music Gets Comic Treatment in London
description: The wide appeal of the music of the Oscar-winning composer Ennio Morricone, who wrote for spaghetti western films such as Fistful of Dollars, Brian de Palmas The Untouchables and hundreds of other films, is evidenced by the wide array of artists who pay homage to him. They range from the producer Danger Mouse, who with Daniele Luppi last year released an album influenced by Morricone, to Metallica, who contributed to a 2007 tribute album.

title: Fighting on Many Fronts in Asian Foreign-Language Entries
description: 1:18 p.m. | Updated  One of the intriguing mysteries of the competition for the Academy Award for best foreign-language film is trying to figure out why certain groups of countries submit films that are so similar in subject matter. For example, this year, as in 2011, several European countries have chosen films about interactions between Europeans and immigrants from poor, ravaged nations seeking sanctuary in the West.

title: When Mandela Goes
description: JOHANNESBURG  Last Friday, the holiday cheer of New Year celebrations was disrupted by news that Nelson Mandela had just been rushed to the hospital. A popular local D.J., Kaya FMs Bob Mabena, saw a report on a local television news channel and tweeted about it, setting off a virtual panic.

title: Jets Season, Foretold
description: It was Jets versus Dallas on a Sunday night at MetLife Stadium.

title: In A Village, Private Schools Do More With Less
description: The phenomena of Indian parents sending their children to private school, no matter whether they are rich or poor, isnt just happening in big cities. It has spread to towns and villages, as well.

title: Reviewing What Worked and What Didnt in 2011
description: The beginning of the year is a great time for reflection, revelation, resolution and even a little celebration. We did do some things right last year, and the results are starting to show. I also did some things wrong, which I intend to rectify in the near future. Move out of the way, 2011.

title: Amid Dark Vents in the Depths, Something Stirs
description: Around 7,800 feet under the frigid Southern Ocean, the flash of a remotely operated underwater vehicle captured scenes from a distant undersea ecosystem. Slender chimneys belched plumes of boiling black smoke. A closer look at clusters of white pebbles revealed a writhing mass of countless yeti crabs  a new species. A pale, lone octopus skulked on the ocean floor.

title: 2 Sentenced to Prison in Racial Killing That Scarred Britain
description: LONDON  More than 18 years late by the reckoning of the victims family and many others across Britain, a jury at the Old Bailey found two white men guilty of the racially motivated stabbing and murder of a black youth named Stephen Lawrence on a south London street in April 1993.

title: Romneys Ugly Win May Be a Charm
description: I dont care if you call it a win or a tie. In Iowa on Tuesday, Mitt Romney had a performance that looks ugly on the stat sheet, but which accomplished quite a bit when you consider it in its broader context.

title: Sex and Santorum
description: The race for the Republican presidential nomination has been an edifying spectacle. No, really: we are learning a lot of things that we might not have if it had been a simple Romney coronation. Until he rose in the polls, Ron Paul was seen by many liberals as an almost cuddly figure, a nice antiwar guy with some quirky ideas about gold; weve learned a bit since.

title: Beautifying America
description: Andy Rosenthal, our editorial page editor, notes that Mitt Romney likes to quote from America the Beautiful, and tells us something I for one didnt know:

title: Image of the Day: January 4
Have N.F.L. Questions? Judy Battista Has Answers
description: How far can the Broncos and Bengals go in the playoffs? Just what is going on with the Colts and Bears? Can the jets be put back together again? Judy Battista, the N.F.L. reporter for The Times, will answer questions from readers. Use the comment field below for your questions. Answers will appear Friday on The Fifth Down.

title: Santorum Celebrates Strong Finish in Iowa
description: JOHNSTON, Iowa  Rick Santorum often speaks in biblical terms, weaving references to God and Christian faith into his speeches on the campaign trail. Before a national audience on Tuesday night, he offered a glimpse of how large a theme religion will be in his quest for the Republican presidential nomination.

title: UniCredit Offering Weighs on Its Shares
description: The Italian bank UniCredit, which is seeking to raise capital to comply with new requirements, offered existing shareholders a significant discount on new stock on Wednesday, sending its shares tumbling.

title: Despite Close Finish, No Recount in Iowa
description: DES MOINES  It was, perhaps, the closest finish ever between two candidates in a presidential caucus.

title: Was Anna Hazare a Media-Created Farce?
description: Last week in Mumbai, an old man accepted defeat, Manu Joseph writes in the International Herald Tribune. What sounds like it might at first be an indictment of the Anna Hazare movement, though, is actually a dissection of the news media that transformed him into a movement.

title: Five Things to Listen For in Cuomo Speech
Both Sides Hang Tough on Teacher Evaluations
Sights for Sore Eyes
description: var data;function jsonSlideshowCallback(response){data = response;}NYTD.options = {source: data,cropType: 'blog480',appendTo: 'fullScreenSlideShow',showHeadLine: 'false', renderstyle: "embeddedSlideShowTmag"}

title: Morning Take-Out
description: For Wall Street Overseer, Progress Comes at a Crawl | Leading a new federal agency intended to help prevent another financial crisis may seem like a dream job for most economic gurus, but the government made a nomination only last month after a painfully slow search process.

title: Wednesday Reading: Space Tourism Flights Departing Soon
description: A variety of consumer-focused articles appears daily in The New York Times and online in our blogs. Each weekday morning, we gather them together here so you can quickly scan the news that could hit you in your wallet.

title: The Breakfast Meeting: Iowa Under the Microscope and China vs. the West
description: Just when you thought the intense news analysis of the presidential choices of 120,000 Iowa Republicans couldnt get any more granular, Tuesday nights caucuses produced a result that, as news anchors are fond of saying, showed that each vote counts. It was thrilling stuff for the anchors, who enjoyed the tension, as Brian Stelter writes. We have no idea when well be able to call this, Rachel Maddow said at 10 p.m. Its great. The cable networks continued on toward 3 a.m. Eastern, after Mitt Romney was declared the winner by eight votes  though, helpfully, he was ahead by a 10th of a decimal point, 24.6 percent vs. 24.5 percent for Rick Santorum.

title: U.S. Charges 3 Swiss Bank Employees With Aiding Tax Evasion
description: Wegelin & Company, the oldest Swiss bank, confirmed on Wednesday that three of its employees had been indicted by prosecutors in New York for helping United States taxpayers to hide more than $1.2 billion from the Internal Revenue Service.

title: Iowas Split Decision
description: In this weeks Campaign Stops column, I argue that given the field they were presented with, Iowas caucus-goers produced what was arguably the best possible outcome:

title: Yahoos Renovator in Chief
description: Yahoo has chosen its Mr. Fix-It.

title: Good Year for Autos, but a Test Waits in 12
description: DETROIT  American automakers last year posted their best sales since the financial crisis, earning healthy profits from better products amid a steady increase in demand for new cars.

title: Three New Stars in 3-Point Land
description: The addition of a consistent 3-point shot is one of the great off-season glamor moves in the world of N.B.A. player development, akin to adding 15 pounds of muscle, or a non-point guard claiming to have put in work on his ball-handling. But theres good reason for teams and players to value the extension of range back to the 3-point arc; although the long ball is certainly chic, its also an incredibly efficient shot and a facilitator for an established halfcourt offense.

title: McCain Backs Romney After Santorums Surge in Iowa
description: MANCHESTER, N.H.  Mitt Romney marked his arrival in New Hampshire on Wednesday with an endorsement by Senator John McCain, one of the states favorite adopted sons. The endorsement came a day after Mr. Romney won the Iowa caucuses by a mere eight votes and helped Mr. Romney consolidate his support among the Republican establishment.

title: Seeking New Yorks Other Opera Company
description: By now enough people have gotten on enough soapboxes about New York City Operas sorry financial state. But while the company remains in limbo, its precarious situation should be a reminder to look at the bigger picture.

title: Daily Report: Teachers Resist Rules on Classroom Tech
description: Matt Richtel writes in Wednesdays New York Times about the conflict over Idahos plan to require students to take online courses and to issue them laptops or tablets. While teachers say they are in favor of using technology in the classroom, they would prefer to use it on their own terms, and they are skeptical of the educational value of online courses. They note that the state may have to shift money away from teacher salaries to pay for these programs.

title: Roku Looks Beyond the Set-Top Box
description: Set-top box is one of those puzzling anachronisms, like record industry, that seems to persist for no clear reason. Perching a cable tuner, TiVo or Apple TV on top one of todays slim television sets would require either amazing balancing skills, very strong adhesive or a bit of both.

title: What Were Reading
description: Saveur: A sketch of the late days of the late, great James Beard, by Jane and Michael Stern.  Julia Moskin

title: Leading Off: The Carousel Goes Off-Axis
description: For a few minutes on Tuesday, the N.F.L. coaching/front office carousel seemed to be rotating rather smoothly. The Chargers, the Eagles and the Bears had scheduled news conferences to deal with their supremely disappointing seasons. But thats where the carousel turned into more of a Tilt-a-Whirl, and if you could follow the logic while your head made all those little circles, well, youre stronger than the rest of us.

title: Stranger Danger: Personal Finance Really Is Personal
description: Carl Richards is a certified financial planner in Park City, Utah. His new book, The Behavior Gap, was published this week, and well be running excerpts all week long. Meanwhile, his sketches are archived here on the Bucks blog.

title: Bachmann Holds News Conference in Iowa
description: Representative Michele Bachmann of Minnesota has scheduled a news conference for 11 a.m. Eastern time in West Des Moines, after her sixth-place finish in Iowas Republican caucuses on Tuesday. Mrs. Bachmann signaled that she would stay in the race after the vote last night; however, The Associated Press reported on Wednesday morning that she had canceledher planned campaign trip to South Carolina.

title: Defying Republicans, Obama to Name Cordray as Consumer Agency Chief
description: 11:49 a.m. | Updated President Obama will challenge Republican foes of the newly created Consumer Financial Protection Bureau by naming Richard Cordray as its director while Congress is out of town.

title: Dee Rees on 'Pariah'
description: Dee Rees, the writer and director of "Pariah," discusses her coming-out drama.

title: After Iowa, Obama Campaign Sharpens 2 Negative Portrayals of Romney
description: WASHINGTON  Bolstered in their view of Mitt Romney as their likeliest opponent, President Obamas campaign advisers gleefully skewered him on Wednesday as a weak front-runner in a narrowing Republican field and made clear they would cast him as out of touch with the concerns of middle-class Americans.

title: Torre Resigns to Pursue Dodgers Deal
description: Having managed in Los Angeles, Joe Torre now wants to return to the Dodgers, but this time as part of an ownership group.

title: 19 Web Sites for Travel Savings in 2012
description: HIGHER hotel prices, airline capacity cuts and rising travel demand mean travelers will have to work harder to find a good deal in 2012. But there are plenty of online tools to help keep your vacation expenses in check. Here are 19 go-to Web sites to help you save money this year.

title: Culture and Control
description: Articles in this series are exploring the struggle to shape the culture of authoritarian China.

title: The New Improved Heckling of Movies
description: Longtime readers already know that Im a huge fan of Rifftrax.com. As I wrote last year:

title: After Long Search, Philharmonic Names Top Executive
description: The New York Philharmonic named its new executive director on Wednesday. He is Matthew VanBesien, a 42-year-old former orchestral player who put away his French horn a decade ago and went on to run the Houston Symphony and then the Melbourne Symphony Orchestra in Australia.

title: An Ode to Flying
description: The classic Japanese childrens song Tako no uta (or Song of Kites) is a cheerful ode to flying. It is also one of many Japanese cultural references embedded in Sora and the Cloud, Felicia Hoshinos rich, clever and appealing book. Offering both English and Japanese text, it is itself a lovely tribute to the joys of soaring high.

title: Introducing the Cuddly Michael Shannon
description: Did you watch the Iowa caucus results last night? Along with Mitt Romney, Rick Santorum and Ron Paul, the winners included Edith Pfeffer and Carolyn Tallet, Clinton County Republican officials who helped explain the vote in a live late-night phone call on CNN, becoming Twitter stars in the process.

title: The New Goth Nail
description: Black nail polish is no longer just for angsty teenagers making their cosmetics purchases on late-night trips to Duane Reade. There has been a resurgence of the dark nail on the runways, including those of Cushnie et Ochs, Chanel and Rag & Bone, to name a few. And to disprove the idea that there cant be more than one shade of black comes the Dickensian Volume, a set of 10 deceivingly dark and metallic shades by the indie nail polish line StrangeBeautiful. Its creator, the designer-turned-beauty-entrepreneur Jane Schub, drew inspiration from Charles Dickens and the Brothers Grimm. Wear a different polish on each nail for the full effect.

title: The Iowa-Is-So-Important Phase Ends, the Iowa-Is-So-Over Phase Begins
description: DES MOINESIn 2008, the very conservative Evangelical Christians in Iowa muddled the Republican presidential nominating contest, giving their support to an unelectable candidate, Mike Huckabee, who won here over the person that Republicans were most likely to settle for in the end, John McCain. That meant the G.O.P. had to spend millions more dollars, run more nasty ads, and toss around more radical right-wing ideas before turning their attention to the general election.

title: Caucus Video: On to New Hampshire
description: Michael D. Shear reports from Des Moines on the virtual tie in Iowa between Mitt Romney and Rick Santorum as the 2012 campaign moves to New Hampshire and South Carolina.

title: On Our Radar: Dredging the Gowanus Canal
description: The Environmental Protection Agency releases a study weighing technologies for cleaning up the Gowanus Canal, which was declared a Superfund site by the agency last year. [Environmental Protection Agency]

title: Jackman to Try to Work His Box Office Magic as Houdini
description: Hugh Jackman, whose recent Broadway concert smashed several box office records, grossing $14.6 million in just 10 weeks, has committed to returning to Broadway in the 2013-14 season to star as the early-20th-century escape artist Harry Houdini in the long-gestating musical Houdini, the lead producers of the project announced on Wednesday.

title: Myanmars First Girl Band Pushes Limits of Censors, and Parents
description: YANGON, Myanmar  With their sensual choreography and provocative outfits, the five members of Myanmars first girl band are pushing the limits of artistic acceptability in this socially conservative country.

title: Bachmann Says She Will Not Continue in the Race
description: 12:12 p.m. | Updated WEST DES MOINES, Iowa  On the morning before Iowas first-in-the-nation caucuses, Representative Michele Bachmann of Minnesota said she was counting on a miracle to resurrect her faltering campaign. On the morning after, she acknowledged that it was beyond saving.

title: With New C.E.O., Yahoo Charts Independent Course
description: With the announcement of its new chief executive on Wednesday, Yahoo appears determined to chart its own course, rather than selling out.

title: Making Texts More Graphic With Emoji
description: A few weeks back, a colleague, Jenna Wortham, wrote about the growing popularity of emoji, which are much more elaborate versions of emoticons.

title: Indonesia Activists Call for Boys Release in Petty-Theft Case
description: JAKARTA  More flimsy, worn-out sandals piled up around Indonesia on Wednesday as part of a protest campaign against the trial of a 15-year-old boy a police officer has taken to court, accusing him of stealing his old footwear.

title: Identity, Discovery and Pariah
description: While Pariah tells the coming-out story of a young African-American lesbian in Brooklyn, its director, Dee Rees, sought to make a film with broader themes. Ms. Rees, who received a Gotham Award this season for breakthrough director and a best director prize from the Black Film Critics Circle, sees her film as a story about identity and self-discovery. Pariah, which stars Adepero Oduye, was a breakout hit at Sundance last year and finally made it to theaters last month. Reviewing the film for The Times, Stephen Holden called it an acutely observed examination of strait-laced parents trying to deny a childs homosexuality while all the time knowing better.

title: Samurai Shopper | Pillow Talk
description: Winter white is always chic. With my off-white faux fur from Portobello Road, my ivory crepe de chine shirt from Gucci and Ann Demeulemeesters rabbity-white leggings, the Michelin Mans got nothing on me.

title: Happier Staffers at Nonprofit Nursing Homes
description: Reading between the lines of a study published in The Gerontologist recently, I noticed another vote for nonprofit nursing homes.

title: After South Boston, a Restaurant Was Easy
description: Emerging from the housing projects of South Boston where James Bulger, known as Whitey, once ruled, Barbara Lynch has become one of Bostons most successful and celebrated restaurateurs.

title: Negotiating My 13-Year-Olds Social Life
description: Last week my almost-14-year-old son, Nathaniel, asked me if I would let him go to a New Years Eve party. Even though he had yet to be invited to one  plans were still taking shape  he was certain of one thing: He was too old and too cool to hang out at home with his mom, dad and grandma for dinner and a movie to ring in the new year.

title: Audit Group Accepts Circulation Practice of The Journal in Europe
description: The British auditing group investigating a complex circulation practice at The Wall Street Journal Europe, which led to the resignation of the papers publisher in October, said Wednesday that the practice complied with its official newspaper circulation reporting standards.

title: My Lipstick? Its in Here Somewhere
description: FOR many of us, the new year brings with it a frenzy of resolutions to streamline and organize ones life. Lets not overlook the pocketbook. More specifically: the makeup in ones pocketbook.

title: Citing Drug Resistance, U.S. Restricts More Antibiotics for Livestock
description: WASHINGTON  Federal drug regulators announced on Wednesday that farmers and ranchers must restrict their use of a critical class of antibiotics in cattle, pigs, chickens and turkeys because such practices may have contributed to the growing threat in people of bacterial infections that are resistant to treatment.

title: Feoktistovs Journal: A Lot of Miles, and Another Tough Loss
description: We heard all about the tradition at Notre Dame and were glad to be playing the Fighting Irish, ranked third in the country. But we lost another close one Tuesday night, 2-1, our third in a row, and it feels like the others  we play hard but we play unlucky.

title: Do You Own the Building?
description: Weve just published an interview with Barbara Lynch, an extremely successful restaurateur in Boston who has one big regret about her business: She doesnt own any of the real estate. My advice would be, try to own the property, Ms. Lynch told Glenn Rifkin. I dont care if its a garage but buy it because with me, nine restaurants later, I dont own any of my buildings. I lease. I make developers pretty successful, but Id rather own because when you leave, after 25 or 30 years, you dont own anything except the equipment, which ages like a car or your body.

title: Beauty Spots
description: EYES WIDE OPEN A California plastic surgeon has combined blepharoplasty (eyelid surgery) and browpexy (brow lift) to create an All-in-One Eye Lid and Brow lift that he says is less invasive than many similar procedures. The new lift takes 30 minutes and requires two internal stitches and about five days of recuperation. The procedure costs approximately $4,500 and is available at the practice of Tancredi F. DAmore, in Corte Madera, Calif. (damoreplasticsurgery.com).

title: A New Year, a New Perspective
description: MONTCLAIR, N.J.  I dont make specific New Years resolutions because I always have goals. Something that I began to think about as 2012 approached, though, is what my expectation is for the coming year. Then I read this quotation:

title: Deflating Defeats in the Burswood Bubble
description: PERTH, AustraliaThough sanctioned as the official mixed team championships of the International Tennis Federation, the annual Hyundai Hopman Cup in Perth is occasionally derisively referred to as an exhibition, the sort of low-stakes tennis crowd-pleaser oft-called a hit-and-giggle.

title: Post Offices in Small Towns Fight for Survival
description: The residents of tiny towns across the country learned last summer that their post offices were being studied for possible closing by the United States Postal Service.

title: A New Music Festival Downtown to Offer Fresh Sounds and Words
description: A music producer and a downtown theater said on Wednesday that they would establish a festival of new music-theater works next January called Prototype: Opera/Theater/Now. The festival will last two weeks and take place at the Here Arts Center in the South Village, in collaboration with Beth Morrison Projects, which produces musical events.

title: A Fight for Post Offices and Towns Souls
description: FOX, Ark.  People over a certain age here remember what happened to Mozart.

title: Libyan Leader Says Militia Clashes Could Create Civil War
description: After deadly clashes between rival fighters in Tripoli this week, Libyas transitional government expressed growing concern that the country could descend into civil war if its militias were not brought under control.

title: Los Angeles Arson Suspect Is Charged With 37 Counts
description: LOS ANGELES  The man suspected of setting more than 50 fires in the Los Angeles area was charged on Wednesday with dozens of counts of arson.

title: Straight (and Gay) Talk From Simon Doonan
description: Simon Doonan, the creative ambassador at large for Barneys New York and the author of the new book Gay Men Dont Get Fat, responds to reader questions about the dietary theories  serious and otherwise  that he expounds in his book and in an interview with The Times. Chiefly, he says the ideal diet is bisexual, mixing foods that he categorizes as straight or gay.

title: New Limits on Commodity Trades Are Approved
description: 7:44 p.m. | Updated

title: Cuomo Pushes Job Creation in 2012 Agenda
description: ALBANY  Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo, vowing to revive New Yorks stagnant economy, on Wednesday unveiled more than a dozen initiatives aimed at creating jobs across the state, including building the nations largest convention center in Queens and offering $1 billion in incentives to lure companies to Buffalo.

title: In Stanford Loss, Echoes of Elway
description: There are many ways to lose a football game, but you would be hard-pressed to find one as heart-wrenching as the way Stanford lost to Oklahoma State in the Fiesta Bowl on Monday night. The Cardinal did not trail until the final whistle, had six different 7-point leads in the game, had the ball for 70 percent of the clock and outgained the Cowboys by 178 total yards, including a 243-13 advantage on the ground. Yet still Stanford could not come away with the win.

title: Boeing to Shut Wichita Plant, Citing Cuts at Pentagon
description: With the Pentagon pushing to cut costs, Boeing said on Wednesday that it would close its sprawling military airplane plant in Wichita, Kan., over the next two years and lay off many of the 2,160 workers.

title: Will Amazon Offer Analytics as a Service?
description: Amazon.com, through its Web services business, stores vast amounts of data for companies worldwide. Does it want to start analyzing it too?

title: A Protester, Along With Students, Returns to St. David's
Sundance Offers a Web Afterlife for Its Alumni
description: WHAT happened was, Tom Noonan won at the Sundance Film Festival, and his movie disappeared.

title: Americans Feeling More Financially Secure
description: At the end of last year, Americans said they were feeling more secure about their financial situation than they had in months  especially those under 30 and those who were more affluent.

title: Assessment Complete  Perry to Stay in Race
description: Gov. Rick Perry of Texas, who said after the Iowa caucuses that he would return to Texas to assess whether there was a path for him to the Republican nomination, decided on Wednesday that there is a way forward.

title: Man Is Sentenced for Raping Ex-Girlfriend and Then Framing Her
description: Updated 5:42 p.m. | The Queens private detective who raped his ex-girlfriend and then framed her for a series of fictional crimes was sentenced to the maximum of 32 years inprison on Wednesday, bringing to a close one of the most bizarre cases to grace a courtroom.

title: Photo Replay: Jan. 4
description: The day in sports included Serena Williams injuring her left ankle at the Brisbane International, and the Water Polo by the Sea match between Australia and the United States.

title: My Three Favorite Colbert Moments
description: In this weeks magazine, Charles McGrath writes about the many sides of Stephen Colbert. Here, his three favorite Colbert moments.

title: Text: 2012 New York State of the State Address Text
description: The text of Gov. Andrew M. Cuomos speech delivered on January 4, 2012 in Albany, N.Y.

title: Video of Cuomos State of the State Address
description: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo, New Yorks 56th governor, delivered his second State of the State address on Wednesday at the Empire State Plaza convention center in Albany. Mr. Cuomos speech, which can be watched in the player above, focused on economic development issues, including the expansion of casino gambling, and on increased accountability for the states public school system.

title: For McCain, a Choice Between Old Enemies
description: For Senator John McCain, the last Republican presidential nominee, choosing between former Gov. Mitt Romney of Massachusetts or Rick Santorum, a former Senate colleague, was a pick between old enemies.

title: Plaque Honoring Michael Landon Is on a Highway to Huh?
description: Though it may lack the drama of a saloon fistfight or shootout on the Ponderosa ranch, the saga of a marker honoring the Bonanza star Michael Landon that was posted in Collingswood, N.J., has yielded differing accounts of what happened to it before it reached the office of a weekly newspaper there and, if nothing else, has revealed how strong sentiment for the actor still runs.

title: Apocalypse Iowa
description: David Brooks: Gail, anybody can be a pundit when theres some decisive thing to talk about, but when youve got a tie, thats when we separate the pros from the amateurs. If a tie in a football or a baseball game is like kissing your sister, then a tie in an Iowa caucus would be like kissing Rick Santorums sister.

title: TimesCast | January 4, 2012
description: The Republican presidential field narrows, and candidates head to New Hampshire | The historical precedents of a Republican insurgency.

title: Stone Links
description: A gathering of recent philosophy-related links.

title: The Lowdown | Cody Critcheloe
description: Arguably the most wonderfully weird thing to come out of Kansas City in recent memory, Cody Critcheloe and SSION (pronounced shun), his band of merry eccentrics, have bounced back and forth across the country for more than a decade, releasing their own music, directing music videos for groups like the Gossip, Peaches and CSS, and making their mark at MoMA PS1, Deitch Projects and the Hole. Now Critcheloe has planted his feet firmly in New York City to, we assume, turn the art of the music video forever on its head.

title: A Chicer, Cheaper New Outlook
description: ON New Years Eve, Andrew Peters, a public relations associate from Washington, was on the prowl for new eyeglasses, something to mix up his conservative day-to-day look. So a friend took him to Warby Parker, a pop-up store in SoHo where prescription glasses are priced mostly at $95, instead of several hundred dollars.

title: Michele Bachmann Ends Campaign
description: After finishing in sixth place in the Iowa caucuses, presidential-hopeful Michele Bachmann ended her campaign.

title: A Photographic Blast From the Past
description: In January 1972, the Environmental Protection Agency asked nearly 100 freelance photographers to roam the country in the pursuit of a single goal: documenting the environmental happenings and non-happenings of the decade. By 1977, the photographers had submitted more than 80,000 images for the project, known as Documerica. About one-quarter of the photographs were shown in public exhibitions but then filed away and largely forgotten.

title: Comcasts 10-Year Deal With Disney Includes Out-of-Home Viewing
description: 1/5/12 | Updated In a deal that represents billions of dollars in revenue for the Walt Disney Company, the entertainment giant and Comcast said Wednesday that they had reached a decade-long distribution agreement covering all of Disneys television content, including streaming for iPads and other devices.

title: Tortorella Fined for Winter Classic Comments
description: 8:30 p.m. | Update Tortorella was fined $30,000 by the N.H.L., according to a league official.

title: Insider Trading Accusations Are Reported Against Swiss Banks Chairman
description: FRANKFURT  Philipp M. Hildebrand, chairman of Switzerlands central bank and a well-known architect of tougher global banking regulations, came under pressure Wednesday after a Swiss publication reported that he profited from currency trades made before and after he oversaw steps to prevent the Swiss franc from becoming too strong.

title: Auditor Clears The Journal Of Improprieties in Europe
description: The British auditor for newspaper sales said on Wednesday that an unusual distribution arrangement operated by The Wall Street Journal Europe appeared to comply with its reporting standards, saying an investigation had turned up no clear evidence of violations.

title: Celebrity Apprentice Goes Higher Profile as NBC Bets Heavy on Reality TV
description: Looking to keep a veteran reality format alive, NBCs Celebrity Apprentice announced a cast for the coming series that is heavier on familiar faces than in recent seasons  as well as funny ones.

title: DLA Piper Hires 5 Energy Lawyers From Hogan Lovells
description: Big news in Big Law: Five partners at Hogan Lovells have announced that they are leaving the firm to join DLA Piper.

title: Hockney Tweaks Hirst Over Authorship of Art
description: The art world has generally come to accept that some pieces are produced by people who work for the artists they are attributed to, rather than the artists themselves. Not David Hockney. Posters for his upcoming exhibition at the Royal Academy of Arts in London include an apparent dig at the artist Damien Hirst, The Guardian reported on Monday, in the form of a note that reads, All the works here were made by the artist himself, personally.

title: Yahoos Gain Is eBays Loss
description: When Yahoo poached PayPals president, Scott Thompson, as its new chief executive this morning, it represented a huge loss for eBay.

title: Former M.T.A. Chief Recounts His Ups and the Systems Downs
description: Not much has been heard from Jay H. Walder, the former chairman of the Metropolitan Transportation Authority, since he resigned abruptly last year to take over the sleek and generously financed rail system of Hong Kong.

title: Amazon to Publish Novel by James Franco
description: James Franco, the laconic actor who collects M.F.A.s when he isnt starring in movies or hosting the Oscars, will publish his first novel in 2013. Actors Anonymous, a follow-up to Palo Alto, a book of short stories that was released in 2010, was acquired by Amazon Publishing New York, the company said on Wednesday. Ed Park, the senior editor who acquired the book, called it a hugely ambitious and wild ride.

title: Bucking Senate, Obama Appoints Consumer Chief
description: SHAKER HEIGHTS, Ohio  President Obama touched off a fierce election-year confrontation with Congressional Republicans on Wednesday, defying their deep opposition to appoint Richard Cordray as director of a new consumer protection agency and fill three labor board vacancies.

title: Margaret Court Defends Her Views on Gay Marriage
description: PERTH, Australia  After receiving a great deal of criticism for her opinions about gays and lesbians, Margaret Court affirmed her opposition to gay marriage in an interview Tuesday, but said that her views did not reflect hatred.

title: Bryants Ailing Wrist Forces Adjustments
description: Kobe Bryant, the Lakers star guard, is making some subtle changes to his shot to help his ailing right wrist. Bryant has been playing through the injury, which has been an issue since he tore a ligament Dec. 19 in a fall in an exhibition game against the Clippers. The injury did not seem significant at the time, but it has recently caused Bryant to curtail the follow-through on his shot.

title: Adele Finishes 2011 at Top of Charts
description: Adele, the British retro-soul singer who dominated music in 2011, rounded out her exceptional year in a truly appropriate way: at the top of the charts.

title: Shopping Snapshots: Jan. 5
description: Scuba influenced dresses, a Proenza Schouler bag, and the Stella McCartney store relocates to Soho.

title: Making the Invisible Visible: Exploring and Addressing Water Pollution
description: Overview | What is bioluminescence, and what function does it play in living organisms? How have researchers harnessed bioluminescence in studies of toxicity and pollution? In this lesson, students explore deep-sea bioluminescence, learn how scientists use this property to identify contaminants in water and participate in a forum on water pollution.

title: Tip for London Police Officers: Booze and Secrets Dont Mix
description: LONDON  Do not indulge in late-night carousing with journalists. Do not flirt with them, either. And above all, advised a report released here on Wednesday, if you are a police officer, do not let a member of the news media ply you with alcohol in an effort to get you to drop your defenses and start saying things you should keep to yourself.

title: Building a Knowosphere, One Cable and Campus at a Time
description: As I wrote over the weekend, the transition to a new year has provided a valuable moment to review goals for this blog and, more generally, assess prospects that the human condition (including the quality of our relationship with our environment) will be improved by the planets fast-spreading web of communication tools. I looked at blogging on Dec. 30.

title: Chrissie Miller, Popular and Still Ready to Hang Out
description: I THINK Im a hang-out-aholic, Chrissie Miller said before emitting her high-pitched laugh, a combination of nasal Upper East Side-ese with the rasp of a born-and-bred New Yorker who has done her fair share of smoking and partying.

title: Raid on Rivals in South Sudan Shows Escalating Violence
description: NAIROBI, Kenya  About one week ago, an enormous column of 8,000 armed youths was advancing through the bush in South Sudan, bent on revenge. United Nations aircraft had been steadily tracking its movements and relaying information back to the head office in Juba, South Sudans capital. Several hundred peacekeepers and government soldiers were rushed into place, but the authorities knew they were far outnumbered, and so they told residents to flee.

title: 2 British Contractors Are Held On Weapons Charges in Kabul
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  Two British citizens detained by the police in Kabul and accused of carrying an arsenal of 30 unlicensed AK-47 assault rifles in their sport utility vehicle were private security contractors, officials in Afghanistan said Wednesday.

title: New York Daily News Picks as Editor Colin Myler, Formerly of News of the World
description: The Daily News of New York on Wednesday appointedColin Myler, a former editor of the recently closed News of the World tabloid in London, its editor in chief.

title: Prosecutor Accuses Security Forces of Interfering in Mubarak Trial
description: CAIRO  The Egyptian prosecutor in the trial of former President Hosni Mubarak said Wednesday that the military-led governments security forces had obstructed his case, suggesting that the nations law enforcement officials were not all committed to a vigorous prosecution of their former boss.

title: No Charges Expected in Staten Island Girls Suicide
description: The police said Wednesday that no criminality is suspected in the case of the 15-year-old Staten Island girl who died Monday after jumping in front of a city bus, and whose uncle alleged that bullying at school was partly to blame.

title: Guess Where This Is
description: This country, which is No. 7 on our list of 45 places to go in 2012, is coming into its own as an upscale safari destination. Guess where this is in the comments below.

title: Relatively Speaking to Close at the End of the Month
description: Relatively Speaking, a triple bill of short comedies that marked Woody Allens return to Broadway as a playwright after 30 years, will close on Jan. 29 after a total of 153 performances, the shows producers announced in a statement on Wednesday. A spokesman for the producers said that they expected to recoup their full investment by the time the show closes; the producers declined to provide that dollar amount.

title: Republican Race Moves Beyond Iowa
description: DES MOINES  After a weeks-long battle over the allegiance of Iowa caucusgoers, the race for the Republican nomination broke open into a wider contest on Wednesday, as the remaining candidates moved to exploit a still-unsettled electorate and expanded playing field in New Hampshire and South Carolina.

title: Remembering Michael Dummett
description: Sir Michael Dummett, one of the most influential philosophers of the 20th century, died last week in Oxford, England. He held the position of Wykeham Professor of Logic at Oxford University from 1979 until his retirement in 1992. Below is a gathering of reminiscences from fellow philosophers, including Hilary Putnam, Timothy Williamson, Dorothy Edgington, Daniel Isaacson, and several others who knew Dummett, worked with him or were influenced by his life and work. We invite readers to offer their own contributions in the comments section.

title: The Competitive Vegan Bodybuilder
description: Jimi Sitko is a competitive vegan bodybuilder that has forged a distinctive, small subculture of anti-beefcake beefcakes who hope to change more of their competitors' eating habits.

title: Cell Carriers Show Little Interest in C.E.S.
description: Wireless carriers will have a lower profile than in previous years at next weeks Consumer Electronics Show, one of the largest technology conventions in the world.

title: Sculptured by Weights and a Strict Vegan Diet
description: HUNTSVILLE, Ala.  Jimi Sitko gets up at 4 most mornings, works out two to four hours a day and can bench-press nearly twice his weight. He has a shaved head and a brightly colored tattoo on his left arm, and he can easily be mistaken for a Marine separated from his platoon.

title: Pro-Gingrich Group Posts Anti-Romney Ad, Featuring McCain
description: MANCHESTER N.H.  On the day Mitt Romney rolled out the endorsement of Senator John McCain of Arizona, a super PAC backing Newt Gingrich dug out an old gem and put in on the Web.

title: Butter Loses its Republican Primary Connection
description: LOS ANGELES So Michele Bachmann is out of the presidential race. And that means a movie with partisan potential, Butter, set for release by the Weinstein Company on March 16, will have to trade more on Hugh Jackmans smile and Olivia Wildes good looks than on Jennifer Garners parody of a seemingly Bachmann-like character who is caught up in the overheated world of Iowa politics and butter sculpting.

title: And Now, the Oil Industry Caucus
description: North America could be self-sufficient in gasoline and diesel fuel in 15 years if only the government would get out of the way, the president of the American Petroleum Institute said on Wednesday in a state of American energy address intended to raise the industrys profile in the presidential election.

title: Poisonous Herb Spices Cat Stew in Felonious Pot
description: SHANGHAI  There was one very disagreeable ingredient in the steaming hot pot of stew that may have killed a Chinese tycoon. And it was not the cat meat.

title: Cuomo Calls for Education Commission, But Is Vague on Details
M.I.T. Professor: High Weight and Horsepower Nullify Gains in Efficiency
description: That cars have put on weight and added horsepower should be no great surprise to even casual observers of the auto industry. But a report by an economics professor at M.I.T. tries to quantify to what degree vehicle bloat has impacted the fuel economy that might have been.

title: Knitty Gritty
description: Chunky, cabled, cropped  wool is popping up in everyones wardrobes this season. (Chalk it up to all those knitting clubs and yarn-bombers.) But who would expect to check into a hotel room and find the sheets, the bedside lamp and even the morning breakfast knitted?

title: Quinn Stands Behind Decision on Seabrook Funds
description: Updated, 5:23 p.m. | A slightly testy City Council Speaker Christine C. Quinn on Wednesday defended her decision not to strip Councilman Larry Seabrook of control over more than $350,000 in discretionary funds in the coming budget cycle, even as he awaits a second trial on corruption charges related to his use of such funds.

title: A New Sign, and a Liquor Store Becomes a Wine Shop
description: The sign is now of the times.

title: New Yorks Other Opera Companies
description: With New York City Opera facing financial difficulties, other companies will have to fill the void left by the dominant Metropolitan Opera.

title: Falcons Clabo Laughs Off Jab from Tuck
description: FLOWERY BRANCH, Ga.  After the crowd of reporters disbanded from in front of his locker here Wednesday, Tyson Clabo, the Atlanta Falcons offensive tackle, said he wished he could have been more creative with his answer to the controversy of the day, but that he did not have time.

title: Too Much Self-Reliance?
description: Today, writer Benjamin Anastas went on NPRs On Point to discuss his Riff for the magazine, The Foul Reign of Emersons Self-Reliance' with Tom Ashbrook. You can listen to Anastas explain his piece and fend off Emerson acolytes here.

title: The Feds Advice on the Housing Crisis
description: The Federal Reserve tried Wednesday to stir interest among policy makers in the problems afflicting the housing market, sending a white paper to Congress outlining suggestions for easing those problems.

title: Near Toulouse, a Restored House Hides in Plain Sight
description: A property with a swimming pool, a movie theater and spalike baths, behind an original workaday exterior.

title: House Hunting in ... Southwestern France
description: A RESTORED MEDIEVAL HOUSE WITH SIX BEDROOMS IN SOUTHERN FRANCE

title: For Univision, the Holidays Bring Viewers
description: What happens when the broadcast networks decide to scale down their programming for a week because of the holidays? They lose viewers to Univision.

title: Team Draws Criticism From Past and Present Jets
description: In separate radio interviews Wednesday, Jets quarterbacks past and present unloaded on the team for fostering a culture of dysfunction and selfishness. And neither of them was Joe Namath.

title: New Programming, Same Old Results as CBS Reigns
description: With the return of new programming CBS resumed its usual Tuesday-night perch as the No. 1 network in total viewers and in the 18-to-49-year-old demographic. NCIS led the way as it broke the 20-million total viewer barrier while NCIS: Los Angeles had its largest audience of the season with 17 million.

title: Stumbling Through an American Muslim Maze
description: What a pleasure to encounter a first novel as self-assured and effortlessly told as Ayad Akhtars American Dervish. Mr. Akhtar, a first-generation Pakistani-American, has written an immensely entertaining coming-of-age story set during the early 1980s among the Pakistanis in the authors hometown, Milwaukee.

title: Obama Tempts Fight Over Recess Appointments
description: 5:41 p.m. | Updated  President Obamas decision on Wednesday to grant recess appointments to four officials  even though the Senate contends that it is not in recess  was an unprecedented legal step that brought into sharper focus a recent bipartisan struggle over presidential power.

title: Teaching Children to Love Healthy Food
description: Chicken fingers. No one  no chef and no parent  wants to raise a child who eats only chicken fingers. Or only white bread, or pasta-with-butter-and-nothing-else. The question of how to raise that highly desirable child who eats everything is one many first-time parents grapple with, and Fanae Aaron, an author and art director, was one such parent. Unlike most of us, though, who approach the process through trial and error, asking around the playground and either embracing or completely rejecting the foods we grew up with, Ms. Aaron set out to ask chefs how they fed their kids (who, she rightly presumed, mostly ate more than just white food).

title: Romney on Jobs
description: Greg Sargent has been demanding that Mitt Romney be held accountable for two claims that he makes about jobs: (1) That Obama has been a job-destroyer (2) that he, Romney, created 100,000 jobs at Bain.

title: Europe Takes Bold Step Toward a Ban on Iranian Oil
description: PARIS  Iran on Thursday sought to downplay the importance of intensified economic sanctions against it, even as European Union countries moved closer to agreement on an embargo on Iranian oil, their boldest step so far in the increasingly tense standoff with Iran over its nuclear program.

title: Pictures of the Day: Iowa and Elsewhere
description: Photographs from Iowa, New Hampshire, Bahrain and Egypt.

title: On the Oscar Shortlist for Visual Effects
description: The Academy winnowed the number of contenders for best visual effects today. On the shortlist are:

title: California Urges Drivers to Change the Oil Less Often
description: A California agency is campaigning to get car owners to change their motor oil at a longer interval, claiming that the time-honored practice of switching the oil every 3,000 miles is financially wasteful, detrimental to the environment and unwarranted.

title: German President Rejects Calls to Quit in Scandal
description: BERLIN  President Christian Wulff of Germany fought back on Wednesday against a barrage of criticism over his handling of a private loan scandal, insisting in a nationally broadcast interview that he would not consider stepping down while admitting that he had made a grave mistake.

title: British Seek Data on Suspect Breast Implants
description: With the British government under increasing pressure to follow the French health authorities recommendation to remove breast implants made with low-grade silicone, Health Secretary Andrew Lansley ordered British clinics on Wednesday to quickly report how many of the implants have ruptured or oozed.

title: The Nonsense Problem
description: Brad DeLong does a lot of work meeting a challenge from Kantoos, who insists that neither Brad or I have done justice to John Cochranes arguments. And what Brad finds is  nothing that makes a bit of sense.

title: Golden Globes Alert: Seeking the Next Young Actress to Reign
description: During this years Hollywood awards season, the fashion world will be scouting for the next ingnue to soar to its upper ranks.

title: The Perilous Art of Giving Books
description: Long ago, The Onion ran the mock-headline: Book Given As Gift Actually Read. More recently, the Tumblr site The Books They Gave Me has collected autobiographical reminiscences that illustrate the sometimes perilous task of finding the right book for the right reader. But what about book-giving as a theme in literature itself? The Times ran a feature last month itemizing the books authors love to give and receive, but the examples below suggest that some writers have taken a dim view of book-giving in their own work:

title: Seeking the Next Red Carpet Knockout
description: AT last years Golden Globes ceremony, when Hailee Steinfeld, then 14 and a star of True Grit, traipsed down the red carpet in a cream-colored Prabal Gurung gown that artfully toed the line between age-appropriate and demurely chic, she went from plucky Hollywood newcomer to fashion It Girl in about a nanosecond.

title: TimesCast: Heading to New Hampshire, and a Look Back
description: Richard W. Stevenson, The Timess political editor, looks at the narrowing Republican presidential field as the candidates head to New Hampshire. Sam Tannenhaus, editor of the Book Review, examines the historical precedents of a Republican insurgency.

title: The Last of Last Years Food Links
description: Meat consumption is on the decline and expected to decline further in 2012. Meanwhile, even U.S. News & World Report is recognizing The Mainstreaming of Vegan Diets.

title: Resolution: Better Personal (and Financial) Organization
description: This week on Bucks, the whole Your Money gang is laying out their financial resolutions for 2012. On Tuesday, Ann Carrns wrote about the paper savings bonds in her closet. Ive got two things on my mind.

title: Barnes & Noble Said to Put Publishing House Up for Sale
description: Barnes & Noble has put Sterling Publishing up for sale, nearly a decade after it bought the publishing house, a person briefed on the matter said Wednesday.

title: Much Ado About Methane
description: David Archer, the author of The Long Thaw and a Realclimate.org contributor, has weighed in at length on questions and assertions about the greenhouse risk posed by methane released from warming Arctic seabeds and tundra.

title: The Buzz
description: A PREVIEW of the must-attend parties, talked-about openings and fashionable night spots for the week ahead.

title: Bote: Red Egg
description: CHINATOWN restaurants that moonlight as night spots have become kitschy refuges on the downtown fashion circuit. One of the few to approach quasi-permanence is Red Egg, where a lively dance party replaces fish balls and duck mei fun several evenings a week. The soirees started during Fashion Week in September, replacing the flash-in-the-pan Madame Wong, and continue to steam up the dumpling house this winter.

title: Comparing Economic Mobility
description: American men born in the bottom quintile are more likely to stay there than the Danish.

title: Rajat Gupta Seeks Dismissal of Charges in Insider Case
description: 7:50 p.m. | Updated

title: Annals of Liberal Wishful Thinking
description: The New Republics Noam Scheiber argues that a strong bid by Rick Santorum could undercut Mitt Romneys general election hopes:

title: For the Hawks, Its a Marvin Williams Moment
description: Seven years ago, a bad decision by then Hawks general manager Billy Knight consigned Marvin Williams to a career of unfair comparisons. Despite the fact that Williams had only played one unremarkable year of college ball, Knight passed on the highly touted Deron Williams and Chris Paul to make Williams, a sixth man and combo forward out of North Carolina, the No. 2 overall pick in the 2005 draft.

title: Homes for $998,000
description: Homes in Manchester, VT., Highlands, N.C. and Austin, Tex.

title: What You Get for ... $998,000
description: MANCHESTER, VT.

title: A Newcomer Is Showing Her Comfort Among Stars
description: The second act of Stick Fly, Lydia R. Diamonds meaty soap opera about an affluent black family, begins with its youngest character, 18-year-old Cheryl, the daughter of the familys maid, on the phone in the familys well-appointed kitchen. Shes getting bad news from her mother. Life-changing bad news.

title: Michigan Has Its Say
description: Jonathan Mahlers article on Benton Harbor, Mich., prompted responses from all over the world. Not surprisingly, a disproportionate number of respondents hailed from Michigan.

title: In Iowa, the Drama Behind the Drama
description: Every four years, for a few hours on a Tuesday night in January, Iowa becomes the center of the political world.

title: In Iowa, the Drama Behind the Drama
description: DES MOINES

title: Fox News Leads in Iowa Ratings; CNN, in Second, Has Big Falloff
description: The cable news networks finished in slightly scrambled positions in the ratings for coverage of the Iowa caucuses Tuesday night, with the perennial leader, Fox News, in first, CNN in second, and MSNBC in third. Typically, MSNBC is second and CNN is third.

title: The New Adventures of Tim
description: It was Landon Donovans 2012 debut (on a short-term loan) in the English Premier League Wednesday, but it was Evertons other American  goalkeeper Tim Howard  who made a huge impression when he became the fourth goalkeeper in E.P.L. history to score a goal.

title: Adviser Accused of Using LinkedIn to Promote Bogus Deals
description: LinkedIn is best known as a social networking hub, where people can locate and research just about anyone.

title: When an Actress Prepares (No Eye Contact, Please)
description: As Lisbeth Salander in David Finchers adaptation of The Girl With the Dragon Tattoo, Rooney Mara rarely gives anyone a straight look. Instead her gaze is downcast, sideways  anywhere but into the face of her interlocutors, whether they are friendly or decidedly not.

title: Todays Wearable Computers Help You Sleep, Not Tweet
description: I recently wrote a column about wearable computing, in which Idiscusseda future in which people will eventuallywear glasses and contact lenses with built-in screens, delivering content we can use. It will be like having smartphones in our eyes, but much smarter ones.

title: A New Diversity Monitor for the S.E.C.
description: 8:52 a.m. | Updated

title: Some Countries Are More Social Than Others, Survey Finds
description: In the big cities of India and China, it seems, people cant help being social. Nearly everyone who uses the Internet there is also active on social networks, according to a vast global survey by Forrester Research, and most of them do much more than read and watch whats posted online. Three out of four of them write blog posts or upload pictures and music.

title: Pushing New Boundaries
description: The five members of Myanmars first girl band are pushing the limits of artistic acceptability in this socially conservative country.

title: Todays Scuttlebot: A Walmart Acquisition and African Song-Swapping
description: Interesting things that Bits reporters and editors found on the Web. More here.

title: Karzai Gives a Lukewarm Welcome to Taliban Talks
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  President Hamid Karzai said on Wednesday that he welcomed the Talibans announcement that they planned to openly pursue negotiations with the United States by setting up an office in Qatar.

title: Scenes From a Career
description: The actor Timothy Olyphant has worked steadily since the 1990s, but in Justified he has found his defining role.

title: Eyeing Santorums Possible Base in New Hampshire
description: While Rick Santorum received strong support from evangelical Christians and voters who described themselves as very conservative in the Iowa caucuses, he most likely wont be able to count on that deep of a base in New Hampshire.

title: Tortorella Apologizes; League Issues Fine
description: GREENBURGH, N.Y.  Offering a detailed series of apologies, Rangers Coach John Tortorella expressed regret Wednesday for his comments after the N.H.L. Winter Classic.

title: Mr. Zeitgeist
description: ON a rainy Thursday last month, Tyler Brl huddled over a cappuccino at Le Pain Quotidien in Greenwich Village, offering a peek at the future: a Heritage G2 tabletop radio designed for Monocle 24, a new radio station he is starting.

title: Sales at Calypso, Crate & Barrel and Others
description: Many pieces of furniture are up to 40 percent off at Crate & Barrel, through Sunday (the Saija chair in Marimekko Spinning fabric, regularly about $1,000, is about $500); (800) 967-6696, crateandbarrel.com.

title: Real Connections in Game Land
description: I used to talk to Natasha on the phone.

title: Presenting Sacred Works in a Style From the 1600s
description: The soprano Jolle Greenleaf and the violinist Scott Metcalfe may not have fully realized that they were on to something big when they started the Green Mountain Project, an outgrowth of Ms. Greenleafs superb vocal ensemble, Tenet. The idea was to assemble the proper forces for Monteverdis Vespers of the Blessed Virgin  a collection of sacred works published in 1610  and to ring in 2010 with a performance celebrating the 400th anniversary of the work. The concert proved a resounding success, and Ms. Greenleaf (the groups artistic director) and Mr. Metcalfe (its music director) reconvened their forces at the start of 2011 and attracted a huge audience.

title: Bachmanns Next Decision: Whether to Run for Re-election
description: WEST DES MOINES, Iowa  Having only decided not to continue her presidential bid on Wednesday morning, Representative Michele Bachmann of Minnesota has yet to decide whether to run for re-election to Congress.

title: At Hotel The Exchange in Amsterdam, Fashion Checks In
description: The United States has Alex Calderwood, the risk-taking owner of the Ace Hotel chain with its street art aesthetic, but the Netherlands has Suzanne Oxenaar and Otto Nan. The enterprising art-world duo opened their first hotel, The Lloyd, in Amsterdam in 2004, and it quickly became the go-to place for artists, musicians and designers. In 2010, they opened the pop-up Llove Hotel in Tokyo, a tongue-in-cheek twist on that citys pay-by-the-hour hotels.

title: Cleaning That Dryer Vent
description: Its the holy grail of New York apartment living: your own washer-dryer. But along with the convenience comes the job of keeping the dryer vent clean, a chore that, for apartment and single-home dwellers, might be a good candidate for that 2012 to-do list.

title: With a Wave in Mind Comes a Table
description: The Wave Dining Table, by Salih Teskeredzic, a Bosnian furniture designer, was inspired by the Neretva River, which overflowed during a storm in the autumn of 2010. The waves that day gave me the idea of the wave, the shape of it, said Mr. Teskeredzic, 49.

title: Dcor NYC, a Consignment Store With Class
description: Another consignment store, Dcor NYC, has just opened in New York, with 6,000 square feet of space for furniture and decorative accessories from consumers, decorators and designer showrooms.

title: Market Ready
description: Q. My apartment doesnt get much natural light. What can I do to improve the way it looks to buyers?

title: Who Had Diamond King? Declarer Didnt Care
description: The Swiss Teams event that was held on Dec. 30, the final day of the Edgar Kaplan Winter Regional in Manhattan, was won by Sylvia Moss, Migry Zur-Campanile-Albu and Pietro Campanile of New York City, and Alex Ornstein of Roslyn Heights, N.Y.

title: A Pantone Executive on Changing the Countrys Tone
description: For the last 12 years, Leatrice Eiseman, executive director of the Pantone Color Institute, author and the owner of a color consulting company, has headed the committee that chooses Pantones color of the year, in an effort, she says, to distill the prevailing mood into a single hue.

title: A Cold Lesson in Fire Safety
description: THE Christmas Day fire that killed five people, including three children, in Stamford, Conn., has sent many homeowners scrambling to check their own safety equipment.

title: 10 Questions for the Dean of Admissions of the University of Pennsylvania
description: In spring 2009, The New York Times started a blog called The Choice to demystify the process of applying to American colleges and universities, and paying for it. The blog has since offered countless tips and reams of news on all aspects of the American college admissions process to an audience of students and their families, as well as to their counselors and to college admissions officers themselves.

title: A Home for a Designer Eager to Renovate
description: Rolf Bruggink, a Dutch designer, calls his crumbling town house in Rotterdam the Black Pearl, after the black-painted brick facade.

title: In Rotterdam, a Town House Reborn
description: ROTTERDAM, the Netherlands

title: The Pirates of the East End
description: A COMBINATION of luck and astoundingly cheap credit several years back put me in possession of a house in East Hampton, N.Y. My downfall had to do with the manly art of maintenance. Shortly after my Hamptons dream house was completed, the ducts that carry exhaust outside from the basement dryer fell to the floor, spewing dust and lint.

title: A Leader in Iowa, Santorum Still Has Trouble Online
description: 3:14 p.m. | Updated Coming within eight votes of victory in the Iowa caucus has brought new respect to Rick Santorum from the news media, and even prospective voters. Just not yet from the Google search engine, or Bing or Yahoo, for that matter.

title: For G.O.P., One Party but Three Platforms
Gene Bartow, Successor to John Wooden at U.C.L.A., Dies at 81
description: Gene Bartow, who succeeded the legendary John Wooden as coach of the U.C.L.A. basketball team and who coached five other college teams over a 34-year period, died on Tuesday at his home in Birmingham, Ala. He was 81.

title: If Only the Beer Grew, Too
description: THE folks at Hammacher Schlemmer have always been expert salespeople, convincing legions of Americans that they need all sorts of products to solve problems they didnt know they had. (If your dog could talk, surely it would tell you it wants you to order that $150 heated car seat for pets.)

title: Relax. Theres Plenty of Room.
description: TEXANS arent known for understatement, so when Mark Williamson starts describing his couch (We call it Texas depth), its a good bet hes not talking about a love seat.

title: Ties to China Linger as Issue as Taiwanese Prepare to Vote
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan  As he nears the end of his first term, President Ma Ying-jeou faces a litany of challenges that might sound familiar to Western politicians: stagnant wages, a growing wealth gap and steep housing prices that have frozen young urbanites out of the real estate market.

title: Meredith Buys FamilyFun Magazine From Disney
description: The Meredith Corporation has agreed to purchase FamilyFun magazine from Disney Publishing Worldwide, adding another title aimed at mothers to its portfolio of magazines, which include American Baby, Parents and Family Circle.

title: Taiwan's Noisy Presidential Elections
description: On January 14th, Taiwan heads to the polls. During the campaign, piggy banks have become a symbol of opposition to incumbent President Ma Ying-jeou.

title: The Giants Secondary Is Burned No More
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  The words used to accurately describe the Giants secondary this season have not been flattering: burned, scorched and barbecued, in addition to confused, struggling and lost.

title: The Night It Was ThisClose in Iowa
description: To the Editor:

title: In N.F.L. Front Offices, Coming, Going and Staying Put
description: At about the six-minute mark, Jeffrey Luries end-of-season news conference began to sound like the best mans toast at a soap-opera wedding.

title: Civilians Killed in War
description: To the Editor:

title: Texas: Student With Pellet Gun Is Killed by Police
description: A 15-year-old student at a Brownsville middle school was shot and killed by police officers on Wednesday after he displayed a gun in the schools main hallway, the authorities said. The weapon was later identified as an air-powered .177-caliber pellet gun. The eighth grader, Jaime Gonzalez, had brandished the weapon in the hallway at Cummings Middle School, after most students were already in their classrooms. The student pointed the gun at Brownsville police officers who came to the scene, and he ignored numerous commands to drop it, police officials said. Two officers fired their weapons, and the student was shot twice. Police officials said he had assaulted a student before the officers arrived and told witnesses that he was going to confront the officers with the weapon.

title: Back to School, and Debt
description: To the Editor:

title: California: Bishop Who Fathered 2 Children Resigns
description: A Roman Catholic bishop in Los Angeles has resigned after the revelation that he has two adult children. Gabino Zavala, an auxiliary bishop in the Los Angeles Archdiocese, submitted his resignation to the pope, which was accepted, according to a letter sent out Wednesday by the archbishop of Los Angeles, Jose H. Gomez. Bishop Zavala will cease taking part in the ministry. The letter stated that the two children, whose identities have not been made public, live with their mother in another state. The archdiocese has offered to help finance the childrens college costs. Roman Catholic priests are required to remain celibate.

title: F.D.A. Orders Surgical Mesh Makers to Study Risks
description: The Food and Drug Administration issued an order on Wednesday requiring makers of implantable surgical mesh used to treat urinary incontinence in women to study its risks.

title: Falcons Still Pursuing Elusive Playoff Victory
description: FLOWERY BRANCH, Ga.  The Atlanta Falcons are caught between floors, between smooth and wrinkled, between coming or going. They are considered solid, often better than that, but no one is going to give the Falcons their due until solid turns into something substantial, like a playoff win or two.

title: Louisiana: Payments for Gulf Spill Resume
description: Kenneth R. Feinberg, administrator of the $20 billion fund created to pay damages from the 2010 Gulf of Mexico oil spill, has reopened the cash window. Mr. Feinberg halted payments on Tuesday while seeking clarification from the federal judge overseeing litigation related to the disaster. Judge Carl J. Barbier recently ruled that 6 percent of settlements after Nov. 7 be put in escrow for certain plaintiff litigation expenses. On Wednesday, he issued a ruling stating that the payment only applies to new settlements, and that the 6 percent will be calculated from the net amount of the settlement after withholding for liens and other obligations, not from the gross amount.

title: Work as Usual for U.S. Warship After Warning by Iran
description: ABOARD U.S.S. JOHN C. STENNIS, in the North Arabian Sea  If Irans warning on Tuesday to this American aircraft carrier was intended to disrupt the ships routine or provoke a high-seas reaction, nothing of the sort was evident on Wednesday.

title: MDC Partners Picks Up RJ Palmer
description: RJ PALMER, a leading independent media agency, is being acquired by MDC Partners in a deal that underscores the growing importance to marketers of media services in a digital age.

title: Candidates Who Do Better Than Expected Win More Media Attention
description: The dramatic finish of the Iowa caucus  the confirmation of a late surge in support for Rick Santorum and the eight-vote margin separating him and Mitt Romney  brings up the question of what happens next. Here is one systematic finding:

title: Retired, but Overcoming Her Pain to Help Disabled Children Ride, and Walk, Tall
description: Mary Anderson tugged on the strap of Kiarra Boodrams helmet, making sure it was secure, then pushed Kiarras wheelchair up to Hot Diggity, a white pony three and a half feet tall with gray and black patches.

title: In a Shift, the President of Yemen Will Stay Put
