title: Thursday Reading: Director Appointment Gives Consumer Agency More Clout
description: A variety of consumer-focused articles appears daily in The New York Times and online in our blogs. Each weekday morning, we gather them together here so you can quickly scan the news that could hit you in your wallet.

title: Daily Report: Yahoos Mr. Fix-It
description: In Thursdays New York Times, Steve Lohr reports on Yahoos pick for its next chief executive  Scott Thompson, the president of PayPal, the online payment service owned by eBay.

title: Poetry Pairing | Precipice
description: Todays Poetry Pairing matches Jill Alexander Essbaums Precipice with two New Years pieces about time. One, the painting shown above, is from a Dec. 31, 2009 article about representations of time in the visual arts; the other, published this Sunday, is a rumination on our temporal lives from The Stone, a Times philosophy blog.

title: U.S. Shares Rally and Recover, but the Euro Falls Again
description: The stock indexes in the United States ended mixed on Thursday, but banks and technology companies rallied and employment data bolstered optimism in the economy. Treasuries fell, and the euro and commodities dropped.

title: Transforming a Body  and a Performance
description: What does it take to make an Oscar-worthy performance for an actress? From Nicole Kidmans nose to Charlize Therons pounds, a physical transformation is often key. The Bagger took a close look at the hopefuls in this seasons race, who endured piercings and shavings (Rooney Mara in The Girl With the Dragon Tattoo), gained weight (Michelle Williams, who wanted it for her curves in My Week With Marilyn) and added British teeth (Meryl Streep in The Iron Lady). In Albert Nobbs, Glenn Close and Janet McTeer even changed gender, a process that Ms. McTeer said quickly gave her a window into her character.

title: Morning Take-Out
description: Facebook Aside, Market for I.P.O.s Stays Cool | It will take more than Facebook to heat up the tepid market for initial public offerings.

title: The Cult of Kirchner
description: BUENOS AIRES  Argentinians breathed a sigh of relief on Wednesday when President Cristina Fernndez de Kirchners spokesman announced that the operation to remove her cancerous thyroid gland had gone off without a hitch. Supporters gathered outside the hospital since Tuesday night cheered in jubilation.

title: The Breakfast Meeting: Adele Lifts Album Sales, and Tension on the Olbermann Set
description: Sales of complete albums reached 330.6 million in the United States last year, a 1.3 percent increase from 2010, according to Nielsen SoundScan. As Ben Sisario writes: Some businesses might call that level of growth flat, but since album sales had fallen every year since 2004, it was a notable improvement. That boost can be traced by the huge sales for Adeles 21 (XL/Columbia), which sold 5.82 million copies, the best one-year sales total since 2004.

title: In Creating Successful Schools, One Size Does Not Fit All
Cuomo's Education Commission: Still Missing the Who, When and What
Vain Glorious | Spray Your Vitamins
description: With 2012 under way and New Years resolutions established (eat fewer frites, exercise more, drink less), why not add a less challenging one  take more vitamins.

title: The Demise of the Public Library
description: LONDON  A couple of years ago, after a reading in Karachi, I told off a young man who was asking me to sign a pirated copy of one of my books. Piracy is destroying publishing in Pakistan, I told him. He said he understood but added that because pirated books are cheaper he could buy more of them. Its not as if Karachi is filled with public libraries, he said.

title: Cuomos Push for Casinos Not Good News for All Gamblers
description: At about the same time that Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo began his State of the State speech on Wednesday, a middle-aged woman walked away from a slot machine called Great Wall in the new gambling hall adjoining Aqueduct racetrack. That machine had taken enough of her money for one day, said the woman, who preferred to keep her name to herself.

title: Barnes & Noble Considers Spinning Off Its Nook Unit
description: 9:13 p.m. | Updated

title: Sherlock Star Benedict Cumberbatch Is Clued In to Star Trek Role
description: The case of the vacant Star Trek role appears to be solved  or has it? The Sherlock star Benedict Cumberbatch, who offers a contemporary portrayal of Sir Arthur Conan Doyles consulting detective, Sherlock Holmes, on that BBC and PBS series, has been cast in a major role in a sequel to Star Trek, the cinematic reimagining of James T. Kirks outer-space adventures from J. J. Abrams and his crew. But just what role Mr. Cumberbatch will play in the new movie is a mystery all its own.

title: Santorum Criticizes Obama for Recess Appointments
description: MANCHESTER, N.H.  Rick Santorum on Thursday assailed President Obama for the recess appointments he made a day earlier, accusing the president of thinking he is above the law and urging the Senate to go to the ramparts on this one.

title: Retail Sales Edged Up in December After Stores Cut Prices Sharply
description: Retailers salvaged their December sales figures with deep discounts, but the results released Thursday could spell trouble for the coming year for both the industry and the economy at large.

title: Gingrich Takes On Romney
description: As promised, Newt Gingrich released a new television ad Thursday calling out Mitt Romney by name  a first  and painting the former Massachusetts governors economic plans as timid compared with his own.

title: What Were Reading
description: City Room: Residents of a well-gentrified Harlem neighborhood get a wine and liquor store to take down its plexiglass barriers and put up a classier sign.  Nick Fox

title: The Race to Document Biodiversity
description: These 10 days aboard Argo have been a blur. Each has been a whirlwind of cutting-edge technology  closed-circuit rebreathers, ultrahigh-resolution 3-D cameras and, of course, the fantastic DeepSee submersible.

title: Serena Williams Withdraws From Brisbane
description: Serena Williams, a favorite to win the Australian Open, had a major setback in her second-round match at the Brisbane International on Wednesday, spraining her left ankle just points away from a straight sets victory over Bojana Jovanovski of Serbia.

title: Josef Skvorecky, Czech-Born Writer Oppressed by Right and Left, Dies at 87
description: Josef Skvorecky, a renowned Czech author who drew on his experiences under the Nazis and the Communists to write fiction that captured the corruptions and humiliations of the 20th century, died on Tuesday in Toronto. He was 87 and had lived and continued to write in Canada for many years.

title: A Mother Pays Tribute to Her Little Girl Tribe
description: The woman in black stood before friends and strangers, parents and their children, family who loved her and local residents who knew nothing of her life, only the nightmare of her recent past.

title: Cobbled Together | The Office of Angela Scott
description: The designer Angela Scotts lovingly offbeat boots and heels dont sell by the thousands and cant be found in more than a handful of stores  Jeffrey in New York and Tomorrowland in Japan are two of them  but thats exactly how the Texas-based designer likes it. I think theres something unique about a product that isnt overproduced, says Scott about her shoes, all of which are bench-made in small-batch factories by cobblers who hand-stitch and mold the vegetable-tanned leather and eco-friendly cork soles that characterize Scotts collection. Id love to just be in one shop, the best shop, in cities around the world. That would be a lovely place for me to sit, she says.

title: Akram Khan Cancels Show Due to Injury
description: Akram Khans first full-length solo work, Desh received rapturous critical notices and attracted capacity audiences when it had its premiere at Sadlers Wells this past October. So much so that the theater, unusually, decided to present Desh  a work in which Mr. Khan explores the confluence of his Bangladeshi origins with his British upbringing  again this season, in February. But Mr. Khan has had to cancel these coming performances, as well as a run of Sacred Monsters, with Sylvie Guillem, in France this week, because of an injured Achilles tendon, which is likely to keep him offstage for several months. Sadlers Wells plans to schedule a replacement run of Desh in October.

title: New Hampshire Polls Show Small Movement
description: 11:55 a.m. | Updated  MANCHESTER  Results from New Hampshire tracking polls over the last week show some slight movement in the field of Republican candidates, as Rick Santorum began making gains in Iowa polls.

title: Tell Us Your B.Q.E. Horror Tales
description: Time seems to move slower on the Brooklyn-Queens Expressway, where for the last 50 years, the road has been under endless construction. Almost anybody who has traveled on the 16.8-mile stretch from the Grand Central Parkway in Queens to 92nd St in Brooklyn has a story of a lane closure, an accident or both that makes driving  and sitting  a slow form of torture.

title: 36 Hours: Vienna
description: The city in photos.

title: 36 Hours: Vienna
description: FOR years, Vienna has lingered in the fading glory of the fin-de-sicle era, understandably satisfied with the grandeur of its Hapsburg-era architecture and parks. Now a new wind is blowing through this imperial city, with the opening of dazzling hotels, new and renovated museums and a reinvention of the gasthaus, that ubiquitous pub where Viennese artists and philosophers, workers and shopkeepers linger over schnitzel and beer well into the night. This year, the city celebrates the 150th birthday of its most famous artistic export, Gustav Klimt, whose gold-toned paintings will be on display at 10 of the citys museums.

title: Romney Calls Obama a Crony Capitalist
description: SALEM, N.H.  Mitt Romney on Thursday branded President Obama a crony capitalist for making three appointments to the National Labor Relations Board without Congressional approval, suggesting the move was a reward to organized labor for its political support.

title: An Online Presidential Debate Thats Meant to Be Laughed At
description: In this presidential election cycle can you handle just one more Republican debate? If that already sounds like a joke  and we havent even mentioned that it will be moderated by Larry King and its panelists will include Mike Tyson  thats precisely the goal of a satirical event that will be presented on Friday morning by Yahoo! and Funny or Die and hopefully offer some comic relief from The Election Season That Wouldnt End (And Yet Somehow Only Just Started).

title: Want a Job? Go to College, and Dont Major in Architecture
description: Say it with me, readers: College is worth it.

title: More City Principals Join Protest
MSNBC Adding Another Political Talk Show on Weekends
description: Continuing its makeover of the weekend mornings, MSNBC will add a talk show next month that will be hosted by Melissa Harris-Perry, a Tulane University professor of political science.

title: Text: Obamas Remarks on Military Spending
description: Following is a transcript of President Obama's remarks on proposed cuts to military spending, as released by the White House on Thursday:

title: New Consumer Chief Promises Strong Agenda
description: WASHINGTON  The new director of the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau outlined a vigorous oversight and enforcement agenda on Thursday, saying that financial companies that take unfair advantage of consumers would face real consequences.

title: Dear FloFab: How to Avoid Bad Wine at a Dinner Party?
description: Florence Fabricant gives advice on the fine points of entertaining at home and eating in restaurants. Have a dining dilemma? Ask FloFab.

title: Guess Where This Is
description: No. 32 on our list of 45 places to go in 2012 is most certainly remote and exotic, but now is luxurious, too. Guess where this is in the comments below.

title: Fussy Baby or a Sleep Disorder?
description: One in 10 infants and toddlers have problems sleeping at night and may be at greater risk of developing a sleep disorder as they get older, a new study suggests.

title: Manufacturing Is Surprising Bright Spot in U.S. Economy
description: For the first time in many years, manufacturing stands out as an area of strength in the American economy.

title: Trailers to Tempt the Theatergoer
description: How do you make the experience of live theater pop on film in a way that makes a potential ticket buyer say, Ive got to see that? Television commercials are a mainstay, but expensive. Trailers  which can run longer than 15 or 30 seconds and be widely distributed  are increasingly being used to promote theater, but producing them is still a challenge in terms of style, access and cost.

title: At the Orange Bowl, a Crying Game
description: It would be interesting to calculate when exactly in West Virginias absurd 70-33 victory over Clemson in the Orange Bowl Wednesday night that most of the weeping began. No, not by Clemsons supporters, who were probably too numb to weep. And not by the poor bowl mascot Obie, because we know exactly when the walking orange got turned into a tackling dummy after one Mountaineer touchdown. And not by the Big East, whose sobbing has been going on all through the conference realignment fiasco that is about to turn it into the Big Whatever.

title: Obama Puts His Stamp on Strategy for a Leaner Military
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama has for the first time put his own stamp on an all-encompassing American military policy by turning from the grinding ground wars that he inherited from the Bush administration and refocusing on what he described as a smaller, more agile force across Asia, the Pacific and the Middle East.

title: Clashing With College Children Over Holiday Break
description: Whats the definition of mixed emotions? goes the joke I heard as a young man. Your mother-in-law driving off a cliff in your new Cadillac. LOL.

title: Seeing Things | Sori Yanagis Everyday Beauty
description: The Japanese designer Sori Yanagi, who died on Dec. 25 in Tokyo at the age of 96, is best known for his 1956 Butterfly Stool. It is both elegant and utterly simple: two curved pieces of molded plywood are held together through compression and tension by a single brass rod. The stools graceful shape recalls a butterflys wings, and has also been compared to the form of torii, the traditional Shinto shrine gates. According to Matilda McQuaid, the deputy curatorial director at the Cooper-Hewitt National Design Museum, the stool epitomizes Yanagis approach to design. He loved traditional Japanese crafts and was dedicated to the modernist principles of simplicity, practicality and tactility that are associated with Alvar Aalto, Charles and Ray Eames, and Le Corbusier.

title: Saltwater May Not Deter Floridas Pythons
description: The python, a staple creature in the tales of Rudyard Kiplings India, is poised to move to Ernest Hemingways Florida Keys, and a new study by scientists at the United States Geological Survey indicates that it may happen sooner than later.

title: Wedding Q&A
description: Paying for the Salon

title: Joseph Kennedy III Considers Bid for Frank Seat
description: BOSTON  Joseph Kennedy III, a 31-year-old grandson of Robert F. Kennedy, announced Thursday that he was forming an exploratory committee to possibly run for the Congressional seat that Representative Barney Frank is giving up this year.

title: At Manchester United, Ferguson Will Play His Hand
description: He may see things that others cannot most of the time, but right now it seems that Alex Ferguson is blind to an issue in need of an urgent solution. Either that or he refuses to admit recognizing what everyone else perceives as a problem at Manchester United.

title: Where Quail Species Meet
description: Jennifer Gee, a biologist at the Claremont University Consortium and the University of California, Riverside, writes from the tropical dry forest near lamos, Mexico, where she and Jennifer Calkins are studying Callipepla quail.

title: Interview With Taiwan President Ma Ying-jeou
description: Taiwan President Ma Ying-jeou is running for re-election on Jan. 14. The following is a partial transcript of an interview conducted last month with Times reporter Andrew Jacobs at Taiwans Presidential Palace in Taipei. Although Mr. Ma speaks fluent English, he chose to speak in Mandarin.

title: Interview With Tsai Ing-wen
description: Tsai Ing-wen, chair of the Democratic Progressive Party, is running for president of Taiwan against President Ma Ying-jeou in the Jan. 14 elections. The following is a partial transcript of the interview conducted last month with Times reporter Andrew Jacobs at the Taipei headquarters of her party. Ms. Tsai spoke in English.

title: A Recap of the Pentagon Briefing on Defense Cuts
description: In an address at the Pentagon this morning, President Obama laid out his administrations new strategic vision for the nations defense, calling for a leaner military that maintains a strong presence in the Pacific, vigilance against the nuclear ambitions of North Korea and Iran, smaller conventional ground forces and higher-tech air power.

title: Matt Damon and Mother Reject Union's Award
Romneys Ugly Win May Be a Charm
description: Mitt Romneys performance in Iowa may look ugly on the stat sheet, but it accomplished quite a bit when you consider it in its broader context.

title: Hallmark Channel Pulls Plug on Martha Stewart
description: Beset by low ratings and high studio costs, Martha Stewarts daytime talk show is coming to an end.

title: On Our Radar: Chinese Airlines Defy Europes Emissions Rules
description: Chinas four leading airlines say they will refuse to pay a tax on carbon dioxide emissions levied on carriers flying to airports in European Union countries. [The Guardian]

title: Step Right Up and Meet Mr. Met
description: With an eternal smile and eyebrows set at optimistic angles, the mascot of the Mets has evolved and endured while delighting baseball fans.

title: House Delegation to Travel to Middle East and France
description: Representative Eric Cantor of Virginia, the House majority leader, announced Thursday that he would be leading a small House delegation on a visit next week to the Middle East and Europe.

title: Mr. Met Keeps His Head Up
description: You know Mr. Met. Enormous baseball for a head and four fingers on each hand. An eternal smile and black eyebrows set at optimistic angles. Blue Mets cap perched on his head like a yarmulke.

title: Romney Aide Expects Strong Santorum Showing in New Hampshire
description: SALEM, N.H.  A senior campaign adviser to Mitt Romney in New Hampshire predicted that Rick Santorum would perform very well in the states Republican primary on Tuesday.

title: Wheelies: The Clash of the Teutons Edition
description: In which we bring you motoring news from around the Web:

title: Israel Plans New Rules on Exchange of Prisoners
description: JERUSALEM  Israel, which recently traded 1,027 Palestinian prisoners for one soldier held by Hamas, is planning on establishing rules that would prevent it from making such a lopsided exchange in the future, Defense Minister Ehud Barak said on Thursday.

title: Book Review Podcast
description: This week, Geoffrey Kabaservice discusses his new book about the decline of moderate Republicanism; Theda Skocpol on the Tea Party; Julie Bosman with notes from the field; and Gregory Cowles has best-seller news. Sam Tanenhaus is the host.

title: A Little Visitor Hovers Awhile Longer
description: Like a hit holiday revue whose run has been extended into the new year, the rufous hummingbird who showed up outside the American Museum of Natural History last month has delayed her journey southward and was seen feeding rather vigorously Thursday morning on Mahonia japonica flowers, recent frigid weather notwithstanding.

title: Paul Taylor Adds a Performance With a 1962 Price
description: These days, $3.50 wont even buy a tall latte at Starbucks. But in 1962 thats what a ticket cost to see a performance of Paul Taylors work Aureole, set to the music of Handel.

title: Manufacturing Revival
description: Employment in manufacturing jobs rose in 2010 and 2011, and manufactured exports also rose. A monthly survey of manufacturers shows more were hiring than firing for 27 consecutive months, the third-longest string since the survey began in 1948.

title: HBO Ends DVD Discounts for Netflix
description: Netflix said a month ago that it sees HBO as its chief rival. And it appears that HBO agrees, as the company confirmed on Thursday that it had decided to stop selling DVDs to Netflix at a discount.

title: U.S. Asks China to Pressure North Korea to Avoid Provocations During Transition
description: SEOUL, South Korea  A senior American diplomat on Thursday called on China to help restrain the new leadership in North Korea from military provocations during the transition of power there.

title: TimesCast | January 5, 2012
description: Explosions kill dozens in Iraq | Rick Santorum takes his message to New Hampshire | Myanmars first girl band.

title: Why Awareness Beats Anxiety
description: Gathering information  being in the know  is not the same thing as being mindful, being aware, being present for whats actually going on behind the news and the chatter and the stuff that just doesnt matter.

title: More Fat-Fighting Wisdom From Simon Doonan
description: Simon Doonan, the creative ambassador at large for Barneys New York and the author of the new book Gay Men Dont Get Fat, has been answering reader questions about the dietary theories  serious and not  that he expounds in his book and in an interview with The Times. Following is his latest advice.

title: G.M. to Reinforce Battery in Its Hybrid Car, the Volt
description: DETROIT  General Motors on Thursday said that it would upgrade the steel structure and liquid cooling system that surround the battery in its Chevrolet Volt to address concerns that the car could catch fire after a severe crash.

title: A Lively Debate Over Teacher Salaries
Jessica Chastain to Star in The Heiress on Broadway
description: The upcoming Broadway revival of The Heiress has found its Catherine Sloper: Jessica Chastain, who received critical acclaim for film performances last year as a snubbed southern wife in The Help and as a nurturing young mother in The Tree of Life, will play the title role in the 1947 play to be directed by Moises Kaufman (33 Variations), the producers announced on Thursday.

title: The Shame of Filling a Prescription
description: Amy, a single mother living in a middle-class suburb (she asked that only her middle name be used), is an educated professional who is reasonably savvy in most medical matters. But every month she goes through an arduous, prolonged and humiliating process: filling a Ritalin prescription for herself and her 11-year-old son.

title: Continuing Education, at the Bar
description: FOR many, January means back to the lecture hall, and not just at colleges and universities. Across New York the backrooms of bars and the main stages of clubs are coming to resemble secret annexes to the Learning Annex  homes to a boom in alternative lecture series that combine the spirit of the seminar room with the atmosphere of speed dating.

title: Ancient Pornographic Artifact Discovered by the Thames
description: A bronze disk recently discovered in the mud near the Putney Bridge in London seemed innocent enough, but on close inspection it has turned out to be one of the oldest pieces of British pornographic art, according to the Guardian.

title: Under the Radar: 5 Questions About Alexis: A Greek Tragedy
description: In December 2008, weeks of rioting erupted in Athens after a police officer shot and killed a 15-year-old boy named Alexandros Grigoropoulos. Two years later the officer was convicted of murder and sentenced to life in prison.

title: Another Try for Bipartisanship
description: A year ago, as Washington grappled with the shooting rampage that nearly took the life of Representative Gabrielle Giffords, the centrist group Third Way made a modest suggestion to members of Congress: Mingle with lawmakers from the opposite party at theState of the Union address.

title: A Community Time Bank
description: Joan Black took a serious tumble two years ago, climbing up on a stepladder to reach for a punchbowl. She was about to host one of her frequent patio parties for a regional theater company in Montpelier, Vt.

title: First Post-Iowa Polls Show Bounce for Santorum
description: The bounce that candidates receive in the polls after a primary or caucus is typically as much a function of exceeding expectations as their actual performance. Although Mitt Romney won the Iowa caucuses by eight votes, it looks as though Rick Santorum will see the largest improvement in his poll numbers.

title: A Party of Extremists?
description: Unlike the liberal writers quoted in my last post, Jacob Weisbergs column on Mitt Romneys inevitability doesnt indulge in wishful thinking about how the primary campaign is rendering Romney unelectable in the fall. But his desire to insist on the G.O.P.s extremism to leads him into this seemingly-contradictory analysis:

title: The Importance of Being Ernest Hemingway
description: Melena Ryzik has a drink with the actor Corey Stoll, who plays Ernest Hemingway in Woody Allens Midnight in Paris.

title: Some Words of Wisdom for Applicants from India
description: Given the growing and passionate interest of students from India in American universities  a recent New York Times article noted that Indians are now the second-largest foreign student population in America, after the Chinese, with almost 105,000 students in the United States  The Choice is undertaking a pilot project in collaboration with a new blog aimed at readers in India.

title: Winter Wonders | Lovers of Puffers
description: The recent Northeast chill requires serious outerwear the kind thats stuffed with down, lined with fleece and trimmed with fur. Here, the television personality Alexa Chung dials down her metallic Marc Jacobs dress and Mary Janes with a furry and more utilitarian parka; the actress Julianne Moore makes an anorak look elegant by pairing it with chic black and brown accessories; and the actress Naomi Watts bundles up in dusty red denim and motorcycle boots.

title: The Top 10 Travel Articles of 2011
description: Life on a giant cruise ship, dealing with canceled flights, an alternate route to Machu Picchu  these are all subjects that attracted Web readers in 2011. As with last years version, this years list is topped by our annual Where to Go roundup. Other popular articles included spring weekend getaways, a different way to look at Paris and an essay on why we travel in unsettling times.

title: Five-Ku: Short Poems on the Career of Mark Wahlberg
description: Dirk Diggler, porn star;Marky Mark makes the most ofA sizable part.

title: Jim Huber, Sports Broadcaster and Essayist, Is Dead at 67
description: Jim Huber, an Emmy-winning broadcaster whose essays on the human dimension of sports were a staple on CNN during his nearly three decades with Turner Broadcasting, died on Monday in Atlanta. He was 67.

title: Listen: SNY.tv Metro Hockey Podcast
description: The Slap Shot contributor Christopher Botta talks hockey with Jim Devellano, the senior vice president of the Red Wings and the former assistant general manager of the Islanders. Also, Brian Compton of NHL.com and Adam Rotter of SNYRangersBlog join in. Topics include Rangers Coach John Tortorella, the Islanders John Tavares, Bruins-Devils and the N.H.L. draft.

title: N.H.L Hands Down Two Suspensions
description: Calgary Flames forward Rene Bourque and Chicago Blackhawks wing Dan Carcillo may now be wishing that they had not again incurred the wrath of the N.H.L.s disciplinary department. The two players received significant suspensions  five games for Bourque and seven for Carcillo  in response to their actions in recent games.

title: A Place to Lay My Heart
description: WHEN I met Joe, he told me he was trying to decide where to live. At the time, he lived in  well, that was hard to say.

title: Fusing Identity: Dollops of Humor and Shea Butter
description: RASHID JOHNSON was discussing his coming exhibition at the Hauser & Wirth gallery recently, when Marc Payot, a gallery partner, mentioned that a previous owner of the gallerys sleek town house on East 69th Street in Manhattan was the boxing promoter Don King.

title: Resolution: Become a Mint.com Power User
description: This year I resolve to become a Mint.com power user.

title: The Writers Guild Goes for the Laugh With Its Nominees
description: Is this the year that funny finally gets its due?

title: Racing Against Time Around the Great Lakes
description: To a dedicated band of tinkerers willing to devote a week or more to nursing old cars over a 1,000-mile rally route, the Great Race is catnip. This years race, which will route participants around the Great Lakes region in a four-state, one-province loop, begins in Traverse City, Mich. on June 23 and will conclude, at least for those whose old iron withstands the ordeal, in Dearborn, Mich., on July 1.

title: Europe Stands Firm on Airline Emissions, Raising Fears of a Trade Conflict
description: BRUSSELS  The European Commission said on Thursday that airlines that did not follow a new European law requiring them to account for their emissions of greenhouse gases could face being banned from European airports.

title: A Sportswriters Hall of Fame Tribute Is Out of Place to Some
description: COOPERSTOWN, N.Y.  In a quiet, sun-splashed corridor, beyond the storied gallery of bronze plaques, a seemingly ordinary exhibit has created a singularly awkward situation for the Baseball Hall of Fame.

title: A Role That Was Good and True and Stole the Scene
description: Corey Stoll was just a little-known actor who happened to be appearing opposite Scarlett Johansson in A View From the Bridge on Broadway when Woody Allen  who cast Ms. Johansson in his film Match Point  came to see the show. Not long after, Mr. Stoll, best known from his role as the bald detective on the short-lived Law & Order: Los Angeles, was called in to see Mr. Allen about a part in Midnight in Paris. He was duly petrified but wound up with the role of Hemingway. He donned a wig and a mustache, and on screen he was one of the most memorable stars in a cast that included Owen Wilson and Marion Cotillard.

title: Alone Again, Naturally
description: ONE cold, misty autumn morning, I slipped and fell. I was on my way out to do errands, the mossy wooden deck on the north side of my house was slick with dew, I was in a hurry, I skidded, and both feet flew out from under me.

title: Romney, in South Carolina, Sets His Sights on Obama
description: CHARLESTON, S.C.  Enjoying a strong lead in New Hampshire polls, Mitt Romney flew here Thursday to get a jump-start with voters in the first Southern primary and begin what might be his biggest challenge yet: convincing Republicans in this socially conservative state that he is the candidate who best represents their values.

title: Swiss Bank Chief Vows Not to Resign Over Currency Trades
description: FRANKFURT  Philipp M. Hildebrand, head of the Swiss central bank, said Thursday that he regretted currency trades that have threatened his international reputation as an advocate for tougher bank regulation, but he maintained that he had violated no laws or regulations and would not resign.

title: Legislator Calls for Hearing on State Aid Suspension
Whats a Protester to Do?
description: These are strange days to walk the streets of New York in the company of protesters.

title: Frank Gehry to Try His Hand at Mozart
description: Having designed the auditorium for the Walt Disney Concert Hall, the architect Frank Gehry is now turning his attention to the stage itself, creating a set for the Los Angeles Philharmonics production of Don Giovanni.

title: Be It Resolved
description: ITS still early in 2012, so lets be optimistic. Lets assume you have made a New Years resolution and have not yet broken it. Based on studies of past resolutions, here are some uplifting predictions:

title: Jets Fine Scott $10,000
description: Bart Scotts frustration cost him $10,000. The Jets levied that fine on Scott for making an obscene gesture toward a photographer Monday, the day after Santonio Holmess skirmish with teammates ina season-ending loss to Miami that eliminated them from playoff contention.

title: Lawyers Intercede in Rift Between Olbermann and Current
description: At this point it could be called Keith Olbermann vs. Current TV.

title: Richard Cordrays Appointment: Was It Justified?
description: President Obamas recess appointment of Richard Cordray, as the head of the new Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, has resulted in a lot of partisan bickering.

title: Hoberman Is Out at Village Voice, and Curtain Drops on an Era
description: On Wednesday, two long-running trends in journalism came together in a single layoff: Jim Hoberman, a senior film critic at the Village Voice since 1988, was let go, yet another instance of the The Voice taking aim at a veteran  and presumably well paid  employee. He joins a list of longtime Voice writers who have been laid off.

title: German President Retreats on Openness
description: BERLIN  A day after a televised interview in which he promised greater openness and transparency, the president of Germany, Christian Wulff, refused on Thursday to allow the countrys biggest-selling newspaper to publish a transcript of a threatening voice mail message he left for the newspapers editor.

title: Scrutinizing Stand-Ins: Working With Nouns and Pronouns
description: Overview | What are pronouns, and what are their purpose and function? How are they used in speech and writing? In this lesson, students identify the connection between nouns and pronouns and discuss how the clarity of a sentence is affected by using a noun as opposed to a pronoun.

title: Still Searching for Republicans With Climate Concerns
description: The Climate Desk, a collaborative journalism project of Mother Jones and several other publications, has produced a video searching in vain for a Republican presidential candidate willing to make any science-based statements on climate.

title: In Borneo, a Safe Place for Orangutans
description: At Camp Leakey, one of three research outposts in Tanjung Puting National Park, Indonesia, semiwild orangutans living in the surrounding forest often drop by for bananas and company.

title: A Gadget Is More Than the Sum of Its Parts
description: As a teenager growing up in the Cleveland suburbs, my first real job was at a Chick-fil-A restaurant in a local mall. I did everything: manned the cash register, made sandwiches and cleaned up.

title: Photo Replay: Jan. 5
description: The day in sports included heavy snowfall at the biathlon World Cup in Oberhof, Germany, and an upset in the quarterfinals of the Brisbane tennis tournament in Australia.

title: Responsible Bidders Sought for Titanic Auction
description: The New York auction house Guernseys explained on Thursday that all bidders in its planned winner-take-all auction of more than 5,500 artifacts salvaged from the wreckage of the Titanic must agree to abide by 19 pages worth of court-ordered covenants and commitments governing the collection. The court has final approval and the right to make sure the buyer has the capability and the desire, said Arlan Ettinger, president of Guernseys. Its like getting a puppy, he added. It takes a great deal of care.

title: Writers, Art Directors and Now Uggie
description: Until someone or Kanye West  tells us otherwise, the Bagger will take this as evidence that blog campaigns and wild Twitter sprees work: The fine folks at Movieline, who started the Consider Uggie campaign on behalf of the little dog in The Artist, point us to a prize that the Jack Russell terrier has already won. Its from the French, bien sr. Last month he earned a special mention in the Prix Lumire Awards, Frances equivalent of the Golden Globes, with The Artist picking up four other nominations  best film, best director, best actor and best actress  over all.

title: Afghanistan Closes Firm Providing Security
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  The Afghan government said Thursday that it was shutting down the operations of one of the largest foreign security companies operating in the country after detaining two of its contractors on suspicion of gun smuggling.

title: New Lawsuit Means All Major Labels Are Suing Grooveshark
description: Grooveshark, a popular digital music service that is being sued for copyright infringement by three of the four major record companies, now has problems with the one big label that it has a licensing deal with.

title: Judge Cites Bias in Halting Brooklyn Development Plan
description: The blighted border of Williamsburg, Bedford-Stuyvesant and Bushwick has been more like the Bermuda Triangle than the Broadway Triangle for developers over the last two decades.

title: The Get | Alice Cicolini Ring
description: Alice Cicolini, a London-based Central Saint Martins graduate, works with Kamal Meenakar, a master craftsman in Jaipur, India, on her candy-colored jewels. The pieces get their distinct finishes through champlev, an intricate enameling process (called meenakari in India). Im drawn to enamel because its like painting on precious metal, said Cicolini, whose latest creations incorporate exotic shapes and motifs associated with religious architecture found along the ancient Silk Road.

title: Of Women, Politics and Laughs
description: The South African novelist, poet and playwright Zakes Mda has a formidable political lineage. His father, A. P. Mda, was a guiding light in the 1959 founding of the Pan Africanist Congress. He was a lawyer and by all accounts a stern, serious man. Zakes Mda (pronounced EM-dah) is a serious man of a different sort: one who refuses to be somber. In Sometimes There Is a Void, his new memoir, his life and hard times are mostly played for wistful comedy.

title: The Caucus | Santorum in New Hampshire
description: Rick Santorum takes the fight for the nomination to one of Mitt Romney's strongholds, New Hampshire.

title: After Brief Calm, Europe Again Worries Over Debt
description: PARIS  Five months after the United States lost its AAA credit rating, buyers are still flocking to bonds issued by Washington. But in Europe, where the euro zone crisis and chronic economic problems may soon erode the credit scores of big countries like France, Italy and Spain, investors are far more wary.

title: Clergymen in Cuffs as Protesters Are Arrested
description: Updated, 6:26 p.m. | Four pastors, including a member of City Council, were among seven men arrested Thursday morning in front of the city Law Department during a protest of the citys ban on allowing churches to hold worship services in public school buildings, the police and organizers said.

title: Sports Fans Are Having Trouble Keeping Their Time Warners Straight
description: Hell hath no fury like a New York sports fan scorned.

title: Caucus Video: Santorum in New Hampshire
description: Rick Santorum takes the fight for the nomination to one of Mitt Romneys strongholds, New Hampshire.

title: Economisting
description: Ill shortly be on my way to the ASSA meetings in Chicago. What with travel and all, quite possibly no posting for some time. At the meetings all my stuff will be on Saturday: a joint presentation of my work with Gauti Eggertsson at 8 AM, a meet-and-greet at the Worth booth from 3:30-5, and a presentation of my 33-year-old paper on interstellar trade (kept fresh by time dilation) at Yoram Baumans humor in economics session at 8 PM. What will I do with all my free time?

title: Miami Nice: Zambrano Joins Guillen
description: At Carlos Zambranos lowest moments in the major leagues, Ozzie Guillen has been there. In June 2010, after a dugout fight with a teammate during a game against the White Sox, Zambrano had dinner with Guillen. Last August, after Zambrano packed his belongings and left the Cubs during a game in Atlanta, Guillens wife spoke with him and Guillen publicly called Zambrano his friend.

title: ABC, With No Reruns, Proves a Magnet for Viewers
description: As the only broadcast network boasting an entire lineup of original programming on Wednesday night, ABC easily finished in first place in all the major ratings categories. Modern Family led the way as the highest-rated show in the 18-to-49-year-old demographic, and it drew its largest audience since its season premiere in September, with 14 million total viewers.

title: Alderson Says Mets Must Improve From Within
description: Several weeks after reaching contract agreements with relievers Frank Francisco and Jon Rauch, the Mets introduced the pitchers on a conference call with reporters Thursday. Unlike many off-seasons, there has been no need for a news conference at the ballpark to show off a splashy new addition.

title: Yankees, Nakajima Unable to Make a Deal
description: 9:16 p.m. | Updated

title: Tata Technologies Readies a Conceptual E.V. for Detroit Auto Show
description: The Tata Technologies electric mobility concept, or Emo, is a pure concept vehicle, with no clear path to production. So why was it built?

title: Get a Midlife
description: YOU may be surprised to learn that when researchers asked people over 65 to pick the age they would most like to return to, the majority bypassed the wild and wrinkle-less pastures of their teens, 20s and 30s, and chose their 40s.

title: Prosecutors in Egypt Call for Mubarak to Be Hanged
description: CAIRO  Egyptian prosecutors called on Thursday for hanging former President Hosni Mubarak, saying his authority over the security forces made him responsible for the deaths of hundreds of protesters who challenged his rule.

title: Dont Shoot the Sitter
description: My sister accused me of manipulating my father into giving me money for pet-sitting fees in advance of a recent trip I took. I planned to repay him but I didnt even get into that with my sister. She is full of grievances about our fathers money, and I wanted to avoid a fight. My question is: How should I deal with the pet sitter, who is clearly my sisters source of information?

title: Die, Nazi Scum!: Soviet Tass Propaganda Posters, 1941-1945
description: Andrew Edlin Gallery

title: TimesCast | Sectarian Attacks in Iraq
description: January 5, 2012  Michael S. Schmidt reports from Baghdad on the sectarian violence and explosions that killed dozens in Iraq.

title: Signs of Hope on Jobs, and Some Caveats
description: With as dismal a run as weve had in the economy over the last few years, its tempting to start looking for the glass to be half full.

title: After Mans Death, a Family Sues the Police for Details
description: The family of a Canadian man struck and killed by a truck while riding his bike in Brooklyn has sued the Police Department to release records of the accident.

title: Neighborhood Joint | Twenty Sided Store
description: Named for the dice used in many role-playing games, a Williamsburg, Brooklyn, shop attracts gamers in search of a community.

title: Theater Talkback: Finding Other Thrills in Dance, Song and Wide Receiving
description: Covering theater is a far cry from being a war correspondent, heaven knows, but there are times during the busier passages of the season when the number of incoming shows feels like an overwhelming barrage of aesthetic artillery. (Insert joke about bombs exploding right and left here.) Simply keeping on top of all the fall openings can put you in a bunker mentality. Weeks can go by when I dont have a chance to attend any cultural events that Im not directly covering, which is not an ideal way of maintaining the properly wide frame of reference that a critic considering any discipline should strive to attain.

title: Where Gamers Freely Unleash Their Alter Egos
description: ON a moonless winter night you journey across a perilous landscape of snaking subway trains, howling traffic and steam-hissing sewers. The rattling dice in your pocket guide you like an oracle toward the object of your quest. At last you spy it: the blue-painted crystal glowing in the window of the Twenty Sided Store.

title: Michael St. John: In the Studio Twenty Eleven and The Wedding (The Walker Evans Polaroid Project)'
description: Andrea Rosen Gallery

title: Erik den Breejen: Smile
description: Freight + Volume

title: Spare Times for Jan. 6-12
description: Around Town

title: Hackers Threaten to Post Source Code for Symantec Product
description: Hackers have posted a file online that they claim is a confidential glimpse into Symantecs Norton Antivirus program and have threatened to release source code for the security giants flagship antivirus product.

title: This Time the Accent Is on Chamber
description: The Manhattan Chamber Orchestra, when it comes down to it, is really just one musician, the composer, conductor, violinist and violist Richard Auldon Clark, along with however many players he can bring together for the project at hand. In prosperous times it was an actual orchestra, assembled from New Yorks rich freelance pool. When finances are tighter  now, for example  it is a chamber group. So if it seemed odd that the orchestras 25th-anniversary celebration, at the Leonard Nimoy Thalia at Symphony Space on Wednesday evening, was a program of duos, trios and quartets, think of that as a measure of Mr. Clarks flexibility.

title: Galaxys Gonzalez Goes to Germany on Loan
description: 11:45 a.m. Jan. 6 | Updated With Gonzalezs Injury Omar Gonzalez tore the anterior cruciate ligament in his left knee in his first practice with Nuremberg of Germanys Bundesliga and is returning to Los Angeles.

title: A Dissident Director of High-Camp, Low-Budget Films
description: On Bizarro World, a planet in Supermans universe, people do everything backward and ineptly. If this anti-Earth had a filmmaker, that person would probably be a lot like George Kuchar (1942-2011), the pioneering underground filmmaker who dedicated his life to upending the values of conventional cinema.

title: Movie Listings for Jan. 6-12
description: Movies

title: Santorum Has Testy Exchange on Same-Sex Marriage
description: CONCORD, N.H.  Rick Santorum engaged in an extended and sometimes testy exchange over same-sex marriage with a group of college students during a campaign appearance on Thursday.

title: Pop and Rock Listings for Jan. 6-12
description: Pop

title: Good News on Gay Rights
description: This week started out with some very bad news for those of us who regard marriage equality as a pressing civil rights issue: Rick Santorums runner-up finish at the Iowa caucuses. Even within the Republican partyno friend to gay coupleshes an extremist. In a 2003 interview with the AP, he made clear that he does not believe in a fundamental right to privacy and supports laws against sodomy. He also seemed to compare homosexuality to man on child and man on dog sex. (How do those ideas pop into his head in the first place?)

title: Jazz Listings for Jan. 6-12
description: Jazz

title: Classical Music/Opera Listings for Jan. 6-12
description: Classical

title: Parental Quandary Considered: Should You Bring a Child to an Adult Party?
description: Every week, the Motherlode Parental Quandary team of experienced, expert parents (thats all of us  own it!) weighs in on a dilemma of an ethical, social or moral nature that could only happen to a fellow parent. We offer fantastic advice, and this weeks advice was unusually universal. Nearly all of us were agreed on what last weeks parent should have done  but caught off guard on the phone isnt the best time to call to mind even the clearest of solutions.

title: Theater Listings: Jan. 6  12
description: Theater

title: Museum and Gallery Listings for Jan. 6-12
description: Art

title: Spare Times: For Children, for Jan. 6-12
description: Live Wolf Encounter

title: Whitney and Storm King to Share a David Smith
description: For more than a decade museums have been joining forces to buy expensive art. Its an arrangement that works to everyones advantage: as prices for contemporary art rise, its a way to defray costs while allowing a wider public to see significant work.

title: Up on the Roof, Dancing With Fire
description: Does anyone have a lighter?

title: A Good Rental History Can Help Borrowers
description: IF youre planning to buy a home for the first time later this year, your chances of qualifying for a mortgage might be better if youve had a history of paying the rent on time.

title: Back to the Barricades, Antigone
description: The dialogues keep multiplying and echoing, contracting and expanding, blurring and zooming into focus. In the raw and resonant Alexis. A Greek Tragedy, one of the opening works in the Under the Radar festival of experimental theater, conversation is hardly limited to the words exchanged by the actors on the stage of the Ellen Stewart Theater at La MaMa.

title: Young Love as Divine, but a Perilous Insanity
description: The dreamy, protracted love scenes in Norwegian Wood recall that now quaint era near the peak of the sexual revolution when intense young love fired the collective imagination with envy, prurience and awe. Yes, there were casual hookups then, but they were not called that in the late 1960s, when the story takes place. Romantic sex still bore a mystical aura.

title: Q & A
description: Benefits of Buying From a Sponsor

title: 18-Century Artisans, Tracked the Modern Way
description: Furniture made in Rhode Island before 1800 would sound like a manageable topic for a thorough Web site. After all, Rhode Island is not that big a state, said Patricia E. Kane, lead curator of American decorative arts at the Yale University Art Gallery.

title: Water Power Meets Resistance
description: WOODBURY

title: In the Presence of the Mountain
description: R. A. Dickey, the Mets pitcher, is climbing Mount Kilimanjaro this month to raise awareness for the Bombay Teen Challenge, an organization that rescues and cares for women and girls in Mumbai who are at risk of being abused and exploited. His posts will appear occasionally in Bats.

title: Little Creatures, Witty and Erotic
description: Stop by Ubu Gallery this month and you may find yourself asking, How did I not know about this guy? Unless you are exceptionally well informed about the history of French Surrealism, the name Georges Hugnet (1906-1974) may have slipped your notice. It did mine, and the gallerys exhibition of his collages and altered postcards comes as a delightful revelation.

title: The Minimalist: Curried Tofu With Soy Sauce
description: Many of the best soups, stews, and braises start with careful browning that creates a flavor thats rich and seductive.

title: State Leads Nation in Down-Payment Size
description: BUYERS in New Jersey have the highest down-payment rate in the country, putting down an average 13.71 percent of the purchase price, according to a new report from LendingTree. That surpasses percentages in cities like Washington, and states like New York, Hawaii and California, though only by tenths of a point. In New York, the average down payment works out to 13.47 percent. The national average is 12.24 percent, for the year ending in November.

title: Pictures of the Day: Iraq and Elsewhere
description: Photographs from Iraq, Pakistan, New York and the Netherlands.

title: The Remote-Controlled House
description: ROBERT STEININGER and his wife, Anh, shopped for a second home on the East End for five years before they stumbled across a modern barn built on speculation by Plum Builders of East Hampton. They loved the gabled design of the five-bedroom five-bath clapboard home, with its vaulted wood-planked ceilings and open and unique layout.

title: A Documenter of Protests Has a Run-In of His Own
description: When Occupy Wall Street protesters set up their encampment in September in Zuccotti Park, a new category of activist emerged alongside fixtures such as meeting facilitators and medics.

title: Todays Scuttlebot: Vanishing Jobs and the Need for Coders
description: Interesting things that Bits reporters and editors found on the Web. More here.

title: Anatomy of a Murder, in Raging Rock
description: The easily downloadable single dominates pop music today, which makes Goodbar, a music-theater piece being presented at the Public Theater as part of the Under the Radar festival, a throwback in more ways than one. The show, created by the band Bamb and the downtown theater troupe Waterwell, is essentially a staged concept album. (Remember them? Remember albums?) Its based loosely on Looking for Mr. Goodbar, the 1975 novel by Judith Rossner about the dark side of that other singles scene  in the bars, that is, where the heroine, a lonely schoolteacher named Theresa, meets a punishing fate.

title: Still Hung Over From the 90s
description: Everybody hates the rich.

title: Dance Listings for Jan. 6-12
description: Dance

title: C. P. H. Gilbert: The Wild Years
description: CHARLES PIERREPONT HENRY GILBERT could shoot from the back of a galloping horse and design a mean neo-Gothic mansion. The Jewish Museum, completed in 1909 at Fifth Avenue and 92nd Street, is part of his string of lacy town houses along Fifth and Madison that came to define the upper-class residence.

title: With This Torch, I Thee Weld a Ring
description: Making a ring in a day is about as challenging as a souffl is for a newbie cook.

title: Singing Hindi in the Rain
description: Its one of the most famous sequences in Indian movies. And, not surprisingly, its a song. A Chaplinesque tramp with holes in his shoes, too-short pants and a slightly goofy hat skips down a country road and sings these lines in Hindi: My shoes are Japanese/These pants are English/On my head is a red Russian hat/But still, he says, pointing to his chest and delivering the kicker, my heart is Hindustani.

title: Leaving Behind an Arduous Commute
description: FOR her internship in the fashion field last summer, Kate Kelly commuted to New York from Philadelphia.

title: One Mans Fight With Google Over a Security Warning
description: Jan. 6, 6:55 p.m. | Updated  See our followup post on the reaction to this one.

title: Diller Scofidio + Renfro to Redesign the Pines Pavilion
description: The architects Diller Scofidio + Renfro and the architectural firm HWKN (HollwichKushner) have been hired to design a new entertainment complex to replace the Pavilion dance club, a gay landmark in Fire Island Pines that was destroyed in a fire last year.

title: Success Academy Blitzes Cobble Hill
Vain Glorious | The Happy Heel
description: These are not aristocratic feet. Im here to tell you these are working feet, says Park Avenues go-to podiatrist, Suzanne Levine, after a quick examination of my not-so-pretty pieds. In all fairness, my childhood and adolescence were spent studying ballet. Anyone whos worn a pair of pointe shoes will confirm that dancing in them is a kind of quiet torture that ceases to bother only after youve grown numb to the pain. Your feet never really recover from the trauma. I sought out Levine and a few other foot gurus after determining springs must-have shoes: the bejeweled slip-ons from Oscar de la Renta, the velvet clogs from Miu Miu and the heel-less metallic numbers with super-pointy toes from Louis Vuitton, among others. The problem? All of these options are of the 18th-century mule variety. In other words, they leave your heels fully exposed, and mine, still callused and battered to a point seemingly beyond return, were in no position to be naked.

title: Bull Riders at Madison Square Garden; the Brooklyn Navy Yard
description: Its a new year. Who knows where it will take you? For this week at least, the Miser does, with a hodgepodge of cheap fun to guide you from the Brooklyn Navy Yard of the mid-19th century to the future of bull riding in the 21st. Ah, the possibilities.

title: Rent-a-Box Services Make Moving Easier for Some
description: FOR Sara Schmidt, an actress, moving to a new apartment used to involve a tiresome quest for cardboard boxes. She picked up castoffs from the street and canvassed her local liquor stores for others  and even then, she still found herself buying expensive new boxes and supplies like packing tape.

title: Gingrich Goes Local on New Hampshire Issues
description: Newt Gingrich is running for president of the United States, but as he blazed a trail over the White Mountains, he showed that he had not forgotten that all politics is local.

title: With This Torch, I Thee Weld
description: MOST couples want their wedding to be awe inspiring. And therein lies the foundation of an enormous industry that, for a price, can guarantee bragging rights for the betrothed, whether its beachside fireworks, a chocolate-candy-bar multitiered cake flown in from Napa or flower-covered candelabra.

title: To New Beginnings, With a Dash of Bitters
description: Elizabeth and the Catapult, a New York City band led by the piano-playing songwriter Elizabeth Ziman, got around to new songs about halfway through a set at the Mercury Lounge on Wednesday night. First came a cheerful ditty about a lazy New Years Day that feels like a new beginning, with poppy la-las punctuating each verse. Then Ms. Ziman announced: O.K., lets get serious. My label just dropped me. She half-smiled. So I wrote a song for them.

title: Bloomberg Says He Will Fight for Fingerprinting Rule
description: A day after Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo vowed to end New York Citys policy of requiring food stamp applicants to be electronically fingerprinted, Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg defended the policy and said he would try to convince the governor to keep it in place.

title: Grand Galleries for National Treasures
description: IN 1924, when the Metropolitan Museum of Art opened its American Wing, the Mets president, Robert W. de Forest, cautiously toasted the state of what he called American domestic art. Perhaps, at the moment, it has more acclaim than future generations would think it ought to have had, he said. It has filled the antiquity shops, it has crowded the auction rooms, it is vogue.

title: Serendipity as Urban Curator
description: WITH apologies to provincial visionaries everywhere, its always been tough to argue with Ezra Pound: All great art is born of the metropolis.

title: The Caucus Click: McCains Slip on the Stump
Presidential Primary Lulz
description: In riffing on the multiple reasons that Im enjoying the Republican nomination process as a supremely entertaining piece of transmedia storytelling, I made passing mention of Rick Perrys Unpopular Opinions, a one-topic Tumblr inspired by the Texas governors ad titled Strong. In that spot, Perry asserted that you know theres something wrong in this country when gays can serve openly in the military, but our kids cant openly celebrate Christmas. The Internet found that argument laughably suspect, and in addition to making the YouTube version of the commercial one of the most disliked videos ever, responded with a barrage of interactive/remix mockery. The aforementioned Tumblr is a conspicuous example, and is made of up GIFs of the same self-assured, Carhartt-clad Perry from the commercial, captioned with phrases like  The Wire was a dumb show and Kim Jong the Second was a humane leader.

title: Ejected From a Job With a Band, Landing Back With Mom in Queens
description: About an hour into Roadie, a film about a middle-aged rock n roll Sherpa whos lost his job and moorings, theres a jumpy, viscerally uncomfortable scene in a motel room  a tempest fueled by booze and coke, old grudges and new hurts  thats so strong and beautifully played that it lifts the movie out of its doldrums. A roadie, Jimmy Testagross (a gruffly tender Ron Eldard), has crawled back to his childhood home in Forest Hills, Queens, after being cut free by his longtime employer, Blue Oyster Cult. From his wounded look it seems as if he werent only fired, but also stripped of his identity. Refusing to admit the truth, even to himself, he tells everyone hes the bands manager.

title: Concert Revenue Was Up in 2011, Led by U2
description: After one of its worst years in recent history, the concert industry rebounded slightly in 2011. But with consumers buying fewer tickets, the industry was still down from its peak in 2009.

title: Hey, Kids, Dont Mess With the Town Undertaker
description: Someone involved with Beneath the Darkness has either watched too many horror movies or not enough. There is not an original thought in this story, written by Bruce Wilkinson, or in the way it is directed by Martin Guigui. That makes for few genuine scares and, by the end, some unintended laughter as the proceedings grow too silly to bear.

title: The Pander Waves of Grain
description: In Iowa earlier this week, Mitt Romney was guilty of an outrageous falsehood: He said that the amber waves of grain in the song America the Beautiful include corn.

title: Obama Makes His Presence Felt in Iowa With Online Ad
description: As if competing against all the other Republican presidential candidates wasnt hard enough.

title: Political Role for Militants Worsens Fault Lines in Iraq
description: BAGHDAD  It was one of the deadliest insurgent groups in Iraq in recent years, an Iranian-backed militia that bombed American military convoys and bases, assassinated dozens of Iraqi officials and tried to kidnap Americans even as the last soldiers withdrew.

title: Santorum Insists West Bank Is Part of Israel
description: Following Rick Santorums sudden rise to prominence in the race for the Republican presidential nomination, new attention has been paid to his views on foreign policy issues, which apparently include a firm conviction that the West Bank is part of Israel.

title: Carnivorous Nights
description: Photos of attendees at an event hosted by the Secret Science Club at the Bell House in Brooklyn.

title: Taking Parking Lots Seriously
description: Images of different designs and uses of parking lots.

title: Rally Against Bronx Science Principal, This Time By Students and Alumni
A Classroom Fight: The Tech Invaders
description: To the Editor:

title: Under the Radar
description: Photos of the shows Alexis. A Greek Tragedy and Goodbar.

title: Lesbian Alien Looks for Love Light Years Away
description: In Codependent Lesbian Space Alien Seeks Same, Madeleine Olneks witty ode to urban love and shoestring sci-fi, a lonely Manhattanite and an exiled extraterrestrial find interspecies contentment.

title: Angry Critters Spearhead an Ecological Battle
description: Pom Poko  one of the final offerings in the welcome Studio Ghibli retrospective at the IFC Center  wasnt directed by the studios master animator, Hayao Miyazaki, but certainly bears his influence. Directed by Mr. Miyazakis frequent collaborator Isao Takahata, the film, from 1994, credits Mr. Miyazaki with planning, and its easy to see: its ecological concerns, nuance and occasional lyricism place it squarely within the Ghibli oeuvre but not among its masterpieces.

title: Free Trade vs. Jobs
description: To the Editor:

title: Can Ron Paul Move the Charts? Kelly Clarkson May Not Prove It
description: Attention politically opinionated pop stars: plugging a presidential candidate may not help your sales, especially if that candidate is Ron Paul.
