description: PERTH, Australia  Tempers flared repeatedly Friday in singles and mixed doubles matches at the Hyundai Hopman Cup between top-ranked American Mardy Fish and the 20-year-old Bulgarian Grigor Dimitrov, tensions that peaked with the two needing to be separated by a tournament official during a changeover.

title: Legal Problem Grounds a Bird Migration
description: Birds and planes dont mix, as was demonstrated strikingly three years ago when Canada geese were sucked into both engines of a USAir flight from LaGuardia, forcing the plane into the Hudson River. But it turns out that a more benign interaction, using ultralight planes to teach endangered whooping cranes their migration route, has its complications, too.

title: Mexicos Election Draws Eyes From Across Border
description: Texas economists are confident that the financial upheavals long associated with Mexican elections are a thing of the past. Still, they are closely watching what this summers presidential contest means for the peso and, in turn, Texas symbiotic business ties to Mexico.

title: Giants Cruz Takes It All the Way
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  When Victor Cruz encounters longtime Giants fans these days  whether in restaurants or shops around his suburban New Jersey home, or on Facebook and Twitter  he often hears a variation on the same message.

title: At the Hall, Forgetting History and Perhaps Repeating It
description: The noble idea of limiting the Baseball Hall of Fame to the truly elite is a fantasy. Babe Ruth and Willie Mays have plaques in Cooperstown, but so do Rick Ferrell and Jesse Haines. There are no distinctions between members inducted on the first writers ballot and those who wait decades for the veterans committee. Officially, all are equal.

title: The Caucus Click: Battleground New Hampshire
Voter Asks Romney, Why Not Give Us a House or Two?
description: TILTON, N.H.  At a spaghetti dinner here over the weekend, Mitt Romney offered his usual stump speech, and his usual applause lines were met with the usual applause, albeit of a slightly lower-energy variety than he encountered last week in Iowa.

title: Federer Forced Into Rare Withdrawal With Back Spasms
description: PERTH, Australia Roger Federer is the latest top player to have his Australian Open forecast clouded by injuries, withdrawing from the Qatar ExxonMobil Open in Doha because of back spasms.

title: As Primary Looms in N.H., Donor Gives Lift to Gingrich
description: MANCHESTER, N.H.  As candidates spent the weekend trying to catch up to Mitt Romney in New Hampshire, with the primary just two days away, a longtime supporter of Newt Gingrich donated $5 million to a super PAC backing his presidential bid, providing a major boost to Mr. Gingrichs ailing campaign.

title: Gingrich Launches Scathing Attacks on Romney
description: 1:24 p.m. | Updated MANCHESTER, N.H.  Here come the scathing attacks on Mitt Romney by Newt Gingrich and his outside supporters.

title: Huntsmans Moment in New Hampshire
description: For good or bad, this is Jon M. Hunstman Jr.s moment. An early favorite of the pundit classes in Washington and New York, Mr. Huntsman has bet it all on New Hampshire.

title: From a Window, Details Tell the Story
Variety: 3-D Word Hunt
description: SECOND SUNDAY PUZZLE  Theres not a lot to say here, although I know some of you look forward to the 3-D Word Hunt and some of you prefer other Variety Puzzles. How many words did you find? Ive listed the answers according to Will Shortz after the jump, so if youre not done solving, dont click through just yet. Give it one more try!

title: For Santorum, Miles to Go Before He Sleeps
description: 1:17 p.m. | Updated MANCHESTER, N.H.  Despite the debate Saturday night, Rick Santorum kept up a busy schedule throughout the day.

title: Huntsman, Out of Options, Bets It All on New Hampshire
description: NEWPORT, N.H.  Jon M. Huntsman Jr. was in jeopardy of arriving late to his own rally here the other night. But his wifes desperate need for caffeine forced them to stop for gas-station blend at the Bradford Market, where an admiring clerk added to their delay.

title: The Heartbreak of the Missed Field-Goal Try
description: NEW ORLEANS  Considering that Louisiana State and Alabama failed to score a touchdown in their first meeting, the possibility that the national title game on Monday will come down to a fateful, final kick looms large. During L.S.U.s 9-6 overtime victory Nov. 5 in Tuscaloosa, host Alabama missed four kicks and L.S.U. ended the game on a 25-yard field goal by Drew Alleman.

title: In a Hemingway Idyll, Intimations of Tolkien
description: R. A. Dickey, the Mets pitcher, is climbing Mount Kilimanjaro this month to raise awareness for the Bombay Teen Challenge, an organization that rescues and cares for women and girls in Mumbai who are at risk of being abused and exploited. His posts will appear occasionally in Bats.

title: Romney Urges Supporters Not to Be Overconfident
description: DERRY, N.H.  Mitt Romney came to Derry, N.H., on Saturday morning, and after a rough start in the state  a phlegmatic McCain endorsement, some less-than-enthusiastic crowds he finally seemed to know his audience.

title: Latest Hacking Scandal Arrest Suggests Focus on Cover-Up
description: LONDON  Scotland Yards arrest of a former personal assistant to Rebekah Brooks, a former chief executive of the British newspaper arm of Rupert Murdochs News Corporation, appears to reflect the investigators intensifying focus on the possibility of a cover-up by executives, editors and others of the extent of illegal phone hacking and other criminal wrongdoing at the The News of the World, which is now defunct.

title: Kings Hope Change Is for the Better
description: On Thursday, nearly two weeks into a lockout-shortened season, the Sacramento Kings were 2-5, had a feud play out in public between the teams coach and a young star, which led to the coachs firing, and were scheduled to play the Milwaukee Bucks in what would be the teams fifth game in six nights.

title: Todays Scuttlebot: New Years and New Era
description: Interesting things that Bits reporters and editors found on the Web. More here.

title: The 76ers Have a Home, but It Still Isnt Their Town
description: PHILADELPHIA  A few fans were tailgating outside Wells Fargo Center on Friday, the 76ers home opener less than two hours away. They were wearing Flyers jerseys.

title: Iranians React to U.S. Rescue of Fishermen
description: One day after the United States Navy rescued 13 Iranian fishermen from Somali pirates in the North Arabian Sea, the response from Iran ranged across a wide spectrum, from gratitude to suspicion.

title: Jerzy Kluger, John Pauls Jewish Confidant, Dies at 90
description: For a half-century, Jerzy Kluger refused to set foot in Poland, where most of his family, including his mother and sister, had died in Nazi death camps. Then, in 1989, an old friend begged him to do an errand.

title: U.S. Team Continues Preparations for Olympic Qualifying
description: The U.S. mens under-23 national team will participate in a two-part, 11-day training camp in California and Costa Rica as it continues to prepare for regional qualifying for a berth in the Summer Olympics in London.

title: A Dimly Flickering Light in a Darkened Downtown
description: LORAIN, Ohio  The dark, empty storefronts that clog the heart of this aging industrial city stare blankly at the street, their fading signs mute reminders of better and busier times.

title: Rand Paul Stumps for His Father in Concord
description: CONCORD, N.H.  Representative Ron Paul may play coy about whether he will run for president as a third-party independent candidate, but the idea clearly seems to make his son, Senator Rand Paul, Republican of Kentucky, uncomfortable.

title: United in Giants Lore and Shaped by Jersey Roots
description: The first time they met, long after David Tyree carved his place in Giants history but before Victor Cruz began rewriting the teams wide receivers record book, there was only a smile, a handshake and an expression on Tyrees face that suggested to Cruz that Tyree recognized him as the new local guy trying to catch on.

title: OBrien Faces Fragile Situation as Paterno Successor
description: Penn State introduced Bill OBrien, the New England Patriots offensive coordinator, as its football coach Saturday. Along with being forever known as the successor to Joe Paterno, OBrien takes over a program at a university that is reeling from the Jerry Sandusky sexual abuse scandal and that has been criticized by former players for going outside the community to find a replacement for Paterno.

title: A Call to End Fighting; a Defense of Retribution
description: It was coincidental, but two successful N.H.L. team executives, Detroits Jimmy Devellano and Torontos Brian Burke, spoke out about fighting in the game last Thursday. They represent diametrically different points of view on the subject, and they were not speaking in response to each other, but it was as good as a point/counterpoint presentation of dueling editorials.

title: Romney Showcases Endorsement by Ex-Ambassadors to Vatican
description: MANCHESTER, N.H.  Five former ambassadors to the Vatican endorsed Mitt Romney on Saturday, choosing a Mormon over two Roman Catholic rivals in the race for the Republican presidential nomination.

title: Andy Carey, Third Baseman for 1950s Yankees, Dies at 80
description: Andy Carey, an underappreciated cog in the powerful Yankees machine of the 1950s that won four consecutive American League pennants and two World Series, died on Dec. 15 at his home in Costa Mesa, Calif. He was 80.

title: The Caucus Click: Debate Prep
Agents Union Stalls Training on Deportation Rules
description: WASHINGTON  The federal agency in charge of deportations is conducting a far-reaching training course to push immigration enforcement officers and prosecutors nationwide to focus their efforts on removing immigrants convicted of crimes.

description: MANCHESTER, N.H.  At a rally for Mitt Romney in Derry on Saturday morning, Gov. Nikki R. Haley of South Carolina set a high bar for Mr. Romneys performance in the New Hampshire primary on Tuesday.

title: An Engineered Doomsday
description: Scientists have long worried that an influenza virus that has ravaged poultry and wild birds in Asia might evolve to pose a threat to humans. Now scientists financed by the National Institutes of Health have shown in a laboratory how that could happen. In the process they created a virus that could kill tens or hundreds of millions of people if it escaped confinement or was stolen by terrorists.

description: PERHAPS the most widespread peril children face isnt guns, swimming pools or speeding cars. Rather, scientists are suggesting that it may be toxic stress early in life, or even before birth.

description: In the closing days of last year, the Obama administration announced multibillion-dollar arms sales packages to Iraq and Saudi Arabia, including advanced fighter jets, tanks, helicopters and an array of smaller weapons.

title: Continuing Assault on Unions
description: Along with their shameful campaign to curb the collective bargaining rights of public sector workers in Wisconsin and Ohio last year, Republicans in statehouses around the country are taking aim at private sector unions.

title: Personal and Political
description: IN the five days since his almost-victory in the Iowa caucuses, Rick Santorums critics have tried out an unusual line of attack against the former Pennsylvania senator. Not content with the many targets that Santorums record presents, theyve gone after the way he and his wife, Karen, handled the premature delivery and death of their fourth child, Gabriel, in 1996.

description: AMONG online networking sites, LinkedIn stands out as the specialized one  its for professional connections only.

title: The Art of Bargaining, So Lost Upon Washington
description: ALMOST everyone agrees about one thing these days: Congress is malfunctioning. To help our representatives escape from their current morass, I suggest that they read An Essay on Bargaining, the classic 1956 article by Thomas Schelling, the Nobel laureate economist. It is profound, and it doesnt contain a single equation.

title: Ohio State Diary: Bringing Humor Into Outdoor Game
description: As some of you may know, Ohio State has a coming weekend series against the University of Michigan that will be capped off on Jan. 15 with an outdoor game at Progressive Field, the home of the Cleveland Indians, called the Frozen Diamond Faceoff. Im here to provide you with a season recap so far for our team.

title: Through an Economic Lens, an Election Too Close to Call
description: ITS the economy, stupid may not be either partys official slogan in this years presidential campaign. But it might as well be.

title: Head of Russian Church Says Leaders Must Listen to Protests
description: MOSCOW  The Russian Orthodox Church continued what appeared to be an effort to get the authorities to address Russians grievances over the political system, with Patriarch Kirill I, the churchs leader, saying in a televised interview that it would be a very bad sign if the countrys leaders failed to heed recent protests over perceived electoral fraud.

title: An Unexpected Plate of Chutzpah May Be Served After Dessert
description: MARKET price.

title: Shootings Soar in Oakland; Children Often the Victims
description: Five-year-old Gabriel Martinez Jr. died Dec. 30, shot as he played under a streetlight near his fathers taco truck on an East Oakland street corner. He was the third young child killed in Oakland since August, the 110th homicide of 2011, and the 199th juvenile shooting victim of more than 2,000 people who were victims of gun violence in an especially bloody year in an increasingly violent city.

title: With Freddie Roach
description: Tyson, De La Hoya, Pacquiao. Freddie Roach has worked with the best.

title: Public Officials Found Helping Clients of Family
description: Denny Jacobs, a former state senator, had a special ally last year when the states largest electric utility company hired him to lobby for a controversial smart-grid energy bill that many say makes it easier for utilities to raise rates.

title: Building the Team That Built Watson
description: THE assignment was one of the biggest challenges in the field of artificial intelligence: build a computer smart enough to beat grand champions at the game of Jeopardy.

title: Disclosure Often Spotty or Inaccurate
description: Public officials who are lobbyists routinely defend decisions to play both roles by saying they disclose their relationships publicly, as the law requires.

title: Investing in Early Childhood
description: My Sunday column looks at new evidence of the importance of early childhood and pregnancy on life outcomes. Ive been increasingly impressed by the research that suggests that biological mechanisms  such as the way cortisol floods a small child under stress, disrupting brain development  appear to lay the groundwork for social disadvantage later. But I was looking for a peg to write about this, and then the American Academy of Pediatrics provided it by issuing a landmark policy statement endorsing this new science of toxic stress.

title: Patrick Buchanans Future at MSNBC Is Murky, Networks Chief Says
description: PASADENA, Calif.  The days of Patrick J. Buchanan as a commentator on the news channel MSNBC may be over.

title: A Vision for Urban Parks
description: WHEN I was 9, a trip to the White Mountains in New Hampshire during summer camp started my interest in parks and hiking. After that, I visited national parks and decided I liked rugged rural areas. Later, I grew to appreciate bits of nature that governments provide for urban residents.

title: Study Challenges Supreme Courts Image as Defender of Free Speech
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court led by Chief Justice John G. Roberts Jr., the conventional wisdom goes, is exceptionally supportive of free speech. Leading scholars and practitioners have called the Roberts court the most pro-First Amendment court in American history.

title: Gary Bauer Says He Will Endorse Santorum
description: MANCHESTER, N.H.  Gary Bauer, a social conservative leader and former Republican presidential hopeful, said that he will endorse Rick Santorums bid for the partys presidential nomination during a visit to South Carolina on Sunday.

title: Notes From a Guantnamo Survivor
description: Bremen, Germany

title: South Korean Law Casts Wide Net, Snaring Satirists in a Hunt for Spies
description: SUWON, South Korea  On May 1, 2007, the police locked Kim Myung-soo in a jail cell so small he could spread his arms and touch the facing walls. On one of those walls, a television was showing trains in North and South Korea preparing to cross the border for the first time since the 1950-53 Korean War. The report also noted that South Korea was donating 400,000 tons of rice to North Korea.

title: Lagunitas Creek Watershed
description: Lagunitas Watershed in Marin County is a prime breeding ground for the endangered coho salmon. Once rain swells the creeks, the fish return from the ocean to their freshwater birthplace to spawn. With declining numbers of salmon in the recent past, environmentalists are closely counting this years returnees. So far, they are hopeful.

title: Its Time to Retire Lees Debt
description: At his swearing-in party Sunday night at City Hall, Mayor Edwin Lee will be praised by Senator Dianne Feinstein and serenaded with a special performance by the San Francisco Symphony.

title: Santorum Buys TV Advertising in South Carolina
description: MANCHESTER, N.H.  The outcome of the New Hampshire primary wont be known until Tuesday evening, but Rick Santorum is already setting his sights on South Carolina, where he will buy significant chunks of advertising time next week.

title: Seeing the Building for the Trees
description: A REVOLUTION in cognitive neuroscience is changing the kinds of experiments that scientists conduct, the kinds of questions economists ask and, increasingly, the ways that architects, landscape architects and urban designers shape our built environment.

title: Dynasty, North Korean-Style
description: Pusan, South Korea

title: What China Can Teach Europe
description: Shanghai

title: No Need for All These Nukes

title: Theater for Twits
description: Ladies and gentlemen, during this evenings performance, flash photography and video recording are strictly prohibited. Now, turn on your cellphones and enjoy the show!

title: Patricia Fleet
description: Patricia Fleets voice is familiar to almost everyone, even if her name doesnt ring a bell. Countless corporations, including several telecommunications companies, use her for their recorded messages, greetings and voicemail prompts. She is probably best known as the registered trademark voice intoning AT&T before callers receive an announcement or are connected to customer support.

title: The Random Horror of the Death Penalty
description: The Supreme Court has not banned capital punishment, as it should, but it has long held that the death penalty is unconstitutional if randomly imposed on a handful of people. An important new study based on capital cases in Connecticut provides powerful evidence that death sentences are haphazardly meted out, with virtually no connection to the heinousness of the crime.

title: Sunday Dialogue: Do We Live in a Less Deadly Time, or Not?
description: Robert Jay Lifton, Steven Pinker and readers discuss violence in this and other eras.

title: The Strip
description: Tap the slide show to see the weekly comic strip featured in the Sunday Review.

title: Santorum Escalates Attacks on Romney
description: AMHERST, N.H.  In what may have been a preview of Saturday nights debate, Rick Santorum took several swipes at Mitt Romney by name Saturday, departing from his usual practice of referring to the front-runner only obliquely.

title: Lincolns French Toast
description: By January 1862, fighting had quieted down in the East. The troops were in winter quarters, and the new Union commander, Gen. George McClellan, was sick with typhoid fever. Only President Lincoln seemed to be champing at the bit for action. The day after Christmas he had ordered Gen. Ambrose Burnside to be off at once. Exactly where Burnside was to go, Lincoln didnt say, so everyone stayed put.

title: That Bright Light May Be Deceiving
description: WHO said making money was supposed to be fun?

title: Bold Lie Turns Run-In at Sea Into Dramatic Rescue
description: ABOARD THE FISHING VESSEL AL MULAHI, in the Gulf of Oman  Late on Thursday afternoon, as the American destroyer Kidd loomed alongside this hijacked Iranian dhow, the warships loudspeaker issued a command in Urdu to the dhows frightened Urdu-speaking crew. American sailors stood ready, weapons in hand.

title: Yes, They Pay a Dividend, but Can You Afford Them?

title: Somali pirates captured in the Gulf Of Oman
description: Late on Thursday afternoon, as the American destroyer U.S.S. Kidd loomed alongside this hijacked Iranian dhow, the warships loudspeaker issued a command in Urdu to the dhows frightened Urdu-speaking crew. American sailors stood ready, weapons in hand.

title: How Often to Trade? Its Tricky for Funds, Too
description: AS an indecisive market kept reversing direction last fall, portfolio managers faced a choice: Try to time its helter-skelter moves, or simply sit back with confidence in an existing portfolio, resisting the temptation to trade with each new bullish or bearish lurch.

title: Slower Growth in Asia May Yield Bargains
description: THE European credit crisis has dominated the headlines, but the biggest reaction to shaky global economic and financial conditions has been in Asia. Stock markets there  and funds investing in them  trailed other major regions during the fourth quarter of 2011.

title: For Three Funds, a Front-Row Seat on a Rally
description: THE Standard & Poors 500-stock index returned nothing in 2011, but a lost year overshadowed a late rally. Managers of three of the fourth quarters better-performing mutual funds found winners in such varied places as small-capitalization stocks, auto parts retailers and aerospace companies.

title: For Bond Investors, a Year to Tread Carefully
description: BOND funds as a group outperformed stock funds last year, though not in the fourth quarter. And despite the bond funds less-volatile performance, choosing one is scarcely a piece of cake.

title: Dont Become Your Moneys Enemy
description: WITH sincere apologies to Roseanne Roseannadanna, when it comes to events that can harm the value of your investments, its always something. Today, its the European debt crisis, or the chance of a double-dip recession, or Congressional gridlock.

title: Dempsey Scores Hat Trick in Fulhams F.A. Cup Win
description: Fulhams Clint Dempsey scored a hat trick, Aston Villas Brad Guzan saved a penalty kick in injury time and Landon Donovan had an assist on Evertons opening goal in a memorable day for American players in England. All three were playing matches in the F.A. Cup, as the Premier League  and the rest of England  took a break from league play for a weekend of matches in the worlds oldest domestic cup competition. For more, read our soccer roundup here.

title: In Florida, Lawmakers Consider Gambling Bill
description: MIAMI  As the Florida Legislature sprints into action on Tuesday for its annual two-month session, lawmakers will face the politically volatile task of redrawing the electoral map (sure to attract a court challenge) and devising new ways to plug a $2 billion deficit in the state budget.

title: A Vote for Charles Haley; Pick Your Hall of Famers
description: The Pro Football Hall of Fame selection committee has narrowed the list of 26 semifinalists to the group of 15 modern-era finalists who will be considered for the class of 2012. The list is at the bottom of this post.

title: Appointments Challenge Senate Role, Experts Say
description: WASHINGTON  To many Republicans and some constitutional scholars, President Obamas decision last week to ignore a sitting Senate and sidestep the confirmation process for several appointees risked nothing short of an end to the Senates role of providing advice and consent on presidential appointments.

title: Iraq Turns Justice Into a Show, and Terror Confessions a Script
description: BAGHDAD  The cameras were rolling and the reporters were ready inside the auditorium, so the Iraqi police officer gave the signal: Bring in the prisoners. In they shuffled, 21 men accused of terrorism and murder, hands shackled, eyes tracing the floor. This was no day in court. Today, they were lined up to meet the press.

title: Lull in Strikes by U.S. Drones Aids Militants in Pakistan

title: Vote Result From Disputed Precinct Deemed Official

description: Dan McGrath writes a column for The Chicago News Cooperative.

title: Appointments Unsettle State of Venezuelan Politics

Now, with a lengthy re-election campaign ahead of him, Mr. Chvez has once again upended expectations, scattering some of his closest confidants and promoting some old associates in a way that seems certain to provoke alarm at home and abroad.

In classrooms, they click through online tutorials and study blueprints emblazoned with the companys logo. And on a mock factory floor, they learn to use wrenches, hoses and power tools that they will need to build axles for large mining trucks.

title: Video: Private Sector Gets Job Skills; Public Gets Bill

Increasingly, companies have come to expect that state and local governments will pay for job training, too.

The article is about Mamata Banerjee, West Bengal chief minister and ruling coalition ally, opposing legislation pushed by the central government. The writers believe her strong stand has to do with building her profile as a robust regional leader and breaking free of whatever remains of her roots as a Congress politician.

Pakistan has already added water to the long list of disputes with India and people in India have grown concerned about what they say are Chinese efforts to dam the Brahmaputra River.

description: JERUSALEM  Israeli prosecutors on Sunday charged five radical Jewish settlers with tracking troop movements in the West Bank and organizing a raid on an Israeli Army base there last month.

title: Metro Pucks: All-Star Picks, 24/7 Three Stars, Weekly Grades
description: Our weekly recap of the metropolitan areas three N.H.L. teams:

title: Rooney and United Paint the Town Red
description: The tide in English soccer has not yet turned as decisively from Manchester United red to City blue as many had thought.

title: Five Easy Steps to Simple Camera Mastery
description: Creativity is all about making choices. But when you set your camera to automatic, as so many do, the camera makes the choices for you. If you want to be creative, the first thing you have to do is turn off the automatic setting.

title: Disruptions: Taxi Supply and Demand, Priced by the Mile
description: 2:59 p.m. | Updated Adding information about how and when Uber customers are notified of surge pricing.

title: A Tech Show Loses Clout as Industry Shifts
description: The International Consumer Electronics Show, which will open on Tuesday in Las Vegas, is impossible to ignore. It will smother the citys gigantic convention center with gadgets and those who make and promote them; more than 140,000 people are expected to attend for a frenzy of old-fashioned social networking with other members of the tech set.

title: Oscar Rule Will Cull Nonfiction Contenders
description: LOS ANGELES  In a move to trim the number of documentaries submitted annually for Oscar consideration, the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences is poised to require a movie review from The New York Times or The Los Angeles Times to qualify a documentary feature for the Academy Awards.

title: Making an iPhone Even More Child-Friendly
description: Here are four storage solutions designed to make your iPhone-size devices more toddler-friendly.

title: Life, Mediated in a Journal, by a Writer Busy Being Born
description: The Susan Sontag of the skunk-striped hair and the illustrious reputation as a public figure looks back on another Susan Sontag, a precocious but insecure young woman hungering for experience, in Sontag: Reborn, a touching, exquisitely rendered portrait of the artist (and thinker) in the process of self-creation at the Public Theater as part of the Under the Radar festival.

title: Consumed in Fire, Cloaked in Ice, Equitables Headquarters Fell 100 Years Ago
description: If that enormous White Star liner had made port on her maiden voyage that year, 1912 would probably have been known by generations of New Yorkers as the year of the great Equitable disaster.

title: Subdued Remembrance of a Dark Day in Tucson
description: TUCSON  The sun had fallen and a crowd had gathered on a chilly Sunday night on the mall at the University of Arizona, for the last event of a weekend commemorating the first anniversary of the mass shooting here one year ago. The vigil began with the Pledge of the Allegiance.

title: Romneys Fear of Firing, Minus the Details
description: ROCHESTER, N.H.  Mitt Romney told a New Hampshire crowd on Sunday afternoon that he knew what it was like to fear a pink slip  but so far, his campaign has not been able to provide any examples of a time when Mr. Romney, the former governor of Massachusetts who spent more than two decades in the private sector, truly feared for his job.

title: Axe Adds Fragrance for Women to Its Lineup
description: SINCE its introduction in the United States in 2002, Axe, the body spray and grooming brand by Unilever, has been pitched squarely at young men, with commercials depicting women getting a whiff of Axe users and then aggressively pursuing them.

title: 2007 Rerun? Giants Take First Step
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  Generally, the Giants are not the reminiscing types. Coach Tom Coughlin often scowls when asked to reflect on anything less immediate than that days injury report, and quarterback Eli Mannings sour face is predictable when the subject involves any sort of nostalgia. Scrapbooking, one imagines, is not a favored hobby in the Giants locker room.

title: Corbis to Acquire NMA Group
description: Corbis, the digital media company owned by Bill Gates that licenses the intellectual property rights to photographs, music and public personalities, is expanding again by acquiring the NMA Group in Los Angeles, a pioneer in the realm of branded entertainment, which helps marketers weave products into the plots of movies and television shows.

title: In House Beautiful, a New Look for Digital Watermarks
description: For magazine readers who find those little black-and-white pixelated boxes, called QR codes, annoying or just unsightly, a new visual cue is on the way.

title: United Beats City, With a Surprise Guest: Scholes
description: Manchester United bounced Manchester City from the F.A. Cup on Sunday in a game that, according to Rob Hughes, proved that the city has not turned as decisively from red to blue as many thought.

title: Newt Gingrich on a Supportive Super PAC
description: Jan. 8, 2012 - At a press conference in Manchester, the former Speaker of the House answered questions from Jeff Zeleny of The New York Times about new ads from a Super PAC attacking Mitt Romney.

title: Gingrich Says Bain Capital Looted Companies
description: MANCHESTER, N.H.  Newt Gingrich assailed Mitt Romneys business background of buying and selling companies at the investment firm Bain Capital, saying Sunday afternoon that the work was comparable to rich people figuring out clever legal ways to loot a company.

title: Footnote
description: The pop-star power coupleBeyonc, 30, and Jay-Z, 42, welcomed a daughter, Blue IvyCarter, into the world on Saturdaynight. Jay-Z rented an entirefloor of Lenox Hill Hospital onthe Upper East Side of Manhattanat a cost of $1.3 million, accordingto an online report fromABCs Good Morning America.An official birth announcementfrom representatives of the couplehad not yet been released.

title: So Much Tension, Pulling at These Strings
description: During intermissions at the Metropolitan Museum of Arts lovably mid-20th-century-modern Grace Rainey Rogers Auditorium its possible to wander through the adjacent galleries of Egyptian art. Attending a concert there, you are aware of history. It makes sense that the Met, with its vast holdings dating back millenniums, should emphasize stability and long relationships in its distinguished concert series.

title: After Debate, Campaigning Turns to South Carolina
description: GREENVILLE, S.C.  Just two days before voting in the Republican nominating contest is to begin in New Hampshire, Rick Santorum turned his attention here on Sunday night, telling a crowd of several hundred who packed a sports bar that he is the candidate who most reflects their values as a strong-conviction conservative.

title: In the Cave: Philosophy and Addiction
Get on TV? Hey, Smack Me Again!
description: Every town has a scene, a subculture, a place where young people go to escape. In Minden, La., a city of about 13,000 some 30 miles east of Shreveport, its mixed martial arts, a sport that attracts young men with hopes of punching and kicking and wrestling their way through their opponents, and hopefully their problems.

title: Partners in Love and the Presidency
description: On the evening of Jan. 12 last year, Michelle Obama sat in the front row of a packed memorial service and fixed her eyes on her husband as he took the stage.

title: In Hollywoods Clubby Culture, a Disney Marketers Rapid Downfall
description: LOS ANGELES  About a year ago, a team of Disney movie executives traveled to rural Britain to visit Steven Spielbergs War Horse set. Mud and manure greeted them. But knowing that film sets are usually filthy and suspecting this one might be particularly so, the group arrived in grungy clothes and work boots.

title: Not Dead Yet
description: I did warn readers of a likely gap in blogging; it got longer than I expected as stuff fell in on me. On my way home from Chicago, and normal blogging should resume tomorrow.

title: Keen Evaluation Ends in Slam
description: The Round Robin Teams top bracket played on Dec. 30, the last day of the Edgar Kaplan Winter Regional in Manhattan, was won by two married couples: Steve and Rona Levine of New York City, and Ralph and Gloria Tamlyn of Larchmont, N.Y.

title: Campbell Says Goodbye With Sparkle and Guitar
description: Last June, Glen Campbell announced that he had Alzheimers disease, and on Saturday night he came to Town Hall as part of what was billed as the Goodbye Tour. Everyone in the room understood. The faithful, reverent crowd appeared not to mind that for much of the show Mr. Campbell was reading lyrics from prompters that had been set between the monitors at the foot of the stage.

title: A Couples Intimate Rotations While Surrounded on All Sides
description: Like many couples, the two people in Nichole Canusos Takes seem trapped together, trapped by each other and the past. In their case the enclosure is literal: a cube the size of a small room. Its walls are made of a fabric gauzy enough to see through but substantial enough to serve as screens for live video of the dancers inside.

title: Monday: Better-Than-You Type
description: MONDAYS PUZZLE  Interesting. You would think a simple, clean theme like this had been done before, but in this debut by Michael Dewey, it seems as if the theme entries are appearing for the first time in The New York Times. Its possible that similar, avian-themed grids have appeared in other newspapers, but not here.

title: Cadillac Spells Its BMW 3 Series Fighter ATS
description: Introduced on Sunday, Jan. 8: 2013 Cadillac ATS.

title: Ear-Openers: New Sounds, No Dogma
description: At best, Winter Jazzfest is an extraordinary thing. Its a significant jazz festival, not tied to any cultural institution. And it doesnt rely on the names that would fill Carnegie Hall or Rose Theater, but on those that make up the musics daily life, chosen with discernment and advocacy. Thats inspired.

title: PAC Ads to Attack Romney as Predatory Capitalist
description: MANCHESTER, N.H.  Thanks to a $5 million donation from a wealthy casino owner, a group supporting Newt Gingrich plans to place advertisements in South Carolina this week attacking Mitt Romney as a predatory capitalist who destroyed jobs and communities, a full-scale Republican assault on Mr. Romneys business background.

title: Seeking Traveling Giants Fans
description: After Sundays dismantling of the Falcons, the Giants now head on the road for a meeting with Aaron Rodgers and the defending Super Bowl champion Green Bay Packers. If youre a Giants fan who is planning to make the trip to Wisconsin this week, or know someone who is, wed like to talk with you. Reach out to us in the comments field below, and well contact you by e-mail.

title: In a Fledgling Country, Perils for the Press
description: In a thatched hut in Juba, the capital of South Sudan, about 10 young men and women sat on lawn chairs made of brown plastic. They loudly typed on the computer keyboards on the tables in front of them. Two fans were blowing heavily. But the loud humming, which turned all speaking in the room into yelling, didnt come from them. It came from the backyard, and when it suddenly stopped, the young people saved their work. Minutes later their screens turned dark.

title: In Tribute to New Orleans Institution, Baton Is Passed to New Fans
description: The Preservation Hall Jazz Band, a quintessential New Orleans institution, discovered new out-of-town admirers after Hurricane Katrina, and it brought many of them along for a concert on Saturday night at Carnegie Hall to celebrate its 50th anniversary.

title: Tim Tebow Is No Good. Except for When Hes Great.
description: The first half of the Denver Broncos A.F.C. playoff game against the Pittsburgh Steelers on Sunday was Tim Tebows career in a nutshell. In the first quarter, he couldnt do anything  going three-and-out on two possessions, including one on which Denver actually went backward.

title: Big Three Newscasts Are Changing the State of Play
description: There was a time when each of the Big Three nightly newscasts on American television tended to open with the same story  the latest campaign speech, a new government study or perhaps a big snowstorm. That time is gone.

title: Manhattan Borough President Is Still Aiming High
description: For those who think that Scott M. Stringer, the Manhattan borough president, wants to play it safe by running for re-election, or perhaps for comptroller, rather than for mayor, consider this: he has just persuaded prominent national Democrats to join his 2013 campaign.

title: Texas Death Offers Grim Reminder That Gun Replicas Can Fool Police
description: BROWNSVILLE, Tex.  In the hallway of a middle school here on Wednesday morning, administrators tried to calm an agitated student who had randomly assaulted another student in a classroom. But then the adults noticed it: the student, a 15-year-old eighth grader named Jaime Gonzalez Jr., had a gun tucked into the waistband of his pants.

title: Paladino, Ever Unpredictable, Stumps for Gingrich
description: MANCHESTER, N.H.  Carl P. Paladino, an unpredictable, unconventional and unvarnished Republican candidate for governor of New York in 2010, made an unexpected visit to New Hampshire this weekend to experiment with a new role: as an on-message, on-script and on-team surrogate (of sorts) for Newt Gingrich.

title: Discovered on Publishers Web Site, Aspiring Author Signs Book Deal
description: Penguin Group USA has plucked its first author from its new electronic slush pile.

title: William P. Carey, Leader in Commercial Real Estate, Dies at 81
description: William P. Carey, who played a leading role in the early use of the commercial real estate transaction known as the sale-leaseback as he built a fortune in investment management, died on Jan. 2 in West Palm Beach, Fla. He was 81 and lived in Manhattan.

title: Treasury Auctions Set for This Week
description: The Treasurys schedule of financing this week includes Mondays regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills and an auction of four-week bills on Tuesday.

title: Economic Reports for the Week Ahead
description: ECONOMIC REPORTS Data will include consumer credit for November (Monday); wholesale trade inventories for November (Tuesday); the Federal Reserve beige book (Wednesday); weekly jobless claims, retail sales for December and business inventories for November (Thursday); and the trade deficit for November and the Thomson Reuters/University of Michigan consumer sentiment index for January (Friday).

title: Huntsman Goes for Independent Appeal
description: HAMPSTEAD, N.H.  For Al Sandler, an independent voter here, Jon M. Huntsman Jr.s performance in Sundays presidential debate was the clincher. When Mr. Huntsman said that Mitt Romney was wrong to criticize him for being President Obamas ambassador to China, adding, The nation is divided because of attitudes like that, it was music to Mr. Sandlers ears.

title: A Ranger Often Overlooked Makes His Hometown Proud
description: Welland may be easy driving distance from Buffalo and Toronto, but many residents of the southern Ontario town have adopted the Rangers as their home team. Dan Girardi, the Rangers defenseman who leads all N.H.L. players in ice time this season  but was not considered good enough just a few years ago to be drafted by any of the leagues 30 teams  was born and raised in Welland.

title: Bank Regulators to Allow Leeway on Liquidity Rule
description: Since the financial crisis, regulators have been pushing big banks to increase capital and ensure short-term liquidity, a move aimed at avoiding the cash flow troubles that brought the financial system to the brink of disaster in 2008.

title: In New Hampshire Newspaper, Gingrich Gets Coveted and Ferocious Supporter
description: MANCHESTER, N.H.  Newt Gingrich may not have much money to spend on advertising here. But he does have Joseph W. McQuaid, the publisher of New Hampshires largest newspaper, The Union Leader. And Mr. McQuaid will happily spill barrel after barrel of ink trying to tear every other candidate down.

title: A Lawyer Who Helped a Family Realize Its Vision
description: On Dec. 21, 2000, Venus Williams stood before a throng of reporters who had come to record another first. Reebok was signing her to the largest endorsement contract signed by a female athlete: five years, $40 million.

title: 2013 Cadillac ATS
description: Overview of the new model.

title: Diagnosis Is Concussion for Ross
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  As the Giants prepare to face the Green Bay Packers and Aaron Rodgers next Sunday, they must do so with a battered secondary. Cornerback Aaron Ross did not finish Sundays 24-2 victory over Atlanta after sustaining a head injury, and the team announced that he had a concussion.

title: News From the Advertising Industry
description: Accounts

title: True to Himself, and Loyal to the End
description: When Jorge Posada signed his final contract, after the 2007 season, he had never been on the disabled list. This was a matter of pride for Posada, and considering the rigors of so many years as a catcher, a minor miracle.

title: Letter to Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton
description: A letter signed by 16 Pakistan scholars and sent to Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton expressing concern for Husain Haqqani, the former Pakistani ambassador to the United States.

title: Behind the Counter, an Acute Anxiety
description: Long Island pharmacists talk of the twitchy arrivals who meander around, peering at the ceiling. They talk of the pharmacy shoppers who call up, give no name, and wonder if the place has oddly copious quantities of a narcotic painkiller, usually oxycodone. No, we dont, they will be told. They suspect the caller is a robber, casing a target.

title: Interpreters Help to Tell the Story Behind the Fight
description: The day before his April bout in Las Vegas with the junior middleweight contender James Kirkland, Nobuhiro Ishida met with the HBO announcers. Ishida, a slender Japanese boxer, was a considerable underdog and he looked the part.

title: With Preliminaries Over, Primary Season Gets Real
description: MANCHESTER, N.H.  After a year or more of anticipation, actual votes have been cast. But the 2012 Republican presidential contest will not proceed in a straight line, evenly spaced out over the next six months. Rather, it is broken up into different phases, each of which will have its own, interesting political dynamic that will affect how the candidates campaign, how they hoard their cash and how they travel.

title: Tony Blankley, Gingrich Aide and Columnist, Dies at 63
description: Tony Blankley, who frustrated and entertained reporters as press secretary to Newt Gingrich during his rise to power in the House, then joined the press corps himself as a columnist and editorial page editor at The Washington Times, died on Saturday in Washington. He was 63.

title: Haiti Can Be Rich Again
description: HAITI wasnt always the poorest nation in the Western hemisphere, though its almost impossible to read about the country today without coming across that phrase. In the two years since the earthquake that devastated it, Haiti has experienced political conflict and its first ever cholera epidemic; hundreds of thousands of the displaced are still living in makeshift tents strewn like dusty flags by the sides of highways. It is easy to forget that, for most of the 19th century, Haiti was a site of agricultural innovation, productivity and economic success.

title: Barricaded Inside His Show
description: When I saw the story last week about Keith Olbermann and Current TV lawyering up, I couldnt help thinking, My, that was quick.

title: With Family as Foundation, Alabamas Richardson Perseveres
description: NEW ORLEANS  Emmitt Smith first heard about Trent Richardson a few years ago, from the coach they shared in common. That coach, Jimmy Nichols, long worked at Escambia High School in Pensacola, Fla., and nearly 20 years after Smith graduated in 1987, after he became the N.F.L.s leading career rusher, another back of similar prowess emerged in his hometown.

title: 2013 Ford C-Max Hybrid
description: Overview of the new model.

title: For CBS This Morning, Showtime Has Arrived
description: It is exceedingly rare for a new television newscast to be made almost entirely from scratch, as is the case with CBS This Morning, which will replace The Early Show on Monday morning.

title: A Diplomat in a Gilded Cage, Feeling Trapped and Not Entirely Safe
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan  Just a few months ago, Husain Haqqani, the former Pakistani ambassador to the United States, brimmed with charm and confidence as he hosted lavish dinner parties for diplomats, generals, journalists and White House aides in Washington.

title: 2013 Ford C-Max Energi
description: Overview of the new model.

title: Same-Sex Marriage a Priority for Democrats in Trenton
description: Democratic leaders in New Jersey are planning to make a bill allowing same-sex marriage the centerpiece of their agenda for 2012, reflecting a key change from two years ago, when a leading Senate Democrat abstained from a vote on the issue.

title: Quick Strike From Tebow Helps Broncos Edge Steelers
description: DENVER  Tebow Time met overtime. And just like the other obstacles that have stood in Tebows way this season, overtime and the Pittsburgh Steelers had no chance.

title: Karzais Ultimatum Complicates U.S. Exit Strategy
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  President Hamid Karzais denunciation last week of abuses at the main American prison in Afghanistan  and his abrupt demand that Americans cede control of the site within a month  surprised many here. The prison, at Bagram Air Base, is one of the few in the country where Afghan and Western rights advocates say that conditions are relatively humane.

title: Publisher Has Deal for Elton John Book
description: Fans of Elton John, below, will have to wait a little longer for his memoir of sex, drugs and rock n roll. But his publisher is expected to announce Monday that Mr. John, 64, has signed up to write his first book, about his experience in fighting AIDS. The book, titled Love Is the Cure, will be the very personal stories of Sir Eltons life during the AIDS epidemic, including his agony at seeing friend after friend perish needlessly, said his publisher, Little, Brown & Company. Mr. John had long wondered why greater effort was not made to cure the disease. Why are we not doing more? he wrote in an e-mail from his publisher. This is a question I have thought deeply about, and wish to answer  and to help change  by writing this book. Mr. John, a longtime AIDS activist, founded the Elton John Aids Foundation in 1992. Michael Pietsch, the publisher of Little, Brown, will edit the book, to be released in July. A number of musicians, including Keith Richards, Patti Smith, Pete Townshend and Sammy Hagar, have lined up in recent years to write memoirs. Robert Barnett, the Washington lawyer who represented Mr. John in the deal, said that Mr. John had no such plans.

title: New Liveries in New York With No TVs to Despise
description: There has been plenty of turmoil over the citys proposed fleet of 18,000 new livery cabs, which will be allowed to pick up street hails in northern Manhattan and the four other boroughs starting later this year.

title: Happy Lobbyists, Unhappy Citizens
description: Few people were more elated at 2:20 a.m. Wednesday morning when Mitt Romney was declared the winner of the Republican caucuses in Iowa than a small group of lobbyists unknown outside of the Washington Beltway. All indications suggest that the New Hampshire primary this Tuesday will bring similar joy.

title: No Longer Upstaged, Nicks Brings Style to the Playoff Dance
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.

title: Politics Up Close and Almost Personal
description: MANCHESTER, N. H.  Newt Gingrich has bright purple cheeks. Rick Santorum has a comb sticking out of his back pocket.

title: On 4th-and-1, Giants Defense Showed Its Mettle
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  If a fourth-and-1 situation sometimes appears like a fierce, primal struggle, a link to footballs 19th-century grunt-and-push origins, it may be worth noting that modern-day pro football players view it no differently.

title: Steelers Momentum Stalls in the Secondary
description: DENVER  Little seemed amiss for the Steelers as they walked to the south end of Sports Authority Field at Mile High to begin the second quarter of their A.F.C. wild-card game Sunday. They led by 6-0 on the scoreboard and the first-down tally. They had limited the Broncos to 8 yards while amassing 119.

title: Rejected 3 Times, School May Still Open Soon, and With a Grant, Too
description: In the last couple of years, Sharon Akman, a real estate agent, applied to the state of New Jersey three times to open a new charter school in the Highland Park area, to be called Tikun Olam Hebrew Language Charter High School.

title: Go East, Young Man
description: Beijing

title: Lottery Numbers
Is the U.S. Still a Land of Opportunity?
2013 Ford Fusion
description: Overview of new model.

title: Queens Broker Is Accused of Bringing Immigrants Ruin
description: For years, a self-made real estate magnate named Edul Ahmad personified the collective dreams of Richmond Hill, Queens, which is populated by many immigrants from Guyana, in South America. Mr. Ahmad drove a yellow Lamborghini, sponsored a cricket team and held white-glove parties at a lavish banquet hall that he owned.

title: Gifts for Dolan at First Sunday Mass Since News of Elevation
description: Gatherers offered cookies and flowers, cards and prayers, a Styrofoam Jesus and a small stash of beer.

title: Haitis Slow Recovery
description: The Interim Haiti Recovery Commission was one of Haitis great hopes after the earthquake, a Haitian-led international partnership that would finally summon the money, will and organizational intelligence to build the country back better than before. But if you visit the commissions Web site today, on the eve of the second anniversary of the Jan. 12 disaster, this is what you see:

title: The Sacketts and the Clean Water Act
description: Chantell and Michael Sacketts case against the Environmental Protection Agency before the Supreme Court on Monday might appear to be David versus Goliath. But those supporting the Sacketts with friend-of-the-court briefs are corporate Goliaths like General Electric and real estate developers eager to weaken the E.P.A.s ability to protect wetlands and waterways under the federal Clean Water Act.

title: Islamists in Egypt Back Timing of Military Handover
description: CAIRO  Poised to dominate the new Parliament here, Egypts largest Islamist group is putting off an expected confrontation with Egypts military rulers, keeping its distance from more radical Islamist parties and hoping that the United States will continue to support the country financially, a top leader of the groups political arm said Sunday.

title: Republicans Versus Reproductive Rights
description: In Iowa, the Republican presidential contenders tried to outdo one another in attacking reproductive rights as they sought the support of caucusgoers from the religious right. In New Hampshire, where voters are less socially conservative, the candidates have focused more on economic issues.

title: Second-Class Commuters
description: This year, more than 2.7 million of the nations commuters will have to pay an additional $550 in taxes, thanks to Congress. For those driving, however, not to worry. Commuting tax benefits only get better for them, while the deal for those who take trains or buses will get worse.

title: Job Creation and Our Energy Choices
description: To the Editor:

title: Corruption in China
description: To the Editor:

title: Football Concussions
description: To the Editor:

title: Sharing an Amusing Moment With a Former Mayor
description: DEAR DIARY:

title: Texting While Walking
description: The filmmaker Casey Neistat explores the hazards of text messaging while walking in New York City.

title: Just the Ticket
description: THE beginning of a new year is a time for resolutions, and Hillary Clintons admirers are already busily, lovingly resolving on her behalf. On one sideline, her friends tell me that after a few years of hyperactive globetrotting what she really needs is to put her feet up and dictate another volume of her memoirs while nagging Chelsea to deliver grandchildren. (Shes tired; she needs some time off, her husband told ABC.) At the other extreme, a couple of Democratic consultants, Patrick Caddell and Douglas Schoen, propose to draft her right now as the 2012 Democratic presidential candidate, whether she likes it or not. (Not only is Mrs. Clinton better positioned to win in 2012 than Mr. Obama, but she is better positioned to govern if she does, they wrote in The Wall Street Journal.) Other helpful devotees have noticed that Brown University is looking for a new president, or have imagined her creating a clone of the Clinton Global Initiative focused on empowering women. Or maybe Ruth Bader Ginsburg will decide to put her feet up, opening a seat on the Supreme Court.

title: Texting While Walking
description: Navigating the sidewalks of New York City can be as challenging as any rushing sport, like football or rugby. But when your opponents are walking while text messaging, their field of view is impaired, and this can render a three-block walk to Starbucks somewhere between infuriating and life-threatening.

title: Americas Unlevel Field
description: Last month President Obama gave a speech invoking the spirit of Teddy Roosevelt on behalf of progressive ideals  and Republicans were not happy. Mitt Romney, in particular, insisted that where Roosevelt believed that government should level the playing field to create equal opportunities, Mr. Obama believes that government should create equal outcomes, that we should have a society where everyone receives the same or similar rewards, regardless of education, effort and willingness to take risk.

title: A Revered, and Divided, Liberator of South Africa
description: JOHANNESBURG  With the slaughter of a snorting black bull, a sumptuous banquet and a golf tournament, the African National Congress celebrated its 100th anniversary this weekend at a lavish jamboree, focusing on its revered history rather than the bitter schisms and accusations that now divide it.

title: Giants Win With Rush
description: A capsule look at the Giants 24-2 victory over Atlanta in their wild-card playoff game:

title: A Food Stamp Program
description: To the Editor:

title: Czechs Singles-First Strategy Pays Off at Hopman Cup
description: PERTH, Australia  Petra Kvitova and Tomas Berdych of the Czech Republic swept through Marion Bartoli and Richard Gasquet of France, taking both singles matches to win the Hopman Cup final on Saturday.

title: In Kansas, a Clash of Science and Gobbledygook
description: Three fine performances in contrasting hues lend a vivifying spirit to How the World Began, a thoughtful but pokey drama by Catherine Trieschmann in which a well-meaning New York liberal parachutes into a heavily Christian town in Kansas, with combustible results.

title: Parallel Points of Light Ricochet Across Time
description: A constellation of light bulbs glows from the stage at St. Anns Warehouse in Brooklyn, where the monologuist extraordinaire Daniel Kitson has set up his own planetarium. In Its Always Right Now, Until Its Later, which opened on Sunday night and runs through Jan. 29, Mr. Kitson maps an earthly cosmology: the points of light in two separate lives that might otherwise be lost to the shadows.

title: U.S. Orders Venezuelan Envoy in Miami to Leave
description: In a move sure to further strain relations between the United States and Venezuela, the State Department on Sunday said that it had ordered a Venezuelan diplomat based in Miami to leave the country.

title: Fox Plans Block of Cartoon Shows for Late Night on Saturdays
description: PASADENA, Calif.  Emphasizing its history as the network that built a franchise around animated comedy shows like The Simpsons and Family Guy, Fox announced here on Sunday an ambitious plan to create a block of cartoon shows that would play in the late-night hour on Saturday.

title: Giants Replay: Jan. 8
description: Images from the Giants 24-2 victory over the Atlanta Falcons in an N.F.C. wild-card playoff game.

title: Sports Replay: Jan. 8
description: The first round of the N.F.L. playoffs came to an electrifying finish in Denver, the F.A. Cup continued in England and biathletes endured heavy snow in Germany.

title: With Work Scarce in Athens, Greeks Go Back to the Land
description: CHIOS, Greece  Nikos Gavalas and Alexandra Tricha, both 31 and trained as agriculturalists, were frustrated working on poorly paying, short-term contracts in Athens, where jobs are scarce and the cost of living is high. So last year, they decided to start a new project: growing edible snails for export.

title: Dueling Debates Vary in Style, Tone and Content
description: MANCHESTER, N.H.  Television networks market their presidential debates with battle metaphors like showdown, face off and head to head  anything to promote the gladiator-ring style of politics that makes news.

title: N.F.C. Divisional Matchups
description: NEW ORLEANS SAINTS (14-3)at SAN FRANCISCO 49ERS (13-3)

title: Smear in Russia Backfires, and Online Tributes Roll In
description: MOSCOW  Does Russias leading opposition activist cavort with space aliens? Or just with enemies of the state?

title: The Downs and Ups of Driving in Los Angeles
description: LOS ANGELES  The southwest border of Beverly Hills runs along Whitworth Drive. In some ways, it is impossible to distinguish where that city ends and this sprawling one begins. The houses are not drastically different and the lawns are manicured on both sides of the road.

title: A.F.C. Divisional Matchups
description: HOUSTON TEXANS (11-6)at BALTIMORE RAVENS (12-4)

title: Corrections: January 9
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Observers Appeal Again to Syria
description: CAIRO  The Arab League called again on Sunday for Syrian security forces and armed groups to immediately halt the violence in the country, and urged the Syrian government to comply with the terms of a peace deal to end months of bloodshed.

title: Enduring a Ceaseless List of Heartbreak, Together
description: In the Cordis family, the two daughters, Judy, 20, and Christina, 19, do most of the talking. Their mother, Patricia Cordis, 53, keeps a silence that masks a mountain of pain. Their brother, David, 15, sums up his place in the tightknit clan: I dont have a role; they overpower me, he said of his sisters.

description: NO. 1 LOUISIANA STATE (13-0) VS. NO. 2 ALABAMA (12-1)8:30 p.m. Eastern, ESPN

title: Malaysian Opposition Leader Acquitted in Sodomy Trial
description: KUALA LUMPUR, Malaysia  Ending a politically charged two-year trial, Malaysias High Court acquitted the countrys opposition leader, Anwar Ibrahim, of sodomy charges on Monday.

title: At Tournament of Champions, Talk of Tebow and Tebowing
description: KAPALUA, Hawaii  Jonathan Byrd carries a Bible verse in his back pocket, in his yardage book, but would he ever consider a more conspicuous display of his faith after a round, like dropping on his knees and praying a la Denver Broncos quarterback Tim Tebow?

title: Yahoo to Distribute Tom Hanks Series
description: Tom Hanks has engaged Yahoo to be the first digital distributor for Electric City, an animated science-fiction series that he created and that he is producing and starring in. Yahoo, which is trying to become recognized for TV-quality Web shows, is to announce the distribution deal on Monday. Electric City is the first original scripted program to be distributed by the Web site. The 90-minute series presents Mr. Hankss vision of a future metropolis that is challenged but not doomed. Yahoo plans to show the series in several parts and incorporate extra features, like interactive maps and casual games. It will be available in English, French, Spanish and other languages.

description: NYT Front Page for 01/09/2012

title: TV Adviser on Money Offers Card
description: For more than a decade, Suze Orman has exhorted her viewers on CNBC to spend less than they earn, flashed her blazing smile from the covers of best-selling books and endorsed the occasional auto loan provider and brokerage firm.

title: Barnes & Noble to Offer Nook Discount to Subscribers of 2 Publications
description: Barnes & Noble, in a move to increase sales of its Nook devices, will offer deep discounts on them to customers who also buy subscriptions to the Nook editions of People magazine or The New York Times, the retailer is expected to announce on Monday.

title: Ford Turns to the Midsize Car to Challenge Japan
description: DETROIT  Its rare for an auto company to undertake a total makeover of one of its best-selling models, from the styling to the seats to the selection of engines.

title: Ford Adds Plug-In Hybrid to Fusion Arsenal
description: 3:19 p.m. | Updated

title: U.S. Agents Aided Mexican Drug Trafficker to Infiltrate His Criminal Ring
description: WASHINGTON  American drug enforcement agents posing as money launderers secretly helped a powerful Mexican drug trafficker and his principal Colombian cocaine supplier move millions in drug proceeds around the world, as part of an effort to infiltrate and dismantle the criminal organizations wreaking havoc south of the border, according to newly obtained Mexican government documents.

title: Little Engines of Creativity, Spinning Freely in the Motor City
description: DETROIT  Navigating tables laden with lentil burgers and smoked wild salmon B.L.T.s, Sharon Robinson escorted a guest toward paintings hanging on the high walls of the Cass Cafe, a venerable gathering place near Wayne State University popular with students, poets and visual artists. The cafe is about three miles from Cobo Center, the site of the North American International Auto Show, where press previews officially begin on Monday.

description: innuendo  \in-y-wen-()do, -y-en-\ noun

title: On the Campaign Trail

title: How to Understand the World in 2012
description: If you want to understand the world, you need to understand Asia, Nicholas D. Kristof writes in The New York Times Travel section, and that means traveling to China and India. Mr. Kristof recommends Indias metropolises as well as Varanasi and Amritsar.

title: Good Wife Watch: Dianes Latest Inappropriate Admirer
description: When The Good Wife came back from its holiday hiatus on Sunday with an episode titled Alienation of Affection, in which a divorced couple sued Lockhart Gardner for $44 million and Alicia found herself at the center of the case, it seemed obvious that we should be looking for connections between that story line and Alicias personal history. Ive thought about it for 10 minutes and havent come up with any that were worth the trouble, so Im going to skip it. Please let us know in the comments what Im missing.

title: The New Hampshire Primary
description: Presidential candidates have been visiting New Hampshire, one of the first battleground states, for a year.

title: The New Scapegoats of Europe

title: Huntsman Has Momentum, but He Lacks Time
description: In a nomination contest in which literally every other major opponent to Mitt Romney has surged in the polls at some point, it is only fitting that the candidate who seems to have the late momentum in New Hampshire is the one who hadnt: Jon M. Huntsman Jr., the former governor of Utah.

title: Gazing Through the Transfer Window at a Few Americans
description: The European transfer window opened on Jan. 1, and that, combined with the buildup to the Mexican Primera Divisions Clausura season, means that there are plenty of Americans abroad who are either on the move or rumored to be changing clubs.

description: Jan. 9, 2012  A look at all five of the presidential candidates in New Hampshire and their different approaches to the campaign trail.

title: Acquittal of Opposition Leader May Level Field in Malaysia
description: KUALA LUMPUR, Malaysia  The surprise acquittal of Anwar Ibrahim, the Malaysian opposition leader, of sodomy charges is likely to make the countrys next national elections a tightly contested affair, analysts said Monday after the verdict was announced.

title: Jan. 9, 1968 | NASAs Surveyor 7 Probe Makes Soft Landing on Moon
description: On Jan. 9, 1968, the Surveyor 7 space probe made a soft landing on the moon. It was the final mission of the Surveyor program, a series of unmanned explorations of the lunar surface.

description: See what you know about the news below. To prepare, you might scan the articles or summaries on todays paper.

title: Iran Imposes Death Sentence on U.S. Man Accused of Spying
description: Irans judiciary on Monday sentenced to death an imprisoned American convicted of espionage for the Central Intelligence Agency. The punishment shocked his family and was imposed against a backdrop of increasingly bellicose relations with the United States over the disputed Iranian nuclear program.

title: Test Yourself | Math, Jan. 9, 2012
description: Test your math skills with this question created by Pete Diamantis at Math for America from the article With Victory No. 700 Comes a P.S.A.L. First.

title: Building an Archive From the Rubble
description: In 1989, Larry Racioppo got his first regular job in years: taking pictures showing New York City at its worst. He spent his days stepping through dank basement crack dens and apartments that were as burned-out as their inhabitants. On rooftops, spent shell casings littered the tar like fallen leaves. At street level, entire neighborhoods had been reduced to empty lots.

title: South Korea Investigates Vote-Buying Scandal
description: SEOUL, South Korea  President Lee Myung-baks ruling Grand National Party faced a growing crisis on Monday as prosecutors investigated an allegation from a whistle-blowing lawmaker that one of its former chairmen tried to buy votes in a party leadership race .

Which is harmless fun, or another opportunity to argue about religion (as a Fifth Down post argued last month, that would be a shame.)

title: Meet Madagascars New Lemur
description: Finding a new species may look easy on paper, the conservationist Jonah Ratsimbazafy says, but it takes a long, long time. He and his colleagues spent many a night in the jungle chasing after camouflaged hamster-size creatures hopping around the branches and brush. Their work paid off, though: after snagging 14 mouse lemurs, they were surprised to find they had a new species.

title: Players Roll the Dice for Dungeons & Dragons Remake
description: True believers have lost faith. Factions squabble. The enemies are not only massed at the gates of the kingdom, but they have also broken through.

title: Image of the Day: January 9
Away From Cobo Center, Automobiles for the Other Half
description: DETROIT  For many gearheads, seeing rare, expensive cars is the whole point of attending an auto show. But with the likes of Aston Martin, Ferrari and Lamborghini again skipping official appearances at the Detroit auto show, organizers staged a special viewing Sunday night of 28 exotic automobiles at the MGM Grand Detroit on the eve of the shows press previews  exclusively for sponsor invitees and 100 members of the public who paid $500 per ticket for the privilege.

title: Hyundai Elantra Is Car of the Year; Range Rover Evoque Is Truck of the Year
description: DETROIT  Selected by a jury of 50 automotive journalists from print, television, Web and radio, the Hyundai Elantra compact sedan was named North American Car of the Year here on Monday morning. Of the Elantra, which beat out the Ford Focus and Volkswagen Passat, Ken Gross, an automotive journalist, said in a media release that it offered beaucoup bang for the buck, impressive mileage; it feels like a more expensive car. Even so, there was a collective gasp here at Cobo Center when the announcement was made.

title: The Breakfast Meeting: Suze Ormans Debit Card and a New CBS Morning Show
description: Suze Orman, the CNBC financial adviser, has introduced a prepaid debit card, investing more $1 million of her own money in the project. These kinds of cards  which are meant for people with no credit history, or poor credit history  have drawn criticism for sky-high fees and poor disclosure. Ms. Orman says she wants to broaden the debit card market by charging low fees and offering new services, Ron Lieber writes; he adds that the project raises so many questions that it is hard to even know where to start.

title: Bowery Diner Is Set to Open

description: The International Consumer Electronics Show cannot be ignored, reports Nick Wingfield, one of The New York Times reporters at the annual technology extravaganza held in Las Vegas. But he writes that the changing nature of the technology industry is reflected in the fact that the most important developments are no longer coming from the the show.

title: Jones Group Calls Off Sale of Jeanswear Unit
description: The Jones Group said on Monday that it had ended efforts to sell its jeanswear unit to another apparel maker, Delta Galil of Israel, terminating a months-long process.

title: Blackmon and Stecklow Join the Exit of Veterans From The Journal

Blackmon, a senior national correspondent who frequently covers politics, will be leaving the newspaper to take an academic post at the University of Virginia and to cover politics for The Washington Post as a contributing editor.

Quarterback Ben Roethlisberger, up to then engineering a spirited comeback on one leg, suddenly looked like he had forgotten everything he ever knew. Ominous, dramatic music was cued up somewhere, most likely in your head.

title: Biomass and Electricity, Part One
description: Burning natural gas releases less heat-trapping carbon dioxide than burning coal does because it has only about half as much carbon per unit of energy. But it can exacerbate global warming if it escapes unburned into the atmosphere as methane; in a century, a methane molecule will trap as much heat as 21 carbon dioxide molecules would.

title: Whats in a Name? At C.E.S., Oftentimes, Its Shenzhen

title: Germans and Aliens
description: The Times has an article today about Germanys faith in austerity as the answer to depression. Its sad reading for anyone hoping that Europe will get its act together; its especially galling that Germans remain so committed to belief in expansionary austerity, despite the thorough empirical debunking the notion has been given over the past year and a half (see, e.g., this IMF working paper (pdf)).

Mitt Romney began an address to the Nashua Chamber of Commerce here on Monday by talking about how he started his consulting career at the entry level, and wound down his speech talking about the need to be able to fire people or businesses when they provide bad service.

title: For Romney, Close Ties to Officials Bear Fruit
description: MANCHESTER, N.H.  One night last week, as Mitt Romney raced across the plains of Iowa, a small group of supporters sat around his headquarters here, dialing up potential voters while slices of pepperoni pizza congealed on a table nearby. They were not just any volunteers: those working the phone banks included a former New Hampshire governor, a half-dozen state senators and Manchesters mayor.

title: Toxic Stress Can Harm Children for Life
description: In his column Sunday, Nicholas D. Kristof points to a new policy statement from the American Academy of Pediatrics based on an increasing wealth of scientific research: toxic stress in infancy or early childhood can disrupt the architecture of the developing brain, thereby influencing behavioral, educational, economic and health outcomes decades and generations later.

title: Numberplay: The Spiraling Skater
description: Our puzzle this week was provided by Numberplay reader Hansen Chen (a.k.a. Hans), who first encountered the problem as a Princeton graduate student. Dr. Chen discovered that the problem was being taught incorrectly. The instructor and textbook had it wrong.

description: LAS VEGAS  Most of the familiar spectacles are likely to be on display here this week during the International Consumer Electronics Show: the acres of flat-screen televisions, the 140,000-or-so smartphone-packing attendees, the grim, never-ending taxicab lines. Something will be missing, though.

title: Dudley of N.Y. Fed to Head Organization of Central Bankers

description: DOVER, N.H.  Political ads, negative and positive, were on the menu when Newt Gingrich visited a home of supporters for a meet-and-greet breakfast here on Monday morning.

title: Digital Dressing Room
description: A new social-network shopping site, motilo.com, with links to high fashion e-commerce sites, makes online shopping with friends more like the real thing. Think of it as Polyvore meets Facebook. Register and invite friends to create head-to-toe looks, all the while video-chatting with your fashion buddies. Its that power of referral that will often help tip you into making a purchase, said Sofia Barattieri di San Pietro, the sites chief executive, who came up with the idea on a shopping trip to Paris with a friend. All of the items featured are linked to retailers like net-a-porter.com and farfetch.com.

title: Advice From Lifes Graying Edge on Finishing With No Regrets

It reflected the approach to life I adopted after my mothers untimely death from cancer at age 49. I chose to live each day as if it could be my last  but with a watchful eye on the future in case it wasnt.

And extensive, they truly are.

title: Cat-and-Mouse Game in the Gupta Prosecution
description: We often think of prosecutions as involving a single crime that took place at a particular moment, so that the charges are fixed and the information that will be presented in court fairly clear-cut. In white-collar prosecutions, that is rarely the case, as prosecutors refine their case after filing charges, sometimes finding new violations, while defendants try to pry evidence from the government that can help their defense.

title: Seeing Social Media More as Portal Than as Pitfall
description: More than a hundred years ago, when the telephone was introduced, there was some hand-wringing over the social dangers that this new technology posed: increased sexual aggression and damaged human relationships. It was going to bring down our society, said Dr. Megan Moreno, a specialist in adolescent medicine at the University of Wisconsin-Madison. Men would be calling women and making lascivious comments, and women would be so vulnerable, and wed never have civilized conversations again.

title: Randolphs Injury Costs Grizzlies Offense, Order
description: The Memphis Grizzlies are in some considerable trouble, and for at least six or seven more weeks, Zach Randolph wont be able to right their wrongs on the strength of his mid-post game. A nasty medial collateral ligament tear ensured that much, and though Randolph is fortunate to have dodged a need for surgery, his absence has sent Memphis offense into a tailspin.

title: Romney Seeks to Clarify Pink Slip Remarks

After more than a week of not taking questions from his press corps, and after two days of back-to-back comments that his campaign has scrambled to explain, Mitt Romney stepped to the microphone after an event at metal fabricating plant here Monday afternoon, and sought to clarify remarks he has made about fearing the pink slip in his private sector career, as well as his statement earlier in the day that he likes being able to fire people or businesses that provide poor service.

title: An Apple a Day
description: There are many reasons an apple a day may keep the doctor away. Among popular fruits, apples rank second (after cranberries) in antioxidant power, according to the nutritionist Jonny Bowden. They are extremely high in phenolic compounds (polyphenols), particularly quercetin, and if the apple is red, anthocyanins. These phytochemicals carry many health benefits, both antioxidant and anti-inflammatory. Apples have been linked to lower rates of heart disease in several studies.

title: Thieves Steal Picasso and Mondrian Paintings in Athens
description: It took thieves all of seven minutes to slip in through a balcony door and steal paintings by Picasso and Mondrian from the National Art Gallery in Athens on Monday, Tthe Associated Press reported. The police said that the burglars intentionally set off alarms Sunday evening to lure guards into disabling a sensor in the museum. One alarm did subsequently go off, but the guards arrived too late to catch a thief.

But to reinforce his theme, Copping also found clever ways to incorporate military details into his clothes. He made epaulets out of jet beads, he introduced a floral print that hints at camouflage, and he interpreted army netting into gloves and a cutout pouf dress, seen here with the pump that Copping calls the new peep toe.

title: Just One Look | Celine
