description: As birthday parties go, turning 45 usually doesnt mean a lot. But it sure did for John C. Liu, the city comptroller.

title: Coil Festival: 5 Questions About Mission Drift
description: Rock music, Dutch teenagers, global financial turmoil, the best and worst of Las Vegas: all of it takes the stage in Mission Drift, by the New York-based theater company the TEAM (Theater of the Emerging American Moment). The piece comes to New York as part of this years Coil Festival after winning several awards at last years Edinburgh Festival Fringe.

title: This Is Citizens United
description: MANCHESTER, N.H.  From December 1 until the Iowa caucuses on January 3, 45 percent of all ads airing in Iowa were directed against Newt Gingrich, who promptly lost his frontrunner status and came in fourth. Financing for these ads came from Ron Paul, Rick Perry and Restore Our Future, a Super PAC that backs Mitt Romney.

title: Just One Look | Chlo
description: Soft round shapes, softer tie-neck blouses and clean, pleated dresses in even softer dusty colors star in Clare Waight Kellers second collection for Chlo. Paired with all of these pretty, work-ready clothes are accessories that look just as beautiful and uncomplicated, like glossy slip-in ankle boots and slipper-front pumps  and theres a new bag, Lucy, a slim three-pocket with zipper closures that comes in multiple colorways and fabrics, with leather handles or a chain strap. The check version of the bag is shown here with cropped pants, a brushed wool plaid coat and this editors favorite new flat: an emerald green loafer embellished with metal-tipped fringe.

title: Toyota Grasps for Heartstrings With NS4 Concept
description: Introduced on Tuesday, Jan. 10: Toyota NS4 concept.

title: 2013 Buick Encore
description: 2013 Buick Encore slide show

title: Attacks on Romney Prompt G.O.P. Backlash
description: MANCHESTER, N.H.  Attacks on Mitt Romney by some of his rivals set off outrage within the Republican Party on Tuesday as voters went to the polls and the candidates turned their attention to South Carolina.

title: Cirque du Soleil 3-D Movie Coming at You This Year
description: According to a partial list compiled by Dan Kois for The New York Times Magazine, moviegoers at 3-D films last year had Captain Americas shield, Justin Biebers hand and 40 partly chewed bean buns flung at them in stereoscopic illusions. This year, audiences can get ready to guard their laps against Cirque du Soleil acrobats who appear to be flying off the screen: Paramount said on Tuesday that it had acquired the distribution rights for a new 3-D movie about that Montreal-based circus troupe, written and directed by Andrew Adamson (of the Shrek and Narnia franchises) and produced by, among others, James Cameron (a filmmaker who knows a thing or two about 3-D movies). The film, called Cirque du Soleil Worlds Away, will feature performances from various shows presented by the troupe. Rob Moore, the vice chairman of Paramount, said in a statement that it will also include a timeless original story written especially for this movie. The studio said Cirque du Soleil Worlds Away is planned for worldwide release later this year.

title: Rule Change Would Allow Some Foreign-Owned Stores to Open in India
description: MUMBAI, India  A month after political opposition led the Indian government to indefinitely delay a decision to allow foreign retailers like Walmart into the country, policy makers on Tuesday changed a rule that would make it easier for predominantly single-brand foreign chains like Ikea and Gap to set up fully owned stores here.

title: In Talks With the Chinese, Geithner Faces an Uphill Climb
description: BEIJING  Timothy F. Geithner, the Treasury secretary, came to Beijing on Tuesday hoping to persuade Chinese leaders to toughen their stance toward Iran and to soften their opposition to a stronger renminbi, a move that could help the American economy.

title: Storm-Ravaged Village Builds a Bond at the Lunch Table
description: SCHOHARIE, N.Y.

title: Return of the Repressed
description: In the course of the 2000s, under a tax-cutting, business-friendly Republican administration, middle class paychecks grew much more slowly than the economy as a whole, upward mobility for the poor continued to lag behind parts of Western Europe, and the combination of unfunded tax cuts and deficit spending worsened the countrys fiscal picture just as the Baby Boomers were poised to retire. Then came the financial crisis, touched off in part by gross recklessness on Wall Street. Then came the Great Recession, which threw millions of Americans out of work, hit downscale workers much harder than it did the college-educated, and sent the deficit spiraling upward to unprecedented heights.

title: Just One Look | Prabal Gurung
description: Prabal Gurungs first prefall collection was consistent with the designers aesthetic: pretty with an edge. The silhouettes ranged from classic sheaths (in emerald green) to prim pleated skirts and fish-tail shirtdresses (with contrast colors on front and back). But what makes Gurung the next generations red carpet go-to for the avant-garde (Rooney Mara, Jessica Chastain) is his ability to imprint himself on traditional fabrics and textures.

title: John Hiatt Performs Songs for the Road at Panasonic Press Event
description: DETROIT  As the first day of press previews came to an end on Monday night, in an antiseptic conference room on the second floor of the Cobo Center, music broke out. The Panasonic Automotive Systems Company of America decided to sweeten the appeal of the companys press conference by presenting John Hiatt, the progressive country and western songwriter and singer known for songs about cars and the roads. He was also promoting his own product, his latest CD called Dirty Jeans and Mudslide Hymns.

title: On Our Radar: A New Snake
description: The Wildlife Conservation Society reports the discovery of a striking snake, the Matildas horned viper, in eastern Tanzania. Its habitat, estimated at only a few square miles, is already severely degraded from logging and the manufacture of charcoal, the group says, and the species is likely to be classified as critically endangered.

title: Lincoln, on the Hot Seat at Cobo Center
description: DETROIT  To build drama around the debut of its MKZ concept, Lincoln used no fog machines. The sedan nevertheless created a wisp of ambience later in the morning here with an electrical fire in the drivers door panel.

title: After Departures, Discovery Reorganizes Its Executive Suite
description: Discovery Communications on Monday named a new chief financial officer and spread out the responsibilities of its former chief operating officer, completing a reorganization of the companys executive suite.

title: Toyota Prius C
description: Overview of the car.

title: Taking My Children to the New Hampshire Primary
description: Because I live in New Hampshire, I got up bright and early this morning, loaded the kids in the car and headed out to vote. My children are 10, 7, 6 and 5, and the two oldest remember coming with me to vote in the last presidential election. But a primary is different, and more confusing. Even though Id explained it several times in the last few weeks, only my oldest child, Sam, really remembered what the primary meant (and when I asked him to name some of the differences between the Republican and Democratic Parties, he offered that the Democrats were represented by a blue elephant  although he was able to correctly identify his grandfather as a Republican).

title: Brad Pitt, Denbygate and Other Scenes From the Critics Circle
description: There was higher-than-normal security at the New York Film Critics Circle awards dinner, but it wasnt for fear of a showdown between David Denby and Scott Rudin. (Not that anyone had forgotten about Denbygate  more on that later.)

title: In an Effort to Greet Voters, Gingrich Finds Mainly News Media
description: MANCHESTER, N.H.  This is like being in New Orleans at Mardi Gras! Newt Gingrich called out from one of his most intense crowds of the week. But it was not a crush of voters. As he dropped by a polling place at a school just a few blocks from downtown Manchester, he was pounced on by scores of journalists Tuesday morning.

title: Fed Turns Over $77 Billion in Profits to the Treasury
description: WASHINGTON  The Federal Reserve said on Tuesday that it contributed $76.9 billion in profits to the Treasury Department last year, slightly less than its record 2010 transfer but much more than in any other previous year.

title: Romneys Big Government Critique Runs Into a New Hampshire Roadblock
description: MANCHESTER, N.H.There was a little-noticed moment in Saturdays Republican debate that perfectly illustrated why Mitt Romney is having a hard time persuading ordinary voters that he cares about their concerns.

title: An Alternative Way to Test Students' Progress
Mayor's Address Will Highlight Small Schools Initiative
Video Shows Attack on Arab League Monitors in Syria
description: The Arab League said that 11 of its monitors in Syria sustained light injuries on Monday during an attack by pro-regime elements in Latakia, a northwestern port city.

title: What Can U.S. Universities Do About a Student Stampede in Johannesburg?
description: A sad development in South Africa provides fresh support for my shift in this blog toward exploring ways universities can help create a global network for sharing and shaping ideas  what Ive taken to calling the Knowosphere.

title: Just Where Are Those Voters?
description: MANCHESTER, N.H.  Theres a belief among some that the New Hampshire primary is nothing but a media spectacle, one in which out-of-state supporters, protesters, members of the news media and tourists engage in a contrived sound-stage ideal of a quaint small-town democracy in a circuslike atmosphere.

title: Up, Up and Away Into Fords Cloud
description: DETROIT  Notwithstanding its recent problems with the Ford MyTouch telematics system, Ford has been keen to trumpet its leading position with respect to in-car technology.

title: Suicide Attackers Storm Afghan Government Building
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  Three suicide attackers stormed a government building in eastern Afghanistan on Tuesday, setting off a seven-hour gunfight with Afghan soldiers and police officers that left 10 people dead, including the attackers, the Afghan police said.

title: Maserati Kubang
description: Maserati Kubang slide show

title: Why Doesnt Anyone Check References?
description: Not long ago, I received a call from a furniture-store owner who was checking the references of one of my former employees. He introduced himself, and got right to the point: Im calling for a reference for  He named a former saleswoman.

title: New Documentary Rules Will Affect DocuWeeks, Group Says
description: LOS ANGELES  The International Documentary Association has weighed in on the rule changes that will winnow films qualified for the documentary Oscar by, among other things, requiring a review in either The New York Times or The Los Angeles Times. In a statement on Tuesday, the association for nonfiction film  which sponsors an annual DocuWeeks program that has qualified documentaries as Oscar submissions by putting them in theaters, but often without getting the requisite review  said the new rules will certainly have an impact on its screening program. But that impact, it said, wouldnt be clear until both the Academy and the editorial staffs of the two newspapers provided more information.

title: Citibank Lets Loyalty Members Pool Points on Facebook
description: Citibank has offered a new Facebook app that lets members of its ThankYou rewards program pool points with friends and family.

title: When New York Snubbed Mary Poppins
description: If things had turned out differently 45 years ago, Mark Bransdon might have been looking at a life-size statue of Mary Poppins in Central Park, a few steps from the familiar statues of Hans Christian Andersen and Alice, of Alice in Wonderland.

title: Not Set in Granite
description: Right now, while we indulge New Hampshires childish insistence on its presidential primary being first in the nation, Americans should decide to bury this tradition. Nearly a century is enough: the Granite State has somehow turned a fluke into an entitlement. Worse, its obsession with primacy prolongs, complicates and distorts the presidential nominating process. In a democracy, no state should be first forever.

title: Lunchtime at the Loaves and Fishes Cafe
description: The effects of Tropical Storm Irene have not toppled Schoharie, N.Y., where a makeshift cafe has helped sustain community spirit.

title: A Slow Start for the Magics Nelson, but He Has Been There Before
description: While the shadow of Dwight Howards trade request hangs over the Orlando Magic, Coach Stan Van Gundy has a few more specific items worthy of his immediate attention.

title: That Revolving Drama in Which All Are Actors
description: The Argentine writer and director Mariano Pensotti sets multiple stories in motion in his smart and smartly staged play El Pasado Es un Animal Grotesco (The Past Is a Grotesque Animal). And they really are in motion: the circular plywood stage, divided into four compartments, revolves constantly (and slowly  you wont feel seasick), as episodes from the lives of four characters are acted out. Their stories cinematically unspool and overlap as time moves onward and even occasionally backward.

title: TimesCast | January 10, 2012
description: The growing influence of unlimited super PAC money on the presidential campaign | New Hampshire voters speak out on whom they're choosing and why.

title: Ron Caron, Former Executive for Blues and Canadiens, Dies
description: Ron Caron, one of the front office architects behind the dominant Montreal Canadiens teams of the 1970s, was remembered for his knowledge and passion for the game after he died Monday evening at age 82. His death was confirmed by the other team he helped build, the St. Louis Blues.

title: Statues Under Wraps in Uttar Pradesh
description: The onerous task of hiding Uttar Pradeshs enormous stone tributes to the states chief minister, Mayawati, and her party began early Tuesday morning.

title: An Almost-There Debut for the 2013 Honda Accord Coupe
description: Introduced Tuesday, Jan. 10: Honda Accord coupe concept.

title: NYSE and Deutsche Borse Chiefs to Discuss Plans to Save Merger
description: 4:12 p.m. | Updated

title: On TimesCast, New Hampshire Votes
description: The growing influence of unlimited super PAC money on the presidential campaign. New Hampshire voters speak out on whom theyre choosing and why.

title: New Hampshire Primary Overview and Forecast
description: Tuesdays primary in New Hampshire is not likely to be as dramatic as the Iowa caucuses, with one candidate, Mitt Romney, holding a clear lead in all of the polls.

title: Perry Attacks Vultures Like Bain
description: FORT MILL, S.C.  Corporate takeover firms like Mitt Romneys Bain Capital are vultures that pick struggling companies clean and leave local communities to pick up the pieces, Gov. Rick Perry of Texas said on Tuesday.

title: No. 7 Sub Gets Bigger in Greenpoint
description: No. 7 Subs new location, opening next Wednesday in Greenpoint, Brooklyn, is larger and more elaborate than the original No. 7 in Fort Greene, but will have an inventive sandwich menu thats similar to the one at the sub shop that the owners, including the chef, Tyler Kord, have in the Ace Hotel in Manhattan.

title: A Buick, Bigger than a Breadbox
description: Introduced on Tuesday, Jan. 10: 2013 Buick Encore.

title: Channel Surfing: Billy the Kid
description: Billy the Kid lived his brief life at precisely the right moment to make him an excellent candidate for an installment of American Experience on PBS. It was an era of the kind of enthusiastic newspaper coverage that leads to outsize legends. And it was an era that left a sparse but compelling photographic record, poetic images of hard-living men and prettily posed women who come alive yet remain tantalizingly distant.

title: Images From a Russian Tankers Icy Journey to Alaska
description: As my colleague William Yardley reports, the coastal town of Nome, Alaska, is anxiously watching its frozen waters for an emergency shipment of fuel being brought by a Russian tanker escorted by an American icebreaker.

title: A Huntsman Throng at a Popular Polling Site
description: MANCHESTER, N.H.  Polling place madness, rinse and repeat.

title: In One Girls Story, a Test of Womens Rights in Afghanistan
description: I went to find Sahar Gul.

title: The Caucus Click: Dutch Get Out the Vote
description: BEDFORD, N.H.  Sake Slootweg, who was photographed outside Rick Santorums campaign headquarters here, is part of a group of students from the Netherlands who are learning about the American election process and making campaign phone calls for a variety of candidates, including Mr. Santorum and Ron Paul.

title: A Sundance Royal Returns
description: Once an Indie Queen always an Indie Queen? Yes  if youre Parker Posey, who has been in more than a dozen Sundance films over the years, including Party Girl and The House of Yes. On Tuesday the festival announced that she will host the 2012 Sundance Film Festival Awards on Jan. 28. Ms. Posey, 43, also stars as a cuckoo from cuckoo-ville boss in Price Check, a comic drama that will have its premiere at the festival. Sundance on Tuesday also announced its roster of jurors. The full list, which includes names like the director Justin Lin (Better Luck Tomorrow, Fast Five) and Charles Ferguson (the director/producer of the Oscar-winning documentary Inside Job), can be found here.

title: Showtime Extends Its Anytime Service
description: Following the lead of its larger rival HBO, Showtime is beginning to broaden access to an Internet service that lets its subscribers stream hundreds of television episodes and feature films.

title: More On Japan (Wonkish)
description: Say this for Eamonn Fingleton: he has started a useful blogospheric discussion of just how badly Japan really did. Noah Smith has weighed in on my last post; heres a further take.

title: A Seller and a Buyer in a Puzzling Exchange
description: In the Solitude of Cotton Fields, a visceral adaptation of a French play by Bernard-Marie Kolts, portrays a high-octane, sexually charged meeting between a dealer and a client, where the goods exchanged are unclear, but the high stakes are not. On another level, this production, staged in Polish with English supertitles by Radoslaw Rychcik, is about a confrontation between theater and rock concert. The rock concert wins.

title: A Low-Priced Rival Pushes to Take Over Frances Mobile Phone Market
description: PARIS  After popularizing the idea of low-cost broadband Internet service in France, upsetting a few vested interests in the process, the telecommunications entrepreneur Xavier Niel wants to do something similar for mobile phones.

title: U.S. Navy Reports Second Rescue of Iranian Mariners
description: In the second diplomacy-tinged sea rescue in less than a week, a vessel on patrol with the Navys Fifth Fleet near the Persian Gulf saved a group of distressed Iranian mariners on Tuesday, pulling them to safety from a cargo dhow that was foundering with a flooded engine room, the naval central command reported.

title: At Aejo, Food to Complement Tequila
description: Mexican restaurants all over town have scores of tequilas on the bar, but at Anejo Tequileria y Restaurante, opening next Tuesday in Hells Kitchen, a carefully curated selection of about two dozen tequilas, mezcals and also bottles of a similar, less known distillate from Chihuahua in the north, sotol, take center stage.

title: Just One Look | Stella McCartney
description: The suit from Stella McCartney this season is a bit of a departure from the one shes best known for, with its soft-edged, single-button jacket. The prefall suit has three buttons and is much more fitted, tailored and body-conscious, said McCartney at last nights presentation. Im always designing for women, things theyll want to wear. Chances are, much of the collection  including the quirky monogrammed separates, the green and black buffalo checks (shown here) and the dazzling brocade dresses  will be on that list, too.

title: In New Hampshire: Coffee, Guns, Pie and Candidates
description: Candidates make hundreds of stops during a campaign season, and one restaurant can blend into another. In New Hampshire, the setting is a little more constant.

title: Spectacles That Change Prescriptions on the Fly
description: LAS VEGAS  At the International Consumer Electronics Show you find electronics in everything, even the glass of spectacles. A company called Pixel Optics is demonstrating eyeglasses in which an electronic current is passed through liquid crystals to change the prescription on the fly.

title: Under the Radar: 5 Questions About Hot Pepper, Air Conditioner, and the Farewell Speech
description: A group of awkward temporary office workers wiggles, rambles and stumbles about in Hot Pepper, Air Conditioner, and the Farewell Speech, three plays written and directed by the Japanese playwright Toshiki Okada. Presented by Mr. Okadas Chelfitsch Theater Company, the piece is being performed at Japan Society in a co-production with the Under the Radar festival.

title: Reader Idea | Guiding Critical Thinking About For-Profit Colleges
description: Here is another in our Great Ideas From Readers series.

title: Magazine Ad Pages Fell 3.1% in 2011, With a Weak End to the Year
description: Declines in the second half of last year resulted in a overall drop in advertising pages in magazines for 2011 compared with 2010, according to a report distributed on Tuesday by the Publishers Information Bureau.

title: Michael Shannons Rocky Start
description: The Bagger has already introduced you to the cuddly Michael Shannon, and over the weekend, the protean star of Take Shelter spoke with the equally cuddly David Carr about his career, from Steppenwolf Theater in Chicago to being directed by Martin Scorsese in Boardwalk Empire.

title: Awaiting a Greek Payout
description: LONDON  Could Greeces next rescue payout go straight into the pockets of London hedge funds?

title: Maserati Kubang Concept: Made in America, but Mums the Word
description: Shown Tuesday, Jan. 10: Maserati Kubang concept.

title: After 30, the Going Is Getting Even Tougher
description: A player winning a Grand Slam singles title past the age of 30 has always been a rare sight: The last one to do so was Francesca Schiavone at the French Open in 2010.

title: Bike Tours Popularity Leads to Changes
description: Given the Bloomberg administrations continued push to have the city become more hospitable to bicyclists, it should come as little surprise that the TD Five Boro Bike Tour has grown in popularity  almost to its own detriment.

title: Q.&A.: T-Mobiles Chief on Whats Next After Failed AT&T Merger
description: LAS VEGAS  For several months in 2011, the wireless carriers T-Mobile USA and AT&T were pursuing a merger to unify their networks and expand their businesses. The deal ultimately collapsed after facing resistance from governmental agencies, which raised antitrust concerns.

title: Digital Notes: Music Apps Enlist Twitter, a New Hire at Sony Music
description: Updates on the business of digital music:

title: App Smart Extra: Best iPad Game Apps
description: Software companies of all kinds flocked to the iPad last year, and the results were great. (See my list of Top 10 iPad apps for 2011.) But in the gaming category in particular, the iPad attracted even more of the worlds accomplished software developers. Heres a list of the 10 best entries from an impressive 2011 vintage, with a nod to various gaming genres.

title: Meatless in the Midwest: A Tale of Survival
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo.

title: Downton Abbey Delivers Big Audience for PBS
description: The Season 2 premiere of Downton Abbey on PBS on Sunday drew an average of 4.2 million total viewers, a number that would impress even the most cold-hearted dowager. That performance doubled the average prime-time rating for PBS, according to Nielsen data, and the show experienced an 18 percent jump in the 18-to-49-year-old demographic when compared with the typical rating from the first season.

title: In Rural Portugal, Ancient Villages and Homemade Delights
description: Three year-old Matilde, dressed in a pink sweatsuit that read Fashion Beauty Girl, wanted to take her princess doll to the pig slaughter. Her mom, whom I had met through my hosts in this small Portuguese town, objected. The piggies are going to make the princess dirty, she said.

title: Should We Have National Standards for Sex Education?
description: A group of advocates for sexuality education in schools, including the Sexuality Information and Education Council of the United States, Advocates for Youth and Answer, have joined forces and worked with 40 individuals from the fields of health education, sexuality education, public health, public policy, philanthropy and advocacy to create what they call national sexuality education standards (PDF). The report says that the goal of the proposed standards is to provide clear, consistent and straightforward guidance on the essential minimum, core content for sexuality education that is developmentally and age-appropriate for students in Grades K12.

title: Have N.F.L. Questions? Judy Battista Has Answers
description: Are the Texans underrated? Where will Andrew Luck land? How many more coaches will lose their jobs before the draft? Judy Battista, the N.F.L. reporter for The Times, will answer questions from readers. Use the comment field below for your questions. Answers will appear Friday on The Fifth Down.

title: With Racy LF-LC, Lexus Risks the Ire of LF-A Buyers
description: Introduced on Monday, Jan. 9: Lexus LF-LC concept.

title: Vegetarian Eating in the Land of Iceberg Lettuce
description: This week, A.G. Sulzberger, a national correspondent in the Kansas City bureau, writes about his plight as a vegetarian living in the meat-loving Midwest, where salads are often topped with crumbled bacon and beans are bathed in lard.

title: U.S. Report Criticizes New York on Monitoring Care of Developmentally Disabled
description: ALBANY  The federal government sharply criticized New Yorks oversight of the developmentally disabled in a new report, saying the state agency charged with oversight lacks independence from the governors office, failed to account for how it is spending public money and has broken several requirements of federal law.

title: Giants Know They Can Match the Packers Score for Score
description: Green Bay Packers games are best thought of as basketball games. The Packers are going to score often. Their opponents are going to score often. Defensive play is more appropriately measured in stops and turnovers, not necessarily points allowed. Every forced punt is a success. Keeping the score close gives either team a chance to win in the final seconds.

title: Violence, Addicting Yet Ugly
description: A Japanese businessman tries to come home on his sons birthday but finds that an escaped convict has taken his family hostage. Outside, the police appear ineffectual, so this rational, soft-spoken man (his birthday gift was a calculator) decides to fight back himself, taking the wife and son of the criminal hostage. Then he sends a message that he will start cutting off the childs fingers unless his family is released.

title: Naval Officer Embarks on PGA Tour Career
description: HONOLULU  Over lunch Monday in the wardroom of the U.S.S. Chung-Hoon, Lt. j.g. Lauren Griebel acknowledged that she met President Obama over the holidays while playing a round of golf with her father on a local course. Smiling broadly, Griebel said, It wasnt Billy Hurley, but yeah.

title: For Villyan Bijev, Destination Liverpool, With a Stop in Dsseldorf
description: As the week-long United States under-20 camp ended last Sunday in Ft. Lauderdale, Fla., one of the players who is shaping up to be an important part of the team in months ahead is the forward Villyan Bijev.

title: Invitation to a Dialogue: Moving Up in America
description: To the Editor:

title: Federal Report on Disabled Care in New York State
description: The report from the Department of Health and Human Services criticized New Yorks oversight of the developmentally disabled.

title: European Official Presses for Moroccan Fishing Treaty
description: PARIS  Europes top fisheries official pledged Tuesday to work for a new fishing treaty with Morocco after the previous agreement was dropped last month by the European Parliament over concerns of overfishing and other issues.

title: TV Decency Is a Puzzler for Justices
description: WASHINGTON  In a rollicking Supreme Court argument that was equal parts cultural criticism and First Amendment doctrine, the justices on Tuesday considered whether the government still had good reason to regulate cursing and nudity on broadcast television.

title: The View From Alabama: Much More Than a Trophy
description: Alabamas dominating performance in the B.C.S. title game was more than just another championship game victory. It was a victory for the university and the city of Tuscaloosa.

title: Season of Equal-Opportunity Sexism
description: The battle of the sexes is over on television. Now viewers get to pick between his or her sexism.

title: Romney Wins New Hampshire Primary
description: Mitt Romney won the New Hampshire primary on Tuesday night.

title: Via Motors: Big G.M. Trucks With Downsized Thirst
description: Introduced on Tuesday, Jan. 10: Via Motors E-REV plug-in hybrid Silverado pickup, Suburban and Express Van.

title: Washington National Opera to Present Ring Cycle in 2016
description: The Washington National Operas merger with the Kennedy Center is appearing to pay dividends. The company announced on Tuesday that it would present the complete Wagner Ring cycle that it had commissioned with the San Francisco Opera but suspended because of money problems. The Washington company, whose merger with the John F. Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts was announced a year ago, ended up presenting the final installment, Gtterdmmerung, only in a concert performance in 2009 after individual productions of the first three operas in previous seasons. It had halted plans for a presentation of the complete cycle, which San Francisco staged last June.

title: Obama Drops by the E.P.A.
description: President Obama, who has been both applauded and jeered for his record on environmental issues, paid a brief visit to the headquarters of the Environmental Protection Agency in Washington on Tuesday to try to raise spirits at an agency that has been under siege for the past year.

title: The poop on how zebras might help us solve our energy problems; how to save a marriage after one spouse suffers a brain injury; and a life in the Antarctic polar desert.
description: The poop on how zebras might help us solve our energy problems; how to save a marriage after one spouse suffers a brain injury; and a life in the Antarctic polar desert.

title: Stone Links
description: A gathering of recent philosophy-related links.

title: Googles Social Move Attracts Critics
description: After Google announced on Tuesday that it was integrating material from Google Plus into its search results, the Web shot back, accusing the company of pushing aside competing social networks like Twitter and Facebook.

title: Texans Rookie Makes a Play as Big as His Dreams
description: HOUSTON  Only three years ago, J. J. Watt was delivering pizzas, mopping floors and being picked at like a leftover pepperoni pie by doubters who scoffed at his football dreams.

title: A Stroll This Side of the Mediterranean
description: WHEN the money that had kept New York aloft went away a few years back, some chefs switched into damage control immediately. They clipped prices. They made their menus and dining rooms more easygoing. They put future projects on hold.

title: Reviewing La Promenade des Anglais
description: The chef Alain Allegrettis new restaurant in Chelsea is a flashy bistro by way of Nice.

title: Huntsmans Country First Slogan
description: MANCHESTER, N.H.There is something quietly devastating about the three-day-old slogan of country first! that Jon Huntsmans supporters have begun chanting at his rallies and appearances here, including one this morning at a Manchester polling place.

title: Photo Replay: Jan. 10
description: A view of the day in sports, including a dusty stage of the Dakar Rally.

title: Interactive Tools to Assess the Likelihood of Death
description: To help prevent overtesting and overtreatment of older patients  or undertreatment for those who remain robust at advanced ages  medical guidelines increasingly call for doctors to consider life expectancy as a factor in their decision-making. But clinicians, research has shown, are notoriously poor at predicting how many years their patients have left.

title: Munger Donates $1.2 Million to University of Michigan
description: Gifting 10 shares of company stock might seem like a small amount to a university. But its a different story when Charles T. Munger, the longtime vice chairman of Berkshire Hathaway, is the donor.

title: Loyal to His 4-Legged Constituents
description: WASHINGTON

title: Things to Keep in Mind While Awaiting Results
description: MANCHESTER, N.H.  Polls here will remain open for several more hours as the Republican candidates prepare to dash from the state.

title: How Long Until the End?
description: Last spring, I wrote about a group of geriatricians and researchers assembling online a variety of geriatric indexes that do a reasonably good job of predicting mortality for those older than age 60. Since a number of tests and treatments ought to take life expectancy into account, they reasoned, physicians should have these validated tools in one handy online location.

title: Todays Scuttlebot: All Those Chiefs and Crime Prediction
description: Interesting things that New York Times reporters and editors found on the Web on Tuesday. Find more Scuttlebot items here.

title: FiveThirtyEight | New Hampshire Primary
description: Megan Liberman and Nate Silver talk about what we might expect to see in the New Hampshire primary tonight.

title: With an Open Mind on a Playoff, Conference Commissioners Meet
description: NEW ORLEANS  Street sweepers washed away the celebratory beads and the other remnants from the revelry that followed Monday nights Bowl Championship Series title game. And as fans poured out of the city, 11 conference commissioners and Notre Dame Athletic Director Jack Swarbrick met Tuesday to begin cleaning up the future of college footballs postseason.

title: Lehman Still Doing Deals in a Second Life on Wall Street
description: Things that refuse to die include Dracula, fungus, Jason from the Friday the 13th movies, zombies  and Lehman Brothers.

title: Five Dishes at La Promenade des Anglais
description: In Nice, France, La Promenade des Anglais is a walkway along the sea where you can stroll while checking out the array of bathing suits worn by the people lounging on blue chairs on the sand below.

title: Solitary Lives, Abruptly Interrupted
description: The crumbling, all but abandoned manor house as symbol of a social order in distress: the English may have invented that notion, but their former colonial subjects in India have also proved adept at employing it as a literary device. In the three novellas that make up The Artist of Disappearance, Anita Desai uses it twice, in differing circumstances and locations, but to the same convincing and plaintive effect.

title: Israel, Expecting Syrian Collapse, Braces for Refugees
description: JERUSALEM  Israels military chief said on Tuesday that the army was preparing for a potential influx of refugees into the Golan Heights from Syria with the demise of the government of President Bashar al-Assad, which he said was inevitable.

title: Nvidia Pushes Into Mobile Processors
description: LAS VEGAS  Nvidia, a chip manufacturer, is making a fast and aggressive push into the world of mobile processors. Its main weapon: the Android operating system

title: Malnutrition Widespread in Indian Children, Report Finds
description: NEW DELHI  In parts of India, 42 percent of all children under age 5 suffer from malnutrition, a sobering reminder of the persistence of poverty and hunger in the worlds largest democracy, according to a major report released on Tuesday.

title: Mistakes and Ideology
description: Mark Thoma sends us to Simon Wren-Lewis on the controversy over fiscal stimulus and all that; Wren-Lewis, refreshingly, doesnt try to make excuses for Lucas and Cochrane:

title: Hispanic Adviser Is Promoted at White House
description: The White House said Tuesday that Cecilia Muoz, who has led its efforts to overhaul immigration laws, had been named director of the Domestic Policy Council, making her one of President Obamas chief advisers on a broad swath of issues, including education and gay rights.

title: Pictures of the Day: New Hampshire and Elsewhere
description: Photographs from New Hampshire, Italy, Nigeria and Pakistan.

title: Analysis From the New Hampshire Primary
description: Welcome to FiveThirtyEights live blog of the New Hampshire primary. Polls have closed, and The New York Times has projected Mitt Romney as the winner, but we will still have plenty of statistical insights into the election.

title: Jaunty Songs That Reveal a Bleaker Reality
description: An erupting wellspring of euphoria: that would describe the vintage swing emanating from Vince Giordano and the Nighthawks at the 92nd Street Y during Saturday evenings season-opening program of Lyrics & Lyricists. It is challenging enough for a band to churn out museum-ready facsimiles of 80-year-old pop tunes outfitted with stylistically accurate period arrangements. But Mr. Giordanos ensemble, like the Jazz at Lincoln Center Orchestra playing the blues, preserves old music with such deep affection and idiomatic understanding that the past becomes the present and the term quaint simply doesnt apply. In its lighthearted way, the music swung as intensely as any being created today.

title: Just One Look | Carven
description: Carvens Guillaume Henry was looking at Diane Arbus photographs from the 1960s for inspiration for his prefall collection. Ordinary people looking extraordinary, said Henry about his muse: a very specific suburban girl who rides the subway in the early morning, is moody, makes her own clothes (or wears her mothers) and wants to look pretty but can only afford synthetic shoes. Hence, the plastic tortoise kitten heels, the fabrics that make references to shag carpets and couches (her only resources) and the jackets made of a leather thats washed to look faux (shes just not that fancy). Shes sweet looking but not dull, Henry said. And she has a terrific, intuitive sense of style, one that doesnt require money. Here, because he likes calm, strong, happy colors with metallics, is a yellow shearling jacket and skirt look paired with the coolest metallic pumps and matching camera bag. Anything but dull, indeed.

title: Giants New House Feels Like Home
description: It has taken nearly two full seasons, but MetLife Stadium finally felt last Sunday like it supplied the Giants with a home-field advantage.

title: First, Mr. Mayor, What of Beyoncs Baby?
description: When Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg began taking general questions at a news conference on Tuesday, the first topic was not his coming State of the City address, or teacher evaluation problems that are endangering federal education money, or even the New Hampshire primary.

title: Finally at Home at MetLife Stadium
description: The Timess William C. Rhoden talks about how the New York Giants have adapted to their new home in MetLife stadium.

title: Prosecco Growers Act to Guard Its Pedigree
description: CONEGLIANO, Italy

title: In the Netherlands, a Childs Game for Children Only
description: The replay of the Dutch Cup match between Ajax and AZ, which was abandoned on Dec. 21 and is scheduled to be played on Jan. 19, will be for children only.

title: From A to Z, a Book Deciphers Cooking
description: Every so often publishers issue kitchen guides with definitions, measurements, conversion tables and the like. The Culinarian: A Kitchen Desk Reference is crammed with an unusual amount of information, organized alphabetically from absinthe to zwieback. The author, Barbara Ann Kipfer, is a seasoned lexicographer, and it shows. Search for chicken, and youll find two pages of tips and a list of 50 chicken breeds. The shrimp entry decodes size grading, and for meringue, four varieties are defined. The book is a voyage of discovery, with useful information and fascinating trivia on every page. The first few pages list smoke points for various oils, and measurements, yields and equivalents for many foods. In one puzzling choice, though, the book provides weights and measures for medium-size eggs, not the large ones that most recipes require.

title: Snap, Crackle and (Some) Pop
description: You could view them, unkindly, as duds: pieces of popcorn that have not been popped to their fluffy white extreme. But these crisp little nuggets are less like the hard kernels at the bottom of your popcorn bowl and more like corn nuts. Halfpops, a new snack from the Seattle area, deliver a similar crunch, but are made from air-popped corn  unlike corn nuts, whole corn kernels that are soaked, then roasted or fried. Halfpops come in two flavors: butter and sea salt, and white Cheddar cheese. And beyond mere snacking, they are excellent sprinkled on a salad or vegetables, or served (as corn nuts are in South America) as a nibble alongside ceviche.

title: Owners of New Republic Seek Sale or New Investors
description: The owners of The New Republic, the nearly century-old magazine that helped define modern American liberalism, are considering selling the magazine or creating a strategic partnership with new investors, people briefed on the matter said on Tuesday.

title: Stringer and Jewish Leaders Condemn Anti-Semitic Acts
description: Scott M. Stringer, the Manhattan borough president and a likely candidate for mayor, held a press conference on Tuesday with a group of Jewish leaders to denounce what he said was a rash of anti-Semitic episodes in the city.

title: Two Quail Species in the Brush
description: Jennifer Gee, a biologist at the Claremont University Consortium and the University of California, Riverside, writes from the tropical dry forest near lamos, Mexico, where she and Jennifer Calkins are studying Callipepla quail.

title: With House Redistricting Looming, 2 California Republicans Retire
description: Days after Representative Elton Gallegly announced his retirement from Congress, another veteran California Republican in the House said he, too, planned to forgo a bid for re-election.

title: Met Gears Up to Be a Player in Contemporary Art
description: Sending a signal that it intends to become a serious competitor in the field of contemporary art for the first time in half a century, the Metropolitan Museum of Art has recruited a prominent London curator to oversee a new department devoted to art of the 20th and 21st centuries. She is Sheena Wagstaff, chief curator of Tate Modern since 2001, who has been responsible for programming there and for helping to organize exhibitions devoted to artists like Roy Lichtenstein, Barnett Newman, Jeff Wall and Eva Hesse.

title: Makerbot Introduces Larger, Two-Color 3-D Printer
description: Three-dimensional printing is getting more sophisticated. Makerbot, a Brooklyn-based start-up that builds 3-D printers for the consumer market, announced its latest offering on Tuesday, the MakerBot Replicator.

title: View of the World From New Hampshire and Iowa
description: MANCHESTER, N.H. While traveling around Iowa and New Hampshire, Ive been surrounded by white people. With few exceptions, the only non-whites Ive encountered have been journalists whove parachuted into these states to cover the Republican campaigns.

title: New Hampshire Primary Live Blog
description: MANCHESTER, N.H.  Mitt Romney has won the New Hampshire Republican primary, achieving a sweep of the first two critical contests in the 2012 presidential race and boosting his chances at becoming his partys nominee this fall.

title: Doodles, Puddles, Responses and Chalk
description: The drawing was already under way Sunday afternoon when I arrived a few minutes early at the Invisible Dog Art Center for Michael Klins Choreography for Blackboards (created in collaboration with the dramaturge Steve Valk), which had its American premiere as part of Performance Space 122s Coil festival.

title: Shining a Bright Light on Stormy Passages
description: The New Schools chamber music series, founded in 1957 and called the Schneider Concerts (in honor of the violinist Alexander Schneider) since 1993, has a dual mission. For young but accomplished ensembles, it is a venerable forum, known for its sterling track record. The pianist Peter Serkin made his New York debut in the series, as did the Guarneri Quartet, and you could have heard early performances by Murray Perahia and Yo-Yo Ma there. For its audiences the Schneider Concerts are an inexpensive way to hear consistently fine performances. (Tickets go for $17; $15 for 65+; and $5 for students.)

title: Phillip Kirschen-Clark to Return, at Demi Monde
description: Phillip Kirschen-Clark, who was previously at Vandaag, will be the chef at Demi Monde when it opens in about a month in the financial district.

title: Churchly Sanctuary for Music Cuts Back
description: Perhaps no institution responded more wholeheartedly to the 10th anniversary of the Sept. 11 attacks last year than Trinity Church. As well it should have; located prominently at Broadway and Wall Street, Trinity was a near neighbor of the World Trade Center, and its satellite St. Pauls Chapel, a few blocks up Broadway and directly across from the Trade Center grounds, served as the prime staging area for rescue workers.

title: Meanwhile, on the Democratic Side ...
description: To the Editor:

title: A Right to the Internet?
description: To the Editor:

title: Affordable Housing
description: To the Editor:

title: Spains Debt: The View From Barcelona
description: To the Editor:

title: City Council to Hold Hearing on Restaurant Inspection Complaints
description: In response to restaurateurs complaints about the citys 18-month-old letter-grading system, the City Council announced Tuesday that it will hold hearings on the inspection process in late February.

title: Just a Regular Guy and Pickpocket
description: There are a couple of movies, or rather a couple of story ideas, tucked in Loosies, an amorphous, laugh-flecked drama about a New York City pickpocket that mostly comes across as a feature-length advertisement for its likable star and writer, Peter Facinelli. A pretty man with an easy grin, Mr. Facinelli has a leading mans looks if not the presence or credits, and is best known these days for standing around stiffly as Dr. Carlisle Cullen, the forever young paterfamilias of the vampire brood in the Twilight flicks. He was infinitely better in the 2007 season of the cable show Damages, where he was actually given a character to work with, one whose appeal was tinged with menace.

title: In a World of Flashing Screens, Behold the Humble Turntable
description: LAS VEGAS  Amid all the flashing screens and high-tech gadgetry here at the International Consumer Electronics Show, its a bit of a surprise to run across a small booth that is fronted by an antique Crosley automobile.

title: Off the Menu
description: Opening

title: Decoding the New Hampshire Primary Coverage
description: While our colleagues on the Politics staff are reporting on the Republican presidential primary in New Hampshire, Brian Stelter and David Carr will be describing the media coverage, how journalism and politics mix and mingle and occasionally get mangled.

title: Whimsy and Tenderness in Motion: Frying Pans and Gentle Touches
description: Its easy to categorize Molissa Fenley as an artist who traffics in the severe. And sublimely so.

title: Dining Calendar
description: Pork, Swiss Style

title: After an Arrest, Civil Rights Questions
description: The photographer who took the iconic portrait used in President Obamas Hope poster lost his White House press credential in October after police arrested him on a charge of disorderly conduct. He is now considering a civil rights suit against the police, Donald R. Winslow reported today in News Photographer magazine, part of the National Press Photographers Association.

title: Queens Man Charged With 3,000 Child Pornography Counts
description: A 35-year-old Queens man was arraigned Tuesday on more than 3,000 counts of child pornography after the authorities found more than 1,500 graphic photos and videos of young girls on his computer, prosecutors said.

title: Lessons From the Early Exit Polls
description: Economic Concerns Drive More Votes in New Hampshire Than in Iowa

description: Ms. Stribling, 67, is the president and a founder of Stribling & Associates, a real estate brokerage and marketing firm based in New York.

title: Final Campaigning in New Hampshire
description: The candidates made their last appearances, some only for the benefit of media organizations, in New Hampshire on primary night.

title: Israel Moves to Ban Use of the Word Nazi and Symbols of the Third Reich
description: Two weeks after ultra-Orthodox Jews in Jerusalem wore yellow stars and striped prison uniforms, invoking Nazi Germany to protest what they called their persecution by secular Israelis, Israels Parliament moved closer to approving a bill that would ban the display of Third Reich symbols and even make it a crime to call someone a Nazi.

title: Corkbuzz Wine Studio
description: 13 East 13th Street (Fifth Avenue); (646) 873-6071; corkbuzz.com

title: Before Handing Romney a Victory, Many Voters Spent Weeks Wavering
description: MANCHESTER, N.H.  Some cast votes grudgingly, others with utmost confidence in their choice, and many in New Hampshires famously late-breaking electorate voted in the Republican primary on Tuesday after making up their minds at the last minute. Their decisions were based on economic concerns and, in many cases, pragmatism, with the aim of defeating President Obama in November.

title: On the Scene: Tuesday, Jan. 10
description: Voters went to the polls and campaigned for their candidates in New Hampshire.

title: Carlyle Reveals Executive Pay and Sets I.P.O. on Nasdaq
description: In its latest amended prospectus, the Carlyle Group is shedding more light on its operations  with its executives compensation among the juiciest new revelations.

title: Onegin
description: 391 Avenue of the Americas (Waverly Place); (212) 924-8001; oneginnyc.com

title: Curried Tofu
description: Mark Bittman braises tofu in a curry sauce.

title: At Long Last, the 1990 Reds Make the Hall of Fame
description: The 1990 Cincinnati Reds have another victory, their first since Todd Benzinger caught Carney Lansfords foul pop to win the World Series. With Barry Larkins election to the Hall of Fame on Monday, the Reds became the last championship team from the pre-wild-card era to be represented in Cooperstown.

title: City and State Move to Shut Down Brooklyn Charter Network
Cuomo Urges Districts and Unions to Compromise on Evaluations
Dividend Payouts Pick Up
description: Total dividends paid by companies in the S.& P. 500-stock index last year.

title: Oklahoma: Court Upholds Blocking of Amendment Against Shariah Law
description: A federal appeals court on Tuesday blocked implementation of an amendment adopted by Oklahoma in November 2010 that would bar state courts from considering Shariah, or Islamic, law in any proceedings. Soon after voters approved the amendment, the American Civil Liberties Union and the Council on American-Islamic Relations sued and a district court issued a preliminary injunction, saying that the amendment most likely violates the First Amendment. On Tuesday, the 10th Circuit of the United States Court of Appeals upheld the injunction, saying the state had not demonstrated any compelling reason for discrimination against one religion.

title: Patriots Try to Dismiss Postseason Blemishes
description: FOXBOROUGH, Mass.  They do not talk about it. They might think about it, but they will not admit to it. They try to ignore it, forced to address it only when queried.

title: Names of the Dead
description: The Department of Defense has identified 1,854 American service members who have died as a part of the Afghan war and related operations. It confirmed the death of the following American this week:

title: Romney Wins New Hampshire Primary
description: MANCHESTER, N.H.  Mitt Romney has won the New Hampshire Republican primary, achieving a sweep of the first two critical contests in the 2012 presidential race and boosting his chances at becoming his partys nominee this fall.

title: Scotland Plans Independence Vote
description: The Scottish government said Tuesday that it would hold a referendum on independence from Britain in 2014, a decision that Alex Salmond, below, who leads the government in Edinburgh, said would be Scotlands most important decision for 300 years. But the path to the referendum promises to be tortuous. Prime Minister David Camerons government in London told Parliament that it had the sole constitutional right to approve a referendum, but that he was prepared to devolve the power to the Scottish authorities on terms that would make the referendum result legal, decisive and fair. Mr. Salmond said he would hold a referendum on his terms. The Cameron government has said it wants an earlier date for the vote, to end uncertainty that it says is deterring investment in Scotland. The British government also said the question should be a straightforward yes or no on independence, without the third option Mr. Salmond wants on the ballot, which would give Scotland full autonomy as part of Britain.

title: Britain: Plan Set for Fast Trains
description: The government approved on Tuesday a controversial $51 billion high-speed rail line linking London to Birmingham, Manchester and Leeds with trains capable of running at 250 miles an hour. Transport Minister Justine Greening said the move would shift millions of passengers from commuter airlines and cars to trains. The project would be a major step toward matching Britains outdated rail network with those in France, Germany and Japan, leaders in high-speed rail travel. But it faces strong opposition from environmental groups, who say the trains would benefit mainly wealthy commuters and scar stretches of the countryside.

title: Seagate Adapter Hits Hard Drives With a Thunderbolt
description: LAS VEGAS  Seagate on Tuesday introduced an accessory that will give some hard drives a major performance boost.

title: Selig Is Likely to Stay in Office at Least 2 Years
description: Sitting at his desk last April, overlooking Lake Michigan 30 floors above downtown Milwaukee, Bud Selig seemed at peace. He had a few initiatives left to accomplish as baseballs commissioner, but he said that as far as he was concerned, he would retire after the 2012 season.

title: Restore Our Future Makes New Ad Buy
description: A group backing Mitt Romney has purchased $3.6 million in additional advertising in Florida, a person with knowledge of the decision said Tuesday, the building blocks of a television firewall intended to guarantee that no other Republican makes it past the states critical primary at the end of the month.

title: Italy: Government Official Quits
description: An under secretary to Prime Minister Mario Monti, Carlo Malinconico, resigned Tuesday after the Italian news media reported that he had vacationed at a five-star Tuscan hotel in 2007 and 2008 as the guest of two businessmen later implicated in a corruption investigation. In a statement issued by the prime ministers office, Mr. Malinconico denied any wrongdoing and said he was resigning to better defend himself and to protect the credibility of the government. When Mr. Monti took office eight weeks ago, he said his cabinet ministers would act with transparency and be free of conflicts of interest. Mr. Malinconico was a high-ranking member of the staff of Romano Prodi, who was prime minister at the time referenced in the allegations.

title: Too Many Notable People to Name Street for Just One
description: Although he had been blind since age 5 and reliant on a guide dog, Matthew P. Sapolin was the citys first commissioner of the Mayors Office for People With Disabilities, pressing to make the citys buildings, taxis and sidewalks more accommodating to people who use wheelchairs or cannot see. He was an accomplished wrestler and musician as well.

title: Egypt: Mubaraks Trial Extended
description: Judges in the trial of former President Hosni Mubarak on Tuesday scheduled a full month for his defense team to make its case, pushing any potential verdict past the day of demonstrations expected on Jan. 25, the anniversary of the uprising that ended his rule. A recent acceleration in the pace of the trial fueled speculation that Egyptian authorities had hoped for a verdict before Jan. 25 that might help mollify anger at the current military-led government. Mr. Mubarak is on trial on charges of corruption and directing the killing of protesters.

title: The Republican Nomination: Going the Distance
description: Mitt Romney has pulled ahead of Newt Gingrich in the Florida polls and is the favorite in many of the February contests, but Mr. Gingrich has vowed to continue on until the Republican convention in August.

title: TVs That Keep Up With Evolution
description: LAS VEGAS  The idea of a smart television is a few years old, but it is evolving so rapidly that Samsung Electronics is worried that consumers may be reluctant to buy a television for fear of missing out on the next big thing.

title: One First Amendment
description: The Constitution generally prohibits the government from suppressing words and images unless they are obscene. But the Supreme Court upheld a narrow exception to this free speech tenet in 1978, letting the Federal Communications Commission ban indecent but not obscene material from radio and television because it said broadcast media were pervasive and accessible to children.

title: Romney Wins G.O.P. Primary in New Hampshire
description: MANCHESTER, N.H.  Mitt Romney swept to victory in the New Hampshire primary on Tuesday, turning back a ferocious assault from rivals who sought to disqualify him in the eyes of conservatives, in a contest that failed to anoint a strong opponent to slow his march to the Republican nomination.

title: Tebow Stretches Field and Maybe His Limits
description: ENGLEWOOD, Colo.  Brady Quinn took one look at how the Pittsburgh Steelers defense lined up against the Denver Broncos last Sunday  line of scrimmage as crowded as a subway car, back end so open a train could have barreled through without hitting anybody  and had a thought.

title: High Court Reverses Conviction in Killings
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court on Tuesday reversed the conviction of a New Orleans man, saying prosecutors there had withheld important evidence that his lawyers could have used in his defense.

title: Shumpert Is Thrilling the Crowd, and the Knicks
description: GREENBURGH, N.Y.

title: James F. Crow, Population Genetics Pioneer, Dies at 95
description: James F. Crow, a leader in the field of population genetics who helped shape public policy toward atomic radiation damage and the use of DNA in the courtroom, died last Wednesday at his home in Madison, Wis. He was 95.

title: As Romney Advances, Private Equity Becomes Part of the Debate
description: The titans of private equity have long feared this moment. As Mitt Romney has established himself as the front-runner for the Republican nomination, not only has his record at Bain Capital come under intense scrutiny and withering attacks  but so has the private equity industry.

title: F.D.A. Creeps Forward
description: Last week, the Food and Drug Administration took a small step toward reducing the routine use of antibiotics in livestock, a practice that creates drug-resistant pathogens and threatens the effectiveness of some antibiotics in human medicine. It restricted the use of a class of antibiotics called cephalosporins. Because they require a prescription, farm veterinarians use them less than other antibiotics, like penicillin.

title: A Seismic Shift for the Subway: Closing Lines for Night Repairs
description: It is a fundamental birthright of New Yorkers that their subway never stops for a breather. The city stays up all night, and so its trains must follow suit.

title: Mets Sign Batista
description: Miguel Batista pitched the final game of the 2011 season for the Mets, beating Cincinnati, 3-0, at age 40 to become the oldest pitcher in franchise history to throw a shutout. Now Batista will try to see what he can do for the Mets at 41. Batista has signed with them for the 2012 season; his role has yet to be determined.

title: Romney Focuses on Obama During Victory Speech
description: MANCHESTER, N.H.  Mitt Romney declared on Tuesday night that his campaign had made history in New Hampshire and vowed to continue on to South Carolina as he pursues his partys nomination to take on President Obama in the fall.

title: Troubled Online Charter Schools
description: Charter schools, which receive public money but are subject to fewer state regulations, are operating in 40 states. A growing body of research shows that charter schools generally perform no better than traditional schools and are often worse as measured by student test data. This is particularly true of online charter schools, which educate more than 200,000 full-time students and are spreading quickly across the country.

title: How Romney Won
description: MANCHESTER, N.H.  A prevailing sense among New Hampshire primary voters that Mitt Romney is the candidate most likely to defeat Barack Obama helped lift him to victory on Tuesday.

title: An Arrest for a Crime That, It Turned Out, Never Happened
description: Just before he was loaded into the police car, Aaron Vansintjan said, one of the officers looked at him.

title: Give Guantnamo Back to Cuba
description: Cambridge, Mass.

title: Mitt Romney | New Hampshire Primary
description: The candidate's victory speech focuses on criticism of President Obama. (Courtesy of MSNBC)

title: Were Eating Less Meat. Why?
description: Americans eat more meat than any other population in the world; about one-sixth of the total, though were less than one-twentieth of the population.

title: Outsiders Feed Unrest in Syria, Assad Says
description: President Bashar al-Assad of Syria on Tuesday said the 10-month uprising in his country was the work of what he called outsiders, terrorists, the international news media and the Arab League, stressing that he would use an an iron hand against his foreign enemies.

title: G.M. Looks to Luxury Cars for Higher Profit
description: DETROIT  After a humbling bankruptcy and $50 billion government bailout in 2009, General Motors has rebounded with steady profits and a fresh lineup of competitive vehicles.

title: Dividends Rise in Sign of Recovery
description: Every year since 1976, McDonalds has increased its annual payout to shareholders. This year it will keep the streak alive, raising its annual dividend to $2.80. In doing so, it will join a broad range of companies that weathered a challenging economy and are now delivering their best payments to shareholders since the financial crisis.

title: Egypts Balance of Power
description: The Timess Thomas L. Friedman returns to Cairo and speaks with Zyad Elelaimy, a secular revolutionary who has recently been elected to the Egyptian Parliament.

title: Advisers Work to Put Positive Spin on Romneys Career in Corporate Buyouts
description: MANCHESTER, N.H.  Campaign advisers to former Gov. Mitt Romney of Massachusetts, stung by unexpectedly fierce attacks from Republican rivals on his career as a corporate buyout specialist, are scrambling to avoid a prolonged and nasty battle over his business record before it does lasting damage to the front-runner.

title: 3 Killed as Drone Strikes Resume in Pakistan
description: WASHINGTON  The United States on Tuesday carried out its first drone strike in Pakistans restive tribal areas in nearly two months, ending a pause that was intended to avoid worsening relations between the countries after an American airstrike in November killed two dozen Pakistani troops.

title: MetLife to Close Mortgage Unit
description: MetLife, the nations largest life insurer, announced Tuesday that it would close its home mortgage-origination operation, costing the company at least $90 million. Most of the 4,300 employees at the unit will lose their jobs.

title: Lottery Numbers
Political Islam Without Oil
description: Cairo

title: Profiles of the Supporters in New Hampshire
description: Breaking down key support for Mitt Romney, Representative Ron Paul and Jon M. Huntsman Jr., based on exit poll data.

title: Honda Returns to Super Bowl, Focused on Young Aspirations
description: AMERICAN HONDA MOTOR is leaping back into the Super Bowl with a commercial for its redesigned CR-V compact crossover, part of an extensive campaign that began this month and is centered on the leap lists of ambitious life goals compiled by twenty- and thirtysomethings.

title: Santorum: On to South Carolina
description: MANCHESTER, N.H.  After his disappointing showing Tuesday in the New Hampshire primary, Rick Santorum is banking on South Carolina to regain the momentum he had a week ago, when he nearly won the Iowa caucuses.

title: New Jersey Tries to Lure Fresh Direct From Queens
description: New Jersey is aggressively trying to lure Fresh Direct, the online grocer based in Queens that employs 1,800 people, across the Hudson River to Jersey City with a $100 million package of tax breaks, land and other subsidies.

title: With Stake in Stability, Businesses in Mexico Help City Shaken by Violence
description: MONTERREY, Mexico  The fine-featured young man gazing off into the distance on billboards perched above the avenues of this desert city is not dreaming of a luxury car or a beach vacation. To the contrary, he wants to join the police force.

title: Developers Sense the Time Is Right to Play Off the Aura of West Chelsea
description: Frank Gehrys IAC building was a shot of glamour for West Chelsea when it was built in 2007, an almost ethereal assemblage of white, sail-like forms at 18th Street and the West Side Highway. At 130,000 square feet, it is one of the largest commercial buildings in the neighborhood.

title: In South Carolina, Challenges Await on Ideology and Faith
description: MANCHESTER, N.H.  Mitt Romney has now defied a generation of political gravity, doing what no non-incumbent Republican has done since the Iowa caucuses became a key part of the campaign in the 1970s, winning the one-two states of Iowa and New Hampshire in his quest for the partys presidential nomination.

title: Big Banks Face Inquiry Over Home Insurance
description: A New York State financial services agency is investigating several large banks to see whether they fraudulently steered homeowners into overpriced insurance policies.

title: Research Bought, Then Paid For
description: Berkeley, Calif.

title: Now Able to Exhale, Libyan Rappers Find a Voice
description: TRIPOLI, Libya  A small crowd of boys huddled around the open door of a concrete shed turned recording studio to gawk at a trio of Libyan rappers in black baseball caps and oversize hoodies mixing tracks on a wide computer screen.

title: Unexpected Benefits From a Super Bowl Bid
description: INDIANAPOLIS  The Colts uncharacteristically wretched season  the perennial N.F.L. playoff contenders finished 2-14  has dimmed some of the luster of the first Super Bowl to be played here, on Feb. 5. But residents can take some consolation from a mini-building boom in anticipation of the big game, with its 150,000 expected visitors and worldwide television audience.

title: Playing Games Without Sore Thumbs
description: LAS VEGAS  The electronics casemaker Speck has rolled out an iPhone cover that is supposedly kind to the thumbs.

title: With Enough Bandwidth, Many Join the Band
description: When Dr. John McClure, a pathologist in Edina, Minn., was pondering his wish list several years ago, he added something a little out of the ordinary: learn to play the bagpipes. But his goal seemed like a long shot after a friend who had been teaching him moved away.

title: Virtual Lessons
description: Jori Chisholm teaches bagpipe lessons to John McClure online via Skype.

title: Court Ruling Goes Against W.P.S., Imperiling League
description: 1:37 p.m. | Updated  In an email response to a request for comment, Dan Borislow said on Wednesday: Being patient, right and investing time into something will ultimately pay off. Just like not telling the truth, incompetence, stealing and immorality all have their consequences, too.

title: Tebowing Gets Even Cooler
description: Forget the Jagr salute, Tebowing is all the rage on the ice, especially after Tim Tebow led the Broncos to a 29-23 overtime victory against the Steelers on Sunday. Kings defenseman Jack Johnson scored in the second period against the Capitals late Monday night and promptly got down on one knee in celebration. (Colton Orr did the same during Leafs Nation Fan Night on Dec. 20.)

title: Heisman Winner Griffin Will Enter the Draft
description: Quarterback Robert Griffin III, who won the Heisman Trophy on the way to leading Baylor to its first top-25 final ranking since 1986, will enter the N.F.L. draft, according to a university football staff member.

title: Well-Dressed Bank Robber Is Arrested, Authorities Say
description: The F.B.I. called him the Dapper Bandit because he dressed nicely for bank robberies, often wearing a suit or a sport coat. And on Tuesday, after eluding the authorities for more than three months, a suspect, identified as Dana M. Connor, was arrested in a relatives closet in Brooklyn, hiding under a pile of clothes, officials said.

title: Ron Paul | New Hampshire Primary
description: Ron Paul spoke to supporters following results in N.H.

title: Bronx Surrogate Judge, Facing Discipline, Defends Himself
description: The complicated arrangement of letters and numbers in the myriad rules and protocols governing his courts procedure rolled off Judge Lee L. Holzmans tongue as easily as the alphabet as he testified on Tuesday.

title: The Republican Contest
description: Where the Iowa caucuses illuminated the dark essence of social conservatism, the New Hampshire primary was a journey into the dingy, cramped quarters of the right wings economic policies.

title: A Survivor of Haitis Quake, and Now of Leukemia, Too
description: In a faint voice, Danielo Morpeau, who is still learning English and speaks with a slight Haitian accent, read two of the first words he learned while living in New York: melatonin, to aid sleep, and Celexa, to treat depression.

title: Hope and Change, but Not on Campus
Russian Official Suggests Weapon Caused Exploration Spacecrafts Failure
description: MOSCOW  A Russian scientific spacecraft whizzing out of control around the Earth, and expected to re-enter the atmosphere on Saturday, may have failed because it was struck by some type of antisatellite weapon, the director of Russias space agency said in an interview published Tuesday.

title: Back From War, Fear and Danger Fill Drivers Seat
description: PALO ALTO, Calif.  Before going to war, Susan Max loved tooling around Northern California in her maroon Mustang. A combat tour in Iraq changed all that.

title: Wednesday: Cookies Baked by Satan
description: Administrivial Tournament Alert! Want to have the time of your life, meet your favorite constructors, schmooze with like-minded puzzle heads, and watch a battle for supremacy among the puzzle-solving elite? Its not too late to register for the American Crossword Puzzle Tournament, held at the Brooklyn Bridge Marriott on March 16-18. See you there!

title: Helping Where Help Is Wanted
description: On Friday I wrote about ReServe, a program that connects retired professionals to part-time jobs in nonprofit organizations or city agencies. Many ReServists, who earn $10 an hour, are working in city schools, including as college counselors in high schools in low-income neighborhoods.

title: A Subject Guide Books Definitely Dont Cover
description: How do you say herpes in Mandarin?

title: The Puzzle Master Throws Down on ILLIN
description: SPECIAL POST  In another time, this would have been a private, hand-written exchange between two people. In the age of the internet, however, an e-mail exchange between a reader and crossword editor Will Shortz somehow found its way to the gossip news site Gawker and launched a debate about the entry ILLIN from last Saturdays puzzle by Joe Krozel.

title: Jon Hunstman | New Hampshire Primary
description: After his third place finish, the former governor reaffirms he'll bring troops home from Afghanistan if elected.  (Courtesy of MSNBC)

title: Ron Paul Finishes Second in New Hampshire
description: MANCHESTER, N.H.  Representative Ron Paul of Texas finished a strong second in the states Republican primary on Tuesday, which in many ways was the more telling outcome in a race where Mitt Romneys dominance was never in doubt.

The overhaul began Tuesday night and claimed three coaches, including Brian Schottenheimer, who resigned as the offensive coordinator, a move surprising only in its timing.

title: Denise Darcel, Sultry French Actress, Dies at 87

title: Iran Reports Killing of Nuclear Scientist in Terrorist Blast
description: LONDON  A bomber on a motorcycle killed a scientist from Irans Natanz uranium enrichment site and his bodyguard-driver on Wednesday during the morning commute in Tehran, Iranian media reported, in an assassination that could further elevate international tensions over the Iranian nuclear program and stoke the countrys growing anti-Western belligerence.

title: Jan. 11, 1935 | Amelia Earhart Sets Off on Hawaii-to-U.S. Mainland Flight
description: On Jan. 11, 1935, the aviator Amelia Earhart began a trip to Oakland, Calif., from Honolulu that she would complete the next day, becoming the first person to fly to the United States mainland from Hawaii.

title: The Kremlins Stooges
description: MOSCOW  A documentary video has just gone viral in Russia. A man and a woman  he a political activist, she a radio reporter  videotaped themselves entering an auditorium they say is located in Moscows State University of Transportation. It is a weekend day during winter break, and the room is full. About 50 young people  presumably students at the university, though this is never made clear  are seated at desks, with stacks of papers in front of them. Hundreds of completed forms sit on a long desk at the front of the auditorium. During the nearly seven minutes that the recording lasts, the man and woman keep asking: What are you doing? They never get an answer and in the end are forcibly removed from the premises.

title: Test Yourself | Math, Jan. 11, 2012

title: Economic Troubles Cited As the Top Risks in 2012
description: Severe income disparity and chronic fiscal imbalances are the top two risks facing business leaders and policy makers this year and over the next decade, the World Economic Forum said in a report Wednesday.

title: Photographing an Invisible Subject
description: Christopher Manson is a British photographer based in Toronto and a recent graduate of Ryerson University. Mr. Manson, 32, has spent the last year working on a project about teenagers with Type 1 diabetes.

title: What Does Wall Street Do for You?
description: Hating Wall Street is an American tradition that dates back even to the days when Thomas Jefferson cursed that money lover Alexander Hamilton. And for centuries, the complaints about it have largely stayed the same: It does nothing! It creates chaos! Its a parasite that sucks hardworking Americans dry! (Or something to that effect.) But these are distortions of a fundamentally beneficial business. The countrys largest investment banks, commercial banks and a few big insurance companies (what we generally refer to as Wall Street) play the crucial role of intermediation  matching borrowers with lenders. Most of the time, the industry does this extremely well (though in the case of matching homeowners debt to the global financial system, too enthusiastically). Perhaps the best way to really appreciate what Wall Street does is to imagine life without it.

title: Tottenham Works Its Way Back to the Top
description: Rob Hughes writes Tuesday about Tottenhams quiet rise to third place in the Premier League in a season that began with the riots near its home stadium. The disturbances forced the postponement of Tottenhams opener against Everton, and its Premier League schedule began instead with consecutive losses to Manchester United and Manchester City.

title: Ricky Gervais Would Like to Nonapologize
description: In a onetime mess hall on a decommissioned Royal Air Force base outside London, Ricky Gervais was directing the 4-foot-6 star of a low-budget re-enactment of The Passion of the Christ on how to play the Crucifixion for more laughs.

title: North Korea Open to Talks on Nuclear Program
description: SEOUL, South Korea  North Korea indicated on Wednesday that it was open to further negotiations with the United States, which it said demanded a halt of its uranium-enrichment program in return for food aid before the death of Kim Jong-il last month.

title: What Game Would You Like to Redesign?

If you were given the chance to redesign a game of any kind, as the hundreds of thousands of passionate D&D fans soon will be, what changes or updates would you recommend? Why?

title: In London, a Pop-Up Thats Not a Pop-Up
description: NoBrow, a Shoreditch-based bookshop and indie publishing company that has two imprints, is known for its graphic novels and other projects created in collaboration with illustrators all over the world. Their output ranges from hardcover books to wrapping paper to handmade books, produced with particular attention to color, printing and paper quality. The result is items that are as much works of art as recreational distractions.

Thanks to the AutoPlay settings box, you can customize the programs Windows uses to handle CDs, DVDs and other types of media on the computer.

title: A Game of Turkey
description: ISTANBUL  The Turkish military has long regarded it as part of its job description to guard against the governments it serves. There have been three coups in Turkey since the end of World War II. And though the last one occurred more than 30 years ago, the armed forces have not surrendered their prerogative to call politicians to heel.

description: A glance at my e-mail in box reveals no shortage of corporate-sponsored programs intended to help small-business owners. But do they work? And if so, how do the owners measure success?
