description: Michael Mussa died yesterday. I didnt know him well, but like everyone in international economics, I was greatly informed by his work.

title: A Case of Good Timing, Perhaps, in Romneys Tax Disclosure
description: The pile-on began just moments after Mitt Romney  a man easily worth more than $200 million  admitted Tuesday morning that he pays federal taxes at a rate of about 15 percent.

title: The Breakfast Meeting: Wikipedia Turns Off the Lights
description: Wednesday is a day of Web-wide protest over proposed antipiracy laws. Some sites, like Google and Craigslist are donning black and encouraging visitors to contact their local members of Congress (both are still operating, however). Others, most notably the English-language Wikipedia portal, have closed for the day, while also asking visitors to lobby Congress.

title: Street Wise | Tel Avivs Hot New Block
description: Nahalat Binyamin Street, which crosses lower Rothschild Boulevard  Tel Avivs chief axis of white Bauhaus beauties  is emerging as the microhood of the moment. By day this thin strip is all garment-district shuffle and cheeky graffiti art, but at night the street takes on a moody but electric air. You might find Bar Refaeli, or at least plenty of women who look like models, at the streets hottest spot, Mizlala (No. 57). Here the citys star chef, Meir Adoni, whips up dishes like fish kebabs, garlic-sage linguine with white asparagus and something called Palestinian tartar  ground beef, raw tahini paste, pine nuts, charred eggplant puree, cumin and parsley.

title: Cuomo Puts Money Where His Mouth Is
In Williamsburg, a Charter School Divides North From South
Court Sanctions Man Who Claims to Own Facebook Stake
description: Paul Ceglia, the man who claims to own half of Facebook, has been held in contempt of court and fined at least $5,000  all for refusing to share.

title: Wednesday Reading: Obesity Rates Stall, but Dont Decline
description: A variety of consumer-focused articles appears daily in The New York Times and online in our blogs. Each weekday morning, we gather them together here so you can quickly scan the news that could hit you in your wallet.

title: How to Diagnose Whats Wrong With Your Business
description: Over the years, I have met a lot of entrepreneurs who have been frustrated by low profits, lack of growth, or the stress of the never-ending demands. Many struggle with all three. While every business is different, there are common denominators. In fact, I believe there are 10. The tricky part is that failing to have a handle on just one of these areas can result in mediocre performance, a stressful existence, or ultimate and intimate failure. That is one reason the failure rate for small businesses is so high (here are some others).

title: Christie Takes Mild Swipe at Cuomo on Tax Plan
description: Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey struck a remarkably friendly tone in his State of the State speech on Tuesday, but that didnt stop him from taking a swipe across the Hudson River at Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo (though he did call him my friend Andrew Cuomo).

title: Protests Against Antipiracy Bills Take to the Streets
description: 1:26 p.m. | Updated  Adding details from the rally.

title: Russian Says Western Support for Arab Revolts Could Cause a Big War
description: MOSCOW  Russias foreign minister, Sergey V. Lavrov, warned Wednesday that outside encouragement of antigovernment uprisings in the Middle East and North Africa could lead to a very big war that will cause suffering not only to countries in the region, but also to states far beyond its boundaries.

title: What Were Reading
description: Wine Review Online: How does the alcohol content of a wine affect the body? Michael Apstein examines the question scientifically.  Eric Asimov

title: I.M.F. Seeks $500 Billion More to Lend as It Plans to Cut Growth Forecast
description: WASHINGTON  The International Monetary Fund announced Wednesday that it was seeking as much as $500 billion more to lend as it prepared to slash its forecasts of global growth.

title: Turning Off the Dark in Myanmar?
description: PARIS  It has been almost giddy, almost gooey, even meteoric, the recent Western embrace of the regime in Myanmar.

title: Death Penalty Death Watch: Ohio
description: Charles Lorraine, who was convicted of killing an elderly man and his bedridden wife in 1986, was scheduled to be executed by lethal injection today in Ohio. But the Sixth Circuit court isnt going to let that happen, which is good news for those of us who oppose capital punishment. (We also wrote on our editorial page today about the Delaware governors decision to commute a prisoners death sentence to life without parole, so there are really two bits of good news.)

title: Mutual Funds Invest in Brazilian Online Deals Company
description: SO PAULO, Brazil  Peixe Urbano, Brazils first online daily deal company, has closed a series C round of financing with mutual funds and institutional accounts managed by Morgan Stanley Investment Management and T. Rowe Price Associates. General Atlantic and Tiger Global Management, who had previously backed the company, also participated. The size of investment was not disclosed.

title: The Spirit of Youth, Circa 1970 New York
description: NOT long ago Alanna Heiss, the renowned curator and self-described art radical, brandished two guns at the Clocktower Gallery, the nonprofit art space she runs in Lower Manhattan. Theyre props, she said with a grin, adding, but theyre also for critics.

title: On Our Radar: Ailing Rice Coral in Hawaii
description: Scientists have discovered an outbreak of a disease in rice coral in Kaneohe Bay off Oahu, a popular spot frequented by snorkelers, bathers, divers, boaters and fishermen. [United States Geological Survey]

title: A Performer Disappears Into Her Songs
description: Two tough sentries guarded Santigold at all times on Monday night.

title: For Your Consideration, Ads We Wish They Ran
description: The For Your Consideration ad, paid for by studios and directed at Academy voters, started appearing in Hollywood trade publications sometime in the 1950s and are often quite elaborate, even for movies that dont have a shot at winning an Oscar. (Michael Jordan, best actor in Space Jam, anyone?) As with everything Oscars related, they have their own artistry and market-tested logic. But though they are designed to promote an actors performance or a films good reception, they are not always entirely accurate. We know, youre shocked, shocked!

title: How Im Surviving (or Trying to) Without Wikipedia at My Fingertips
description: My Internet is broken today. Hitting that all known thought button on my toolbar gives me a quick, maddening glimpse of Wikipedia that is then overtaken by a black screen that asks me to Imagine a world without free knowledge. I just did and I didnt like it, now can I have my Wikipedia back?

title: Stone Links
description: A gathering of recent philosophy-related links.

title: Surfing for a Vacation Rental
description: WITH hotel rates on the rise, vacation rentals are looking attractive, often providing more space and amenities for less than you would spend on a hotel. But finding that apartment in Paris or seaside cottage in Florida can be a daunting task.

title: Of Parrots, Paras and Time
Are Inequality and Immobility Inseparable?
description: Ive written a number of posts and piecespushing the idea that American conservatives need what Ive called an opportunity agenda  one that focuses more on the problems of upward mobility and stagnating wages than does the current standard Republican line, but doesnt share contemporary liberalisms tendency to blame the struggles of downscale Americans almost entirely on the richest 1 percent. I thought Id use this post to respond to the most plausible left-wing critique of this idea. (Ill tackle the most plausible right-wing critique in a later post.) First, heres Matt Yglesias, pivoting off an excellent piece by my colleague Jason DeParle to question the idea that theres any real distinction between fighting inequality and fighting immobility:

title: Milan Top 5 | Gucci
description: The rich jacquard roses sprouting throughout Frida Gianninis fall collection, an ode to the tortured prose of Wilde and Rimbaud, added a refreshingly romantic note to the usually sexy Gucci guy. A drop-shouldered, double-faced coat slouched over a low-cut sweater and scarf atop those slim floral pants, in a style Giannini describes as Visconti grunge, stood out most and was hardly a look for the tormented wallflower type who inspired it.

title: Leading Off: Whats Next in Indy?
description: Even with the surprise value of the Colts firing Coach Jim Caldwell on Tuesday ranking near zero  when you lose your quarterback to injury but the rest of the team plays like it should be hospitalized, it does not look good on a coachingrsum it did immediately bring a much larger issue to the top of the pile. With the Colts seemingly intent on ridding all vestiges of the Peyton Manning era, what does this mean for Peyton Manning?

title: Analyst Who Is Able to Back Up Opinions
description: KAPALUA, Hawaii  During a telecast on the eve of golfs season-opening event, Nick Faldo waded into shallow waters by predicting a fabulous run in the majors for a fellow Englishman, Luke Donald, the No. 1 player in the world and the reigning money champion on the PGA and European Tours.

title: New Museums Record-Breaking Hller Exhibition Prepares to Close
description: A group of intrepid museum-goers as large as the population of Myrtle Beach, S.C.  slightly more than 30,000  have screwed up their courage and plummeted down the two-story tubular slide at the New Museums Carsten Hller exhibition, which closes Sunday after an almost-three-month run, the museum announced.

title: Another Mothers Son Lost
description: I knew her name from the newspaper articles, but I did not know if I should speak to her. What would I say to the woman whose son had fallen dead at my sons feet?

title: Baby Brothers
description: Little brothers crop up all the time, but picture books about pesky little brothers in the shape of anthropomorphized animals who happen to be named Peter? Not so much. This month brings two of them: Another Brother, written and illustrated by Matthew Cordell (Trouble Gum), and Peter Is Just a Baby, written and illustrated by Marisabina Russo. Both titles could easily have rolled right out of a resentful older siblings mouth.

title: Fish Is Ousted at Australian Open
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  No. 8 Mardy Fish, the top-ranked American, became the first top 10 player to fall in the mens draw when he lost in the second round to the 71st-ranked Alejandro Falla of Colombia, 7-6 (4), 6-3, 7-6 (6), in three hours Wednesday.

title: Japanese Reactors Could Operate Beyond 40-Year Cap
description: Japan could allow nuclear reactors to operate for up to 60 years if they pass safety checks, the government said Wednesday, already revealing a loophole in recently announced plans to cap their lifespans at 40 years. Chief Cabinet Secretary Osamu Fujimura told reporters on Wednesday that the 40-year cap on reactors, announced earlier this month, will still apply in principle  but operators will likely be allowed a single 20-year extension for each reactor, providing they meet strict safety standards.

title: Isner Outlasts Nalbandian in Disputed 5-Set Victory
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  In a stunning point-blank shootout at net, John Isner of the United States slammed a forehand volley past a lunging David Nalbandian of Argentina to claim a grueling victory, 4-6, 6-3, 2-6, 7-6 (5), 10-8.

title: In Pradas Spring-Summer 2012 Collection, Shoes With Tailfins
description: Decades ago, Converse advertised its Chuck Taylor sneakers as limousines for the feet. Nike designed its Air Jordan 14 basketball shoes after Michael Jordans favorite Ferrari years before Ferrari produced shoes with Puma.

title: In Fight Over Piracy Bills, New Economy Rises Against Old
description: WASHINGTON  When the powerful world of old media mobilized to win passage of an online antipiracy bill, it marshaled the reliable giants of K Street  the United States Chamber of Commerce, the Recording Industry Association of America and, of course, the motion picture lobby, with its new chairman, former Senator Christopher J. Dodd, the Connecticut Democrat and an insiders insider.

title: Photo Replay: Jan. 18
description: A view of the day in sports, from snowboarding in the Alps to cycling Down Under.

title: The Cavs Arent Terrible. How Come?
description: On this day one year ago, the Cleveland Cavaliers held an astoundingly awful 8-32 record, and were right in the thick of what would become a 26-game losing streak. LeBron James had sneaked out in the night (as much as one can sneak out on national television), Anderson Varejao had been ruled out for the season with an ankle injury, and Mo Williams  the Cavs top remaining player  had been injured just days earlier.

title: Runway in Review
description: Diesel Black GoldDesigner: Roberto LorenziDate and Location: Tuesday, Jan. 17, Via Savona, 56Photos: slide show

title: Moncler: Fall 2012 Menswear
description: Milan

title: Rivals and Supporters Urge Romney to Release Tax Data
description: Mitt Romneys rivals and supporters urged him on Wednesday to release his tax returns, a day after he acknowledged that he pays an effective federal tax rate of roughly 15 percent rate.

title: Kenneth Branagh, Star-Struck
description: The Bagger doesnt like to play favorites  at least not yet. That comes later, when were trying to win our Oscar pool. But every awards season there are a few people who seem to rise above the hype machine and have engaging conversations that keep everything in perspective. (Shouts to our girl Michelle Williams.) This year the Bagger has found a new gimlet conversationalist in Kenneth Branagh, Ms. Williamss co-star in My Week With Marilyn.

title: For Callan, Life After Lehman Includes a New Husband
description: Erin Callan, the former chief financial officer of Lehman Brothers, all but disappeared from Wall Street after the collapse of the firm.

title: Those Incredible Shrinking Savings Account Rates
description: As far as savings accounts go, 2012 appears to be a continuation of last years Incredible Shrinking Rates.

title: Brutal, With a Touch of Magic
description: BERLIN

title: Regime in North Korea is Tottering, Says Kims Eldest Son
description: The eldest of the late Kim Jong-ils three sons believes the despotic North Korean regime is vulnerable to collapse, according to a new book by a Tokyo-based journalist. Kim Jong-nam, who lives primarily in the gambling enclave of Macao, also says the late leaders youngest son, and North Koreas new leader, Kim Jong-un, is simply a figurehead. Their father died Dec. 17 at the age of 69. Read the full story from The Associated Press

title: A Zoo Roams Large on Milan Runways
description: MILAN

title: Taking to the Streets of Cairo, Wielding Video Projectors
description: Updated | Thursday | 11:49 a.m. As Egyptian protesters and the ruling military council brace for confrontation next week, on the first anniversary of the revolution that forced former President Hosni Mubarak from office, activists have deployed a new weapon in their battle for public opinion: portable video projectors.

title: Five Dishes at Romera New York
description: Miguel Snchez Romera, the Barcelona chef who has set his sights on Manhattan with his restaurant Romera New York, is a highly articulate, cerebral cook.

title: A D.J. Master Talks About Dance Music
description: Tisto may be one of the older D.J.s on the booming dance-music circuit these days, but the Dutch dance music master was one of the first musicians to prove a D.J. could compete with pop and rock acts in filling arenas. He is one of the biggest-drawing electronic acts in the world.

title: Are the Dangers of Epidurals Overstated?
description: Does the question of whether or not a woman should have an epidural during the birth of her child really need to be a polarizing one? On Slate, Melinda Wenner Moyer considers the claims of both sides of the issue  all of which were impressed upon her during her pregnancy last year.

title: Clybourne Park Coming to Broadway in April
description: A critically acclaimed production of Clybourne Park, the 2011 Pulitzer Prize winner for drama by Bruce Norris, will open on Broadway at the Walter Kerr Theater on April 12, a spokesman for the show said on Wednesday.

title: A Franchisee Decides to Take Charge
description: Last week we published a case study about William Burris, one of 10 franchisees who learned that their Australia-based franchiser, Rent Your Boxes, had gone bankrupt. Mr. Burris, who had invested more than $100,000 to purchase three territories in the Washington area, rallied by creating a new company, Rent Our Boxes, for himself and his nine fellow franchisees.

title: Milan Top 5 | Umit Benan
description: The unmistakable sound of a tattoo gun could be heard coming from backstage while we waited for the start of Umit Benans fall show. Curiosity overtaking decorum, I popped behind the curtain to see an already inked model getting another actual tattoo, with a pretty raw arm to show for it. He was one of a group of real guys taking part in a barracks tableau, jubilantly postwar, that included a naked soldier showering (eventually he got dressed for his trip down the runway), a bruiser boxing and other assorted military types. It was a fine line to walk for a presentation, but it steered clear of clich by committing wholeheartedly (and bodily) to the enactment. Though at times a bit too literal an interpretation, the clothing featured a lot of clever riffs on the theme, with the actual tattoo artists rig being the most clever. He wore a high-buttoned vest with oversize envelope pockets over a striped shirt and tie with cropped cargo pocket pants, and carried a military style jacket with leather sleeves. It was a vivid, memorable show.

title: The Book on Mitt
description: When John McCain endorsed Mitt Romney just before the New Hampshire primary, there was some tittering about all the nasty things the Senator from Arizona said about his former rival during the 2008 Republican nominating contestlike when he called Mr. Romney a phony in an ad. That was a little embarrassing, especially since the John McCain who ran for president, and lost, was also a phony hard-righter.

title: U.S. Debt? Bain Might Leverage It
description: Imagine how Mitt Romney would campaign if he actually ran as a private equity executive, dangerous though that may be in this era of the Tea Party and Occupy Wall Street.

title: Federer, Murray, and Dolgopolov: Answers to Readers Questions
description: Christopher Clarey, who covers tennis for The Times and The International Herald Tribune, answers questions from readers. Additional answers will be posted on Straight Sets throughout the Australian Open.

title: In Sweden, Twitter Is Democratic, and File Sharing Is a Religion
description: This week, Sweden is a lesbian truck driver named Hanna.

title: LL Cool J to Host Grammys
description: LL Cool J will host the Grammy Awards next month, marking the first time in seven years that the shows producers have decided to go with a single master of ceremonies, the National Academy of Recording Arts and Sciences announced on Wednesday. Since 2008, the rapper and actor has been the host for the televised nominations concert the Grammys produces in the fall. This is the first time, however, he will be asked to keep the main ceremony moving along.

title: The FOF Theory of the GOP Primary
description: Steve Benen notes that by normal standards, Mitt Romney is a terrible candidate  but just not as bad as his rivals. He adds,

title: Clijsters Seeks Meaning as She Winds Down Her Career
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  It looked so easy for Kim Clijsters at the Australian Open on Wednesday as she leaned into her strokes from inside the baseline and dispatched the overmatched Stphanie Foretz Gacon, 6-0, 6-1, in well under an hour.

title: TimesCast | January 18, 2012
description: Internet companies flex their political muscle by opposing proposed piracy legislation | Rick Santorum and Newt Gingrich vie for South Carolina's conservative voters.

title: Academy Releases Foreign-Language Shortlist
description: The Academy has released its shortlist for the foreign-language Oscar and its an interesting list, with some names expected (like the entries from Iran, Israel, Germany) and some more surprising. The Belgians declined to nominate the Dardenne brothers film The Kid With a Bike, and their choice, Bullhead, a crime drama, made the cut:

title: Can I See Your Tax Return?
description: David Brooks: Gail, Im sorry we missed each other in South Carolina, but Ive moved on to the next primary state, Florida, in search of people who pay Mitt Romneys 15 percent tax rate. Im in Palm Beach now. I think Ive found them.

title: Down on the Farm, a Sculpture Finds a Second Life
description: At Pennsylvanias Farm Show, a boy of around 10 proudly presents his prize dairy calf to onlookers. Chin held high, he accepts the golden ribbon for best of show. Today, hes the talk of the town, but tomorrow hell be converted into a pile of melted grease to be mixed in with liquid manure. Hes part of the shows famous 1,000-pound butter sculpture, and hes going to be recycled.

title: Inside Debate Prep at Fox News, a Discussion Over Race Question
description: MYRTLE BEACH, S.C. The frosty exchange over race and social welfare between Juan Williams and Newt Gingrich during Monday nights Fox News debate has become a breakout moment of the South Carolina primary. For many conservatives, it demonstrates how liberals defend a broken entitlement system. And for many liberals, it shows how minorities are often unfairly caricaturedas addicted to government aid.

title: For the Love of Ink and Paper
description: Earl Kallemeyn insists that he is not a designer. He is not a businessman. He is not an artist or an engineer. Hes just the person who puts the ink on the paper.

title: Rejecting Pipeline Proposal, Obama Blames Congress
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama on Wednesday rejected, for now, the proposed Keystone XL oil pipeline, saying the $7 billion project could not be adequately reviewed within the 60-day deadline set by Congress. While the presidents action does not preclude later approval of the project, it sets up a baldly partisan fight over energy, jobs and regulation that will most likely persist through the November election.

title: Climate in Classrooms
description: Theres much to explore about the challenges in teaching about the evolving relationship between people and their climate.

title: Coming Soon | Belted Coats
description: var data;function jsonSlideshowCallback(response){data = response;}NYTD.options = {source: data,cropType: 'blog480',appendTo: 'fullScreenSlideShow',showHeadLine: 'false', renderstyle: "embeddedSlideShowTmag"}

title: Gingrich Says His Tax Rate Was 31 Percent
description: WINNSBORO, S.C.  Ill show you mine. Now you show me yours.

title: Reactions to the Webs Protests Against Piracy Bills
description: On Wednesday morning, as people tried to gain access to 7,000 sites around the Web  including Flickr, Tumblr, Wikipedia, Google and Reddit  they were greeted with gloomy black boxes and error messages.

title: Some Comments on the Rise and Fall of Twinkies
description: The third-to-last of the nearly 40 ingredients that make up a Twinkie is listed on the package as sorbic acid (to retain freshness). Its the only ingredient that comes with an explanation of its purpose, as if its essential for us to understand that this Twinkie is as good as it was when it was made.

title: The Giants Get Ready for Some Stormy Weather
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  As the Giants began practice Wednesday for the N.F.C. championship game this weekend, they did so with a virtually full complement of players. Running back Ahmad Bradshaw was the only player not working in early drills, and linebacker Mark Herzlich  who has been out with an ankle injury  returned to the field for the first time since Nov. 28.

title: Have Soccer Questions? Jack Bell Has Answers
description: Who will win the English Premier Leagueone of the two Manchester teams or Tottenham? Has the U.S. mens national team made any progress since Jurgen Klinsmann took over as coach last July? How will the U.S. womens national team do in its Olympic qualifying games in Vancouver this month? Jack Bell, who covers soccer for The Times, will answer questions from readers. Use the comment field below for your questions. Answers will appear early next week on Goal.

title: Letterpress
description: Earl Kallemeyn has been a pressman all his life. He reflects on why the letterpress is an important tool, and its changing role today.

title: Shopping Snapshots: Jan. 19
description: Model Karlie Kloss on what shes wearing now and hip Hawaiian shirts from J. Crew and Stella McCartney.

title: Time to Face the Pain
description: Last year in Mexico, just a couple of days into my vacation, I fractured my kneecap. In the emergency room, through pain so severe I found myself yelling at all helpful parties around me, particularly my wife, the doctors noted that they did not have painkillers to send home with me. WHAT!? I screamed. No oxycodone, hydrocodone, nothing? They explained that Mexicos drug laws had grown so strict due to the actions of the narcotraficantes that pain meds were tough to come by (and only provided to patients who had been admitted to the hospital).

title: Justices Rule for Inmate After Mailroom Mix-Up
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court on Wednesday ruled that an Alabama death row inmate who missed a filing deadline thanks to a mix-up in the mailroom of a prominent New York law firm must be given another chance.

title: Adele Ties Titanic on Billboard Chart
description: At this point, Adeles run at the top of the Billboard chart is titanic. Literally: This week Adeles 21 (XL/Columbia) notches its 16th No. 1, the first time since the Titanic soundtrack in 1998 that a release has topped the list as many times. As Billboard notes, only three albums in the last 20 years have had more weeks at No. 1: Billy Ray Cyruss Some Gave All, which had 17 in 1992; Garth Brookss Ropin the Wind, with 18 in 1991 and 1992; and the soundtrack to The Bodyguard, with 20 in 1992 and 1993.)

title: New York City Opera Announces Deal With Unions
description: New York City Opera cleared a major obstacle in its effort to forge ahead in reduced form and without its Lincoln Center home, saying on Wednesday that it had reached agreements with both of its major unions. Rehearsals were to begin immediately.

title: The History Of Capital Gains Taxes
description: Heres how Romneys low taxes will be defended by smarter conservatives (the less smart ones will just shout class warfare): theyll claim that there are compelling reasons to have low taxes on capital gains, and that there is therefore nothing wrong with having very high-income people paying lower tax rates than the middle class. David Frum offers a good example.

title: Scouting Report
description: EVENTS

title: Behold the Power of Google
description: Talk about instant gratification.

title: The Pleasures and Pitfalls of Off-the-Grid Solar
description: For our year living in the woods of Maine, I wanted a place where I could see and hear wildlife. Someplace both quiet and remote.

title: Facing Elections, Sarkozy Focuses on the Jobless
description: PARIS  With the French jobless rate at a 12-year high and elections approaching, President Nicolas Sarkozy brought union and business leaders together on Wednesday for a social summit meeting to discuss legal changes to promote greater economic flexibility.

title: Veil of Silence Lifted in Indonesia
description: JAKARTA  As a solitary voice intoned a traditional Indonesian harvest song, dancers acted out the gathering of rice. Members of the audience joined in  most knew the words  until the song was overtaken by a vigorous hip-hop backbeat.

title: Winter Wonders | Dark Stars
description: There comes a time in every womans winter when nothing but a simple black coat will do. Here, the actress Rachel McAdams goes bare-legged in one with cool buckle closures; the actress Jessica Alba chooses a collarless style with shiny shoulder embellishments (an easy complement to all that color underneath); and the actress Catherine Zeta-Jones elevates a sharper duster with a cherry red clutch and heels.

title: Trial Set for Financier Accused in Decades-Long Ponzi Scheme
description: HOUSTON  A federal judge ruled on Wednesday that R. Allen Stanford, the Texas financier accused of defrauding thousands of investors in a $7 billion Ponzi scheme, will go on trial next week, nearly three years after his arrest.

title: Where Koreans Go to Reunify (Hint: Its Not the Koreas)
description: SIEM REAP, Cambodia  At a roadside restaurant here near the sprawling ancient ruins of Angkor Wat, busloads of South Korean tourists file in to witness an unexpectedly exotic spectacle: doll-faced North Korean women performing everything from saccharine ballads to a rousing number from Bizets Carmen.

title: A Matchmaker for Drivers and Parking Spaces
description: Weve all been in this situation: You drive to an important appointment in the city  or a big outing, say, at a sports arena  and waste precious time frantically looking for a parking spot that wont cost you a days wages.

title: On the Sea of Tranquillity
description: THE fashion industrys concept of a cruise season has long amused and confused me. Also known as resort, a term that might gain momentum following the deadly crash of the Costa Concordia, its a small, lightweight collection of clothes marketed at people who can afford long jaunts to the tropics when the rest of us are trudging through sludge and applying extra lashings of bronzer to our ghastly January pallor. It blithely ignores what the great wobbly mass of American humanity tends to wear while traveling  e.g., velour tracksuits and Disney mouse ears.

title: Bill T. Jones Takes a Turn on the Stage in New Work
description: Its tempting to say that Bill. T. Jones has followed the classic trajectory from artistic outsider to consummate insider. Mr. Jones, a choreographer, writer and theater director whose reputation was built on provocative work that marries high-art aesthetics with social concerns, has journeyed from the stages of downtown dance to two Tony awards for choreography and a Kennedy Center Honor. But Mr. Jones, in a recent interview, insisted that he is still a stranger in a strange land, making an audacious shuttle between avant-garde and commercial audiences.

title: Manning Leaves Practice Because of Illness
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  In what can only be thought of as stomach-churning news for the Giants, quarterback Eli Manning left practice early Wednesday because of illness.

title: Instead of a New Novel, Cormac McCarthy Delivers a Screenplay
description: An aged man is but a paltry thing/A tattered coat upon a stick, unless/Soul clap its hands and sing, Yeats wrote in Sailing to Byzantium, the poem whose first line Cormac McCarthy borrowed as the title of his 2005 novel, No Country for Old Men, which was made into the Oscar-winning movie by Joel and Ethan Coen.

title: Teachers Urged to Attend Panel Meeting
TimesCast | Tech Sector's Clout
description: January 18, 2012 - As Wikipedia and other websites go dark Wednesday, protesting proposed anti-piracy legislation, a new axis of influence emerges in Washington.

title: Peer Review Meets D.I.Y.: Publishing a Student Science Journal
description: Overview | How are scientific discoveries made, and how does science advance? In this lesson, students consider and analyze the longstanding peer review model, consider it the context of a movement to make science more open and collaborative and conduct an exercise in peer review and journal publication.

title: Tigers Lose Martinez to Knee Injury, Mull Signing a Replacement
description: The hopes of the Detroit Tigers took a big jolt when the team announced on Tuesday that the valuable designated hitter Victor Martinez sustained a torn anterior cruciate ligament and could miss the 2012 season. Martinezs injury occurred last week, during an agility workout to prepare for spring training and the upcoming season. He is in the process of seeking other opinions on his treatment options, but the outcome is expected to be the same: reconstruction surgery and many months of rehab.

title: Carlyle Readies an Unfriendly I.P.O. for Shareholders
description: It is quite possible that the Carlyle Group, the private equity firm that is preparing to go public, is proposing the most shareholder-unfriendly corporate governance structure in modern history.

title: The Mountaintop Recoups On Broadway
description: The Broadway production of The Mountaintop, Katori Halls drama about the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.s final night before his assassination, has recouped its entire capitalization of $3.1 million, the lead producers Jean Doumanian and Sonia Friedman announced on Wednesday. The play opened to mixed reviews in October, but ticket sales proved durable in part because of the drawing power of its stars, Samuel L. Jackson (as King) and Angela Bassett (as a mysterious motel maid).

title: Scene City: InStyles Golden Globes After-Party
description: Wall-to-wall celebrities at the undersea-themed party.

title: After the Globes Show, the Party Rush
description: IF it werent for the wall-to-wall celebrities, the Beverly Hilton Hotel in Los Angeles might have been mistaken for the Los Angeles airport.

title: New Episodes Lift Fox on Slow Night
description: After a monthlong holiday hiatus, Glee and New Girl returned with new episodes to give Fox a lift in the broadcast television ratings on an otherwise sluggish Tuesday night. How sluggish? According to Nielsen data, CBS was still the No. 1 network in total viewers despite a full slate of repeats on the schedule. Fox was first in the advertiser-coveted 18-to-49-year-old demographic, as New Girl was the highest-rated program of the night in that category. The show also had a total audience of 6.9 million viewers. Glee finished with more viewers (7.5 million) but was second among adults 18 to 49.

title: Museum of Contemporary Art to Create Original Programming for YouTube
description: Joining its hometown industry and betting on the success of YouTubes new initiative to promote original content, the Museum of Contemporary Art in Los Angeles announced that it would start an online video channel in July featuring news and talk-show programming, among other art-focused shows.

title: Italian Trial of American Antiquities Dealer Comes to an End
description: ROME  The trial of the American antiquities dealer Robert Hecht ended this week in Rome when a three-judge panel ruled that the statute of limitations on his alleged crimes  receiving artifacts illegally looted from Italy and conspiring to deal in them  had expired.

title: Mitts Best Friend
description: Theres some buzz today about a Gingrich surge, based on a national Rasmussen poll showing him rising after this weeks debate performances, as well as non-statistical indicators like Sarah Palins kinda-sorta endorsement and the Romney camps decision to stop ignoring the former speaker and start attacking once again. In the absence of any hard data on the South Carolina race, though, Im sticking by my assessment in this weeks Campaign Stops column, which argues that Gingrich has been an ideal rival for Romney:

title: The Get | Marni Clutch
description: This two-in-one Marni clutch has a girlish pink polka dot on one face and a bolder, more Marniesque green and black print on the flip side. Big enough to carry your BlackBerry and Kindle but not so big that you lose your lipstick in it, the versatile accessory tackles mood swings as easily as it does the whole day-to-night dressing thing. What to do? Just switcheroo!

title: On TV, Antipiracy Coverage May Include a Disclosure
description: As television networks have covered Internet companies positions against antipiracy legislation before Congress this week, they have had to consider whether to disclose the positions of their parent companies  virtually all of which have campaigned in favor of it.

title: Obama to Start Advertising as Early as Thursday
description: President Obamas campaign has begun buying advertising time in a handful of key battleground states, making his first purchase of television time so far this election.

title: Gap Narrows Between Android and iPhone
description: It looks like the holidays were very big for the iPhone.

title: Web Sites Aim to Join Protests While Keeping Their Mojo
description: The Web sites on Wednesday of, clockwise from top left, Google, Mozilla, Wired and Wikipedia.

title: New Laws Possible In Wake of MF Globals Demise
description: Lawmakers are considering new policies aimed at preventing a repeat of the MF Global debacle, in which the futures brokerage firm misused an estimated $1.2 billion in customer money as it collapsed.

title: Romney Hits Some Bumps in South Carolina
description: SPARTANBURG, S.C.  Just a week ago, Mitt Romney, flush from a big victory in the New Hampshire primary, was all high hopes and big smiles as he boarded a charter flight to South Carolina  Its a lovely state, cant wait to be there, he said, before adding that he expected South Carolina, a state where he finished fourth four years ago, to be a challenge.

title: TimesCast | S.C.s Conservative Vote
description: January 18, 2012  In South Carolina, Rick Santorum and Newt Gingirich are dueling to be the more conservative alternative to Mitt Romney.

title: Bosh and Anderson, Efficiency Experts
description: Shot creation has long been crucial to ascendancy as a premier scorer, but Michael Jordans eminence brought that particular skill to unprecedented heights. Jordan revolutionized one-on-one play with his electricity; one of his many enduring legacies is the way scorers are perceived and evaluated today.

title: Imperfect Makeup Is a Trend for 2012
description: Goodbye, lip liners, brow pencils, spackled-on foundations.

title: You Can Fall Out of Bed and Look Good
description: GOODBYE, lip liners, brow pencils, spackled-on foundations. The hottest beauty trend of 2012 is imperfection.

title: Arsenal-Manchester United Live on Fox
description: Football Sunday on the Fox network has got a bit more interesting.

title: Beauty Spots
description: BEAUTY SCHOOL START-UP Frustrated with YouTube makeup tutorials? Heres a more hands-on option: the Make Up for Ever Academy. The company has branches in Paris (where its headquarters are); Nice, France; Hong Kong, and Beirut. A school in Union Square (above), which opened this month, is its first in North America. That one includes a lecture room with individual stations and a photo studio. Three makeup courses are available: Beauty-Fashion, Television-Film and Stage-Artistic (a seven-week program costs $4,450). Apply at makeupforeverusa.com/mufe/academy/.

title: Dennis Kucinichs Favorite Film
description: Like everyone else on the Internet today, the Bagger is dedicated to providing you with weird facts that you would otherwise find on Wikipedia. Has anyone demanded their money back after seeing The Artist, for being a silent film in an era of talkies? Yup. Is Tina Fey the queen of photobombing awards shows? You betcha. What is Representative Dennis Kucinichs favorite movie this year?

title: Before Tearing Out a Wall, Check Your Phone
description: Im never more inspired to tackle a home improvement project than after watching a TV show in which an attractive expert rejuvenates a living room in a day, for less than $200.

title: Newly Released Books
description: Two novelists who turned heads with their debuts are back this month with their sophomore novels, mingling with two first-timers and two more seasoned writers. And something must be in the water, as two of the books practically share an aquatic title.

title: Pictures of the Day: Gaza and Elsewhere
description: Photographs from Gaza, Indonesia, Italy and Israel.

title: TimesCast: S.C.s Conservative Vote
description: In South Carolina, Rick Santorum and Newt Gingirich are dueling to be the more conservative alternative to Mitt Romney.

title: Concerts to Be Focus in Shift From HDNet to AXS TV
description: 6:25 p.m. | Updated Ryan Seacrest, his talent agency CAA and the events promoter A.E.G. have been talking for three years about making a cable channel for concerts, live events and other entertainment.

title: Online Fracas for a Critic of the Right
description: For Corey Robin the author its been a bruising few months. Shortly after his essay collection The Reactionary Mind: Conservatism From Edmund Burke to Sarah Palin appeared last fall, The New York Times Book Review published a review by Sheri Berman dismissing the book as a diatribe that preaches to the converted, so filled with exaggeration and invective that the readers eyes roll. Then in late December, The New York Review of Books ran a withering assessment by Mark Lilla, who dismissed the book as history as W.P.A. mural,  if not the left-wing scholarly equivalent of Glenn Becks blackboard scribblings.

title: Patients With Normal Bone Density Can Delay Retests, Study Suggests
description: Bone loss and osteoporosis develop so slowly in most women whose bones test normal at age 65 that many can safely wait as long as 15 years before having a second bone density test, researchers report in a new study.

title: Shopping for Writing Desks
description: The novelist Arthur Phillips found writing desks from the sublime to the affordable.

title: Writing Desks
description: When Arthur Phillips bought his wife an enormous television for Christmas, he failed at what he calls the manly art of measuring. Too big for its intended cabinet, the TV now sits on Mr. Phillipss desk.

title: Yu Darvish Signs With the Rangers
description: For several years Yu Darvish, an icon of Japanese baseball, has been dominating batters on the other side of the planet, mostly unseen by Americans other than the legions of scouts and executives who yearned for the day when he would test his skills in Major League Baseball.

title: Heather Armstrong and Her Husband Announce Their Separation  by Blog
description: Heather Armstrong, a k a Dooce, a k a Queen of the Mommy Bloggers, has announced, via blog post, that she and her husband, Jon, are at least temporarily separating. Mr. Armstrong echoed her words on his own blog, Blurbomat, and publicly announced that hes available  for work, that is. The small media empire the couple spun from Ms. Armstrongs blog, Dooce.com (which famously got Ms. Armstrong fired from her job in 2002), once supported them both, along with two daughters and a dog. But apparently the company Ms. Armstrong runs will no longer support Jon (at least not until theyre talking settlement).

title: How Wikipedia Turned Off the Lights
description: On Wednesday, Wikipedia, the online encyclopedia, directed its English-language visitors to a spooky, black-and-white Web page that read, Imagine a World Without Free Knowledge. The page, part of a protest against two online piracy bills, was simple and minimalistic. But the path to its publication was more complicated.

title: Anthony Giardina on How a House Speaks for Its Owner
description: If you know youre looking for a beautiful house, you approach it with a certain discernment, Anthony Giardina said. But when a piece of real estate captures your imagination from out of nowhere, he added, The desire gets amped up.

title: Inching Closer to Agreement on Evaluations for Teachers
Gingrich Cuts Romneys Lead in South Carolina,  Poll Finds
description: Newt Gingrich has gained significant ground on Mitt Romney in South Carolina as the two men intensify their rhetoric with three days left before Republicans go to the polls on Saturday.

title: Campaign Fund Balances Hint at Candidates for City Races
description: Political chatter in New York City has focused on the 2013 campaign for mayor, as Michael R. Bloomberg prepares to leave City Hall after 12 years in office.

title: Gingrich Feels Heat From Romney, and Welcomes It
description: WARRENVILLE, S.C.  Newt Gingrich is having a flashback to mid-December, when the word surge appeared in every news account mentioning his name, and Mitt Romney perceived him as a real enough threat to bother to attack him.

title: Bloomberg Says He Pays Highest Tax Rate and Opposes Hedge Fund Break
description: A day after Mitt Romney conceded that he paid a lower tax rate than many Americans, Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg  another politician who made his fortune in the financial industry  said on Wednesday that he personally paid the highest personal income tax rate.

title: Within the Medina, a Feast for the Eyes
description: A traditional house in Fez, built around a tiled courtyard, offers 6,500 square feet of refurbished space ideal for use as a guesthouse.

title: House Hunting in ... Morocco
description: TRADITIONAL HOUSE WITH FIVE BEDROOMS IN FEZ

title: Good Decision on Keystone XL
description: President Obama has at times failed to stand up for his principles (or at least what I thought were his principles) under the relentless Republican campaign to deny him anything he wants, even if the nation badly needs it.

title: EBay Reports Stronger Earnings, Fueled by PayPal
description: SAN FRANCISCO  EBays net income soared in the fourth quarter, in large part because of the sale of its remaining investment in Skype and continued success of PayPal.

title: Pollo
description: TUCKED under a sign for a Vietnamese restaurant in a hard-to-find pocket of Chinatown, the Mexican restaurant Pulqueria does not have to work overtime to feel hidden. Owned by Heather and Christopher Tierney, the brother and sister who operate Apothke, an absinthe den next door, Pulqueria gets a cool crowd that is drawn to its speakeasy atmosphere and inventive cocktails.

title: Market Ready
description: Q. Ive inherited a rundown home. Is it better to sell as is or invest in repairs and upgrades?

title: Homes for $1 Million
description: A cabin compound in Wisconsin; a co-op in Washington, D.C.; and a five-bedroom house in Maine

title: A Grim Aspect of Modernity (and a Breezy Tour)
description: While visiting the Alhambra, Cullen Murphy, editor at large at Vanity Fair, overheard a guide recounting the momentous events of 1492. King Ferdinand and Queen Isabella united Spain under a single Roman Catholic monarchy; Columbus journeyed west; and all Jews who refused to convert to Christianity were expelled, part of the rulers full-bodied embrace of the Inquisition.

title: What You Get for ... $1 Million
description: CLIFTON TOWNSHIP, WIS.

title: Older Women and Bone Tests
description: How often should older women be tested for thinning bones? Though its been nearly 15 years since Congress passed the Bone Mass Measurement Act mandating Medicare coverage for bone density tests to prevent osteoporosis, nobody really knew  until now.

title: Pressed by Europe, Hungary Backtracks on New Laws
description: BRUSSELS  Accused of undermining fundamental democratic principles, Hungarys prime minister, Viktor Orban, beat a tactical retreat on Wednesday. He offered to change details of controversial new laws, but he rejected claims that his country was sliding toward authoritarianism.

title: Pass the Tea and the Remote and Put on Your Tiaras
description: TO much of the civilized world, the entail sounds like some part of a cow that Mario Batali might serve alla Romana. But to aficionados of Downton Abbey, which recently began a second, highly anticipated season on PBS, it is the great matter, the root of all evil  and all delight.

title: Letters
description: Equal, but Separate?

title: Curtain Rises on a Season Aloft
description: There is lots to be excited about in this coming New York City Ballet season. Alexei Ratmanskys Russian Seasons, a new Christopher Wheeldon piece anchoring the companys first program dedicated entirely to his work, George Balanchines Vienna Waltzes  the list goes on.

title: Flower Seed Suggestions From the Experts
description: Eight flowers whose seeds you should sow.

title: Packets Full of Promise
description: WHERE have all the flowers gone? Seriously, where did they go?

title: Robber Sought in Hold-Up of Brooklyn Dunkin Donuts
description: On Monday night around 9:20, the police said, a man in his late 20s walked into a Dunkin Donuts on McGuinness Boulevard near the Pulaski Bridge in Greenpoint, Brooklyn.

title: Bling! Vavoom! Celebrities! A Concert, Too
description: The path to a career in classical music often passes through Carnegie Hall. The stop is usually an appearance with a major orchestra or a debut recital, often financed by patrons, institutions or the artist. Sometimes Carnegie itself presents the performer

title: A Miami Mashup
description: Tamara Hendershot makes a living by renting out every part of Magic City Farm, a one-acre compound with seven bungalows and a boathouse, as a location for print, television and film shoots.

title: In Miami, Bungalows With a Worldview
description: MIAMI

title: On Spec: Vintage-Style Glasses Online
description: AT Morgenthal Frederics, the fashionable eyeglass store, a pair of espresso-colored Stephanie frames, hand-carved from 12 layers of horn from Asian water buffaloes, sells for $1,495. And thats not counting the mother-of-pearl flourishes, which push the price to $1,795.

title: For Online Protests, Throwing Spaghetti Against the Internet
description: The World Wide Web is still learning how to stage protests online, with people and companies trying different tactics, throwing spaghetti against the Internet and trying to see what sticks.

title: Does Gingrich Have Momentum in South Carolina?
description: Every contentious campaign seems to have moments when there is conflicting evidence about which candidate, if any, has the momentum in the race.

title: Digital Notes: Grooveshark Copyright Suit and Its Unusual Evidence
description: In the music industrys frequent lawsuits over unauthorized content online, the court documents are often stuffed with dreary material like server logs and long lists of copyrighted songs. But the latest high-profile case, against Grooveshark, centers on some unusual and controversial evidence: a pair of anonymous blog comments.

title: Bloomberg 'Optimistic' on Teacher Evaluations
At P.S. 41, College Planning Begins in Pre-K
The Key to Creativity: Solitude or Teams?
description: To the Editor:

title: A Commercial, Sandwiched Between Lines of Dialogue on Hawaii Five-0
description: Product placement in scripted television shows has quickly become a fact of life, as struggling networks seek new ways to make money. Sometimes its done subtly, sometimes with a sledgehammer. But this example from Puolo, Mondays episode of Hawaii Five-0 on CBS, was particularly egregious  the most jarring, disruptive and insulting example Ive seen.

title: Italian Mens Fashion Week Shows in Milan Go Conservative
description: Cautious the collections were, but not meretricious.

title: Color, Line and Shape
description: Images of Ellsworth Kellys recent work.

title: Nicotine Replacement
description: To the Editor:

title: Two Teenagers on the Bottom Rung, Yearning to Improve Their Uncool Status
description: The timing of the animated series Unsupervised is unfortunate. A kind of reversed Beavis and Butt-Head  in which the teenage heroes, while losers in just about every way, are also social strivers yearning for suburban domesticity and dispensing Oprah Winfrey-style affirmations  it has the bad luck of coming along three months after the original was revived by MTV. The new show looks awfully pale by comparison.

title: Nine Things You Didnt Know About Twitter
description: Twitter, the minimalist-format social network that claims to have 100 million users, has built its reputation around its simplicity. Members can post to the service only in text messages of 140 characters or less. They can include a link to another site, or to a photo or video. They can repost other users messages on their own pages. They can send each other equally spartan private messages. Thats about it  or so it seems.

title: Caring for Elderly Parents
description: To the Editor:

title: Gitmo and the Embargo
description: To the Editor:

title: Inside the Homes of Mexicos Rich and Infamous
description: MEXICO CITY

title: Where Home Tours Dont Go
description: A look inside the vacant homes of alleged drug traffickers in Mexico, from the palatial to the humble hiding in plain sight.

title: Understanding the Role of Catholic Priests Wives
description: To the Editor:

title: Full Results of The New York Times and CBS News Poll
description: Complete results from a poll on President Obamas job performance leading into the campaign.

title: Todays Scuttlebot:  Blackout Comics and Twitter Maps
description: Interesting things that reporters and editors for The New York Times found on the Web on Wednesday. Find more Scuttlebot items here.

title: Poll Shows Obamas Vulnerability With Swing Voters
description: President Obama opens his re-election bid facing significant obstacles among independent voters, according to the latest New York Times/CBS News poll, with the critical piece of the electorate that cemented his victory four years ago open to denying him a second term.

title: How the Poll Was Conducted
description: The latest New York Times/CBS News Poll is based on telephone interviews conducted Jan. 12 through 17 with 1,154 adults throughout the United States. Of these, 1,021 said they were registered to vote.

title: Sharp Edges, but a Soft Glow
description: The carbon fiber Victory lamp made by Novaled, a German company, features a new type of light source: organic light-emitting diodes, or OLEDs, a technology that uses thin layers of film to produce a more diffuse light than traditional LEDs. If you look into the light source, theres no glare whatsoever, said Uli Petzold, founder of the Miami lighting design company Uli+friends, the exclusive distributor of the $7,500 lamp in the United States. The color temperature is very warm.

title: Pill Organizers Pretty Enough to Come Out of the Cabinet
description: Hoping to remedy an everyday annoyance  the management of medications and vitamins  the health and wellness company Sabi has developed a range of products. Created by the industrial designer Yves Bhar, they can be used to dispense, organize, carry, crush and cut pills. With shapely, ergonomic curves, the pieces are intended to be easily used by an aging population, but visually appealing to all generations.

title: What's the Best Way to Protect Against Online Piracy?
Photographing the Pool, as California Icon
description: What is the most enduring symbol of the Southern California lifestyle? Daniell Cornell, senior curator at the Palm Springs Art Museum, believes its the swimming pool.

title: Madeline Weinrib Branches Out
description: Its been almost 14 years since Madeline Weinrib, the granddaughter of the ABC Carpet & Home founder Max Weinrib, introduced her first collection of rugs there. Several years later, she turned an area on the sixth floor of the store into what she called her Atelier, which sold the rugs, as well as pillows, napkins and other objects she designed.

title: Sales at Canvas and Dempsey & Carroll
description: Decorative pillows are up to 30 percent off at the Michele Varian shop at ABC Carpet & Home, through Jan. 28 (the Skull and Sword ultrasuede pillow in black, originally $245, is $172); 888 Broadway (19th Street), (646) 602-3367.

title: Quiet Strutting at the Mens Shows in Milan
description: MILAN

title: How to Argue About Politics
description: As a philosophy professor, I spend much of my time thinking about the arguments put forward by professional philosophers. As a citizen (and an occasional columnist for The Stone), I also spend lots of time thinking about the arguments put forward by Democrats and Republicans on currently disputed political issues. Of course, there are differences in logical sophistication and complexity between the philosophical and the political arguments. But, allowing that popular political arguments require shortcuts from full academic rigor, there is not, I think, that much difference between the logical acumen of politicians and philosophers.

title: An Oscar Shortlist Tilts East
description: Two films from the Islamic world and one from Israel. An Asian historical epic with a strong resemblance to the futuristic Avatar. And a dance meditation thats also a contender for best documentary. The shortlist for the Oscar for best foreign language film, announced Wednesday by the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences, can always be counted on for surprises and intrigues. This years semifinalists, which include a Canadian entry, underlined a shift away from the Academys Eurocentric focus in the past, with just four films from Europe rounding out the group.

title: For Super Bowl XLVI, a Bigger Batch of First-Time Advertisers
description: SOMETIMES a team comes to the Super Bowl having never played one. That is also true on the advertising side of the game. And for Super Bowl XLVI, to be broadcast by NBC on Feb. 5, there will more first-time sponsors than usual.

title: Leading Your Weakest Suit Can Distract Your Opponent
description: At the District 3 Winter Regional in Rye Brook, N.Y., the winners of the first two-day knockout teams, on Jan. 10 and 11, were Kelley Hwang of New York City; William Ehlers of Montclair, N.J.; Richard DeMartino of Riverside, Conn.; and John Stiefel of Wethersfield, Conn.

title: Obama Plans Trip to Five States
description: President Obama plans three days of travel to five battleground states after he delivers his nationally televised State of the Union address next Tuesday, a trip that the White House bills as official but one that has all the markings of his first campaign swing of the year.

title: Icahn Raises Bet on WebMD
description: Carl C. Icahn wont be deterred by WebMDs woes.

title: Headphones to Shut Out the World
description: In the olden days, you didnt need much to enjoy air travel: a pair of goggles, a trusty biplane and a song in your heart. These days, the equipment list is slightly longer: a roll-on bag, a neck pillow and an eye mask  not to mention T.S.A.-friendly slip-on shoes, a fold-out laptop case and an all-plastic watch.

title: Unearthing the Meaning in a Massacre
description: Theres a revealing image late in Grey Matter: a lingering close-up of wind chimes made from keys and shards of green glass. Shortly before, the glass was part of a bottle, shattered by a young man as a means to slit his own throat. From despair, art.

title: Norman Finds Comfort Zone With Clinton
description: LA QUINTA, Calif.  Greg Norman did not expect to like President Bill Clinton, whose politics he opposed. So when the call came from the White House inviting Norman to play golf with Clinton in Normans native Australia in 1994, he was inclined to turn it down.

title: Brown Asks California to Cheer Rail Project
description: SACRAMENTO  Gov. Jerry Brown on Wednesday threw his unequivocal support behind a $100 billion high-speed rail line that has come under fire here in California and across the country, embracing it in a strikingly optimistic State of the State speech in which he asserted that government should pursue ambitious ventures even during times of economic strife.

title: Regulators Concerned About How to Apply Volcker Rule
description: A federal proposal that seeks to bar banks from trading with their own money has found few friends in Washington and on Wall Street.

title: Clarity on Pipeline Decision, From North of the Border
description: For White House reporters covering President Obamas controversial decision on Wednesday to reject, for now, the proposed Keystone XL oil pipeline from Canada to the Gulf of Mexico, it helped to have a colleague reporting from the Canadian prime ministers office.

title: Hudson Valley Democrat Wont Seek 11th Term in Congress
description: Representative Maurice D. Hinchey, a 10-term Democrat from the mid-Hudson Valley, announced on Wednesday that he would not seek re-election this year.

title: Cruise Lines Use Law and Contracts to Limit Liability
description: The wreck of the Costa Concordia has attracted those habitual companions of disaster: lawyers.

title: Financial Aid Advice for Indian Students From Colgate University
description: For many Indian students thinking about going to American colleges, one of the biggest questions is Can I afford it? We asked Katryna A. Swartwout Ryan, associate dean of admissions at Colgate University, who oversees the recruitment and selection process for international students, and travels around the world to recruit, several questions about financing your college education.

title: The Literary Circus Comes to Jaipur
description: Page Two columnist Manu Joseph writes  that Delhis writers, readers, publishers, critics, television anchors  and politicians who can read and write will shift to Jaipur on Friday for the five-day Jaipur Literature Festival, a serious salon at its heart and a circus on its fringes.

title: Public Domain Works Can Be Copyrighted Anew, Supreme Court Rules
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court on Wednesday upheld a federal law that restored copyright protection to works that had entered the public domain.

title: U.S. Drafts Abdul-Jabbar as a Cultural Ambassador
description: Kareem Abdul-Jabbars life has been a case study in the art of the possible, from his humble Harlem roots to N.B.A. fame and through his life after basketball as a historian and scholar. His next endeavor will draw on all of it.

title: Warm Winter Deflates Prospects for Retailers
description: As winter approached, retailers ordered clothes for cold weather, arranged their stores for cold weather and then just started hoping for cold weather.

title: Hungarys Junk Democracy
description: Budapest

title: China: Dissident Author Flees to U.S.
description: Yu Jie, a prominent writer of 11 books and a critic of the Chinese Communist Party, said Wednesday in a news conference in Washington that he and his family had left China on Jan. 11 after more than a year of harassment and house arrest. Mr. Yu said his ordeal began Oct. 13, 2010, when he was placed under house arrest after the announcement that his close friend Liu Xiaobo, an imprisoned writer, had won the 2010 Nobel Peace Prize. That December, Mr. Yu said, he was detained for four days and tortured nearly to death. He said security officers criticized him for planning to write a biography of Mr. Liu and for writing Chinas Best Actor: Wen Jiabao, a scathing critique of the prime minister. Mr. Yu was then kept under house arrest, with a travel ban, until this month.

title: Obama Fights Back Against Koch Brothers in New Ad
description: 10:09 p.m. | Updated COLUMBIA, S.C.  Facing attacks on his character from some particularly aggressive and well-financed opponents,President Obama will begin running the first broadcast television ad of his presidential re-election campaign on Thursday.

title: Britain: Rendition Inquiry Put on Hold
description: Justice Minister Kenneth Clarke announced Wednesday that the government was scrapping an inquiry into allegations that the secret intelligence service, MI6, was complicit in the abuse of terrorism suspects who were caught up in the American-run process of extraordinary rendition after the Sept. 11 attacks. Mr. Clarke said that a team of lawyers and investigators under a retired judge, Sir Peter Gibson, had reviewed more than 10,000 secret documents, but that the next phase, summoning testimony by MI6 officials and others, could not proceed until all related criminal investigations were completed.

title: In Pakistans Coup Intrigue, an X-Rated Plot Twist
description: The complex political and legal drama Pakistani reporters call Memogate veered into unexpected territory on Wednesday, when an American businessman who claims that Pakistans government asked the United States to help it stave off a military coup admitted that he once played a supporting role in a racy music video that featured naked female wrestling.

title: Hedge Funds May Sue Greece if It Tries to Force Losses
description: LONDON  Hedge funds have been known to use hardball tactics to make money. Now they have come up with a new one: suing Greece in a human rights court to make good on its bond payments.

title: Afghanistan: Report of Molestation by British Troops Is Being Investigated
description: The British Defense Ministry said Wednesday that the Royal Military Police had begun an investigation into allegations of inappropriate behavior by two servicemen in Afghanistan after a report of child abuse. The British newspaper The Sun reported that the two servicemen had been questioned about claims that they had encouraged a boy and girl, both about 10, to touch them through their clothes. The servicemen are accused of filming the children and showing the images on laptop computers to other soldiers who alerted the military authorities, the newspaper reported.

title: This Year, Voters Focus More on a Man Than on His Religion
description: GREENVILLE, S.C.  Four years ago, Mitt Romneys Mormon faith was a point of considerable concern, if not contention, for many Republican voters in South Carolina, a state where many voters are evangelical Christians and one that is known for its bare-knuckled politics.

title: As a 49er, Carr Saw Alex Smiths Confidence
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  While the rise of San Francisco 49ers quarterback Alex Smith this season has surprised many around the N.F.L., the Giants backup quarterback David Carr is not among those stunned. As a former backup to Smith, the No. 1 overall pick in 2005, Carr saw how he handled a difficult season in 2010  which included a stadium full of 49ers fans chanting for him to be benched  and came away impressed by Smiths mental toughness.

title: The 1% and That 15%
description: During the Republican debate on Monday, Mitt Romney suggested that he might release his 2011 tax return, but only in April. On Tuesday, he told reporters that his effective tax rate was probably closer to the 15 percent rate than anything.

title: Classless in the Clsico?
description: Barcelona defeated Real Madrid, 2-1, in the first leg of their Copa del Rey quarterfinal series. But as usual, there was more to it than three goals.

title: Russia: Blogger Meets With Cleric
description: A popular Russian opposition leader, the blogger Aleksei Navalny, met Wednesday with a top official of the Russian Orthodox Church, Archpriest Vsevolod Chaplin, adding to speculation that the church would try to mediate between Prime Minister Vladimir V. Putin and his critics.

title: Road Safety Agency Is Urged to Add Expertise in Electronics Systems
description: DETROIT  A branch of the National Academy of Sciences reported Wednesday that federal safety regulators lack the expertise to monitor vehicles with increasingly sophisticated electronics.

title: At Stake, a Super Bowl Berth, and a Loaf of Sourdough Bread
description: As inspiring pregame speeches go, the New York Giants head coach, Tom Coughlin, could perhaps do better than, Our mayor needs that sourdough bread!

title: Unrepentant, Killer of Four Is Sentenced to 200 Years
description: Grinning, glaring and hurling epithets to the friends and family members of the people he killed in a violent rampage across Brooklyn and Manhattan last winter, Maksim Gelman turned what was to be a predictable life sentencing into one final perverse spectacle.

title: For Darvish, Small Shoes to Fill
description: The Texas Rangers are spending a lot of money on Yu Darvish, and they have to hope he is a lot better than the other Japanese players who have already pitched in the major leagues.

title: S.E.C. Charges Banker with Misleading Investors
description: A Florida banker who is known for tangling with his critics, including with a prominent bank analyst during the financial crisis, was charged by federal regulators on Wednesday with misleading investors about his companys real estate portfolio as the housing market turned south.

title: A Maestro Sets the Tone
description: SOMETHING historic happened at the New York Philharmonic on the evening of Jan. 10, about an hour into Mahlers Ninth Symphony. During the introspective, achingly beautiful fourth movement, an audience members cellphone loudly rang. And rang. And rang again. It was the kind of marimba riff weve all heard at some point on the street from a strangers phone.

title: Kim Clijsters, Mama Champion
description: MELBOURNE  Rare is the professional athlete who takes much interest in the interviewer across the table, but Kim Clijsters, finding out that I had three daughters, quickly asked a few questions of her own on Wednesday: How old are they? How do you handle the schooling if youre going back and forth between Europe and the States?

title: Dismantling Detroit
description: The filmmakers Heidi Ewing and Rachel Grady look at young men who salvage scrap metal from Detroits derelict buildings, set against the backdrop of globalization.

title: Dismantling Detroit
description: We chose to focus our cameras on Detroit out of a gut feeling that this city  often heralded as the birthplace of the middle class  may well be a harbinger of things to come for the rest of the country.

title: Facebook Adds New Apps to Its Timeline
description: To help usher in Facebooks coming seventh birthday, the company is learning how to use more verbs.

title: Ravens Flacco Is Used to Getting Little Credit
description: OWINGS MILLS, Md.  For a brief moment Wednesday afternoon, Ray Rice morphed from Baltimores star running back into an M.C., welcoming the quarterback with more victories in his first four seasons than any other in N.F.L. history. When that quarterback, Joe Flacco, reached the podium, Rice leaped toward him. Flacco did not move.

title: Reporter Dies in Pakistan, and Taliban Warn Others
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan  The Pakistani Taliban claimed responsibility on Wednesday for the killing of a reporter for the Voice of America, a radio service financed by the United States government, and warned that others would be targets in the future.

title: From an Attempted Suicide to Salvation, Then to Helping Others
description: On a cold December day in 2009, Sheaneen Holimon stuffed the tailpipe of a car with a sock, sat down in the drivers seat with the doors and windows closed, and started the engine. She was tired of fighting a losing battle with drugs and alcohol.

title: Wikipedia Absence Is Noted, but as a Brief Inconvenience
description: The day of protest at English Wikipedia brought measurable results, the sites administrators reported: four million people used the tool Wikipedia had provided to find their member of Congress by entering their ZIP code; 90 million came to the site and learned about the antipiracy legislation that Wikipedia and other Web sites are protesting.

title: U.S. Charges 7 for Insider Trading of Dell Stock
description: 9:05 p.m. | Updated

title: When the Lights Go Down in the City
description: Los Angeles

title: Britain: Protesters Eviction Approved
description: London authorities can evict protesters from the Occupy London encampment that has surrounded St. Pauls Cathedral since October, a British court said Wednesday. A prompt appeal was expected. The battle between protesters and the Corporation of London, the authority overseeing the land outside the historic cathedral, began late last year when the demonstrators refused to heed eviction notices pinned to tents.

title: Britain: Weighing New London Airport
description: The British government agreed Wednesday to assess the possibility of easing heavy congestion at Heathrow and other airports by building an $80 billion airport on an island in the Thames River estuary. Heathrow draws criticism from among its 70 million annual passengers, and from neighbors who complain about the noise pollution from its 480,000 flights a year. Mayor Boris Johnson of London and others have said a replacement is essential if Britain is to remain competitive as an international aviation hub. Environmentalists opposing the plan say the favored site, on the Isle of Grain, 35 miles east of London, is a major center for wintering birds and a summer breeding ground for bird species like avocets and marsh harriers.

title: As Attacks Heat Up, Romneys Lead Narrows in S.C.
description: MOUNT PLEASANT, S.C.  For Mitt Romney, the South Carolina primary probably cant come soon enough, as he faced a day of nonstop negative ads, questions about his religion and his taxes, and new poll numbers that showed his comfortable lead narrowing.

title: With Twitter, Blackouts and Demonstrations, Web Flexes Its Muscle
description: The Web buzzed with protests large and small on Wednesday as the tech industry rallied against Congressional legislation to curb Internet piracy.

title: The False Ideals of the Web
description: Berkeley, Calif.

title: Priest, Newly Installed, Is Removed From Post for Fathering Child While in Seminary
description: A newly minted Roman Catholic priest has been removed from his parish in Orange County, N.Y., by church officials for secretly fathering a child while he was attending seminary.

title: Online Piracy and Political Overreach
description: For months, it seemed as if Congress would pass an online antipiracy bill, even though its main weapons  cutting off the financing of pirate Web sites and making them harder to find  risk censoring legitimate speech and undermining the security of the Internet. But the unmovable corporations behind those bills have run into an unstoppable force: an outcry by Internet companies led by Google and Wikipedia that culminated in an extraordinary online protest on Wednesday.

title: 35 Accused of Selling PCP in an Open-Air Drug Market
description: In a courtyard between two housing complexes in Upper Manhattan, an 8-year-old boy would sometimes steer a line of customers toward an enclosed area called the Pit.

title: A Second Here a Second There May Just Be a Waste of Time
description: On Thursday, the world will go to battle over a second.

title: Coalition Spends Millions Pushing Cuomos Agenda
description: ALBANY  Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo on Wednesday unveiled a new Web site promoting his proposed state budget, featuring a photograph of the smiling governor, his sleeves rolled up, greeting farmers in a flood-stricken upstate community.

title: Penn States Trustees Recount Painful Decision to Fire Paterno
description: It was growing late on the night of Nov. 9, 2011. John P. Surma, the chief executive of U.S. Steel and the vice chairman of Penn State Universitys board of trustees, sat at a rectangular table at the Penn Stater Hotel. Gov. Tom Corbett of Pennsylvania was on the speaker phone. Other trustees were present, many emotionally spent.

title: Gingrich Camp Responds to Ex-Wifes Interview
description: GREENVILLE, S.C.  Anticipating a potentially damaging interview with one of Newt Gingrichs former wives ahead of the South Carolina primary, the Gingrich campaign issued an open letter on Wednesday night to ABC News leadership, the network that conducted the interview, in preparation for a Thursday night broadcast.

title: Republican Senator Runs Away From the Party Line
description: BOSTON  Two years ago, Scott P. Brown was a little-known state legislator on the cusp of one of the biggest upset victories in modern politics: capturing Edward M. Kennedys longtime Senate seat in this overwhelmingly Democratic state, costing that party its filibuster-proof majority and becoming a Republican sensation.

title: Cuomo Limits State Money for Salaries of Contractors
description: ALBANY  Looking to rein in the use of public money to pay what he called excessive salaries, Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo signed an executive order on Wednesday placing a $199,000 limit on the amount of state funds that contractors can use to pay executives.

title: Forgot to Move Car? City Council Votes to End a Sticker of Shame
description: For a quarter-century, it has stood out as a scourge to New York City drivers, a scarlet letter in a bright hue, stuck onto the windows of vehicles whose owners neglected to participate in the ritualistic alternate-side parking dance.

title: Lottery Numbers
Thursday: Foofaraw
description: THURSDAYS PUZZLE  Hoo boy, this grid exhausted me. Were you exhausted? Every corner, a different TO-DO. In fact, I wouldnt hesitate to call this the Drama Queen of All Puzzles.

title: Its a Dehumanizing Business, Becoming Top Dog
description: Oh, Mr. Romney, have you met Richard, Duke of Gloucester? A front-runner for the Republican presidential nomination might benefit from a sit-down with the title character of Richard III, or the version of him that is being embodied with all-conquering audacity by Kevin Spacey at the Brooklyn Academy of Music.

title: Anchors Aweigh, My Boys
description: CHARLESTON, S.C.

title: Romney Riches Are Being Seen as New Hurdle
description: With a fortune estimated to be as large as a quarter of a billion dollars, Mitt Romney is among the wealthiest men ever to run for president.

title: Obamas Pipeline Move: Something for Everyone
description: Theres been extensive coverage of President Obamas decision, forced by a Republican legislative maneuver, to reject the application for a much-debated pipeline project, known asKeystone XL, that would have carried a tarry oil precursor from Canadian oil sands to American refineries.

title: Once Again, Wilfork Anchors Patriots Defense
description: FOXBOROUGH, Mass.  Three trips to the Pro Bowl apparently were not enough. Anchoring the defense only on certain occasions would not do, either.

title: Is Banking Bad?
description: When I spoke at Swarthmore College recently, I was startled by one question: Is it immoral for students to seek banking jobs?

title: Mexicos Drug War Bloodies Areas Thought Safe
description: MEXICO CITY  The Mexican drug war that has largely been defined by violence along the border is intensifying in interior and southern areas once thought clear of the carnage, broadening a conflict that has already overwhelmed the authorities and dispirited the public, according to analysts and new government data.

title: Suns and Nash Deal DAntoni 4th Straight Loss
description: Mike DAntonis glorious past and still-jumbled present collided at Madison Square Garden on Wednesday night, and presumably this should have produced a frantic festival of points and fast breaks. Instead, the evening came down to a solitary man, standing at the foul line, methodically putting away a low-scoring game with a series of free throws.

title: Irans Currency at Low vs. Dollar
description: Irans currency, the rial, fell to its lowest level ever against the dollar on Wednesday in unofficial foreign exchange transactions in Tehran, Iranian news agencies reported.

title: Higher Deficits Seen in Romneys Tax Plan, and His Rivals, Too
