These annual parties, which begin in mid-December and continue, relentlessly, through late January, are a longstanding Russian tradition in which children endure performances of various levels of vapidity, featuring Grandfather Frost and his granddaughter the Snowgirl. The kids are rewarded for their patience with a bag full of chocolate candy.

title: The Breakfast Meeting: Same Old Oscars, and Whos Missing at Davos?
description: For all the change whirling about the entertainment business (technological and other), the Oscar nominations announced Tuesday morning send an incongruous message: nothing has changed. Parsing the nine best picture nominees, Michael Cieply finds some recurring patterns: no animation (though, with Hugo, a 3-D movie was included); all but one from a major studio or a specialty division of same (The Artist is the exception); the settings are more past than present. He continues:

title: Finding a Place for Peyton
description: It seems ever clearer that Peyton Manning will not play for the Colts next season. So where will he play if he decides not to retire?

title: Top 10 Super Bowl Story Lines, and Reasons to Sigh
description: Here are the Top 10 Super Bowl XLVI story lines that you may or may not get sick of in the next two weeks.

title: Glenn Close, Already Thanking Her Makeup and Hair Team
description: The Oscar attention that Glenn Close received on Tuesday for her passion project, Albert Nobbs, was really a triple win. Yes, she was nominated for best actress  her first recognition by the Academy in 23 years. (Although shes been nominated five times before, shes never won.) But her co-star Janet McTeer also got a nod, as best supporting actress. They sent congratulatory text messages to each other on Tuesday morning.

title: Model-Morphosis | Karo Mrozkova at Armani Priv
description: The photographer Greg Kessler captures the transformations of the Spring 2012 Couture collections in Paris. Here, the model Karo Mrozkova of Marilyn Management before (left) and after (right) transforms, with makeup by Linda Contello and hair by Franco Gobbi. (Drag the orange bar left to reveal the full transformation.)

title: Davos Potpourri: Day One
description: The World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland, officially began on Wednesday, bringing thousands of world leaders and their entourages to a remote alpine outpost.

title: Leno Sued Over Joke That Offended Sikhs
description: Just when it seemed that the world was ready to move on from a poorly received Tonight Show joke that offended Sikhs  and, perhaps, onto President Obamas poorly received spilled milk joke from Tuesdays State of the Union address  a man has filed a suit against Jay Leno, the Tonight Show host, for what he says are racist remarks.

title: Obama Praises Teachers and Calls for Mandatory Attendance
Californias Lead in Solar Is Slowly Eroding
description: The growth of Californias local solar-power systems, not only on rooftops but in parking lots, farmers fields and vineyard irrigation ponds, has kept the state well ahead of others in the total power generated from photovoltaic systems.

title: The Tigers Confounding Royalty Payment
description: Just about the same time Prince Fielders gargantuan, nine-year, $214 million contract agreement with the Detroit Tigers set baseball jaws dropping on Tuesday  the wows stemming from how long the contract is, the eye-popping total and that it was the Detroit Tigers shelling it out  it got its whiff of irony by arriving on exactly the same day Moneyball was nominated for the Oscar for Best Picture.

title: Can New Android Software Unify Android Devices?
description: A new wave of smartphones and tablets will be introduced this year with Ice Cream Sandwich, the latest version of Googles Android software. The mobile operating system has been expanded to run on both smartphones and tablets, but it remains unclear how it will fix the problem that plagues Android at its core: fragmentation.

title: Liberal Populism and 2012
description: This weeks Campaign Stops column considers the presidents speech through the lens of the campaign to come:

title: Indias Political Blasphemy
description: VARANASI, India  The current storm of censorship and intimidation over Salman Rushdie at the Jaipur Literature Festival is nothing more than a dodge by Indias politicians and Muslim leaders to cover their failure to improve the dreadful conditions in which many Indian Muslims live.

title: How to Buy Friends and Influence Politicians
description: I almost feel bad for Sheldon and Miriam Adelson, who have contributed $10 million to the pro-Gingrich Winning Our Future super PAC. If it werent for the Supreme Courts astonishingly wrongheaded Citizens United ruling, which among other things allows independent (hardly!) political committees to raise unlimited sums, the couple might have directed their millions to better uselike recapitalizing a casino or two.

title: Just One Look | Givenchy
description: At Givenchy, Riccardo Tisci was inspired by the cool glamour of Fritz Langs Metropolis and by early techno culture. The results were 10 long lean looks, encrusted with bugle beads, sequins and croc paillettes, that said red-carpet rebel, especially when finished with a jeweled nose ring (seen earlier this week at Givenchy mens) and massive chandelier earrings. One exquisite example of why his influences were so cleverly paired: an Ert-worthy silhouette, fully embroidered on the bias, worn over a ribbed muscle tank.

title: Soros Promotes Crisis Plan for Europe
description: The billionaire investor George Soros said on Wednesday that it was possible Greece could be pushed out of the euro zone this year.

title: What Were Reading
description: Tasting Table: Its time to stop being a hater when it comes to iceberg lettuce.  Jeff Gordinier

title: Reflections on an Unfinished Revolution
description: A year after the first protests in Tahrir Square, young Egyptians look back at the promise of the Arab Spring as well as the reality many revolutionaries failed to foresee.

title: Bout Time: Claressa Shields
description: The story of Claressa Shields, a 16-year-old female boxer living in Flint, Mich.

title: HBO Bets on Two Thoroughbreds
description: AHORSE race is a just a contest where large animals are loosed from a pen at the sound of a bell to take a few lefts around an oval, first one home wins.

title: Real Housewife Bethenny Frankel Gets Talk-Show Tryout
description: MIAMI  Bethenny Frankel, made famous by Bravo as a member of the Real Housewives of New York City, is being given a talk-show tryout by Warner Brothers and Fox.

title: Image of the Day: January 25
Bout Time: Tiara Brown
description: The story of Tiara Brown, a 23-year old female boxer who spends six hours per day in the gym and doesnt plan to stop until she makes the Olympics.

title: Dissected Long Before Her Debut
description: ITS already difficult to remember Lana Del Rey, but lets try. She was a meme of 2011, a singer who emerged seemingly fully formed from the ether who was in short order revealed to be, get this, a singer who was not always fully formed. That moll with the dangerous tastes in men and pastimes and the puffed-out lips and hair? That songwriter who used words like velvet and exotic in the tiki-lounge way of overemphasizing noir culture? Yep, it was a pose, cut from existing, densely patterned cloth. Just like all the other poses. And all the other cloths.

title: Midnight in Paris Almost Didnt Happen in Paris
description: When she got the script for Midnight in Paris, Letty Aronson, Woody Allens longtime producer, wasnt buying it. When I first read the script, honestly, my impression was, whos going to come to this movie? said Ms. Aronson, who also happens to be the directors sister. Nobody even knows Gertrude Stein anymore.

title: Romney Calls Obama Detached From Reality
description: ORLANDO, Fla.  Mitt Romney called President Obama detached from reality on Wednesday, accusing him of saying one thing during his State of the Union speech and doing another during his presidency.

title: Netflix to Issue Earnings Report, First Since Consumer Backlash Over Its Spin-Off Plan
description: Netflix on Wednesday afternoon will release its earnings for the fourth quarter of 2011, the first full quarter since a price increase and a bungled plan to spin off a DVD service hurt the companys reputation and decimated its stock price.

title: Ramones Jacket Is Off the Block, for Now
description: The online auction house offered a sweat-soaked gem from punks New York glory years  the black leather jacket worn by the Ramones drummer Marky Ramone during his first stint with the band. But the drummer cried foul, calling the jacket a fake.

title: Spare a Hair Band? A Man Bun to Go
description: ON a recent night at Hotel Delmano, a stylish speakeasy in Williamsburg, Brooklyn, the heavily tattooed head bartender, Sam Anderson, and his colleague, Michaelangelo Davis III, were shaking up cocktails with manly vigor.

title: In the Company of Bears
description: Theres a vast gap between scary bears and teddy bears, but its one comfortably occupied by the bears who star in three new picture books. My Bear Griz, Otto the Book Bear and Maudie and Bear are all about real(ish) bears who greatly prefer the company of others to bearish solitude.

title: The Chink in Illuminas Defense
description: Roche Holdings $5.7 billion hostile offer for Illumina is built on a loophole in Illuminas takeover defenses.

title: Activists Call for Breakup of Bank of America
description: Public Citizen, a consumer advocacy group, is calling for the breakup of Bank of America.

title: For a Veteran, Disability Payment Is Long in Coming
description: The year Leroy MacKlem lost his veterans disability compensation for a bad hip, gasoline cost 27 cents a gallon, a Yankee shortstop named Rizzuto was the American Leagues most valuable player and President Harry S. Truman ordered production of the hydrogen bomb. It was 1950.

title: Stewart, Colbert and Coldplay Lined Up for First Secret Policemans Ball in U.S.
description: 11:28 a.m. | Updated

title: When the Sex Offender Is a Teenager in Love
description: For having sex with his freshman girlfriend when he was a senior in high school, Ken Thornsberry spent six years in a Michigan prison. Abigail Pesta of The Daily Beast reports on his story and on the growing number of parents outraged that older teenagers are being jailed, and added to sex offender registries, for having sex with younger teenagers.

title: Gloomy Debate over Euro Darkens Davos
description: DAVOS, Switzerland  For a usually optimistic crowd, there was a lot of gloom and doom being prophesied among the movers and shakers gathered here on the first day of the World Economic Forum. The subject of their angst: whether the euro zone will ever get out of its lingering troubles in one piece.

title: Tip of the Week: Gmails Pop-out Feature
description: Composing and replaying to Gmail messages through the Web browser is a convenient way to keep all your mail in one online location. But keeping the message in the main window can be frustrating if you need to refer to a different message elsewhere in your accounts inbox.

title: Behind Closed Doors at the Fed
description: You may have wondered what exactly happens when the Federal Open Market Committee meets every six weeks to make policy decisions for the Federal Reserve  like the two-day meeting that is wrapping up Wednesday. And you are in luck, because earlier this month, the Fed released transcripts of the committees meetings in 2006, Year One in the chairmanship of Ben S. Bernanke.

title: Photos of the Moment | Armani Priv
description: var data;function jsonSlideshowCallback(response){data = response;}NYTD.options = {source: data,cropType: 'blog480',appendTo: 'fullScreenSlideShow',showHeadLine: 'false', renderstyle: "embeddedSlideShowTmag"}

title: Wheelies: The Skunkworks Edition
description: In which we bring you motoring news from around the Web:

title: Take My Comedy Influences. Please.
description: If it wasnt a trend before, it certainly will become one on Thursday night with the premiere of Inside Comedy on Showtime. The business of being funny has spawned a cottage industry of comedians talking about the business of being funny.

title: States Drive to Collect Taxes on Internet Sales Is a Blow to Marketers
description: On a dreary day last April, Tim Storm, the founder of FatWallet, and his 54 employees formed a convoy of some 30 cars, three moving trucks and a trailer laden with two fiberglass cows (one purple, one black), and drove five miles north from their old corporate home in Rockton, Ill.. to the new FatWallet headquarters in Beloit, Wis.

title: Anniversary of the Egyptian Uprising
description: Tens of thousands of Egyptians gathered in Tahrir Square, the crucible of their revolution, on Wednesday.

title: A Staten Island School Blames Its Problems on Location
Is Affiliate Marketing a Useful Tool?
description: Weve just published an article that looks at how the new nexus tax laws affect affiliate marketing companies and the retailers that use their services. The nexus laws say, in essence, that any company advertising through an affiliate marketer  usually an online deal site or blog that publishes ads or coupons and collects commissions on sales that come through them  has to collect and remit sales tax in the states and jurisdictions where the affiliate marketer is located.

title: For Indias MBAs, Money Does Not Come First
description: If you were graduating from a topnotch business school, would you pick a great job profile or a tempting salary?

title: On Our Radar: A Big Solar Storm
description: The solar storm of the last few days was the largest since 2003, the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration says. Some aircraft flying over the North Pole were rerouted in anticipation of potential communication problems linked to proton radiation. [Discovery News]

title: Sports Club Switches to Annual Fee in Lieu of Monthly Increases
description: Many members who last year joined fitness clubs owned by Town Sports International saw a $29 fee on their bill this month. The fee represents an annual rate lock payment, assessed in lieu of an increase in the members monthly dues, the company says.

title: Federer-Nadal Rivalry Adds Another Chapter
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  The rivalry between Rafael Nadal and Roger Federer is now a fully formed, fully explored phenomenon, one that has put them on a first-name basis with much of the planet. They meet for the 27th time on Thursday (3:30 a.m. Eastern, ESPN2), in the semifinals of the Australian Open.

title: New Books for the Old Internet
description: There have been many attempts to replicate the experience of reading a real, tangible book on a screen. There is Google Books, of course, and this somewhat unconvincing page-flipping simulation. There is also Project Gutenberg, the vast online archive of public domain e-books, and, you know, the Kindle.

title: Marriage Equality: Demagoguery in New Jersey
description: To borrow an old Washington joke about another self-promoting politician, the most dangerous place in politics is between Chris Christie and a TV crew. Most weeks, he clamors for national attention with rhetoric about small government (for the poor, that is, not the rich). This week, hes taken up gay marriage.

title: A Few Tears on Oscar-Nod Morning
description: Like a producer of Midnight in Paris, the writer-director of the financial thriller Margin Call, J.C. Chandor, who received his first Oscar nomination on Tuesday for best original screenplay, also initially worried about finding an audience. Our film has always suffered from the fact that it doesnt sound that good on paper, he said. Its not the most heartwarming, feel-good movie.

title: Luminaries Gather Virtually to Mark Global Funds 10th Anniversary
description: DAVOS, Switzerland  One place where Davos luminaries will be gathering this year  at least virtually  is on the silver screen. To mark the 10th anniversary of the Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria, Fund supporters including Bill Gates, Bono, Tony Blair, Bill Clinton and Jeffrey Sachs will feature in a two-minute film that celebrates the Funds work, while calling for more efforts against the diseases that still kill millions of poor people.

title: Fete Accompli | Here to Stay
description: var data;function jsonSlideshowCallback(response){data = response;}NYTD.options = {source: data,cropType: 'blog480',appendTo: 'fullScreenSlideShow',showHeadLine: 'false', renderstyle: "embeddedSlideShowTmag"}

title: Bout Time: Alex Love
description: Alex Love, a self-taught boxer from Monroe, Wash., will compete in the U.S. Olympic Team Trials in February for a shot at the London Games.

title: Its Getting Routine: Top 4 Men Are Final 4
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  David Ferrer was subdued to begin with Wednesday as he took gulps from his water bottle after another defeat in the second week of a Grand Slam tournament, this one to Novak Djokovic.

title: Fears Lurk in a Post-Transition Afghanistan
description: Over the mountains from frigid Kabul, Mihtarlam is one place where American-led forces have transferred authority to the Afghans.

title: TiqIQ: The Kayak of Live-Event Tickets
description: When searching for airline tickets, many people are like quants at a hedge fund. They pore over data, using sites like Kayak, SeatGuru and Bing Travel to divine the best price, route and seat for their coming flight.

title: Reflections on an Unfinished Revolution
description: A year after the first protests in Tahrir Square, young Egyptians look back at the promise of the Arab Spring as well as the reality many revolutionaries failed to foresee.

title: Using Test Scores to Evaluate Teachers Is Based on the Wrong Values
As I.P.O. Looms, Facebook Halts Clearing of Trades
description: As Facebook readies for an initial public offering, its lawyers are pressing the pause button on the trading process for shares of the social networking giant.

title: Rolles Super Bowl XLII Memories (From Brazil)
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  Antrel Rolle is not one of the 15 players on the Giants roster who played in the Super Bowl XLII victory over New England four years ago, but that does not mean Rolle  the Giants loquacious safety  does not have a good story from the game.

title: Greenlight Capital to Pay $11 Million Fine in Insider Case
description: 8:43 p.m. | Updated

title: An Emotional Farewell on the House Floor
description: WASHINGTON  The House bade a tearful farewell to Representative Gabrielle Giffords of Arizona on Wednesday as she submitted her resignation and was praised by members of both parties as an inspiring symbol of courage in the aftermath of an assassination attempt against her last year.

title: On a Futures Bet, Las Vegas Loses if the Giants Win
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  It should come as no surprise that the Giants have fans rooting against them in the Super Bowl in places like New Hampshire, Massachusetts and even parts of Connecticut. After all, the New England Patriots have a dedicated following, and quarterback Tom Brady has mainstream appeal.

title: In Reversal, Iran Allows Interest Rates to Increase
description: Facing a wave of panic selling by Iranians worried that international sanctions and inflation are destroying the value of the countrys currency, the rial, Irans president reversed himself on Wednesday and allowed bank interest rates to rise sharply in an effort to stop a slide that has depressed the rial to a relentless string of record lows.

title: J.C. Penney to Revise Pricing Methods and Limit Promotions
description: J. C. Penneys new leader has a vision for tomorrows shopping experience. But the retailer is still stuck with yesterdays stores.

title: Fed Signals That a Full Recovery Is Years Away
description: WASHINGTON  The Federal Reserve, declaring that the economy would need help for years to come, said Wednesday it would extend by 18 months the period that it plans to hold down interest rates in an effort to spur growth.

title: State of the Republicans
description: Gail Collins: David, I have to apologize. For the last few weeks I was somewhat snarky about my having more faith than you did in the Republican voters being too sane to nominate Newt Gingrich. My confidence in their rationality was, at best, premature.

title: Does Technology Affect Happiness?
description: As young people spend more time on computers, smartphones and other devices, researchers are asking how all that screen time and multitasking affects childrens and teenagers ability to focus and learn  even drive cars.

title: Newt Gingrich Gets a Grilling on Univision
description: MIAMI  Where was Jorge Ramos when John King and Juan Williams needed him?

title: Paris Top 5 | Herms
description: The Herms collection, described as having a palette of colorful blacks, dark harmonies,was a quiet show that grew on me the more time I had to reflect on it. Luxurious materials, and leather  always a feature of the house and certainly a trend this show season  were beautifully represented in belted calfskin coats, slim serge trousers, and suits in colors like ebony, licorice, plum and black. Signature printed ties were noticeably absent, replaced with dark, solid neck wear and collared shirts buttoned all the way up. The look that stuck was simple but clever: a carbon-colored evening suit paired with a black crew-neck knit and a dark patterned scarf that came draped under the lapels (attached with a hidden zipper to keep it in place all evening long). It was a chic and sexy runway look  easy to envision on handsome young actors on red carpets everywhere.

title: Gingrich Ad Faulting Romney on Immigration Stirs Furor
description: 2:17 p.m. | Updated Newt Gingrich faced a rising chorus of demands Wednesday that he pull a radio ad that calls Mitt Romney anti-immigrant. In a letter released by the Romney campaign, Hispanic leaders said the ad was untrue, offensive and unbecoming a candidate for the Republican nomination for president.

title: Why I Dont Rat Out My Sons Friends
description: Let me say right off the bat: I have no interest in being the Narc Mom.

title: TimesCast | January 25, 2012
description: Thousands gather on the Egyptian uprisings first anniversary | President Obama begins a three-day tour that includes battleground states.

title: Below the Line: Dressing the Bridesmaids
description: When it comes to costume designing, the Oscars tend to favor the past. In the same ways that dramas dominate the best picture category, period films are primarily the ones that get recognition in the costume design category. But costume design for contemporary films can present as many challenges as the ones involving corsets and long skirts.

title: How Obamas Tough Talk Plays in China
description: BEIJING  President Obama took a new swipe at Chinas economic policies in his State of the Union speech on Tuesday, and leaders here are unlikely to be surprised. Chinas rulers know that Mr. Obama faces a tough re-election battle, and they know that he must address his opponents repeated claims that he has failed to stand up to Beijing.

title: He Has Two Legs. But What About His Name?
description: Update, Jan. 29 | We found him, or, more accurately, he responded to us. Hes an actor named Cleo Berry who is not thrilled with the fictionalization of his body. Read the story.

title: With Split at Colorado College, Minnesota Takes Conference Lead
description: Throughout the college hockey season, Slap Shot will feature reports about some of the countrys top-ranked teams.

title: Goodbye Rebecca, Hello Stella: Streetcar Will Open on Broadway This Spring
description: The new multiracial production of Tennessee Williamss Streetcar Named Desire, starring Blair Underwood, Nicole Ari Parker, Daphne Rubin-Vega and Wood Harris, will play the Broadhurst Theater this spring, according to a spokesman for the production. No performance dates were announced.

title: The Essence of Obamanomics
description: Even the liberal Matt Yglesias was exhausted by the presidents paean to industrial policy in last nights speech, calling it a strikingly retrograde, self-contradictory, and confused agenda of reviving American prosperity through mercantilism. He goes on:

title: Just One Look | Elie Saab
description: Elie Saabs haute couture show, presented in the Grand Palais to an audience of Bollywood stars (Sonam Kapoor, gorgeous in kohl-lined eyes and a pale pink jeweled sari), Oscar hopefuls (Berenice Bejo) and clients from all the global wealthy pockets, was as beaded and lacy as we have come to expect from this house. The effect, for spring, was sweet, not sultry. Pastel dresses were entirely covered in tulle flowers, metallic embroideries and crystal beading. Since Saab is so well known for his red-carpet columns, it was refreshing to think about how his shorter offerings, all indisputably for evening, could fare on a big night. Consider, for example, an elegant little frock in white lace and pearls, so ridiculously pretty it registers angelic and wicked clever all at once.

title: Hornets Gordon Offered Contract Extension
description: It was a bit of a cliff-hanger, but the New Orleans Hornets, currently operated by the N.B.A., have arrived at a contract extension for guard Eric Gordon. According to Yahoo.com , the team is giving Gordon a four-year deal, after getting approval from the league.

title: TV Ad Says Gingrich Exaggerates His Ties to Reagan
description: A new ad on behalf of Mitt Romney pokes fun at Newt Gingrich, and says he is exaggerating his relationship with Ronald Reagan.

title: Court Keeps Hitlers Work From German Newsstands
description: BERLIN  The German authorities on Wednesday won their most recent victory in a continuing battle to prevent circulation of Hitlers seminal work in Germany when a Bavarian court ruled that a British publisher could not release annotated excerpts ofMein Kampf.

title: Castro Calls Republican Field a Competition of Idiocy
description: With the Republican candidates courting Cubans in Miami today, Fidel Castro chimed in with an opinion piece in state-run media saying he was unimpressed, at the very least, with the field.

title: European Banks Push to Meet Capital Goals
description: LONDON  European banks have been busy.

title: Caucus Click: Changes Down the Road
Historic Buildings May Be Greener Than You Think
description: In New York City, a conflict has long been perceived between historic preservation and urban sustainability goals. Older buildings are often seen as outdated energy hogs that cant pull their weight, efficiency-wise, in a city that is expected to add a million new residents by 2030. About 55 percent of the citys 838,337 buildings were constructed before 1940, half a century before the notion of green LEED building certification was even dreamed up.

title: Something Rare for Iowa Wrestling: A Losing Streak
description: Throughout the college wrestling season, The Quad will follow some of the countrys top-ranked teams.

title: Runway in Review
description: The critics weigh in on Monday and Tuesdays shows in Paris.

title: M.T.A. Board Loses 2 Members and Star Power
description: Updated 2:59 p.m. | Two members of the board of the Metropolitan Transportation Authority resigned on Wednesday. One will leave to spend more time running the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey; the other will have more time with her new spouse, Paul McCartney.

title: IMAX Chief Envisions the Future of 3-D in Theaters
description: DAVOS, Switzerland  For the IMAX Corporation, the future is brighter, larger and in 3-D.

title: Jean Paul Gaultier: Spring 2012 Couture
description: Paris

title: Jean Paul Gaultier Couture
description: Paris

title: Andreessen Is Said to Seek $1.5 Billion in Fund-Raising
description: A name like Andreessen goes a long way in Silicon Valley.

title: Obama Embarks on Five-State Tour
description: 10:19 p.m. | Updated The full report of this article is available here.

title: Penneys New Approach Takes Target-Like Tack
description: Shoppers are about to find out what is changing at J.C. Penney in an advertising effort that, not coincidentally, evokes the Target way of marketing.

title: Towers of Dreams: One Ended in Nightmare
description: Hortense Davis sat beside neat stacks of new magazines in the pristine administrative office at Penn South, the 1960s high-rise housing cooperative development for low- and moderate-income workers in Chelsea. She was asked to ponder life there across 20 years.

title: Oil Supply as a Strategic Risk
description: Concerns about the climate have not inspired a lot of action lately on global energy policy. Now two professors are arguing that supply concerns and rising oil prices ought to be enough to get governments moving, even if the climate does not.

title: Scientist Plays Down Danger of Flu Strain
description: A Wisconsin virology team that created a more contagious form of bird flu did not produce a highly lethal superflu, as a Dutch team famously and controversially did last year, according to the leader of the Wisconsin team.

title: Showing a Little Restraint
description: IF youre one of the guys who likes to chuckle over the penchant some gals have for crazy stilettos that can cost more than $1,000  well, brother, dont look down. Over the last decade, your fashion-forward comrades have developed a taste for similarly extravagant shoes, a predilection that has somehow escaped derision because of its origins in the untouchable cool of hip-hop culture.

title: At Davos, Discussions of a Global Data Deluge
description: DAVOS, Switzerland  Each year, a new theme reverberates through technology conferences around the world. A few years ago it was predictions of the coming wave of social media, location-based services and mobile, long before they became mainstream.

title: Deep Crisis of Confidence Afflicts Democracies, Elsewhere Unease
description: Protesters in Moscow and Cairo fill public squares to demand representative government. Yet, on the streets of Madrid and New York  or of Athens, which gave us the very word for democracy  discontent is almost as rampant.

title: Assange to Host Conversations on TV Show
description: In yet another twist to the pretzel-like Julian Assange story, stay tuned for Mr. Assanges talk show, set to air in March.

title: Using More Than Two In Vitro Embryos Adds to Risks
description: The United States is one of the few countries that still routinely transfer more than two embryos during an in vitro fertilization procedure. While thats a practice that may be in keeping with our national more is more philosophy, and with the natural instinct of anxious parents to maximize the chances of success, The Timess Vital Signs column just reported on a British study showing that transferring three or more embryos does not increase the number of live births. Instead, those larger transfers are associated with a significantly higher risk of complications, including preterm birth and low birth weight.

title: Red Bulls, Klinsmann, College Soccer: Answers to Readers Questions
description: Q.

title: Adele Racks Up Two No.1s This Week
description: If anyone still doubted the commercial appeal of an old-fashioned soul singer who can channel raw emotion into song, Adele has put those doubts to rest. Not since 1993 has an album remained at No. 1 on the Billboard 200 chart for as long as  her album, 21 (XL/Columbia). That album finished its 17th week atop the sales chart since its release in the United States last February, selling 95,000 copies last week. Thats the best any album has done since The Bodyguard soundtrack, released in 1993, was on top for 20 weeks, Billboard reported.

title: Obama Returns to Familiar Theme in Case for 2nd Term
description: WASHINGTON  President Obamas election-year State of the Union address on Tuesday echoed a theme that has run through his career: Government and citizens are responsible together for the common good, even as they celebrate individualism and free markets.

title: New Rules for School Meals Aim at Reducing Obesity
description: WASHINGTON  Hoping to combat the growing problem of childhood obesity, the Obama administration on Wednesday announced its long-awaited changes to government-subsidized school meals, a final round of rules that adds more fruits and green vegetables to breakfasts and lunches and reduces the amount of salt and fat.

title: The Class Warfare Canard
description: Republicans roared onto the post-State-of-the-Union morning shows accusing President Obama of waging class warfare. Actually the class warrior in the field yesterday was in Florida, campaigning for the Republican nomination for president.

title: TimesCast | Anniversary of the Uprising
description: January 25, 2012  Thousands gather on the Egyptian uprisings first anniversary.

title: With Prevalence of Nanomaterials Rising, Panel Urges Review of Risks
description: Tiny substances called nanomaterials have moved into the marketplace over the last decade, in products as varied as cosmetics, clothing and paint. But not enough is known about their potential health and environmental risks, which should be studied further, an expert panel of the National Academy of Sciences said on Wednesday.

title: Syrian Role at Unesco Under Fire
description: PARIS  At least 25 countries have joined to try to unseat Syria from two committees of the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization that deal with issues of human rights, Western diplomats and Unesco officials said Wednesday.

title: Listen: SNY.tv Metro Hockey Podcast
description: Jeff Z. Klein joins Christopher Botta in studio to discuss the latest Rangers, Devils and Islanders news in this edition of the SNY.tv Metro Hockey Podcast. Pierre McGuire from NBC and Brian Compton of NHL.com also join in to discuss news from around the N.H.L.

title: Time to Push for Tax Fairness, Democrats Say
description: This time theyre really serious.

description: President Obama begins a three-day tour that includes battleground states.

title: Bachmann to Run for Re-Election
description: WASHINGTON  Representative Michele Bachmann, whose White House quest fizzled after a poor showing in the Iowa caucuses, said Wednesday that she would seek re-election in Minnesotas Sixth Congressional District.

title: Caucus Video: President Obamas Tour
description: President Obama begins a three-day tour that includes five battleground states. Jonathan Weisman reports.

title: Knicks Over Bobcats: That Was Supposed to Happen
description: Before Tuesday nights game against the Charlotte Bobcats, the Knicks had lost their previous six games. With the Knicks performing below expectations, this streak harkened to Micheal Ray Richardsons famous quote the ship be sinking.

title: SundayArts Show on City Culture Moves to Prime Time
description: New York Citys arts and culture scene will get a high-profile spotlight and a more vibrant digital presencewhen WNETs afternoon SundayArts show takes over a prime-time slot, on Thursdays at 8 p.m. Along with the move, the half-hour program will take on a new name, NYC-ARTS, as its news, interviews and video archives are merged with the existing Web site and mobile platforms of NYC-ARTS.org, a guide to arts and cultural events in the city. NYC-ARTS, developed with the help of city funds by the advocacy and research organization Alliance for the Arts, moved its operations to WNET last year.

title: Uh-Oh, Peer-to-Peer Networks Discover 3-D Printing
description: As I wrote in a column in November, people will soon be able to download files of physical objects and print them out at home. Although being able to print out a new mug or toothbrush at home sounds magical, I said that there would surely be copyright problems that occur as a result of this technologys going mainstream.

title: Shopping Snapshots: Jan. 26
description: Power blazers are back; a line of jewelry incorporates mechanical parts; and the return of the bodysuit.

title: Valentino: Spring 2012 Couture
description: Paris

title: Valentino Couture
description: Paris

title: On Eve of Philharmonic Concert, Chinese Conductor Slugs It Out With Attacker
description: A man attacked the Chinese conductor Long Yu on Columbus Avenue a day before his Chinese New Year concert with the New York Philharmonic  punching him in the eye and running off  but not before Mr. Yu landed a few blows of his own.

title: Patient Voices: Hemophilia
description: From weekly treatments to long-term joint pain to changing attitudes on the disease, hemophilia affects everyone slightly differently. Here, five people speak about living with hemophilia.

title: The Voices of Hemophilia
description: Hemophilia is a rare genetic condition in which the blood doesnt clot normally. The disease primarily affects men, and patients with hemophilia take injections of a clotting factor to prevent or reduce bleeding episodes.

title: Is This the Last Year the Academy Votes by Mail?
description: LOS ANGELES  Its official: The Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences is going to electronic voting for next years Oscars, with a system that will be developed by Everyone Counts.

title: Merrill Lynch Fined $1 Million for Bonus Clawbacks
description: The big bonuses doled out at Merrill Lynch during the height of the financial crisis have once again reared their ugly head.

title: Activists Press for End to Military Rule on Anniversary of Egypts Revolution
description: Updated | 4:42 p.m. As my colleague David Kirkpatrick reports from Cairo, there was a mixture of celebration and anger as Egyptians gathered in Tahrir Square on Wednesday on the first anniversary of the protest movement that forced President Hosni Mubarak from power.

title: Apple and Verizon Earnings Underscore the Power of the iPhone
description: Apple and Verizon on Tuesday reported their quarterly earnings, and for both companies, much of their good news centered on one product: the iPhone. And the numbers tell the story of a device that seems to gain power each day.

title: Avoiding Surgery in the Elderly
description: It may take members of our parents generation (and our own) a long time to get over thinking of hospitals as refuges of safety and operating rooms as harbingers of better days ahead. But its gradually becoming clearer that for the very old and frail, and for nursing home residents in particular, hospitals are places to avoid whenever possible, and surgery can become a source of danger in itself.

title: The United States of Numeracy: The Math of a Presidential Campaign
description: A presidential race is a gift to American history and civics classes. But its also rife with learning opportunities for math students, too.

title: A Toast to the Bard of Ayrshire
description: Its entirely possible that, just a few weeks ago, you sang the fine old tune Auld Lang Syne to welcome the New Year. You might still puzzle over the lyrics, no matter how many times youve sung it, and you might not know that the man responsible for the song as we know it is Robert Burns, the Scottish poet who was born on this day in 1759. Robert Burns and Auld Lang Syne, a lovely little exhibition at the Morgan Library and Museum, can take care of explaining the lyrics; seeing it would be a great way to kick off your celebration of Burns Night, the Scottish holiday marking the birth of the Scottish poet behind the song.

title: Citing Europes Progress, Merkel Urges Patience
description: DAVOS, Switzerland  Chancellor Angela Merkel of Germany said Wednesday that Europe had made more progress in dealing with the sovereign debt crisis than foreign investors acknowledged, as she toned down her usual calls for budgetary austerity.

title: Cracking the Code in Heeeres Johnny!
description: Burbank, Calif.

title: Scouting Report
description: OPENINGS

title: An Urban Paradise Lost
description: Images from the documentary, The Pruitt-Igoe Myth, which examines the St. Louis housing project that became a symbol of urban disaster.

title: New Rule Requires Fee Disclosure for Overseas Cash Transfers
description: People transferring money overseas must be informed of the exchange rate they are paying as well as any fees, under a new rule from the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau.

title: Wittman and the Wizards: Where to Begin?
description: The responsibility for getting the wayward Wizards on the same page no longer falls on Flip Saunderss shoulders. Washington officially parted ways with Saunders on Tuesday, and though the former head coach was hardly blameless in the Wizards horrendous 2-15 start, his firing appears to be little more than a token. Something had to change in Washington, and as is often the case, the head coach turned out to be  in the eyes of the organization  the most disposable element.

title: Cameron Calls for European Court to Limit Its Reach
description: BRUSSELS  Opening a new battle over the reach of Europes institutions, Prime Minister David Cameron of Britain on Wednesday called for the European Court of Human Rights to restrict its power to overrule national judgments.

title: A New Player on the Fashion Stage
description: var data;function jsonSlideshowCallback(response){data = response;}NYTD.options = {source: data,cropType: 'blog480',appendTo: 'fullScreenSlideShow',showHeadLine: 'false', renderstyle: "embeddedSlideShowTmag"}

title: Executive Director of Alvin Ailey Dance Foundation to Step Down
description: After 16 years as executive director of the Alvin Ailey Dance Foundation, Sharon Gersten Luckman will step down next year, the organization announced on Wednesday.

title: Romney Defends Stance on Immigration
description: MIAMI  Mitt Romney on Wednesday angrily rejected Newt Gingrichs accusation that he is anti-immigrant, calling that a personal attack that is out of bounds.

title: The Sons Also Rise
description: Here are the stages of inequality rationalization:

title: Romneys Tax Bill, European Style
description: 5:46 p.m. | Updated to correct income figure for Liliane Bettencourt.

title: Photo Replay: Jan. 25
description: A view of the day in sports, from basketball in Moscow to Joe Paternos funeral.

title: Is iMessage Starting to Take a Bite Out of Standard Texting?
description: When Apple introduced iMessage, a service that lets people with its mobile devices send each other free text messages over data networks, many analysts predicted that it would take a substantial bite out of the profits that text messages generate for wireless carriers in the United States.

title: Despite Generic Rivals, Branded Drugs Still Sell Well
description: Though the loss of patent protection on a brand-name prescription drug tends to lead to a sharp drop in sales for that product in the United States, such older medicines have become a booming business for the pharmaceutical industry in emerging markets.

title: Homes for $350,000
description: A two-bedroom in Utah, a 1920s bungalow in Atlanta and a three-bedroom in Kingston, N.Y.

title: What You Get for ... $350,000
description: EMIGRATION CANYON, UTAH

title: M.I.T. CityCar, Renamed Hiriko, Is Headed to Production
description: At European Union Commission headquarters in Brussels on Tuesday, the commission chief, Jos Manuel Barroso, inspected a small city-car prototype. It was the commercial version of the long-gestating CityCar from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology Media Lab.

title: Yuri Rasovsky, Dramatist for the Ear, Is Dead at 67
description: Yuri Rasovsky, whose boyhood revelation that radio drama transcends the stage  because listeners must make imaginative leaps to see the action  propelled his career as a leading creator of radio plays and audio books, died on Jan. 18 at his home in Los Angeles. He was 67.

title: Finding the Truth
description: A commenter on my latest Politifact screed asks a good question: where do you go to check whether a politicians statement is actually true?

title: Contemporary Zeitgeist, in Design and Furnishings
description: The classic and the modern come together in a roomy, high-tech home not far from a large American military base.

title: House Hunting in ... Germany
description: A FIVE-BEDROOM MOUNTAINSIDE HOME NEAR FRANKFURT

title: Just One Look | Jean Paul Gaultier
description: Jean Paul Gaultier loves to flirt with bad taste. So was it at all surprising that his spring couture show was dedicated to the memory of Amy Winehouse? To a live doo-wop performance of Rehab, beehived models strutted the catwalk in an extraordinary variety of garments and looks  yes, Winehouse-inspired pencil skirts and boleros, but also an elegant draped evening gown in electric blue crepe and a fetishists corset dress in black and ivory satin. Here, a dress that proves that python, tulle, cabochon embroidery, roses and lace can  in the right mains  keep one from going back to black.

title: Greenwich Village Country Club
description: WITH its adult kickball leagues and Craigslist roomies, New York could be regarded as a cradle for suspended adolescence. The argument is hard to deny at Greenwich Village Country Club, a monstrous shrine to frat culture and preppy nostalgia that opened last November above Bowlmor Lanes.

title: A Rebirth on Fulton Street
description: The South Street Seaport Museum in New York City reopens to the public on Thursday after nearly a year of being closed.

title: The Fine Line
description: PARIS

title: Haute Couture: The Fine Line
description: Couture survived and nowadays, almost no one talks about its demise.

title: Build Up Your Phones Defenses Against Hackers
description: Chuck Bokath would be terrifying if he were not such a nice guy. A jovial senior engineer at the Georgia Tech Research Institute in Atlanta, Mr. Bokath can hack into your cellphone just by dialing the number. He can remotely listen to your calls, read your text messages, snap pictures with your phones camera and track your movements around town  not to mention access the password to your online bank account.

title: A Free Source of Information and Advice for New Parents
description: Everyone wants a piece of a new parent  or, at least, the wallet of a new parent.

title: Sylvie Guillem to Make Rare New York Appearance
description: The French ballerina Sylvie Guillem will bring her production 6000 miles away to the David H. Koch Theater this spring, in a rare New York appearance. She last performed here in 2006. The engagement, a co-production with Sadlers Wells London, on April 4, 5 and 7, is the latest to fill empty nights at the theater, which lost New York City Opera this season because of the companys financial problems. 6000 miles away, a reference to Japans earthquake and tsunami last year, is being presented by the Joyce Theater Foundation. It consists of works by the choreographers Mats Ek, William Forsythe and Jiri Kylian.

title: Polls: Before and After South Carolina
description: Two Florida polls released on Wednesday offer a clearer snapshot of how Newt Gingrichs upset victory in South Carolina is swaying the states likely primary voters, as Mr. Gingrich pulls even with Mitt Romney.

title: Were Having Fun!
description: WHEN Amber Katz, who blogs at BeautyBloggingJunkie.com, speaks of her favorite cosmetics collections, high on the list is the supersized red lipglass shade from the Wonder Woman for MAC Cosmetics collection, inspired by what she called the fierce superheroine.

title: Murray State Is Small but Accustomed to Winning
description: MURRAY, Ky.  The place to be on Monday nights in this Kentucky town is the wistfully named Big Apple Cafe. On a recent blustery evening, 71 people  a record, it was said  jammed into the back room to watch the Murray State radio play-by-play announcer Neal Bradley interview the universitys mens basketball coach, Steve Prohm, for the weekly radio show Hey Coach, which can be heard across southwestern Kentucky.

title: Shopping for Soup Tureens
description: The chef Dale Talde searched for versatile tureens for that ta-da moment.

title: Soup Tureens
description: DALE TALDE might be known to many people as one of the more memorable contestants on the Bravo show Top Chef.

title: Winter Wonders | Day Break
description: The casual end of the coat spectrum brings us woolens with hoodies and casual closures, like wooden toggles, zippers and snaps. Here, the singer Taylor Swift wears riding boots with a burgundy toggle coat in London; the television host Alexa Chung looks cozy in our favorite color combo, navy and black; and the actress Elizabeth Olsen sports a double-breasted schoolboy blazer, complete with gold buttons and crested pocket.

title: Goal of the Year (So Far)?
description: As we write this, the match between Barcelona and Real Madrid at the Camp Nou, the second leg of their Copa del Rey series, is still in progress.

title: New U.N. Envoy Urges Afghans to Take Part in Peace Process
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  The new United Nations representative to Afghanistan urged Afghans on Wednesday to embrace an inclusive peace process in which all the elements of society would have a voice.

title: Previewing Federer Vs. Nadal
description: Wednesday nights Australian Open semifinal match from Melbourne between Roger Federer and Rafael Nadal has tennis fans across the globe giddy with anticipation. Their rivalry has elevated the level of play in mens tennis, and it is a privilege to get to watch them play in such an important match. Federer has been playing sublime tennis, and, remarkably, has improved his game in the last year, especially his backhand and his net play. He knew that the book on how to play him involved attacking the Federer backhand until it broke down.

title: SUNY Trustees Support Tuition Aid for Illegal Immigrants
A Generations Big Sister Pays a Visit to New York
description: Bright lights, big city. Youth and hope. A glittering wonderland of infinite possibility where everythings waiting for you. That is a paradisiacal dream world of Downtown, held out like a bauble in Petula Clarks signature hit that entered the charts in late 1964 and went to No. 1 early the next year.

title: The Lyricism of Chinese New Year
description: That the New York Philharmonic would salute China with a glitzy affair like the Chinese New Year gala it hosted on Tuesday evening at Avery Fisher Hall should come as no surprise. For years now China has been cast as the next great frontier for Western classical music: a place of crowded conservatories, hungry audiences and, possibly, bulging coffers. The Philharmonic saw the effects of this bloom firsthand during its concert tour there in 2008.

title: A Tribute to an Artifact of 60s Originality
description: The oddest and possibly slyest aspect of David Dorfmans Prophets of Funk, his tribute to Sly and the Family Stone, which opened at the Joyce Theater on Tuesday, is the role he plays himself. Hes the first dancer we meet: white, middle-aged, thick around the waist. Squatting and kicking to the groove in platform shoes, hes more limber than you might expect, yet unavoidably comic. Mr. Dorfman knows this and makes the ridiculousness look intentional. The recorded applause isnt for him, but he acts as if it were.

title: Panama vs. U.S.: Pregame Notes and Quotes
description: PANAMA CITY  The road to the World Cup in Concacaf qualifying goes through Central America, and Wednesday night United States national team coach Jurgen Klinsmann got his first taste of what that means when the Yanks played Panama in Estadio Rommel Fernandez.

title: Applied Neuroscience, the Six-String Method
description: At 13, an age when most boys want to learn the guitar, Gary Marcus, decided he wanted to be a scientist. Twenty-five years later he had become one of the countrys best known cognitive psychologists, with major papers and three general-interest books on the workings of the human mind and a position running New York Universitys Center for Language and Music.

title: Todays Scuttlebot: Video Game Rats and Groupons Snake Serum
description: Here are the interesting things that the tech reporters and editors for The New York Times found on the Web on Wednesday. Find more Scuttlebot items here.

title: All Sorts of Strange Stuff Happens When You Destroy the World
description: Near the end of Ryan Boudinots bracingly weird new novel a man asks his girlfriend, an editor, about the book that shes working on.

title: Retired Police Commander Could See Dismissal of Protest Charges
description: A retired Philadelphia police commander who was arrested at an Occupy Wall Street demonstration in November will have his case dismissed if he stays out of trouble for six months.

title: The Catchy Voice of a Hundred TV Moments Shows a Blunter Edge
description: Hours before her album-release show at Joes Pub on Tuesday night, Ingrid Michaelson was in the back of an ambulance, speeding toward the emergency room. The incident  a false alarm, as she described it onstage  had involved heart palpitations, a mounting panic and some awkward embarrassment. But what if her near-death experience, as she wryly put it, had yielded a musical epiphany? What if I came up here and started doing, like, freestyle jazz? she asked, before delivering an impromptu-sounding gag song with her guitar. Then, laughing: Greys Anatomy will not like that one.

title: Embracing the Mothers of Invention
description: Ill admit it: Im sometimes smugly entertained by the older generations reaction to the fads of the Web. Facebook? Why on earth would I want other people to know about my private life? Twitter? Whos got the time for that nonsense?

title: Pictures of the Day: Egypt and Elsewhere
description: Photographs from Egypt, Greece, France and Thailand.

title: Independent Hair Salons in New York
description: A number of under-the-radar salons are thriving.

title: Bout Time
description: Americas boxing women set their sights on an Olympic debut.

title: For Hair That Isnt Brand-Name
description: AMY SCHIAPPAS first job in New York was as an assistant at John Barrett Salon in Bergdorf Goodman, which was famed for churning out the sort of platinum-coiffed society girls celebrated in Plum Sykess 2004 novel, Bergdorf Blondes.

title: Antony Sees the Light
description: Critics like to describe Antony Hegarty, the silken-voiced leader of Antony and the Johnsons, as otherworldly. In recent years, the singers music has grown from pop, cabaret and soul signifiers to include characteristics of art song and sounds stranger still. Certainly, each of his acclaimed, prismatic albums seems to float in its own haunted universe.

title: Moss, a Design Mecca, Is Closing
description: After 18 years in business, Moss, the SoHo design mecca, is shutting down its retail space on Greene Street, on Feb. 17.

title: Frieze Art Fair New York Announces Commissioned Art Projects
description: The American version of Londons annual Frieze Art Fair, which makes its debut in New York in May, wants to be more than just another place to see and buy contemporary art. Using its unusual and remote location  the 256-acre Randalls Island, in the East River between East Harlem, the South Bronx and Astoria, Queens  it has commissioned eight artists to construct what is calls a temporary pop-up village.

title: Seaport Museum Sets Sail, Again
description: Its historic ships still arent in any shape to hit the high seas.

title: Greenhill Profit Jumps, and Firm Honors Its Fallen Bankers
description: Greenhill & Company had a lot of good earnings news to report on Wednesday  but it acknowledged its continued sadness over the deaths of two senior bankers last month.

title: Barcelona Keeps Rival Real Madrid From Advancing
description: BARCELONA, Spain  Barcelona knocked out its archrival, Real Madrid, in the quarterfinals of the Copa del Rey on Wednesday, securing a tense 2-2 draw and delivering another blow to the ambitions of Madrids boisterous coach, Jos Mourinho.

title: A Decline in Viewers for State of the Union Address
description: The State of the Union address Tuesday night was seen by 37.8 million television viewers, according to figures released by the Nielsen company, by far the fewest who have watched President Obama give the address.

title: Stone Links
description: A gathering of recent philosophy-related links.

title: A Frosty Meeting for Obama and Arizona Governor
description: PHOENIX  President Obamas visit to Phoenix got off to a rough start on Wednesday afternoon when Air Force One was met by Gov. Jan Brewer of Arizona  she of the book Scorpions for Breakfast, in which she accuses the Obama administration of turning a blind eye to illegal immigration because migrants will help Mr. Obama register more Democratic votes.

title: Unlikely Routes Lead to Oscars
description: When she got the script for Midnight in Paris, Letty Aronson, Woody Allens longtime producer, wasnt buying it. When I first read the script, honestly, my impression was: Whos going to come to this movie? Ms. Aronson said. Nobody even knows Gertrude Stein anymore.

title: A Town House Filled With Reimagined Vintage Pieces
description: In Brooklyn, the design firm Nightwood created a space that looks at once handmade and ethereal.

title: What Vintage? Circa 2011
description: AYA YAMANOUCHI LLOYD met Nadia Yaron and Ry Scruggs, the Brooklyn designers who own Nightwood, in the spring of 2010.

title: Polls Suggest Gingrichs Support May Have Peaked
description: Polling released within the past 24 hours suggests that Mitt Romney has stopped and possibly reversed Newt Gingrichs momentum before the Florida primary on Tuesday.

title: Mourners Pay Tribute to Paterno During Funeral Procession
description: STATE COLLEGE, Pa.  The blue Cadillac hearse carrying Joe Paterno made its way through streets lined with thousands of mourners who tossed flowers, took photographs or simply waved goodbye as his funeral procession rolled through the Penn State campus and downtown along College Avenue on Wednesday.

title: Attention, Class: Show-and-Tell Time With Carleton Varney
description: The interior designer Carleton Varney is a man of many talents. He has designed furniture, lighting, dinnerware and linens; he has two lines of fabrics, as well as a CD (Carleton Varney, Music With Style); his client roster includes luminaries like former President Jimmy Carter and the late Joan Crawford; and he can often be seen hawking his wares on HSN, where he is never without his signature scarf-worn-as-tie (the scarf designs are his as well).

title: Amazon Aims Service at Cloud Novices
description: Amazon just made life a little harder for old-line computer companies, by making a play for their data storage backup business.

title: Folk Art for Young Collectors
description: Susan Baerwald, a former Hollywood producer who now runs Just Folk, a gallery outside Santa Barbara, Calif., that she started with a fellow TV industry veteran, Marcy Carsey, said her first brush with American folk art was buying quilts. They were a wonderful way to decorate an apartment in New York, she said. They took up a lot of wall space.

title: A Hand-Embroidered Flight of Fancy
description: Marie-France de Crcy, a 38-year-old Parisian textile designer who once worked as a fashion stylist, creates upholstery fabrics with many of the same qualities as those found in haute couture, including hand-embroidery, hand-beading and the idea of placement, she said, where a print appears in a very specific place on a piece of furniture.

title: Stored for Decades, Hitlers Silver Is to Go on Display
description: For 66 years, they lay unseen, first in a vault on the Upper West Side, more recently in a special cabinet. Now the New-York Historical Society plans to put them on public display alongside a silver cigar box, a silver ice cream dish and the silver controller handle that Mayor George B. McClellan Jr. used when he drove the first subway train, in 1904: A knife and fork with the initials A and H, for Adolf Hitler.

title: The Daily Shoe | Valentino
description: For the Couture edition of The Daily Shoe, T picks the most exquisite made-to-measures.

title: Design Perfectionists at Home
description: The minimalist spaces where design perfectionists live  some so fastidious that they have no furniture at all.

title: Sales at Phaidon and Jensen-Lewis
description: Hundreds of art, architecture, design and photography titles from Phaidon are up to 80 percent off during January, or while supplies last (the three-volume Phaidon Design Classics, regularly $175, is about $87); 83 Wooster Street (Spring Street), (212) 925-1900, phaidon.com.

title: One Foot Planted Firmly in the Nest
description: I LOVE Yorkville, the Manhattan neighborhood that my family has called home since 1896. During my childhood in the 1960s, it was my warren, and I burrowed joyously into and around it. There was Joes Candy Store, with the moodiest Italian bachelor in New York City, who served cold soda from his giant tub of frosty water. There was Parkers Mom & Pop Grocery, starring sweet Murray Parker and his Elmer Fudd hat with earflaps that he wore year round on his bald head. And there was Prexys (The hamburger with the college education), Loftus Tavern (my fathers regular haunt) and the Cherokee Democratic Club (a double-wide brownstone on East 79th Street that I had the run of because my grandmother was Yorkvilles longtime district leader).

title: No Room for Mistakes
description: TODD WATERBURYS apartment is just perfect.

title: Kris Humphries Redecorates for One
description: The 72-day marriage and subsequent divorce of Kim Kardashian and Kris Humphries set off a firestorm of tabloid coverage, he-said she-said bickering and angry cries that the whole thing was a publicity stunt. But for all the high-profile drama, the relationship may have been doomed by a mundane problem: the couple apparently couldnt agree on where to live.

title: Market Ready
description: Q. I have a built-in banquette in my kitchen. Should I reupholster it before trying to sell my home?

title: A Highly Rated Body of Work
description: ALL around, there were construction workers, particle-board dust and the whine of drills. But as John Blair, arguably the longest-working gay nightlife promoter in New York, swaggered through what would soon be XL, the citys first new gay megaclub in many years, you could almost hear the thump of the dance music, see the writhing throng of shirtless men and smell the heady mix of cologne, dry ice and sweat.

title: EBay Seller Seeks a Cool $1 Million for President Obamas Chrysler
description: Cars with presidential provenance have been known to command hefty premiums at auction. One eBay seller is hoping to sell a 2005 Chrysler 300C that reportedly belonged to Barack Obama for a downright princely sum.

title: An Indian Students Guide to the SAT and ACT Admissions Exams
description: Robin Mamlet, the former dean of admissions at Stanford University in California, and Christine VanDeVelde, a journalist, are the authors of College Admission: From Application to Acceptance, Step by Step.

title: When Skyscrapers Are Your Screen
description: THERE is a commercial building at the intersection of Canal Street and West Broadway with a whitewashed and windowless side that most people would consider an eyesore. But for J R Skola on a recent evening it was a six-story canvas for a traveling work called Space Monkey.

title: Poll: Apple Products
description: Results from a telephone survey conducted by The New York Times in Nov. 2011.

title: Poll Finds Consumer Confusion on Where Apple Devices Are Made
description: The outsourcing of manufacturing jobs remains a major sore point for most Americans. But owners of some of the nations most popular electronics  including iPhones and iPads  are less concerned than other Americans about where their purchases are made, according to a nationwide survey conducted by The New York Times.

title: Parsing the State of the Union Address
description: To the Editor:

title: In China, Human Costs Are Built Into an iPad
description: The explosion ripped through Building A5 on a Friday evening last May, an eruption of fire and noise that twisted metal pipes as if they were discarded straws.

title: Colts Pick Ravens Pagano as Coach
description: The Indianapolis Colts hired Chuck Pagano,the defensive coordinator for the Baltimore Ravens,as their coach Wednesday.

title: Names of the Dead
description: The Department of Defense has identified 1,868 American service members who have died as a part of the Afghan war and related operations. It confirmed the death of the following American recently:

title: Chinese Readers on the iEconomy
description: On Sunday, The Times published How the U.S. Lost Out on iPhoneWork, the first article in The iEconomy, a new series examining the challenges posed by increasingly globalized high-tech industries.

title: Deft Grand-Slam Bidding Wins a Pair Game
description: The District 3 Winter Regional in Rye Brook, N.Y., which started on Jan. 10, was carefully scheduled. Since it ended on Jan. 16, Martin Luther Kings Birthday, an extra day of play could be sneaked in.

title: Facebook Chat About the iEconomy Series
description: 5:31 p.m. | Updated  Weve added highlights from the Facebook chat at the bottom of the post.

title: Photos of the Moment | Jean Paul Gaultier

title: A Turnaround at Netflix, as Its Mail Sector Shrinks
description: After a haltingly poor performance in the middle of last year, Netflix reported fourth-quarter earnings on Wednesday that exceeded analysts expectations and a subscriber uptick that surpassed its own outlook.

title: At Perelman Trial, an Assistants Work Is Scrutinized
description: Personal assistants on Wall Street inhabit a secretive world, with daily access to the private lives of the powerful.

title: The Language of Flowers: Latin No More?
description: To the Editor:

description: To the Editor:

description: To the Editor:

title: A Year Later, Still Young, Still Fighting
description: Its been a year. Nothing happened.

title: Profits Rise, and Shares Follow, for US Airways and Delta
description: Shares of both Delta Air Lines and US Airways rose after the companies reported fourth-quarter profits that topped analysts estimates.

title: Made in China
description: Workers assembling iPads, iPhones and other products often work in abusive, sometimes deadly conditions. Employees of Foxconn offered a glimpse inside their factory in Chengdu.

title: Pattern of Intimidation Is Seen in Arrests of Iranian Journalists and Bloggers
description: The judicial authorities in Iran have arrested at least half a dozen journalists and bloggers over the past few weeks, according to their acquaintances, opposition Web sites and rights groups. The moves appear to be part of a pre-emptive campaign of intimidation to thwart protests surrounding the parliamentary elections that are scheduled to be held in early March.

title: Grunting Is Loud, and So Is Response
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  The sound of womens tennis has not changed, but the fury it can cause has intensified.

title: The New York (Mayors) Review of Books
description: He controls a global publishing empire, but few would call him bookish. His city is a hotbed of writers and critics, but when it comes to literature, he pleads ignorance.

title: Recommend a Book to Mayor Bloomberg
description: During a visit to a high school English class in the Bronx, Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg revealed his love for the John le Carr classic, Tinker, Tailor, Soldier, Spy. His literary leaning even inspired a rare trip to the cinema to catch the new movie version of the book.

title: Hedge Funds Scramble to Unload Greek Debt
description: 8:29 p.m. | Updated

title: A Judgeship With Prestige, and, Oh, What a Grand Room
description: Sure, being the top judge of the appeals court in Brooklyn is impressive. It is one of the most powerful judicial seats in the state.

title: Candidates Scramble to Win Hispanic Votes in Florida
description: MIAMI  The leading Republican candidates spent Wednesday appealing for the votes of South Floridas Hispanic voters, with the campaigns of Mitt Romney and Newt Gingrich skirmishing over an advertisement that branded Mr. Romney as anti-immigration.

title: Wesley E. Brown, Oldest Judge in Nations History, Dies at 104
description: Judge Wesley E. Brown, whose work ethic and a hale constitution kept him climbing the stairs to his fourth-floor courtroom past his 100th birthday, making him the oldest active federal judge in the nations history, died on Monday in Wichita, Kan. He was 104.

title: Djibouti Outpost Behind Somalia Rescue Is Part of New Defense Strategy
description: WASHINGTON  An austere Pentagon outpost in the hardscrabble desert on the Horn of Africa proved serendipitously ideal as a launching pad for Tuesdays commando raid that freed two aid workers held in Somalia. The use of the base, Camp Lemonnier in neighboring Djibouti, is also a signpost to the future, as the military focuses on economy of force missions that can preserve an American military presence and protect national security interests at relatively low cost.

title: The True Cost of High School Dropouts
description: ONLY 21 states require students to attend high school until they graduate or turn 18. The proposal President Obama announced on Tuesday night in his State of the Union address  to make such attendance compulsory in every state  is a step in the right direction, but it would not go far enough to reduce a dropout rate that imposes a heavy cost on the entire economy, not just on those who fail to obtain a diploma.

title: Family Ties a Plus for Mannings
description: So you havent heard enough about Peyton and Eli Manning  their quarterbacking careers, their Super Bowl Most Valuable Player awards and their skills as Madison Avenue pitchmen?

title: A Judge in the Dock
description: IN October 1998, British police officers arrested the Chilean general Augusto Pinochet while he was recuperating from back surgery at a London hospital. They were acting on an international warrant issued by the Spanish judge Baltasar Garzn seeking General Pinochets extradition to stand trial in Spain on charges of torture and murder. After a 17-month legal battle, General Pinochet was released on medical grounds, but Judge Garzns warrant paved the way for stripping the former dictator of immunity and prosecuting him in Chile.

title: Why Evangelicals Dont Like Mormons
description: According to a CNN exit poll of South Carolina Republican primary voters, Newt Gingrich, a thrice-married Catholic, won twice as much support from evangelical Protestants as Mitt Romney, a Protestant. And among voters for whom religion meant a great deal, 46 percent voted for Mr. Gingrich and only 10 percent for Mr. Romney.

title: Second Chances
description: The Supreme Courts decision last week giving an Alabama death-row inmate who was abandoned by his lawyers a second chance at an appeal has been justly celebrated. The 7-to-2 decision in Maples v. Thomas was a welcome display of compassion by a substantial majority of the Roberts court  for which compassion (dare I say empathy?) is not a descriptor that often springs to mind.

title: When N.H.L.s All-Star Captains Choose Sides, Someone Has to Be Last
description: Being named an All-Star is an honor for professional athletes, but it could turn out to be an embarrassment for one N.H.L. player.

title: Fewer Cows Hides May Bear the Mark of Home
description: MORGAN HILL, Calif.  In the half-light of a winter evening here, a tawny calf skitters across the pasture after its mother, a Lazy T brand visible on its right hip. The brand, used by the Tilton Ranch since Janet Burbacks parents settled on this land in 1917, appears on the ranchers shirts, their trucks and their business cards.

title: Potent Sting Is Prepared in the Belly of a Warship
description: ABOARD THE U.S.S. JOHN C. STENNIS, in the North Arabian Sea  Depending on who describes it, a nuclear aircraft carrier can be any number of things: an instrument of national will, a nemesis to be threatened and watched, a fast-moving and wide-ranging city at sea.

title: Philosophy  Whats the Use?
description: Almost every article that appears in The Stone provokes some comments from readers challenging the very idea that philosophy has anything relevant to say to non-philosophers. There are, in particular, complaints that philosophy is an irrelevant ivory-tower exercise, useless to any except those interested in logic-chopping for its own sake.

title: With Audiences Encouraged to React, Primary Debates Seem More Made for TV
description: Hello, Charleston!

title: They Will Say We Are Not Here
description: The filmmakers Katherine Fairfax Wright and Malika Zouhali-Worrall explore the motivations, sorrows and dreams of the slain Ugandan gay rights activist David Kato.

title: After Charges of Latino Abuse, Anger Shifts to a Mayor for His Taco Remark
description: For more than a decade they have been joined at the hip, the police chief with an old-school, tough-guy reputation and the mayor who resurrected the officers flagging career, made him his chief and then stood by him at every turn.

title: X Games Snowmobilers Shrug Off Injury Concerns
description: ASPEN, Colo.  A bruised hip, a broken femur and a double dislocation of the shoulders  count these injuries among the recent setbacks of freestyle snowmobile riders competing in the Winter X Games, starting here Thursday. Absent from the lineup are two former gold-medal-winning riders who crashed more recently this month. One sustained multiple vertebrae fractures of the neck two days after anothers shin bone crumpled in the same practice pit in Minnesota.

title: Romney Embraces Attack Style Against Gingrich
description: ORLANDO, Fla.  He drinks milk, not beer, and his vocabulary includes gee and darn, but Mitt Romney is being forced by increasingly tenuous political circumstances to show his mean guy.

title: Freighter Oversupply Weighs on Shipowners and Banks
description: SINGAPORE  The skyscrapers and immaculate beaches of this seaport look out on one of the worlds largest parking lots: mile after mile of empty cargo ships, as far as the eye can see.

title: Futures Industry Sees Chance to Shape Oversight
description: Earlier this month, in a ninth-floor conference room of the Northern Trust bank in Chicago, an unlikely assembly of futures industry executives, regulators and customers discussed the fallout from MF Globals collapse.

title: Boeing Posts 20% Profit Gain but Cuts Forecast for 2012 as Jet Completions Slow
description: Boeing reported strong fourth-quarter results on Wednesday but forecast lower-than-expected profits for 2012 because of rising pension costs and the slow completion rate for its new 787 Dreamliner passenger jets.

title: They Will Say We Are Not Here
description: These are fragments of David Kato, glimpses of a Ugandan activist and friend who  one year ago today  was brutally murdered. These moments offer a perspective on the inner world that David shared with us, a world teeming with passion and relentless determination, good humor and vivid daydreams.

title: Funny, Youre So Sad
description: The guy next to me had recently moved to Brooklyn from Cincinnati. When I asked him what he did in New York he said comedy. When I asked him what he did for money in New York he said temping. He and I both had little notebooks that we had written our jokes in. The relevant page in mine read bidet, rats, Obama, Entourage. I had spent months working on that page.

title: A City Order in Firehouses Draws Anger
description: To New York City firefighters, who often put in 24-hour shifts, the firehouse can be a home away from home between emergency calls. It is where they cook meals, conduct training, lift weights and trade notes on the latest internal policy or city political imbroglio.

title: Bedbugs and Worried Workers at a Hotel Anything but Fleabag
description: A room for a midweek night starts at $695 and can soar up to $4,500 for a suite, but this particular hotel on Central Park South may have a problem commonly, if unfairly, associated with more low-rent lodging  bedbugs. And it may also have a bigger issue  grumbling workers.

title: Small City Is Home to Israels Unlikely Top Team
description: KIRYAT SHMONA, Israel  This city is one of Israels smallest, a hardscrabble place with a population of 23,000 that is less than two miles from the Lebanese border and through the decades has repeatedly found itself caught in the crossfire of Arab-Israeli strife.

title: A Better Way to Fix the Housing Market?
A Mortgage Investigation
description: In the State of the Union address, President Obama promised a fresh investigation into mortgage abuses that led to the financial meltdown. The goal, he said, is to hold accountable those who broke the law, speed assistance to homeowners and help turn the page on an era of recklessness that hurt so many Americans.

title: Talk of Taxing the Rich More Faces Political Realities
description: WASHINGTON  President Obamas call for tax fairness and Mitt Romneys tax returns have catapulted the debate over tax increases on the rich to the top of the political agenda. But with even some top Democrats hesitant, the prospects of a so-called Buffett tax on high-earning households remain uncertain, if not remote, for the immediate future. What is left may be only politics, at least until after the November elections.

title: NBC Brings Science of N.H.L. Hockey to TVs and Classrooms
description: NBC News and NBC Sports have produced a series of 10 educational segments called Science of N.H.L. Hockey that will make their debut during the NBC Sports Networks coverage of the All-Star festivities this weekend.

title: GPS and the Right to Privacy
description: The Supreme Court ruled unanimously on Monday that the police violated the Constitution when they hid a Global Positioning System tracking device on the car of Antoine Jones and monitored his movements for 28 days. It put law enforcement on notice that most GPS electronic surveillance will be suspect without a judges warrant.

title: Better Care for Troubled Youth
description: Gov. Andrew Cuomo has proposed allowing the New York City system, instead of the state system, to begin handling all but the most dangerous juvenile offenders. This is an excellent idea in principle, but the city and state must make sure that the quality of services is high and that a detailed plan is in place before they put this new policy into effect in the fall.

title: Woman Accuses New York Police Commissioners Son of Rape
description: The Manhattan district attorneys office is investigating an accusation that Greg Kelly, a local television anchor who is a son of Police Commissioner Raymond W. Kelly, raped a young woman in Lower Manhattan last October, law enforcement officials and Greg Kellys lawyer said Wednesday.

title: In Hawaii, a Bid to Sell Each Island as Unique
description: HOW The Descendants a film about life and love in Hawaii  fared when the Academy Award nominations were announced on Tuesday was big news in the Aloha State, as evidenced by the headline on a Honolulu Web site: The Descendants Gets 5 Oscar Nominations; Hugo Leads With 11.

title: At 19, Without a Diploma, a Job, or a Place to Call Home
description: De Andre Hill, 19, is the first to admit it: He grew up way too soon.

title: Ramone Says Jacket for Bid Is Just a Poser
