title: A Warm, Hopeful Breeze Wafting From Juilliard
description: A couple of planets in the small cosmos of early music seemed out of alignment last week when an obscure French Baroque opera passed through New York, and the great French Baroque specialist William Christie was here to conduct. For they appeared on competing stages.

title: A Crime of Genocide Denial
description: To the Editor:

title: Fighting for Gender Equality on the Battlefield
description: Suspended from her position in December, the commandant of the United States Armys drill sergeant school is currently under investigation for an undisclosed personnel issue. Command Sgt. Maj. Teresa L. King was the first female commandant of the school, a somewhat high-profile position that is the source for the Armys pool of drill sergeants. These soldiers, who are typically men, are responsible for training thousands of new recruits each year. Sergeant Major King, known for her keen attention to detail and dogmatic demand for discipline, was named commandant in 2009. Since then, she has enjoyed some well-deserved popularity, including being named to Oprah Winfreys O Power List, as well as an appearance in the October 2010 issue of O, The Oprah Magazine.

title: Your Film of Films: A Sweeping History of an Art
description: A glance at the nominees for best picture at this years Oscars will confirm that the movies, a forward-looking medium tumbling headlong into a digital future, find themselves in a moment of retrospection. It is not just that a majority of the nominees take place in lovingly imagined and carefully costumed versions of the past  that in itself is hardly new  but also that several look back with affection at earlier phases in the history of cinema.

title: Disney Adds to Its India Investment With Takeover of UTV Software
description: LOS ANGELES  Its full steam ahead for Mickey Mouse in India.

title: Trailer: 'The Story of Film'
description: A preview of The Story of Film: An Odyssey.

title: On Godly Grounds, a Prideful Flock
description: On the 13 acres surrounding the Cathedral Church of St. John the Divine are a biblical garden, a fountain depicting the struggle between good and evil, and three longtime residents who spend their days wandering where they please: Jim, Phil and Harry.

title: On X Factor, 2 Judges and Host Get the Ax
description: Before he starts the second season of The X Factor, Simon Cowell is pressing the reset button.

title: A Rapper Reborn Into a Whole New Status
description: Tall and gangly and with arms that seem impossibly long, the Atlanta rapper 2 Chainz is an endearing galoot, never menacing even when talking tough. Once upon a time, he was Tity Boi, of the rap duo Playaz Circle, but about a year ago, he switched his name, and with the change came new life.

title: In Atlanta, Housing Woes Reflect Nations Pain
description: MARIETTA, Ga.  Housing prices continue to fall nationwide, despite a few modest signs of improvement. But not all markets are equal.

title: Footnote
description: The soprano Angela Meade, above, has won the Beverly Sills Artist Award, a $50,000 prize for singers 25 to 40 who have appeared in featured roles at the Metropolitan Opera, the company said on Monday. Ms. Meade, 34, made her Met debut as Elvira in Verdis Ernani four years ago and will appear again in the role on Thursday in a new run of the opera.

title: Gaining Power in Parliament, Islamists Block a Cairo Protest
description: CAIRO  The Muslim Brotherhood flexed its muscles here on Tuesday as hundreds of its young members linked arms to block a protest march from reaching Parliament while its lawmakers inside dominated the selection of leaders for legislative committees.

title: The House That George Romney Built
description: Ithaca, N.Y.

title: A Wrinkle in Time Turns 50
description: A Wrinkle in Time turns 50 years old this year. That would make its heroine, Meg Murry, 63 years old, and her daughter, Polly OKeefe (heroine of An Acceptable Time) probably near 40, since Meg had her first child young (in the style of many fictional heroines, whose romantic fate was often decided in their first book appearance).
